Title: Associate Frontend Developer (w/m/d)
Description: Auf der Suche nach einer neuen Herausforderung? Wir erfüllen Deinen Wunsch!  Bei Siemens Global Business Services (GBS) gestalten wir die „Shared Services" – Landschaft der Zukunft. Wir unterstützen Siemens Kunden aus jeder Branche und global. Wir sind der sichere Partner der Wahl, wenn es um maßgeschneiderte und herausragenden Unternehmensdienstleistungen in höchster Qualität geht.   Lass uns gemeinsam die aktuell spannendsten Herausforderungen angehen und neueste technische Lösungen im Cloud Umfeld umsetzen. Nutze diese Chance, Deine Ideen einzubringen und gemeinsam mit uns in einem motivierten internationalen Team die End2End Reporting-, Analytics- und SurveyPlattform Pulse weiterzubringen!   Verändere gemeinsam mit uns die Welt von morgen.   Gemeinsam mit unserem Team berätst Du Kunden in Business Intelligence Projekten auf unserer Plattform www.pulse.cloud Du konzipierst und entwickelst eigenständig neue, innovative UI/UX für unsere globale BI& Survey Cloud-Plattform Dabei begleitest Du den gesamten Lebenszyklus der Entwicklung: von Entwurf und Implementierung über die Integration bis hin zum Produktivbetrieb Du stehst als zuverlässige Kontaktperson in direktem Austausch mit unseren Kunden, mit denen wir gemeinsam kontinuierlich die Weiterentwicklung unseres Portfolios vorantreiben Mit Deiner Erfahrung stellst Du sicher, dass unsere Entwicklung den höchsten Ansprüchen an Benutzungsfreundlichkeit, Performance und Design erfüllt   Dein Qualifikation - fundiert und adäquat.   Grundlage bildet Dein Bachelorstudium im Bereich (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder einer verwandten Fachrichtung und Du kannst erste Berufserfahrung in der Webentwicklung (Frontend) vorweisen Alternativ verfügst Du über eine dreijährige Berufsausbildung im Bereich Informatik sowie langjährige Berufserfahrung und Spezialkenntnisse im Bereich der Angular Entwicklung und umfangreiche praktische Erfahrungen mit Webtechnologien Du hast ein besonderes Händchen für Design und es fällt Dir leicht, mit Hilfe von gängigen Webtechnologien qualitative UIs zu entwickeln, die auf verschiedenen Endgeräten funktionieren und eine gute Usability aufweisen. In Deiner Arbeit handelst Du eigenverantwortlich und selbständig Du überzeugst durch Motivation, Leidenschaft und ein starkes Interesse neue Dinge zu lernen und Dich ständig weiterzuentwickeln Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden Dein Profil ab   Was wir Dir bieten.   2 bis 3 Tage pro Woche mobiles Arbeiten als zukünftiger, globaler Standard Freie Arbeitsmittelwahl (Mac oder Windows) Verwendung von aktuellen Spitzentechnologien Ansprechendes Vergütungspaket Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für berufliche als auch persönliche Entwicklung 30 Tage Urlaub sowie vielfältige, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, die eine Auszeit für Dich und Deine Familie ermöglichen Zugang zu Aktienplänen für Mitarbeitende Und viele weitere Benefits hier   Die einzelnen Benefits sind jeweils zugeschnitten auf lokale gesetzliche Anforderungen, Vorgaben verschiedener Job-Profile und Standorte sowie individuelle Präferenzen.  Wir wollen, dass Du willst: Bewerbe Dich jetzt!  Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.   https://new.siemens.com/  - wenn Du mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchtest.   FAQ  - wenn Sie eine Frage zum Thema Bewerbung bei Siemens haben.   Organization:  Global Business Services   Company:  Siemens AG   Experience Level:  Recent College Graduate   Job Type:  Full-time

Title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPER (m,f,d)
Description: Frontend and backend development and data visualization    Are you passionate about geodata and programming? Then you've come to the right place: we're looking for a highly motivated software developer who enjoys trying new things. Are you an investigative character who likes geodata and data visualization? If you enjoy working in an inspiring team, then join our mission to map and monitor the planet.    Requirements:  Degree in computer science or geoinformatics  Experience in developing web applications, frontend and backend  Experience with React or other front-end Javascript frameworks, LeafletJS, CesiumJS and UI/UX design  Programming experience in Java Script, HTML, CSS, REST-API  Knowledge of QGIS, PostgreSQL, Git, Python is desirable

Title: Software Development Engineer
Description: The ideal candidate has experience in the handling with electronics and instrument applications. You should enjoy working in a development-oriented and international team.    Qualifications    Completed engineering studies in computer science, electrical engineering or comparable technical studies Good knowledge of the operating system Microsoft Windows, as well as experience with embedded Linux Good programming skills in Python as well as JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, bootstrap as well as jQuery or similar Web Application Framework Further knowledge of shell / bash scripting and ssh would be an advantage Enjoy working with real hardware such as motors, sensors, cameras, lasers and any kind of controllers Understanding of technical / physical relationships Good communication and team skills, as well as open-mindedness to new tasks Extensive analytical and technical skills Strong willingness to communicate, good organizational skills and self-motivation Good German and English, both spoken and written    Responsibilities    Design, implement, documentation and maintain software for instrument control and data analysis of life science research equipment, including: - Communication protocols such as TCP / IP based Web-Sockets, http, REST / JSON - Control flow for automated sample preparation with subsequent measurements and analyzes Development of web-based UI for device control and adjustment Software verification including code reviews, automated system tests, troubleshooting and documentation in online tracking- and documentation Systems Prepare detailed technical specifications in collaboration with the project team Development and planning of software architectures to control our devices and their implementation Promote collaborative software development and quality assurance    What We Offer    Purposeful & inspirational environment Dynamic culture in which customers are at the forefront Being part of a highly qualified team that is committed to excellence Access to cutting-edge expertise through which you can make positive impact in the world around us

Title: Working Student - Automatic Testing
Description: trivago's quality of user experience on the website depends, among other factors, on the accuracy of the data displayed on it. To keep a high level of accuracy, the Advertiser Quality team  builds systems that extract, parse, and store information about the rates offered by different advertisers. While our systems already extract and monitor large data, there are still improvements to be made and new sources of data to be integrated.   Our team is looking for an individual who knows the programming fundamentals, understands the challenges, and loves learning by doing, to join our team of 8 colleagues. If you are a student  with a technical mind, looking for an opportunity to work with data and software tools  in a data-driven company, don’t hesitate to apply!   How you’ll make an impact:   Set up and maintain a test suite to ensure a proper price accuracy on trivago's platform Use scripting and querying to improve processes and simplify data analysis Communicate with other teams and external partners to follow up on issues found during testing Execute daily checks of core metrics Assist developers by handling simple programming tasks    What you’ll learn:   How a data-driven company works internally and the decision making processes How advanced data-extraction systems function How to collaborate with an international team of experienced developers, DevOps engineers, and data scientists    What we’re looking for:   A computer science (or similar field) student with knowledge of one programing language Basic knowledge of SQL Ability to make data-driven decisions Capacity to work at least 15 hours a week and occasionally from our campus Ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team    What makes you stand out:   Familiarity with web technologies and a basic knowledge of python    Don’t let these nice-to-haves stop you from applying for the job! As long as you have relevant experience and the right attitude, we’d love to hear from you.   What you can expect from life at trivago:  Entrepreneurship:  The freedom to take ownership of your work and drive initiatives independently. It’s the idea that counts, not the position.   Growth:  Support for your development, constant new opportunities, regular peer feedback, mentorship and training.   International  workforce  :  Collaboration with international talents from 80+ nations bringing different perspectives, backgrounds and expertise together to ensure a truly global focus.   Flexibility:  Self-determined working hours and the opportunity to split your time between home and our campus in Düsseldorf: At least 4 days in the office per month and the rest at home. We also offer further flexibility for parents of young children and talents with severe disabilities or health conditions.   Relocation  and integration  :  Support with relocation costs, insurance, work permit and visa questions.   Equal  o  pportunity:  Commitment to creating an all-inclusive workplace, because we know representing the diversity of our users in our talent base enables us to create a more meaningful product.    A note from our recruitment team:     We know that applying for a new job can be both exciting and intimidating, but don’t worry, we’ve got you. Our recruiting team will be on hand every step of the way, but if you have any questions or concerns before applying, feel free to reach out to us at   joinus@trivago.com  . You can also find out more about our hiring process  here  .  We look forward to your application!

Title: Robotics Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: What's the role?  We are looking to hire a dynamic and hands on software developer (m/f/d) who will implement the next generation software platform for construction robotics. You will be part of our Open Innovation & Robotics team which is spearheading our corporate innovation in mobile robotics.   Who is Hilti?  We develop, manufacture and sell cutting-edge products, technology, software and services for the global construction industry. Hilti stands for innovation, quality and direct customer relationships.   In our IoT department we develop innovative Software Solutions, Mobile Apps, Measurement Technologies and software platform for mobile construction robotics - through our technologies in application software we take our customers to the next level of the technological progress.   With 30,000 employees in more than 120 countries, we're a great place for you to show us your worth, step up to new challenges and grow in your career.   What does the role involve?  As one of our Robotics Software Engineer (m/f/d) you will develop the next generation software platform for mobile construction robotics. In order to this, you will evaluate best practices and possible solutions, including design, implement and document our ROS-based Jaibot systems and maintain high code quality.   With your willingness to learn and to become part of a very dynamic high-performing international team at a highly reputable global organization, you will work on cutting-edge technologies, including sensor algorithms, autonomy, machine learning and many more.   Furthermore, you will collaborate and work with a team of internal and external developers to deliver the product on time and you will support our Mechanic and Electric development team to deliver the full-integrated Hilti robot platform.   93% of our people say they’re proud to work for Hilti, thanks to the quality of our products and the way we look after our people.   What do we offer?  We offer you a unique place to work, in which you are part of a creative and interdisciplinary team. We will give you a lot of responsibility to develop yourself and we´ll support you in shaping your individual career path.   In addition, we offer you innovative and personalized Benefits, such as   Flat hierarchies Internal mentoring program Flexible working arrangements (e.g. Mobile Working, Sabbatical and many more) Subsidy for monthly and annual public transport subscriptions and free company parking    spaces   Company pension scheme (employer-financed)    Further benefits:   Support in relocating and finding a flat Tax advice    Integrity, courage, teamwork and commitment are essential for Hilti – both today and tomorrow. We are proud to say that we not only talk about our values, but also live them every day.   What you need is:   Degree in Robotics, Computer science, Mathematics, or a comparable qualification 6+ years of experience in software development (e.g. complex embedded systems) and a strong track record as a software developer Strong practical experience with programming languages C++, Python and software development methods Practical experience with ROS, ideally gained through the industrialization and commercialization as well as deployment of robotic solutions is a great plus Broad understanding of systems architecture (hardware & software) as well as in integrated support systems (e.g. autonomy, safety, localization) and development lifecycle Any experience in Machine learning, Neural networks and SW development for parallel computing is an advantage Outstanding communication skills, strong command of English (spoken and written), German is optional    Why should you apply?  You drive for innovation and want to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies, where a job title is not considered a final destination but the starting point.   Take up the next challenge and start your career with HILTI! We are always looking for employees for a long-term cooperation.   During your job interview you will spend some time with us and get to know our company. Thus you will get a feeling for the job and our corporate culture.   Hilti stands for equal opportunities. We are looking forward to receiving applications from severely disabled persons and similarly disabled persons.   Contact: Hilti Entwicklungsgesellschaft mbH I Vivien Wildt I Human Resources   Should you encounter technical problems during your application, please contact mycareer-techsupport@hilti.com .

Title: Software Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Would creating future energy products excite you?  Do you love collaborating with teams to solve complex problems and deliver solutions?  Join our Software Development Team  Our Oilfield-Services-Digital-Team works with our business to provide intelligent, connected technologies. We develop and maintain applications and tools for our internal and external customers for data acquisition, data processing and visualization. We collaborate with development teams in science, mechanical and electrical engineering, physics, and geoscience, to develop innovative firmware and application software.   Partner with the best  As a Software Developer, you'll take ownership of the development process, ensuring the continuous improvement of our code. Part of a Scrum Team, you'll collaborate with Product Owners and Domain Experts to create features for our applications. You will engineer and develop versatile products and services for the energy industry.   As a Software Developer, you will be responsible for:    Supporting the technical lead with managing a diverse team of software developers, conceptualizing future products and features for a commercial drilling automation system Collaborating with users, stakeholders, and development teams to plan development of features for new and existing applications Understanding the business needs, value, and scope Hands on sustaining of existing components of a drilling automation system including OPC UA infrastructure     Fuel your passion    To be successful in this role you will:    Be a graduate in Computer Science, IT or similar or demonstrate equivalent professional work experience Have in-depth knowledge of .NET technology stack in C# using modern software development principles Demonstrate practical experience with developing web applications using web socket connections as well as RESTful interfaces Have experience with developing web applications using web socket connections as well as RESTful interfaces Have knowledge on Java-/Typescript and Angular framework Show knowledge on the concepts of TCP communication protocols, such as WCF, OPC UA Demonstrate experience in requirements documentation, verification, and validation Show the ability to be a self-starter and a good team player Have experience in WPF / WCF / PRISM / Visual Studio and TFS/Azure DevOps Be fluent in English (oral and written) and excellent all-round communication skills    Work in a way that works for you  We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:    Working flexible hours - flexing the times you work in the day Working 4 or 5 days a week    Working with us  Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.   Working for you  Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:    Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities Comprehensive private medical care options Safety net of life insurance and disability programs Tailored financial programs Additional elected or voluntary benefits    About Us:  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.   Join Us:  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.   Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.   R36752

Title: Software Engineer - Frontend (EU-Remote)
Description: Workera.aiis the precision upskilling platform helping enterprises, governments and individuals upskill and reskill to meet the critical demand for key technological capabilities including data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence. The Workera platform provides AI-driven mentorship at scale with its adaptive assessments and personalized learning plans that drive measurable results to close the skills gap.    We are a Silicon Valley start-up backed by New Enterprise Associates (NEA), Owl Ventures and Andrew Ng’s AI Fund. Our founders are Kian Katanforoosh, an award-winning Stanford Computer Science Lecturer who has taught AI to over 1 million people, and James Lee, former VP of Global Operations at Udacity. Our Chairman is Dr. Andrew Ng, co-founder of Coursera (NYSE: COUR), CEO of DeepLearning.AI, and founding lead of the Google Brain project.     Workera’s vision is to help humanity measurably close the skills gap to achieve its fullest potential.    We are looking for a Software Engineer - Frontend (EU)to join our team! You will be part of the Admin & Insightsteam at Workera.    The Admin & Insightsteam is responsible for ensuring the person managing Workera for their employees has all the insights and tools available to them for their employees' precise and efficient upskilling. You'll help the team deliver on that promise by ensuring that our software's quality remains high.    At Workera, we believe that building software is a craft, and we create an environment where we move fast by close cross-functional collaboration and near-instant feedback loops.    That's also why we invested in a stack which boosts that environment. Using the Elixirlanguage and the Phoenixweb framework, we have created a collaborative environment where we can move fast without breaking things.    Prior experience with Elixir is not required, but you must be excited to learn a new language and expand your horizon. We will give you the necessary resources and tools to know the language. In the past, we have successfully onboarded people on this stack, and they are now happy contributors to the code.    🌍 BST | CEST | EEST    Join this team if you want to join a highly collaborative and autonomous team who works with exciting new technologies!     Here's what you'll do ⚡️ :   Understanding the needs of people managing the Workera platform. Reading, writing, and reviewing application code, focusing on writing maintainable code that is easy to understand. Communicating persuasively with peers to inspire cooperation. Building scalable and highly available systems that follow operational best practices. Building observable systems that we can learn from, and we can continuously improve.     Here's what you'll bring 🪄 :   2+ years experience with software development, foundational knowledge in HTML, CSS & Javascript. Solid written and verbal communication skills in English. 1+ years of experience working with a distributed team. Knowledge of testing principles. Eager to learn how to work with the Elixir language and Phoenix framework.     What you'll get by working with us:   Unlimited PTO plus a week off between Christmas and New Year’s Collegial atmosphere Innovative environment Full support for home offices A culture of life-long learning supported up to $3,000 reimbursement for professional development Working across cultural and geographical lines alongside our offices in different parts of the world Being part of a world-class technical team that’s trying to make the world more meritocratic Being part of a great cause to improve lives everywhere through artificial intelligence Opportunity to own high-impact projects     What it's like to work at Workera:   High-velocity career growth.  You will be joining an all-star team of industry experts, world-class technologists from top tech companies, and proven startup operators that have built large, successful businesses. Workera is backed by top-tier venture capital firms and most importantly, we’re solving a massive problem for enterprises and individuals, so your opportunities for growth and impact are unlimited A company that is solving one of the most exciting interdisciplinary problems of our era.  World-changing innovations often spur from interdisciplinary research and development. Workera is, at its heart, an interdisciplinary company. To create the world’s most reliable and valid skills signal powering talent development, we hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on the most challenging problems at the intersection of psychometrics, artificial intelligence, and software engineering – from developing valid and reliable computer adaptive tests, to recommending personalized learning plans to employees and organizations, and enabling business leaders worldwide to make the best strategic decisions for upskilling and recruiting Diversity.  We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. Our team-members, like our users, transcend geography, culture, and language; what we share, collectively, is a drive to create a skills-based, more meritocratic world, and a unique ability to execute. A remote-friendly work environment.  No matter where you reside, you’re a part of Workera. We ensure that our globally distributed employees can participate fully in our company’s activities and do their best work every day. Lifelong learning.  As talented as our team members are, we know that everyone is a constant work-in-progress and that the best is yet to come. We support each other in our curiosity and creativity – which we pursue through thoughtful discussion, mentorship, and knowledge-sharing among a diverse set of peers and colleagues. Did someone ever tell you that world-class mentorship doesn’t exist in startups? Please send them our way! A culture of transparency  that we carry through to messaging communication, ensuring that team members have the information they need to make good decisions.    🔮 We’re learners, dreamers, and game-changers. Join us to bring everyone the opportunity to achieve their fullest potential!     At Workera we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation, and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Workera believes that diversity and inclusion among our employees are critical to our success as a company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Selection for employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Title: Software-Engineer (w/m/d) Digitalisierung für Bahntechnik
Description: Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied  Siemens Mobility  ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 39.600 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.   Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld – herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert   Als Software-Engineer (w/m/d) Digitalisierung wirken Sie mit bei der digitalen Transformation und treiben entsprechende Projekte mit voran. Sie unterstützen die Mobility Geschäftsfelder beim Architektur-Design von Systemen sowie beim Einsatz moderner Software-Technologien. Sie identifizieren Trends, machen diese für andere verfügbar und treiben gemeinsam mit Kollegen die Entwicklung voran. Sie entwickeln kundenspezifische Lösungen basierend auf standardisierten Produkten und Tools, entwerfen Spezifikationen, technische Konzepte und Schnittstellenintegrationen. Sie treiben eine offene Fehlerkultur und finden alternative Wege, um Innovationsziele zu erreichen. Sie arbeiten partnerschaftlich mit den Bereichen, wie z.B. Software-Architektur und Inbetriebsetzung zusammen. Sie konzeptionieren Testumgebungen und Automatisierungslösungen für Hard- und Software für den Bereich Schienenfahrzeuge und -infrastruktur. Eine ausführliche Einarbeitung, gezielte Förderung durch Training und Weiterbildung sowie die Arbeit im internationalen Umfeld steht Ihnen offen. Sie erwarten vielfältige Optionen und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten innerhalb des Expert House der Mobility und die Chance auf einen langfristigen zukunftsträchtigen Arbeitsplatz.   Ihre Qualifikationen – fundiert und adäquat   Sie haben ein abgeschlossenes Bachelor-Studium in Informatik, Ingenieurswissenschaften oder einer ähnlichen Fachrichtung. Wünschenswerterweise besitzen sie erste Berufserfahrung in den genannten Technologien, die Sie z.B. in Rahmen einer Werkstudententätigkeit erworben haben. Sie besitzen Kenntnisse in mehreren dieser Technologien: UI/UX Design Prinzipien, Cloud-Plattform AWS und Azure-Ökosystem, Machine Learning, Source Code Tools wie Gitlab, Github. Außerdem besitzen Sie Kenntnisse in den Programmiersprachen: Java, C, C++, C#, Angular, React, PHP, Python. Ein agiles Mindset und Erfahrung in den Mechanismen der Softwareentwicklung (z.B. Scrum), einschließlich Quellcodeverwaltung, Repositories, Wikis und Continuous Integration wären wünschenswert. Außerdem besitzen Sie einen gültigen Führerschein der Klasse B. Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab.   So treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt – einfach und direkt  www.siemens.de/mobility  wenn Sie vor Ihrer Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchten.   +49 (9131) 17- 52430  wenn Sie erste Fragen mit unserem Recruiting Team klären möchten. Ansprechpartner dieser Stellenausschreibung ist Peter Wiebories.   www.siemens.de/karriere  wenn Sie mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchten.   Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.   Organisation:  Siemens Mobility   Unternehmen:  Siemens Mobility GmbH   Erfahrungsniveau:  Graduate   Jobtyp:  Vollzeit

Title: Software-Engineer (w/m/d) Digitalisierung für Bahntechnik
Description: Standort:  ERL S SP 7   Fachabteilung:  SMO CS LS EH   Art der Anstellung:  Unbefristet / Vollzeit   Eingruppierung:  Germany - Non Senior Management - ERA-Entgeltgruppe 09   Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied  Siemens Mobility  ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 39.600 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.   Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld – herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert   Als Software-Engineer (w/m/d) Digitalisierung wirken Sie mit bei der digitalen Transformation und treiben entsprechende Projekte mit voran. Sie unterstützen die Mobility Geschäftsfelder beim Architektur-Design von Systemen sowie beim Einsatz moderner Software-Technologien. Sie identifizieren Trends, machen diese für andere verfügbar und treiben gemeinsam mit Kollegen die Entwicklung voran. Sie entwickeln kundenspezifische Lösungen basierend auf standardisierten Produkten und Tools, entwerfen Spezifikationen, technische Konzepte und Schnittstellenintegrationen. Sie treiben eine offene Fehlerkultur und finden alternative Wege, um Innovationsziele zu erreichen. Sie arbeiten partnerschaftlich mit den Bereichen, wie z.B. Software-Architektur und Inbetriebsetzung zusammen. Sie konzeptionieren Testumgebungen und Automatisierungslösungen für Hard- und Software für den Bereich Schienenfahrzeuge und -infrastruktur. Eine ausführliche Einarbeitung, gezielte Förderung durch Training und Weiterbildung sowie die Arbeit im internationalen Umfeld steht Ihnen offen. Sie erwarten vielfältige Optionen und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten innerhalb des Expert House der Mobility und die Chance auf einen langfristigen zukunftsträchtigen Arbeitsplatz.   Ihre Qualifikationen – fundiert und adäquat   Sie haben ein abgeschlossenes Bachelor-Studium in Informatik, Ingenieurswissenschaften oder einer ähnlichen Fachrichtung. Wünschenswerterweise besitzen sie erste Berufserfahrung in den genannten Technologien, die Sie z.B. in Rahmen einer Werkstudententätigkeit erworben haben. Sie besitzen Kenntnisse in mehreren dieser Technologien: UI/UX Design Prinzipien, Cloud-Plattform AWS und Azure-Ökosystem, Machine Learning, Source Code Tools wie Gitlab, Github. Außerdem besitzen Sie Kenntnisse in den Programmiersprachen: Java, C, C++, C#, Angular, React, PHP, Python. Ein agiles Mindset und Erfahrung in den Mechanismen der Softwareentwicklung (z.B. Scrum), einschließlich Quellcodeverwaltung, Repositories, Wikis und Continuous Integration wären wünschenswert. Außerdem besitzen Sie einen gültigen Führerschein der Klasse B. Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab.   So treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt – einfach und direkt  www.siemens.de/mobility  wenn Sie vor Ihrer Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchten.   +49 (9131) 17- 52430  wenn Sie erste Fragen mit unserem Recruiting Team klären möchten. Ansprechpartner dieser Stellenausschreibung ist Peter Wiebories.   www.siemens.de/karriere  wenn Sie mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchten.   Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.   Organization:  Siemens Mobility   Company:  Siemens Mobility GmbH   Experience Level:  Recent College Graduate   Job Type:  Full-time

Title: Full Stack Web Developer (m/w/d)
Description: Bei Bayer sind wir Visionäre und entschlossen, die größten Herausforderungen unseres Planeten zu überwinden und zu einer Welt beizutragen, in der genug Nahrung und ausreichende medizinische Versorgung für alle Menschen keine unerreichbaren Ziele mehr darstellen. Wir tun dies mit Energie, Neugier und purer Hingabe, lernen stets von den Menschen um uns herum, erweitern unsere Denkweise, verbessern unsere Fähigkeiten und definieren das „Unmögliche“ neu. Es gibt viele Gründe, sich uns anzuschließen: Wenn Sie nach einer abwechslungsreichen und bedeutungsvollen beruflichen Zukunft streben, in der Sie gemeinsam mit anderen brillanten Köpfen wirklich etwas bewegen können, möchten wir Sie in unserem Team haben.  Full Stack Web Developer (m/w/d)  IHRE AUFGABEN UND VERANTWORTLICHKEITEN   Leite die Entwicklung von Front End-Anwendungen und von Back End-Services, die unsere Aktivitäten in den Bereichen IoT, Computer Vision, Machine Learning und Big Data unterstützen Entwerfe und entwickle Full Stack-Webanwendungen, sowohl Prototypen als auch robuste und skalierbare produktive Software Werde ein wichtiger Bestandteil des Bayer Crop Protection Innovation Lab-Teams und unterstütze Landwirte weltweit bei der Qualifizierung und Quantifizierung von Unkraut-, Krankheits- und Schädlingsproblemen auf ihren Feldern Arbeite in einem funktionsübergreifenden Team bestehend aus Entwicklern, Datenwissenschaftlern, Agronomen und Softwareingenieuren und übernehme End to End-Produktverantwortung Nutze einen hochmodernen Technologiestack, sowie den Zugang zu Beratern, Schulungen und Konferenzen, um deine Expertise zu vertiefen, dich kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln und unsere Produkte zu verbessern Entwerfe und implementiere mittels der Infrastruktur als Code (IaC) Methodik, Testautomatisierung, und CI/ CD gemäß DevOps-Praktiken   WAS SIE MITBRINGEN   Bachelor oder Master of Science in Informatik, Statistik, Operations-Research, angewandter Mathematik oder verwandten Bereichen Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung von Full Stack-Webanwendungen mit modernen JavaScript-Frameworks (React bevorzugt) einschließlich Automatisierung wie Grunt, Gulp, Brunch, etc. Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von REST-APIs mit Python, Java etc. und vertiefte Kenntnisse von Standards wie HTML5, CSS3, Browser-APIs, OAuth und Websicherheit Erfahrung mit SQL, relationalen und nicht-relationalen Datenbanken Erfahrung mit Amazon Web Services (AWS) und Serverless Computing Erfahrung mit DevOps-Praktiken und Tools für CI/ CD, Testautomatisierung und Monitoring Erfahrung mit Software-Tests und Praktiken wie TDD, Unit-, End2End-Tests und Test-Frameworks Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse, sowohl in Wort als auch in Schrift   IHRE BEWERBUNG  Dies ist Ihre Chance, sich mit uns gemeinsam den größten globalen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit zu stellen: die Gesundheit der Menschen zu erhalten, die wachsende Weltbevölkerung zu ernähren und den Klimawandel zu verlangsamen. Sie haben eine Stimme, Ideen und Perspektiven, die wir hören möchten. Denn unser Erfolg beginnt mit Ihnen. Seien Sie dabei!   Bayer begrüßt Bewerbungen aller Menschen ungeachtet von ethnischer Herkunft, nationaler Herkunft, Geschlecht, Alter, körperlichen Merkmalen, sozialer Herkunft, Behinderung, Mitgliedschaft in einer Gewerkschaft, Religion, Familienstand, Schwangerschaft, sexueller Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentität oder einem anderen sachfremden Kriterium nach geltendem Recht. Wir bekennen uns zu dem Grundsatz, alle Bewerberinnen und Bewerber fair zu behandeln und Benachteiligungen zu vermeiden.   Standort:  Leverkusen   Division:  Crop Science   Referenzcode:  539146

Title: Software Engineer C# (m/f/d)
Description: BICOis the leading bio convergence company in the world, equipping hundreds of laboratories and thousands of scientists with cutting-edge life science technologies. By combining different technologies, such as robotics, artificial intelligence, computer science, and 3D bioprinting with biology, BICO enables customers to improve people's health and lives for the better.    The Business Area BIOSCIENCESis one of the three business areas of BICO and combines the knowledge and innovative technology of five life-science companies: CYTENA, DISPENDIX, CYTENA Bioprocess Solutions, ECHO and BIOSERO. Driven by the BICO vision to create the future of health, we develop technologies and products for sorting and analysis of single- and multi-cell applications, such as single-cell omics, liquid handling, cell imaging and cell line development.    Our vision is: Create the Future of Health.    We are looking for a Software Engineer C# (m/f/d)to join our BIOSEROteam at our offices in Freiburg or to work remotely.       Responsibilities   Develop instrument control drivers using .NET/C# for Green Button Go software Test and deploy drivers and support other teams in the use and implementation of Green Button Go drivers Work with the team and independently to develop custom software solutions for laboratory automation and integration, then test and deploy those solutions in the lab Work with customers to gather requirements and implement custom software solutions that fit their needs Integrate BIOSERO software solutions with a wide variety of data and informatics systems Contribute to the development of new software products       Qualifications   University degree in computer science, software engineering or comparable fields, preferably with some knowledge of lab automation and scheduling software Excellent programming skills in C# Experience in Pharma/Life Sciences industry and using laboratory instruments is a plus Working knowledge of communication technologies (Serial, TCP/IP, CAN, etc.) and the ability to debug networking issues is advantageous Experience using and building applications using Cloud Infrastructure and technologies (Azure, AWS, IBM Cloud, etc.) is a plus Availability to travel occasionally to customer sites for developing GBG methods and to resolve software and driver issues       What we offer  Joining the Business Area BIOSCIENCESmeans being part of something big and shaping the future of medicine. We are a fast-growing life sciences company with award winning products and a fun, cool team that is friendly and supportive.     Agile start-up culture  : being a dynamic and international company and still benefit from a flat organizational structure. We work agile (SCRUM) in cross functional teams that is very progressive. Freedom  : There is a lot of opportunity to get involved in new projects and have an impact. There is a level of freedom to take ownership and responsibility and work on projects you enjoy. Development  : We regularly celebrate individual accomplishments and develop new skills through training courses. We have a talented team you can learn from and gain hands-on knowledge outside of your main responsibilities. Flexible working  : We focus on results not working hours, we want our employees to be as productive and happy as possible. Depending on the position and tasks also mobile working is possible. Team building:  Teamwork is a top priority for us! We are open-minded, help each other and enjoy organizing team events. Benefits:  We offer a wide range of benefits like free fruit, water, coffee in a modern stylish office with chillout area and many more… Company Pension plan:  The future of our employees is important to us. It is possible to participate in the company pension plan by our insurance partner with attractive conditions and subsidized by the employer. A chance to make a difference:  We are in the life sciences industry and our work is an excellent way to contribute to the development of new drugs and treatments that will be used to help hundreds of thousands of people worldwide.    Do you want to become part of our success story? Then apply online via our job portal. Please note that for Data Privacy compliance we are not able to accept any e-mail applications!    At BICO, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. We are an equal opportunity workplace and will always pride ourselves on being a collaborative environment.

Title: Full Stack Web Developer (m/f/d)
Description: At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.  Full Stack Web Developer (m/f/d)   Your Tasks And Responsibilities    You will lead the development of both, front-end applications and back-end services, which will support our IoT, computer vision, machine learning and big data activities Design and develop full stack web applications by evaluating, prototyping and implementing scalable solutions Work in a cross functional SCRUM team with end-to end-product responsibility Interact with a team of developers, data scientists, agronomists and engineers that solve real world problems in farming You will leverage a state-of-the-art technology stack and access to consultants, training and conferences to deepen your expertise, continuously develop your skills and leverage your knowledge for our products Ensure a fast delivery pipeline by following current practices of CI/CD Design and implement infrastructure as code, test automation, continuous integration, continuous delivery, and monitoring solutions following DevOps practices    Who You Are    Bachelor or Master of Science in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics or related fields Working experience in developing full stack web applications with modern JavaScript frameworks (React preferred) including automation such as Grunt, Gulp, Brunch, etc. Experienced in developing REST APIs with Python, Java etc. and strong knowledge of standards like HTML5, CSS3, browser API's, OAuth and web security Experienced with SQL, relational and non-relational databases Experienced with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and serverless computing Experienced with DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration, test automation, continuous delivery and monitoring Experienced with software testing and practices like TDD, Unit-, End2End-testing and testing frameworks Very good English skills, both written and spoken   YOUR APPLICATION  This is your opportunity to tackle the world’s biggest challenges with us: Maintaining our health, feeding growing populations and slowing the rate of climate change. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something big. Be Bayer.   Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.   Location:  Leverkusen   Division:  Crop Science   Reference Code:  539146

Title: Werkstudent (w/m/d) Data Management
Description: If you really want to make a difference – make it with us  Siemens Mobility  is a separately managed company of Siemens AG. As a leader in transport solutions for more than 160 years, Siemens Mobility is constantly innovating its portfolio in its core areas of rolling stock, rail automation and electrification, turnkey systems, intelligent traffic systems as well as related services. With digitalization, Siemens Mobility is enabling mobility operators worldwide to make infrastructure intelligent, increase value sustainably over the entire lifecycle, enhance passenger experience and guarantee availability. In fiscal year 2020, which ended on September 30, 2020, the former Siemens Mobility Division posted revenue of €9.1 billion and had around 38,500 employees worldwide.   Your new role – challenging and future-oriented  We, the Smart Products & Advanced Technologies department, are an R&D Competence Center for the Siemens Mobility GmbH with the mission to innovate technologies in the fields of digitalization, automation, and electrification in the Mobility domain. As our new    You contribute to our code base with high quality, testable and powerful code, you implement new features and refactor existing solutions. You will also test our products and provide recommendations to further improve our services. You work with various databases (SQL and NoSQL) and implement scalable/robust systems to handle large amounts of data. Investigating, evaluating, and implementing new concepts and methodologies in data management for ML development is also part of your responsibilities. In addition, creating common datasets and curating ML models for our customers is part of it. You'll also work with front-end developers and DevOps to co-create full-stack solutions that provide portals into data warehouses.   Your Qualifications – Solid And Appropriate   You study computer science (or a closely related field) and have already successfully completed basic courses in programming and e.g. databases, algorithms and data structures, theoretical computer science or software engineering. Furthermore, you have a passion for programming and have already gained some experience developing in Python. Familiarity with the Linux ecosystem is an advantage. You value a flexible and independent approach to work and have a strong attention to detail. Furthermore, you are fluent in German and English.   Getting in touch with us – straightforward and direct  www.siemens.de/mobility  if you would like to find out more about Siemens before applying.   +49 (9131) 17 52430  if you wish to discuss any initial questions with our recruitment team. The contact person handling this job ad is Ms. Julia Greff.   www.siemens.com/careers  if you would like more information about jobs and careers at Siemens.   As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.   Organization:  Siemens Mobility   Company:  Siemens Mobility GmbH   Experience Level:  Student (Not Yet Graduated)   Job Type:  Part-time

Title: JUNIOR DEVELOPER - Dubai, UAE
Description: Starting salary of 55,000 USD per annum  in a zero-tax environment.   Fast progression for strong performers.   Job location:  Dubai, UAE   About us:  Cobblestone Energy is a proprietary trading firm that specializes in the wholesale electricity market across Europe. Electricity is fundamental to the world's economic activities. We trade enough electricity every day to power a small country, and in doing so, we help to address the mismatch between electricity generation and consumption.    Job Description    At Cobblestone Energy we are on a mission to build the most advanced European electricity trading and analytics platform, with our technology being used by our teams of commercial traders to create significant value. We are looking for enthusiastic and resourceful developers who are passionate about building exceptionally reliable and performance data processing solutions. You want to help the commercial team make data-informed decisions, have a curious mindset, and are motivated to understand our business better. Developing a strong domain knowledge of our industry over time is key to long term success in this role.   If you have excellent programming skills, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for developing and improving applications utilizing cutting edge technologies, then we would like to meet you.   What we offer in this role    Competitive remuneration, with fast progression for strong performers. A challenging but exciting, open, and fun work environment. An opportunity to work with remarkably talented colleagues. Vast growth potential in every aspect. 15% target bonus with further upside. Employee share scheme participation International relocation support Opportunity to be embedded within a commercial team for those with strong commercial interest    Responsibilities    Write software applications and programs for backend/frontend purposes. Analyse programs and apps to improve their features and functionalities. Test & debug programs and fix any reported bugs. Collaborate with the tech team to improve the performance, efficiency, and scalability of our tools.    Requirements    BS/BE in Computer Science/Computer Engineering. Programming experience of 1 to 2 years in Python language. Expertise in at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask ...). Experience of 1 to 2 years in front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS, JQuery, JS, ...etc. Knowledge of APIs and webservices. Knowledge of Relational Databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server ...) and SQL language. Knowledge of NoSQL databases is a plus. Knowledge of AWS is a plus / Knowledge of data visualization tools, mainly Tableau, is a plus. Ability to work in a team environment. Strong problem-solving skills and analytical skills. Resilience and a determination to succeed. Independent thinkers with growth mindset. Must be passionate, self-motivated, and able to learn quickly. Strong sense of integrity. Personal values that match our company values.

Title: Junior Frontend Engineer (Vue.js)
Description: With Spenoki, we ask the following question: How can we build a sustainable economy that inspires? At Spenoki, we believe in inventions that add value to the world and create change because they are compelling. The time has come when the world needs a solution that makes sustainability as manageable for any business as its other resources.   Spenoki is a Munich-based startup that offers an easy-to-use SaaS solution that helps companies analyze, optimize, and report on their sustainability.   Spenoki is where great ideas become great experiences. We are looking for an experienced designer to join our core team to enhance and expand our existing portfolio. The ideal designer will have a passion for taking on complex problems and designing elegant, simple solutions that surprise and delight our customers. With a focus on sustainability management, you will design products that are not only easy to use, but also lead to a more sustainable future.   Join us if you want to develop the SaaS solution for the environmentally-conscious age!   Tasks  As a Software Engineer, you will contribute to defining and driving the future of Spenoki's products and thus the future of sustainability management.   Together with a highly autonomous, talented, cross-functional team of designers, domain experts and product managers, you will drive solutions from idea to production. You are the architect, designer and coder of your project. You are dynamic and able to work well both independently and as part of a team.   At Spenoki, we leave all egos at the door and concentrate on the job at hand. We value passionate, down-to-earth, “can do” people who enjoy fine-tuning small details, without losing sight of the big picture. We are looking for the type of person who feels uncomfortable when a day goes by without achieving something impactful. Someone who is driven to get things done and views obstacles as an exciting challenge that demands a creative solution. Above all, this task requires someone who is very proud of their work and who is inspired and motivated by their role to develop effective products for sustainability management and thus create a world worth living in.   Spenoki R&D is all about teamwork. Engineers work side by side with Product Designers and Domain Experts in a fast, creative atmosphere with minimal documentation. Our team members are self-sufficient and problem solvers. We are looking for people who are passionate about sustainability and strive to break it down into accessible features for everyone. Always one step ahead in development platforms, new functionality and APIs.   You will be part of every stage of development from concept to deployment.   If you're passionate about the user experience, want to be part of a group that works on very early stage products, have the opportunity to shape them, and enjoy crafting robust, scalable, and maintainable apps, we may be the team for you!   Design and develop the overall architecture of the web applications. Collaborate with the rest of the project team to conceptualize, code and launch new features. Follow and share the best engineering practices.    Requirements    Minimum Requirements:   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Frontend web development, including JavaScript, web standards, and modern frameworks. Understanding of data structures & relational/non-relational database technologies. Passion for engineering excellence and experience with agile project development. Experience in REST APIs.   Preferred qualifications:   Experience in the Vue.js frontend framework. A foundation in Computer Science fundamentals with excellent problem-solving skills, deep knowledge of data structures and object-oriented design, development paradigms and API design. Knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing and operations. Understanding of cloud services, such as AWS. Experience with backend development in Python or Java.    Benefits    Together, we will redefine how companies manage their sustainability. You have an impact on dozens of SMEs in Europe and that's just the start. Highly entrepreneurial environment. Ownership is one of our core values. We believe in your talent. Work from home, the WERK1 office in Munich or the Factory in Berlin with your colleagues. We offer you a competitive compensation package (salary, benefits and virtual shares). We support your personal growth and education with a time and money budget, as well as team learning events.

Title: Fullstack Web Developer (m/f/d)
Description: The ultimate upswing in e-commerce was triggered by the pandemic and has surfaced the need for sustainability more than ever. Our mission is to enable conscious and sustainable online shopping.  We develop an AI-based SaaS technology that allows online shoe shoppers to measure their feet easily and accurately at home in order to always find the perfect fitting shoe. This way, we reduce size-related returns and help avoiding unnecessary CO2 emissions, while helping online retailers lower their operating costs.   We are a strong, experienced team, coming from award winning innovation hubs with the know how to build impact-making products. In product creation and development, we consistently place the user and data insights at the center of our decisions.   Tasks   Develop multi-platform web applications for mobile and desktop Conceptualize, implement and maintain features of our products Develop reusable libraries Optimize the applications for performance and responsiveness Design and develop backend apps and APIs    Requirements    Ideally a completed degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field At least 3 years of experience in developing fullstack web applications, using: Node.js, React with HTML5 and CSS Good understanding of: Test-driven development (TDD), CI/CD pipelines, DevOps principles and MS-Azure cloud Having fun in solving complex problems Good level of English (minimum C1 level)   Nice to have:   Experience with Kubernetes and Docker Experience in developing with C# and Go for cloud applications Experience in using Grafana and Sentry (or similar)    Benefits    Confidence in you as the expert of your field and inclusion of your knowledge in company decisions Direct constructive feedback in a two-way manner, a great scope for creativity and mutual learning Maximum freedom and trust regarding working hours, location (preferably Germany) and vacations, so you can organize your work and private life according to your needs Opportunity to further develop your experience by certified trainings when required Guidance and coaching whenever needed as well as support in finding the right mentors from our broad network of experts A competitive salary and steep career opportunities thanks to continuous growth Monthly extra credit with Edenred, redeemable in a large store partner network   Being transparent is the bestway for us to find solutions and grow together. We pursue a culture where we frankly address anything that concerns us or affects our work. We bring in a rich combination of skillsets and individual strengths, making us a powerful team.   Do you care about our planet and want to connect it to your passion for software development? Then we are looking forward to getting to know you!   Your Footprint Crew

Title: Frontend Developer (w/m/d)
Description: FUJITSU – Shape your world by working your way  Fujitsu ist ein weltweit führendes IT-Unternehmen mit ca. 130.000 Mitarbeitern in 100 Ländern. Ob Hardware oder Cloud Solutions, Consulting oder Artificial Intelligence Lösungen - als globaler Konzern bietet Fujitsu das gesamte Spektrum an IT-Services und -Produkten aus einer Hand. Gestalten Sie Ihre und unsere Welt, indem wir gemeinsam für unsere Kunden hervorragende Ergebnisse erzielen und die digitale Transformation vorantreiben.   Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt für den Standort Neckarsulm, Stuttgart, Frankfurt, München, Düsseldorf, Berlin, Hannover, Nürnberg, Ulm, Hamburg oder Frankfurt  einen:   Frontend Developer  (w/m/d)  Legal Entity: Fujitsu TDS GmbH  Diese Aufgaben erwarten Sie:   Sie unterstützen als Teil eines agilen Scrum Teams bei der Neu- und Weiterentwicklung von innovativen Applikationen im SAP-Kontext Sie konzipieren und realisieren Benutzeroberflächen mit SAPUI5 oder anderen Frontend Web Frameworks Sie integrieren Frontend- und Backend-Services Sie begleiten den gesamten Produktentwicklungs- und Projektzyklus: von der Anforderungsanalyse über die Konzeptentwicklung bis hin zum Projekt / Deployment beim Kunden Sie identifizieren und bewerten neue Technologien und Trends Sie wirken als Teil des Entwicklungsteams beim späteren Support der entwickelten Produkte mit (DevOps) Es erwarten Sie spannende und innovative Entwicklungen für Fujitsu-eigene Softwareprodukte wie z. B. Internet of Things (IoT), Machine Learning (ML), Robotic Process Automation (RPA) etc.    Folgende Qualifikationen sollten Sie mitbringen:   Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung Mindestens drei Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Web-Entwicklung Gute Kenntnisse mind. eines UI Frameworks (Angular, React, Vue, SAPUI5) Erfahrungen in der Datenanbindung über JSON und REST APIs Ausgeprägtes Qualitätsbewusstsein und Kenntnisse im Bereich Version Control mit GIT Vertieftes Wissen im Bereich User Experience (UX) und User Interface Design Generisches Wissen zur ganzheitlichen Applikationsentwicklung Erfahrung in agilen, selbstorganisierten und verteilten Teams Wünschenswert sind außerdem Kenntnisse zu OpenUI5 / SAPUI5, SAP Cloud Platform (SCP) / Business Technology Platform (BTP), SAP HANA 2.0 / SAP HANA XS Advanced, Confluence und Jira Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift    Warum Fujitsu:   Moderne Arbeitsplätze und Ausstattung Flexible Arbeitszeiten sowie Arbeiten von Zuhause möglich Umfangreiche Fort- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten in Führungs- oder Expertenlaufbahnen 30 Tage Urlaub & Sonderurlaub Verschiedenste Gesundheitsprogramme Zahlreiche Vergünstigungen, Firmenfeiern & Teamevents    Erfahren Sie mehr über unsere Werte und Unternehmenskultur:   Trusted to deliver - Bei uns erleben sie vertrauensvolle Zusammenarbeit in allen Bereichen, die Ihnen den notwendigen Freiraum zur persönlichen Entfaltung ermöglicht. Do the right thing - Unser Ziel ist es, die Welt nachhaltiger zu machen, und mit unseren Produkten und Dienstleistungen einen positiven Einfluss auf die Gesellschaft auszuüben. Work your way - Gestalten Sie Ihre Arbeit flexibel, um eine gute Balance zwischen Beruf und Privatleben zu haben. Achieve together – Wir übertreffen gemeinsam unsere individuellen Ziele und schaffen Mehrwert für alle Beteiligten. Play your part in a leading global technology business: Gestalten Sie Ihre Welt in einem führenden globalen Technologieunternehmen, das die Welt verändert und Innovationen vorantreibt. Wir respektieren Fairness, Chancengleichheit und fördern die Vielfalt mit all ihren Facetten sowie die Inklusion im Unternehmen    https://www.fujitsu.com/de/about/careers/do-the-right-thing/index.html

Title: JUNIOR DEVELOPER - Dubai, UAE
Description: Starting salary of 55,000 USD per annum  in a zero-tax environment.   Fast progression for strong performers.   Job location:  Dubai, UAE   About us:  Cobblestone Energy is a proprietary trading firm that specializes in the wholesale electricity market across Europe. Electricity is fundamental to the world's economic activities. We trade enough electricity every day to power a small country, and in doing so, we help to address the mismatch between electricity generation and consumption.    Job Description    At Cobblestone Energy we are on a mission to build the most advanced European electricity trading and analytics platform, with our technology being used by our teams of commercial traders to create significant value. We are looking for enthusiastic and resourceful developers who are passionate about building exceptionally reliable and performance data processing solutions. You want to help the commercial team make data-informed decisions, have a curious mindset, and are motivated to understand our business better. Developing a strong domain knowledge of our industry over time is key to long term success in this role.   If you have excellent programming skills, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for developing and improving applications utilizing cutting edge technologies, then we would like to meet you.   What we offer in this role    Competitive remuneration, with fast progression for strong performers. A challenging but exciting, open, and fun work environment. An opportunity to work with remarkably talented colleagues. Vast growth potential in every aspect. 15% target bonus with further upside. Employee share scheme participation International relocation support Opportunity to be embedded within a commercial team for those with strong commercial interest    Responsibilities    Write software applications and programs for backend/frontend purposes. Analyse programs and apps to improve their features and functionalities. Test & debug programs and fix any reported bugs. Collaborate with the tech team to improve the performance, efficiency, and scalability of our tools.    Requirements    BS/BE in Computer Science/Computer Engineering. Programming experience of 1 to 2 years in Python language. Expertise in at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask ...). Experience of 1 to 2 years in front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS, JQuery, JS, ...etc. Knowledge of APIs and webservices. Knowledge of Relational Databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server ...) and SQL language. Knowledge of NoSQL databases is a plus. Knowledge of AWS is a plus / Knowledge of data visualization tools, mainly Tableau, is a plus. Ability to work in a team environment. Strong problem-solving skills and analytical skills. Resilience and a determination to succeed. Independent thinkers with growth mindset. Must be passionate, self-motivated, and able to learn quickly. Strong sense of integrity. Personal values that match our company values.

Title: Werkstudent*in (w/m/d) im Cost and Value Engineering zur Entwicklung von KI-gestützten Web-Applikationen ab Oktober 2022
Description: Art der Anstellung:  Befristet; 15 – 20 Stunden/Woche   Deine Extraportion Praxis.  Wie werden wir uns übermorgen fortbewegen, miteinander kommunizieren, Energien nutzen? Lass uns gemeinsam an den Antworten arbeiten. Wir suchen dafür kluge Köpfe, die Theorie in Praxis umwandeln und clever mitdenken. Kurz: Menschen, die ihre und unsere Fragen in neue Ausrufezeichen verwandeln wollen! Als Werkstudent (w/m/d) stehen dir bei uns viele Türen offen, um dich einzubringen: Ergreife die Chance und werde Teil unseres weltweiten Netzwerks, knüpfe wichtige Kontakte und lege so den Grundstein für deine berufliche und persönliche Zukunft. Unsere Teams freuen sich auf dich.   Wir setzen um, worauf es ankommt. Das ist dein Beitrag.  Wir suchen ab Oktober 2022  einen Werkstudenten (w/m/d), der uns bei der Entwicklung von Web-Applikationen unterstützt, die das Cost and Value Engineering Expertennetzwerk nachhaltig optimieren.    Im Rahmen deiner Tätigkeit arbeitest du an der Erstellung von Web-Applikationen aktiv mit Du verbesserst das UI/UX Design unserer Applikationen Du arbeitest mit unseren Backend-Entwicklern zusammen, um die bestmöglichen Lösungen zu finden   Wir suchen keine Superhelden. Sondern super helle Köpfe.   Dein Ticket zu uns ist dein Studium im Fachbereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Mathematik, Computer Science, Data Science oder Vergleichbares und du bist auf der Suche nach einem anspruchsvollen, langfristigen Job (15 - 20 Stunden / Woche) Du hast Erfahrung mit Frontend-Entwicklung (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, …) und bereits erste Single-Page Applikationen mit Vue, React oder Angular erstellt Idealerweise bringst du auch bereits erste Projekt-Erfahrungen aus der Frontend-Entwicklung mit Aufgaben und Probleme gehst du analytisch und lösungsorientiert an Kenntnisse zur Produktkosten-Kalkulation und Kostenstrukturen sowie Erfahrungen in der Projekt- oder Gruppenarbeit sind dein Plus Deine guten Deutsch- oder guten Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab   Wir wollen, dass du willst: Bewirb dich!  www.siemens.de  wenn du vor deiner Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchtest.   Du hast Fragen zur Bewerbung? Hier  findest du Antworten auf häufig gestellte Fragen.   Wenn du darüber hinaus noch Fragen hast, wende dich gerne an uns: www.siemens.de/fragenzurbewerbung   www.siemens.de/karriere   wenn du mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchtest.   Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.   Organization:  Supply Chain Management   Company:  Siemens AG   Experience Level:  Student (Not Yet Graduated)   Job Type:  Part-time

Title: Trainee Technology Java/Cloud/Data/Quality Assurance (all genders)
Description: Become an IT consultant in a field of your choice within Technology in just six to eight weeks. With an entry-level program that is so close to the real world that you can apply your know-how immediately? After successful completion, you will receive a permanent employment contract. Is this totally your thing?   Then live your passion in a position where you will become a Tech specialist exceptionally quickly and implement innovative solutions at the customer's site.   This is what awaits you:  Choose one of our trainee program, so you'll be up to speed in a short time!  Java: Development of Java applications based on Java EE, Spring, Hibernate and open source frameworks.  Data: Introduction to Big Data Management (Analytics, Machine Learning & AI); Data Integration and ETL & Streaming Technologies.  Cloud Infrastructure: Network Technology, Datacenter-Management and Cloud Computing (AWS, Azure)  Quality Assurance & Test Automation: Quality Assurance on large-scale projects within current procedure models and Requirement analysis and management.  Cloud Strategy and Design: Agile methods, especially Scrum  Basics in software engineering and software architecture.  We are looking forward to  Completed IT or IT-related studies or a solid IT apprenticeship  First practice in Java, Cloud, Data Basis (SQL), Quality Engineering or something IT related.  Very good analytical-conceptual skills and a high motivation to learn.  Very strong proficiency in English.  Mobility and pleasure in working in an international project team  Your contact  Do you have any questions? Then contact our recruiting team by e-mail at recruiting_germany@accenture.com or by phone at 00800 45045045. .   We are looking forward to your application.

Title: Software Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Sind Sie bereit die Zukunft des Fahrzeugs aktiv mitzugestalten? Revolutionieren Sie mit uns das Erlebnis des autonomen und vernetzten Fahrens und werden Sie ein Teil unseres VALEO-Teams!  Am Standort Bietigheim-Bissingen  entwickeln und fertigen wir erfolgreich innovative Produkte, die den Fahrkomfort und die Sicherheit neu erfinden. Um unser Wachstum und die Weiterentwicklung voranzutreiben, suchen wir Sie, für unser Team.   Diese Herausforderungen erwarten Sie   Entwicklung des Algorithmus für Einparksysteme oder aktive Sicherheits- oder autonome Fahrfunktionen wie Fahrzeug-, Fußgänger- oder andere Hinderniserkennung, Multisensor-Objektverfolgung, Multisensor Fusion, Szene Wahrnehmung und Situationsbewertung usw. Design, Implementierung und Evaluierung des entwickelten Algorithmus auf einem Embedded Target unter Verwendung von C/C++ unter Berücksichtigung von ISO26262 und ASPICE Analyse der Kundenanforderungen und Abstimmung mit internen und externen Entwicklungsabteilungen Durchführung von technischen Analysen zu identifizierten Problemen (Reproduktion, Profiling, Debugging, Trace-Analyse usw.). Abstimmung der Algorithmenentwicklung, Themen mit Kunden und anderen Valeo Abteilungen (Software, System, Test, Validierung etc.), Arbeiten in einem agilen, dynamischen Expertenteam und Zusammenarbeit mit internationalen Teams aus verschiedenen Bereichen auf der ganzen Welt.   Sind Sie bereit dafür?   Abschluss Studium in Informatik, Robotics oder Elektrotechnik oder vergleichbare Ausbildung Solide C-Programmierung Kenntnisse für die Integration, das Debugging und die Kompilierung von eingebettetem C/C++-Code für die Produktion von Algorithmen. Starke Kenntnisse der Algorithmenentwicklung in Python oder Matlab-Tools: Simulink, Stateflow und MATLAB-scripts. Kenntnisse in der Generierung von Produktionscode mit MATLAB Coder/Simulink Embedded Coder sind von Vorteil. Mindestens 2 Jahre Erfahrung in einem oder mehreren der folgenden Bereiche: PID-Regler, Machine Learning, Umfeld Erkennung, Kalman-Filter, künstliche Intelligenz, Robotik, digitale Signalverarbeitung. Erfahrung und gutes Verständnis von Multicore-Prozessoren. AUTOSAR- oder Adaptive AUTOSAR-Kenntnisse sind von Vorteil. Fähigkeit und umfassend zu dokumentieren Proaktiv und rigoros, mit starker Fähigkeit zur Problemlösung. Englisch fließend, Deutsch von Vorteil Fähigkeit zu kommunizieren, zu kooperieren und im Team zu arbeiten   Revolutionieren Sie mit uns die Zukunft des Automobils!  Dank unserer auf Innovation ausgerichteten Strategie stehen wir bei Valeo im Zentrum der drei Revolutionen, die den Automobilsektor nachhaltig verändern: Elektrifizierung, autonome und vernetzte Fahrzeuge sowie die digitale Mobilität. Wir bieten Ihnen hervorragende Karrierechancen und die Möglichkeit, diese revolutionären Entwicklungen aktiv mitzugestalten, auch international.   Suchen Sie nach neuen technologischen und persönlichen Herausforderungen? Dann kommen Sie zu uns!   Sie möchten mehr erfahren?   Alessa KNAPP    Mobil: +49 (0) 176 3000 2352  Bitte reichen Sie Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen aus datenschutzrechtlichen Gründen ausschließlich online über das Bewerberportal auf unserer Website www.valeo.de ein.   Mehr Information auf https://www.valeo.com   Primärer Standort  HCC2-DE-Baden Wurttemberg   Tätigkeit  Research and Development -DE   Organisation  10L Driving Systems And Functions   Beschäftigungsart  Vollzeit   Schicht  Tagarbeit   Beschäftigungsstatus  Unbefristet   Beschäftigungsverhältnis  Standard   Stellenanzeige  28.06.2022, 09:13:49

Title: Junior Software Engineer (all genders)
Description: Shaping the Digital Future   DEVnet  consultants blend technological knowhow with analytical insights and industry expertise to develop sustainable solutions in a data-driven world. Founded in 1998, the company is headquartered in Grünwald near Munich with three further locations in Germany and Poland.   Its 150 experts collaborate with clients ranging from global banks and insurances to providers of energy and mobility as well as startups in the digital economy. They focus on organising data, developing platforms and algorithms, generating insights and facilitating digital transformation to build digital fitness.   Junior Software Engineer (all genders)   #1 What the job offers you    You will work in an international environment and can count on our experienced teams of experts Your skills will be promoted and can develop in varied activities Your personal and professional training and development is important to us We highly value team spirit and personal responsibility    #2 A few key data you should agree with    A degree in computer science You compile a kernel privately from time to time and have fun trying out the latest topics GitHub, Codeproject, Golem and Heise are your daily reading material Ability to work in a team and communicate Fascination for programming languages and technologies Initial knowledge of specialist processes in the retail sector Interest in the financial sector A goal-oriented, self-reliant working style Fluent in German and English Good MS Office skills Willingness to travel IT process knowledge is desirable    #3 Benefits    You will learn the consulting and project business together with our experienced developers Close contact with specialist and IT departments Interesting projects with international customers using state of the art technologies Independence and rapid assumption of responsibility Individual training and further education under attractive conditions In our training programme you will develop your own ideas with colleagues and work independently on new topics    We are here for you!   Please refer to reference number YF10707003  in your application.   Sounds all good but do you still have any questions?   Furusan Hammerschmidt  Human Relations / Business Development Services   jobs[AT]devnet.de   Meeting Office   DEVnet GmbH  Wredestraße 7   80335 München   Tel: +49 89 244154 000   Fax: +49 89 244154 001   www.devnet.de

Title: Software Engineer Algorithmic Trading (f/m/d)
Description: Job description:   For our Team Trading Innovation Solutions in Düsseldorf we are looking for you!     Designing and implementing robust, integrated, cloud-based software solutions with a focus on innovative technologies to accelerate our algo trading and analytics capability Working closely with front office and risk stakeholders to analyze, capture and transform their business requirements into trade automation and analytics solutions Align with other developers, data scientists and design architects throughout the full agile development process  Profile description:    Essential:  Bachelor's or an MS in computer science, engineering or other related discipline Significant experience with programming languages like Python, Java, C# and C++ Tangible experience working with energy traders on decision support analytics and/or trade automation Advanced analytical, problem-solving and troubleshooting skills Experience with agile delivery processes (Scrum, Kanban etc) as well as familiarity with energy trading and risk management  Desirable:  Web and database development experience – GUI and full stack development DevOps, Docker / Kubernetes, IP networking and cloud technologies Experience with data science as well as traditional approaches to optimization and analytics is a significant plus Middleware and streaming technology (eg kafka, flink) experience is also desirable   If you have any questions about this role, please contact:  Nadine Peralta da Margarida  career@uniper.energy Please note that applications by e-mail cannot be considered for data protection reasons.
