Title: Graduate Solutions Architect (m/f/d)
Description: Introduction  In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. We’re focused on one thing, helping your business get the most out of your data. NetApp brings the enterprise-grade data services you rely on into the cloud, and the simple flexibility of cloud into the data center. Our industry-leading solutions work across diverse customer environments and the world’s biggest public clouds.  As a cloud-led, data-centric software company, only NetApp can help build your unique data fabric, simplify and connect your cloud, and securely deliver the right data, services and applications to the right people—anytime, anywhere.     S3 Program  As a company committed to developing our future workforce, we created a program that enables our Early In Careers hires to fast track their careers through classroom and on-the-job training and clear benchmarks.  We have created a robust 90-day training program based in Raleigh Durham NC, USA, designed for entry-level talent. During this training, you will gain foundational knowledge of the Storage Industry, NetApp, and our products and solutions. Additionally, you will develop transferable soft skills that will allow you to excel within the organization and in your long-term career.  You will train alongside your peers from all over the world. Afterwards, you will transition into the business to start the on-the-job portion of your training.     Job Summary  As a NetApp Solutions Architect you will utilize your strong technical competencies and customer service orientation to provide the highest level of technical consultation to sales teams to support sales goals. You will work on cross-functional teams including Sales, Product Marketing, Services and Engineering to create a strategy that provides the best solutions to customers. You will become intimately acquainted with the customer's business requirements, technical needs, systems, environment, and service history, enabling you to present targeted business solutions.  Essential Functions  Solutions Architects work with NetApp potential customers and the EMEA Account/Sales Teams and Partners by providing expertise in the following areas:   Work closely with sales as a consultant to understand prospect's technical needs related to a specific product or market. Perform consultative selling of optimum support and system solutions. Manage and evolve a comprehensive technology collaboration and support. Provide technical consultation/education to the Sales team and keep them apprised on new product information. Participate in customer evaluations and proof of concepts for deploying test systems. Plan, conduct and direct projects to support sales efforts and address future customer needs. Project plan includes costs, staffing, technical leadership and project evaluation. Keep apprised of all new product features and fixes.     Job Requirements   Technical understanding of NetApp’s products and technology. Understanding of cloud, AI/ML and modern data analytics solutions is a plus. Working knowledge of all security aspects on-prem, the data path and in the cloud is a plus. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Good interpersonal communication and customer service skills are needed in order to work successfully with prospects, customers, partners, and cross functional teams to meet sales goals. Account management and project management experience, is a plus. Strong aptitude for learning new technologies and understanding how to utilize them in a customer facing environment. Ability to follow standard engineering principles and practices. Creative approach to problem solving. Travel to the prospective customer's domestic sites and other global sites as necessary.     Your Profile   Intern experience as a Solution Architect or similar Presales role is a plus. A Bachelor or Master of Arts or Sciences Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, AI related, or equivalent is required. Understand future datacenter architectures, automation, security, DevOps, End user compute environments. Specialized knowledge in breadth and/or depth. VMware / AWS / Azure / Google certification is helpful

Title: Mobile App Analyst (f/m/d)
Location: Cologne Bonn Region, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany
Description: Anstellungsdetails  Permanent contract, full-time or part-time, Cologne / Darmstadt / Remote   Info   Who We Are    We operate Kaufland.de: Several thousand sellers and millions of products make us one of the fastest growing online marketplaces. Our work is characterised by a dynamic corporate culture, with a start-up mentality and the opportunities offered by a large corporation in the background. We combine knowledge and many years of experience in e-commerce with flat hierarchies and a highly motivated team. Whether as an intern or an executive: We take every idea seriously, because we want to work together in shaping the future of e-commerce!   We love flexibility!  That's why we offer you a modern workplace in our office in Cologne / Darmstadt / Düsseldorf, while at the same time giving you the opportunity to work remotely. We want to offer you the most attractive workplace in e-commerce and a maximum of flexibility for your personal work-life balance.   Day-by-day, our development team of about 190 experts pursues the goal of creating the best-possible customer shopping experience for the Kaufland.de marketplace. We are here to inspire millions of customers, to help them find, purchase and get the things they love. To enrich the lives of our customers, we collaborate in cross-functional teams, in which product owners, product designers, frontend and backend engineers, data scientists and lean managers join forces. Details regarding the challenges of the respective product areas can be found here: https://kaufland-ecommerce.com/en/team/tech/   Detail   Your Tasks – This Is What Awaits You In Detail    You help our fast-growing mobile app to stay user-centered with meaningful data analysis You answer data requests and proactively generate ideas from data You define implementation requirements for engineers and test them self-sufficiently You influence business and feature decisions with your analyses You assist in the interpretation of A/B test results and consult on test setups    Your Profile – This Is What We Expect From You    You are proficient in using a tracking tool, e.g. Google Analytics You have a thorough understanding of analytics in an app setting You have at least basic knowledge in data visualization You are a strong communicator who is able to get their point across to several stakeholder groups, from peers to non-technical business colleagues You have good SQL basics, advanced skills are a plus Any knowledge in A/B testing as well as Python or R skills are a plus    What We Offer    Create your own work-life! We offer you the best possible flexibility in terms of working hours and location A highly-motivated and qualified team from different fields and numerous nations The future is digital - Develop the e-commerce of the future with us and work on a product with millions of users with a broadly-based technology stack Power meets dynamic - flat hierarchies and start-up mentality meet the power of a big corporate group and offers you an agile and secure working environment at the same time Free choice of hardware – we provide you with the development environment of your choice Personal & team growth: We love to have flexibility in terms of working location, but we also believe that personal interactions are important. That’s why we organize company events, and cover the costs to bring you there and to other (approved) get togethers with your peers. The same applies to conferences and other learning opportunities. We want everybody to grow personally and professionally, as a team and as a company. Top conditions at the Urban Sports Club for fitness, team sports, yoga and more   Check out our Principles & our blog for even more insights into our company culture!   Bewerben  Why are you the perfect fit for this position? Don't bother with cover letters - we're interested in facts and figures!   As we have very international teams, we would highly appreciate it to receive your CV or profile link in English. Title: Werkstudent*in (w/m/d) im Cost and Value Engineering zur Entwicklung von KI-gestützten Web-Applikationen ab Oktober 2022
Description: Art der Anstellung:  Befristet; 15 – 20 Stunden/Woche   Deine Extraportion Praxis.  Wie werden wir uns übermorgen fortbewegen, miteinander kommunizieren, Energien nutzen? Lass uns gemeinsam an den Antworten arbeiten. Wir suchen dafür kluge Köpfe, die Theorie in Praxis umwandeln und clever mitdenken. Kurz: Menschen, die ihre und unsere Fragen in neue Ausrufezeichen verwandeln wollen! Als Werkstudent (w/m/d) stehen dir bei uns viele Türen offen, um dich einzubringen: Ergreife die Chance und werde Teil unseres weltweiten Netzwerks, knüpfe wichtige Kontakte und lege so den Grundstein für deine berufliche und persönliche Zukunft. Unsere Teams freuen sich auf dich.   Wir setzen um, worauf es ankommt. Das ist dein Beitrag.  Wir suchen ab Oktober 2022  einen Werkstudenten (w/m/d), der uns bei der Entwicklung von Web-Applikationen unterstützt, die das Cost and Value Engineering Expertennetzwerk nachhaltig optimieren.    Im Rahmen deiner Tätigkeit arbeitest du an der Erstellung von Web-Applikationen aktiv mit Du verbesserst das UI/UX Design unserer Applikationen Du arbeitest mit unseren Backend-Entwicklern zusammen, um die bestmöglichen Lösungen zu finden   Wir suchen keine Superhelden. Sondern super helle Köpfe.   Dein Ticket zu uns ist dein Studium im Fachbereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Mathematik, Computer Science, Data Science oder Vergleichbares und du bist auf der Suche nach einem anspruchsvollen, langfristigen Job (15 - 20 Stunden / Woche) Du hast Erfahrung mit Frontend-Entwicklung (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, …) und bereits erste Single-Page Applikationen mit Vue, React oder Angular erstellt Idealerweise bringst du auch bereits erste Projekt-Erfahrungen aus der Frontend-Entwicklung mit Aufgaben und Probleme gehst du analytisch und lösungsorientiert an Kenntnisse zur Produktkosten-Kalkulation und Kostenstrukturen sowie Erfahrungen in der Projekt- oder Gruppenarbeit sind dein Plus Deine guten Deutsch- oder guten Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab   Wir wollen, dass du willst: Bewirb dich!  www.siemens.de  wenn du vor deiner Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchtest.   Du hast Fragen zur Bewerbung? Hier  findest du Antworten auf häufig gestellte Fragen.   Wenn du darüber hinaus noch Fragen hast, wende dich gerne an uns: www.siemens.de/fragenzurbewerbung   www.siemens.de/karriere   wenn du mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchtest.   Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.   Organization:  Supply Chain Management   Company:  Siemens AG   Experience Level:  Student (Not Yet Graduated)   Job Type:  Part-time

Title: Software Engineer - Frontend (Remote - EU)
Description: Workera.ai  is the precision upskilling platform helping enterprises, governments and individuals upskill and reskill to meet the critical demand for key technological capabilities including data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence. The Workera platform provides AI-driven mentorship at scale with its adaptive assessments and personalized learning plans that drive measurable results to close the skills gap.   We are a Silicon Valley start-up backed by New Enterprise Associates (NEA), Owl Ventures and Andrew Ng’s AI Fund. Our founders are Kian Katanforoosh, an award-winning Stanford Computer Science Lecturer who has taught AI to over 1 million people, and James Lee, former VP of Global Operations at Udacity. Our Chairman is Dr. Andrew Ng, co-founder of Coursera (NYSE: COUR), CEO of DeepLearning.AI, and founding lead of the Google Brain project.   Workera’s vision is to help humanity measurably close the skills gap to achieve its fullest potential.   We are looking for a Frontend Software Engineer (Remote)  to join our team! You will be part of the Admin & Insights team at Workera.   The Admin & Insights team is responsible for ensuring the person managing Workera for their employees has all the insights and tools available to them for their employees' precise and efficient upskilling. You'll help the team deliver on that promise by ensuring that our software's quality remains high.   At Workera, we believe that building software is a craft, and we create an environment where we move fast by close cross-functional collaboration and near-instant feedback loops.   That's also why we invested in a stack which boosts that environment. Using the Elixir language and the Phoenix web framework, we have created a collaborative environment where we can move fast without breaking things.   Prior experience with Elixir is not required, but you must be excited to learn a new language and expand your horizon. We will give you the necessary resources and tools to know the language. In the past, we have successfully onboarded people on this stack, and they are now happy contributors to the code.   Join this team if you want to join a highly collaborative and autonomous team who works with exciting new technologies!   Here's what you'll do:   Understanding the needs of people managing the Workera platform. Reading, writing, and reviewing application code, focusing on writing maintainable code that is easy to understand. Communicating persuasively with peers to inspire cooperation. Building scalable and highly available systems that follow operational best practices. Building observable systems that we can learn from, and we can continuously improve.    Here's what you'll bring:   2+ years experience with software development, foundational knowledge in HTML, CSS & Javascript. Solid written and verbal communication skills in English. 1+ years of experience working with a distributed team. Knowledge of testing principles. Eager to learn how to work with the Elixir language and Phoenix framework.    What you'll get by working with us:   Unlimited PTO plus a week off between Christmas and New Year’s Collegial atmosphere Innovative environment Full support for home offices A culture of life-long learning supported up to $3,000 reimbursement for professional development Working across cultural and geographical lines alongside our offices in different parts of the world Being part of a world-class technical team that’s trying to make the world more meritocratic Being part of a great cause to improve lives everywhere through artificial intelligence Opportunity to own high-impact projects    What it's like to work at Workera:   High-velocity career growth. You will be joining an all-star team of industry experts, world-class technologists from top tech companies, and proven startup operators that have built large, successful businesses. Workera is backed by top-tier venture capital firms and most importantly, we’re solving a massive problem for enterprises and individuals, so your opportunities for growth and impact are unlimited   A company that is solving one of the most exciting interdisciplinary problems of our era. World-changing innovations often spur from interdisciplinary research and development. Workera is, at its heart, an interdisciplinary company. To create the world’s most reliable and valid skills signal powering talent development, we hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on the most challenging problems at the intersection of psychometrics, artificial intelligence, and software engineering – from developing valid and reliable computer adaptive tests, to recommending personalized learning plans to employees and organizations, and enabling business leaders worldwide to make the best strategic decisions for upskilling and recruiting   Diversity. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. Our team-members, like our users, transcend geography, culture, and language; what we share, collectively, is a drive to create a skills-based, more meritocratic world, and a unique ability to execute.     A remote-friendly work environment. No matter where you reside, you’re a part of Workera. We ensure that our globally distributed employees can participate fully in our company’s activities and do their best work every day.     Lifelong learning. As talented as our team members are, we know that everyone is a constant work-in-progress and that the best is yet to come. We support each other in our curiosity and creativity – which we pursue through thoughtful discussion, mentorship, and knowledge-sharing among a diverse set of peers and colleagues. Did someone ever tell you that world-class mentorship doesn’t exist in startups? Please send them our way!     A culture of transparency that we carry through to messaging communication, ensuring that team members have the information they need to make good decisions.   We’re learners, dreamers, and game-changers. Join us to bring everyone the opportunity to achieve their fullest potential!   At Workera we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation, and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Workera believes that diversity and inclusion among our employees are critical to our success as a company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Selection for employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

Title: Trainee Technology Java/Cloud/Data/Quality Assurance (all genders)
Description: Become an IT consultant in a field of your choice within Technology in just six to eight weeks. With an entry-level program that is so close to the real world that you can apply your know-how immediately? After successful completion, you will receive a permanent employment contract. Java: Development of Java applications based on Java EE, Spring, Hibernate and open source frameworks. Very good analytical-conceptual skills and a high motivation to learn.  Very strong proficiency in English.  Mobility and pleasure in working in an international project team  Your contact  Do you have any questions? Then contact our recruiting team by e-mail at recruiting_germany@accenture.com or by phone at 00800 45045045. .   We are looking forward to your application.

Title: Backend Developer - Infrastructure (f/m/d)
Description:
We are looking for a brilliant Backend Developer to drive the growth of our data-centric backend and the billions of data it processes on an ongoing basis. About Thryve Thryve empowers digital health services globally to provide better care with a unified access to health data. While we currently serve 2.000.000+ users for our corporate customers, we grow rapidly in line with healthcare digitalization. Your mission You ensure that our (micro-)services provide excellent event-based data access, secure backend administration and rapid mass data processing. Together with the mobile engineering and data science teams, you decide on new and changed modules as well as their interaction and implementation. You take full ownership of software and appreciate the freedom to choose the best stack of tools and methodologies for any given task. Why join For clients and millions of users globally, Thryve provides a key element to improve the single most important thing for humanity: health. As we grow rapidly, this is an exciting opportunity to join an evolving global player and shape the growth of our fantastic, international team (backgrounds in 10+ countries & speaking 15+ languages). While our lovely industrial loft office in central Kreuzberg has free food and drinks (and fantastic lunch & bar options around), we're flexible in remote work and working hours. If you join, you benefit from competitive salaries and equity opportunities, as well as benefits in kind (e.g. your new bike sponsored by us). We are an equal opportunities employer and strive for an open and inclusive work atmosphere. Join us and shape tomorrow's health care, globally.

Desired Skills and Experience

You have at least three years’ work experience, with a solid background in Java or Kotlin You understand modern software systems and its development life cycle in and out You’re familiar with cloud based infrastructure (e.g. AWS, OTC) and orchestration technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) Ideally, you are familiar with big data technologies (e.g. OLAP) and event-driven architectures (Apache Kafka) You thrive in an open, agile and clean-code environment You have very good communication skills in English

Title: Junior Software Engineer (m/f/d) Production Systems
Description: Your mission  The production of our LiDAR sensors requires numerous coordinated test and production systems which are developed in-house at Blickfeld. Customized software ensures a smooth test process and records the production and measurement results of each individual product. With this seamless tracking, we ensure optimized processes and contribute to the continuous improvement of our products. As Junior Software Engineer (m/f/d) Production Systems you plan the software for test systems in your team and define database models before you develop the PC software with Python and accompany the commissioning. Your heart beats for software development with hardware reference?   You are interested in LiDAR technology, like to take responsibility yourself after an appropriate training phase and want to make Blickfeld even better with creative ideas – Then we are looking forward to working with you!   Your tasks   Together with the team you design and develop PC applications for our internal and external production lines, including GUI development, integration of various hardware components (robots, cameras, sensors, etc.), image processing and point cloud evaluation You support the extension and optimization of our extensive Django database backend You help to expand enterprise-wide libraries and our tool landscape to be prepared for the next Blickfeld products and requirements from our various production teams Using in-depth data analysis, you will ensure a smooth production process and provide valuable reports to all areas of the company   Your profile   You have a degree in Computer science or Electrical Engineering and ideally 1-2 years of professional experience in software development. Ambitious newcomers are welcome depending on knowledge and practical experience! You have experience with Python and GUI development as well as ideally in multi-threading applications, 3rd party library integration, deployment tools and common IDEs You have knowledge of versioning systems (Git) and you like to work in an agile software team You ideally have knowledge in one or more of the following areas: PySide (or PyQt), OpenCV, Django, Django REST API, relational databases Your knowledge on computer vision in general or point cloud processing in particular is a big plus You have good English communication skills, both written and spoken   Why Blickfeld?   Enjoy free beverages and lunch allowance Work in a dynamic environment with quick development cycles and flat hierarchies Develop ideas and realize them Be part of a great team, that lives and breathes technology Make the future of mobility a reality today We are one team – everybody pitches in “Can do” attitude Courage to act and to make decisions Things can go wrong, that’s ok Friendly and constructive behavior We stick together and can rely on each other   Contact  We are looking forward to your application with your CV, a short letter of motivation and your references!   Your contact person: Christian Wawra

Title: Software Engineer - Backend (d/f/m)
Description: At Stylight, we’re on a mission to build the world’s best search platform for Fashion, Beauty and Design. We're always looking for talent to join our engineering team, and help connect millions of users with their favorite products across 16 countries.  You’ll get to work with systems that handle thousands of requests per second, from custom analytics solutions to multi-regional search and ranking pipelines. We operate at a scale of billions of data points per month, which means you'll never run out of fun challenges waiting to be solved. Sounds exciting? Read on!     Your Responsibilities   Build, deploy, and monitor our live systems across four global regions. Implement, deploy and AB test new features for millions of website visitors. Foster technical excellence within the team, and contribute engineering best practices. Help us grow our engineering culture, from knowledge sharing sessions to hackathons.     Your Profile   At least 4 years of relevant experience in a software development role. Proficient with Python, Scala or Java. Willingness to learn new languages. Demonstrated experience with one or more of the following topics: Search Infrastructure, Distributed Systems, Machine Learning or Batch Processing (Terabyte-scale). Big plus: working knowledge of Docker, Elasticsearch, Kubernetes, Spark or BigQuery.     Our Tech Stack   Most of our services are written in either Python or Scala. We run our systems on AWS, and Google Cloud Platform. We use CircleCI to test, package, and deploy Docker containers to Kubernetes. We monitor our services with Datadog, Kibana, Sentry, Cloudwatch, and PagerDuty.     Your future team   We’re an international team with different backgrounds: Machine Learning, Data Science, Engineering. We love solving problems with a pragmatic approach - good enough is better than perfect. We work in two-week sprints, value autonomy, open communication and having few meetings. We love Slack. Besides sharing bad jokes and memes, it’s also where our alerts show up.     Why join Stylight?    📈 Shape the way Stylight grows!With 160m yearly shoppers in 16 countries and >1,500 shops we are the world's leading online search platform for Fashion, Beauty, and Design.   🌎 Worldwide vibes! Our team is made up of individuals from over 25 countries, who speak 41 languages, and represent many different backgrounds. You will be inspired by talented colleagues from around the world.   🤓 Curiosity is our compass!We support you in achieving your goals by providing you with an annual personal development budget and days as well as regular feedback sessions with your peers and manager.   🚀 Always one step ahead!Bi-monthly Innovation Days foster knowledge sharing throughout the whole company.   💻 Hybrid Working Model:Balance is the key to our success! Through a mix of office, remote and semi-remote opportunities, we give you the ability to manage your own work and personal life.   🤙 You are not alone!You will be assigned a buddy who will help you navigate through your first weeks of onboarding.   🍺 Prost, Cheers, Salute !We celebrate our success in every language!     ﻿Want to know more? Check out:about.stylight.com andblog.stylight.com.    Up for the challenge?  If you want to work in a fun, exciting, challenging and dedicated environment, then don't hesitate and apply today via https://about.stylight.com/jobs. We're looking forward to reading your complete application (cover letter, CV, references, certificates, GitHub profile) in English!

Title: Join our Tech Community as Working Student (m/f/d)
Description: Motius - We R&D:From autonomous industrial robots to self-charging drones and chatbot platforms, we're building it and you can be part of it. Motius is a research and development company specializing in the development of products and prototypes in the latest tech fields (A.I., IoT, AR/VR and many more). With the unique combination of a permanent core team and an interdisciplinary tech community, we reinvent R&D and develop the tech products of the future together with our world-class customers.    You join our tech community via our talent pool as a Working Student (m/f/d). You are a part of our small and agile teams in our diverse R&D projects - either on a flexible & short-term basis, or continuously from project to project. You can find sample projects in our Motius Success Stories.     Your profile   You study Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, Information Systems, Informatics, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or similar disciplines Experience in agile development projects in a domain covered by at least one of our tech clusters Curiousity about the latest tech trends and R&D, and motivated to develop yourself both technically and personally You want to have a direct impact on the products and innvoations of our world-class customers     Your benefits & our offer   Steady learning curve and insights into new markets & products in our agile development projects and through the collaboration with our clients We trust your skills and force your growth, as TUM student you can combine one of our projects with your IDP Community events, e.g. our Motius Tech Discovery Conference and regular teambuildings Flexible working hours, competitive salary and numerous benefits like access to Makerspace, discounts via CorporateBenefits and free drinks in the office    You can find more details and reasons why you should join Motius in our latest blog post and on Instagram @team_motius.    Does that make you curious? Read more about our selection process on our website here: How to join Motius. Feel free to approach Marinafor any questions regarding becoming part of our talent community. We are looking forward to receiving your application!

Title: Full Stack Engineer - Nucleus (Berlin)
Description: Scale’s emerging products are some of the fastest-growing in the company's history. We are looking for great entrepreneurial engineers for our office in Berlin to help us grow further and can bring in good technical fundamentals. In this role, you’ll be a core member of our product team and own the development of entire product features from ideation to the delivery. We are looking for software engineer generalists who care deeply about the impact and solving customer problems and are willing to iterate quickly. We want people who are results-oriented who will find great innovative solutions to deliver the best product that helps our users accomplish their goals. You will work with a dedicated group of engineers to launch and grow Scale’s emerging products.   With Scale Nucleus we’re building the dataset IDE for machine learning. It allows our users to build better datasets in less time and identify problems with datasets or models. Scale Nucleus is tightly integrated with all other Scale products which allows it to significantly accelerate the development of diverse AI applications.   Learn more here: https://scale.com/nucleus    You will:    Own and drive the development of new product features. Cover development efforts across the entire stack. Break down problems into their composite parts, prototype MVPs quickly and help us build a highly scalable product. Work with AEs, PMs, and the broader Customer Delivery teams to identify and satisfy customer-specific feature requests.   Ideally you'd have:    3+ years of experience working as a Full Stack/Product Engineer Communication and Team Management skills Be able, and willing, to multi-task and learn new technologies quickly Self-starter, willing to be challenged with new responsibilities, and high attention to details Ability & comfort taking architectural decisions autonomously and proactively Deep knowledge of JavaScript, Typescript, React, Node, HTML/CSS and Python   Nice to haves:    Prior startup experience Strong technical (written and verbal) communication, prioritization, and time management skills Mentored and grown members of your team or been a tech lead on large projects   About Us:  At Scale, we believe that the transition from traditional software to AI is one of the most important shifts of our time. Our mission is to make that happen faster across every industry, and our team is transforming how machine learning can build innovative products. Our products provide access to human-powered data for hundreds of use cases and are used by industry leaders such as Open AI, Lyft, Meta, GM, Samsung, Airbnb, NVIDIA, and many more. We’ve recently raised $325 million in Series E funding at a valuation of $7B+ and are expanding our team to accelerate the development of AI applications.   We believe that everyone should be able to bring their whole selves to work, which is why we are proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability status, gender identity or Veteran status.   We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation in the application or recruiting process due to a disability, please contact us at accommodations@scale.com. Please see the United States Department of Labor's EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.

Title: Junior Backend Engineer (Python)
Description: With Spenoki, we ask the following question: How can we build a sustainable economy that inspires? At Spenoki, we believe in inventions that add value to the world and create change because they are compelling. The time has come when the world needs a solution that makes sustainability as manageable for any business as its other resources.   Spenoki is a Munich-based startup that offers an easy-to-use SaaS solution that helps companies analyze, optimize, and report on their sustainability.   Spenoki is where great ideas become great experiences. We are looking for an experienced designer to join our core team to enhance and expand our existing portfolio. The ideal designer will have a passion for taking on complex problems and designing elegant, simple solutions that surprise and delight our customers. With a focus on sustainability management, you will design products that are not only easy to use, but also lead to a more sustainable future.   Join us if you want to develop the SaaS solution for the environmentally-conscious age!   Tasks  As a Software Engineer, you will contribute to defining and driving the future of Spenoki's products and thus the future of sustainability management.   Together with a highly autonomous, talented, cross-functional team of designers, domain experts and product managers, you will drive solutions from idea to production. You are the architect, designer and coder of your project. You are dynamic and able to work well both independently and as part of a team.   At Spenoki, we leave all egos at the door and concentrate on the job at hand. We value passionate, down-to-earth, “can do” people who enjoy fine-tuning small details, without losing sight of the big picture. We are looking for the type of person who feels uncomfortable when a day goes by without achieving something impactful. Someone who is driven to get things done and views obstacles as an exciting challenge that demands a creative solution. Above all, this task requires someone who is very proud of their work and who is inspired and motivated by their role to develop effective products for sustainability management and thus create a world worth living in.   Spenoki R&D is all about teamwork. Engineers work side by side with Product Designers and Domain Experts in a fast, creative atmosphere with minimal documentation. Our team members are self-sufficient and problem solvers. We are looking for people who are passionate about sustainability and strive to break it down into accessible features for everyone. Always one step ahead in development platforms, new functionality and APIs.   You will be part of every stage of development from concept to deployment.   If you're passionate about great software design, want to be part of a group that works on very early stage products, have the opportunity to shape them, and enjoy crafting robust, scalable, and maintainable services, we may be the team for you!   Design and develop the overall architecture of the web applications. Collaborate with the rest of the project team to conceptualize, design, code and launch new features. Follow and share the best engineering practices.    Requirements    Minimum Requirements:   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Experience working in software development with one or more of the following programming languages; Python, Java, C/C++, C#, and/or JavaScript. Backend web development, including Python, web standards, and modern frameworks. Experience with data modeling & relational/non-relational database technologies. Passion for engineering excellence and experience with agile project development. Experience in REST APIs.   Preferred qualifications:   Knowledge in developing scalable and robust SaaS applications in the cloud. A foundation in Computer Science fundamentals with excellent problem-solving skills, deep knowledge of data structures and object-oriented design, development paradigms and API design. Knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing and operations. Knowledge about cloud services, such as AWS.    Benefits    Together, we will redefine how companies manage their sustainability. You have an impact on dozens of SMEs in Europe and that's just the start. Highly entrepreneurial environment. Ownership is one of our core values. We believe in your talent. Work from home, the WERK1 office in Munich or the Factory in Berlin with your colleagues. We offer you a competitive compensation package (salary, benefits and virtual shares). We support your personal growth and education with a time and money budget, as well as team learning events.

Title: Project Engineer (m/f/d) Battery Quick Check - Munich based
Description: The world is transitioning towards renewable energy generation and sustainable transportation to counteract global climate change. Batteries are both the key and the achilles heel of this transition. Our mission is to enable efficient development and long lifetime of stationary energy storage systems and electric vehicles with our Predictive Battery Analytic Software based on Digital Twins. Join us on our way to an emission free future. We are a fast growing venture capital financed start-up of about 100 employees – Become part of the family!   About the role  Our battery quick check team develops an innovative and novel product, a battery report for used electric vehicles. We are responsible for the whole development process from the concept stage to the final customer deployment and the product ramp-up including several iterations and variants.   To strengthen our team, we are looking for an enthusiastic hands-on Project Engineer (m/f/d)  . With your analytical and creative way of thinking you will support the team in an agile fast-paced environment to roll out the Battery Quick Check on the market and continuously improve the product. In this position, you will have a wide range of tasks. You are responsible for planning and coordinating your own projects and then implementing them yourself. With your results you impact the success of the Battery Quick Check.   Your daily business will involve   Gather customer feedback and requirements to contribute to product development Implement and test new product features together with software and battery engineers Coordinate and conduct product tests with various EV models Analyze product tests and battery measurements and visualize the results Implement and demonstrate product versions for dedicated key customers and markets Prepare and coordinate technical demonstrations for new customers You work together in a small, cross-functional team of product managers, UI/UX designers, software and battery engineers to develop the battery quick check in a “you build it, you run it” environment   Your profile   You have a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, information technology or equivalent You have already 1+ years of working experience in product development; relevant working experience as student is also considered Excellent programming skills in Python, additional programming skills (Matlab, Javascript etc.) are a benefit for us Experience in data processing and data analytics with python Product development experience in the battery or automotive sector is a plus Experience in cloud technologies (e.g. AWS) is a plus You have the driving license for Germany Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks at a time and drive them to successful completion Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, German is a plus   Benefits  Apart from you having a meaningful activity  in one of the most exciting areas of our time, we care about your mental and physical health  . We care about your flexible working time  and your time off, about your social environment  and your personal growth.   We offer you:  A very competitive salary Training budget 2000€/year and further training possibilities within the company Free healthy breakfast, free healthy lunch, free snacks, drinks and coffee Free access to a tool of your choice (skillshare or coursera) Gympass Membership (subsidized access to gyms - not only for you, but also for your family and friends) Flexible working hours and flexible homeoffice - work wherever and whenever you want Mobile and remote working (working from another city? No problem!) A high degree of personal responsibility, creative freedom and opportunities Strong team culture with regular team events and off-sites (Summer and Christmas party, at least one big off-site, Oktoberfest (Wiesn) event, Cocktail and Movie nights once a month, regular team and sports events, company kitchen with cooking events) International team and relocation budget of 800€ Borrow our e-Golf for private purposes and free EV-charging at our company Book circle (Order a book via TWAICE - we pay for it, you read it)   Social Media  Would you like to find out more about TWAICE as an employer? Then take a look at Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn or Kununu.

Title: Junior Software Entwickler/Administrator
Description: Description  Stellenbeschreibung:Junior Software Entwickler/Administrator   Anstellungsvertrag: unbefristet   Ort:Hamburg   Vorgesetzter: Senior Engineer & Germany IT Manager   Argus ist ein schnell wachsendes globales B2B-Medienunternehmen, das wichtige Informationen zu den Rohstoffmärkten bereitstellt. Als Unternehmen wachsen und entwickeln wir uns weiter und fügen neue Märkte, neue Dienstleistungen, neue Lieferoptionen und verbesserte Analysetools hinzu.   Stellenbeschreibung   Junior Software EntwicklerInnen sind bei Argus für die Implementierung interner und kundenorientierter Anwendungen verantwortlich, insbesondere für unsere deutschen Digitalangebote.   Technologie ist für unser kontinuierliches Wachstum von zentraler Bedeutung. Daher haben wir stark in unsere internen Entwicklungs- und Data Science-Teams investiert, die branchenführende digitale Datenlösungen liefern. Die Entwicklungsteams verwenden einige der neuesten Technologien und moderne Entwicklungsmethoden zur Realisierung unserer Projekte.   Als Teil der Argus-Technologieabteilung in unserem Hamburger Büro spielen Sie eine entscheidende Rolle bei der Bereitstellung erstklassiger digitaler Datenprodukte für unsere strategischen Schlüsseldaten, Preise und grundlegenden Initiativen. Zudem unterstützen Sie ab und an beim Support unserer Kunden im deutschsprachigen Raum und der Kollegen im Hamburger Büro.   Hauptverantwortlichkeiten   Lösen realer Probleme in Software, um unsere Anwendungen zu verbessern. Teilnahme an SCRUM-Meetings, Erstellung von Dokumentationen und anderen Teilen des Softwareentwicklungslebenszyklus. Betreuung und Weiterentwicklung der IT Infrastruktur Unterstützung unserer deutschen Mitarbeiter und Kunden bei IT-Anfragen    Grundlegende Fähigkeiten und Erfahrungen   Gutes Verständnis von Datenstrukturen und Datenbanken Die Fähigkeit, nach einem kommerziellen Standard zu programmieren, einschließlich Unit-Tests, angemessener Verwendung von Frameworks und SOLID-Prinzipien Neugier und die Fahigkeit auch autodidaktisch zu lernen Sehr gute Deutsch und English Kenntnisse Knowledge of PHP and the Symfony Framework Contao CMS Jquery Javascript Framework MySQL Server Administration Linux server administration (LAMP) / shell scripting VBA scripting    Das Folgende sind alle technischen Bereiche, die Argus nutzt oder die er umfassend nutzen möchte. Erfahrung und / oder Interesse an einem oder mehreren von ihnen sind von Vorteil   AWS platform, einschließlich CloudWatch, CloudFormation und Lambda Python RabbitMQ oder ähnliche Message queue Systeme Angular JavaScript Framework und Bootstrap CSS Framework Agile Entwicklungsmethoden Windows Server Administration Linux Server Administration Windows Client Administration PHP Contao CMS Symfony Framework C#    Über Argus Media   Argus ist ein unabhängiges Medienunternehmen mit über 1.000 MitarbeiterInnen. Es hat seinen Hauptsitz in London und verfügt über 23 Büros in den wichtigsten Rohstoffhandels- und Produktionszentren der Welt. Argus erstellt Preisbewertungen und Analysen der internationalen Energie- und anderer Rohstoffmärkte und bietet maßgeschneiderte Beratungsdienste und branchenführende Konferenzen an.   Unternehmen in 140 Ländern auf der ganzen Welt nutzen die Daten von Argus als Index für den physischen Handel und als Benchmarks auf den Märkten für Finanzderivate sowie für Analyse- und Planungszwecke.   Argus wurde 1970 gegründet und ist ein privates, in Großbritannien eingetragenes Unternehmen. Es befindet sich im Besitz von Belegschaftsaktionären und der globalen Wachstumsaktiengesellschaft General Atlantic und Hg.   Benefits  Unser schnell wachsendes, preisgekröntes Unternehmen bietet talentierten, unternehmerischen Fachleuten ein dynamisches Umfeld, um Ergebnisse zu erzielen und ihre Karriere auszubauen. Argus erkennt und belohnt erfolgreiche Leistungen. Argus fördert die berufliche Entwicklung aller MitarbeiterInnen für ein leistungsstarkes Team, das sich für den Aufbau unseres Erfolgs einsetzt.   Wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalt und Firmenbonus 30 Tage Urlaub Umfangreiche interne und externe Schulungen ÖPNV Beteiligung und andere Vergünstigungen verhandelbar    Bewerbung   Wenn dieses Jobangebot Ihr Interesse geweckt hat, würden wir uns freuen, von Ihnen zu hören.   www.argusmedia.com/en/careers/open-positions

Title: Digital Innovation Engineer (d/f/m)
Description: At Henkel, you can be a game changer and craft your career. Unleash your entrepreneurial spirit by bringing your ideas to life within a global team. Our leading brands and technologies, along with our high-performing businesses will provide you with countless opportunities to develop your skills and explore new paths. Your career at Henkel will contribute to a more sustainable future, while you grow within our vibrant, diverse culture of trust and belonging. If youâ€™re up for challenging the status quo, join our team of pioneers and make your mark on the future with us.   Do you dare to make an impact?  Your Role   Support the roll-out and active deployment of new software and automation tools across the global innovation organization Review, respond and prioritize feature ideas and take note of all feature requests, pain points, bugs, etc. related to digital tools and automation Work closely with the digital systems teams to understand software / hardware development roadmaps Create and distribute communication material, e.g. newsletters, portal articles, release communications Actively communicate with different stakeholders (Product Development Leads, Lab Managers, Chemists, Technicians, etc.) Review and standardize digital innovation data collection across SBUs and locations Audit and remove duplicates for commonly used data such as units, manufacturers, raw materials, parameters, data columns, etc. Work with internal Henkel Data Science team to drive increased data leverage in new areas Coordinate any IT related integrations for future functionality, such as Pricing, Sustainability, Operations, etc. Measure engagement & retention of digital innovation tools, and define new success metrics    YOUR SKILLS   Bachelor’s degree in chemistry, materials science, engineering or in software engineering, computer science, data science or a related field. Passion for driving change management, specifically focused on Digital upskilling and tools Quick learner and very comfortable with technology (Web applications, data analytic tools, mobile apps, etc.) Natural curiosity for new topics, cultural candor and strong social skills Excellent analytical skills combined with strategic thinking Strategic, entrepreneurial mindset with an eye for design (to support in the constant updates and enhancements of the Albert platform) Fluent in English Experience in software development (Javascript, MySQL, etc.), product management, or other software roles is nice to have Proficient knowledge of REST APIs, Swagger documentation and JWT authentication is nice to have Working knowledge and experience with eLN, LIMS, or Chemical Inventory Management software is nice to have    Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to gender, origin, culture, mindset, generation, disability, religion and sexual orientation.

Title: Software Programmer
Description: Role Overview 👨‍💻   We are looking for a driven and innovative Software Programmer to work on our novel nanotechnology application as part of an interdisciplinary team. You will develop algorithms to improve DNA origami design and data analysis, and write software to improve and automate existing DNA origami workflows. Your work will directly lead to impactful real-world uses.     What you will do 🔬    Develop and write programs for nanostructure design (e.g., Cadano) and data analysis Write custom computer tools for various R&D projects Develop tool requirements and specifications with other team members Support other team members in tool adaption and development     Skills & Experience 💡    Experience with Python Experience with Databases Creative, proactive, results-oriented Ideally with a background in life sciences and a strong record of academic achievement Able to quickly gain proficiency in new, interdisciplinary fields Excited about working in a fast-growing startup Fluent in English     Benefits    Great and dynamic working environment Join a diverse and driven team Diverse and challenging tasks in a fast-growing startup Real chance of progression with the organisation purely based on success in the role Above-average remuneration

Title: Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Are you passionate about moving the B2B world to a more sustainable future? Are you comfortable working in an agile, fast-paced environment? Then you've come to the right place! At Ecotrek, you will help companies to achieve sustainable procurement through sustainability data mining.   Tasks  Your opportunity to make an impact   Be our tech chameleon! Maintain and enhance our state-of-the-art web-development practices Work across our interdisciplinary functional data & software development environment and have no problem being the firefighter within the tech team, helping out where you are needed Assure & optimize our data-to-customer flow from the data pipelines, to the frontend Be an example and a guard for our company culture and values.    Requirements    3+ years of full-stack web development experience Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics or equivalent experience Proficient in JavaScript and familiar with general-purpose languages like Python or Java Expert knowledge in technologies and frameworks like REACT, Vue.js, NodeJS, GraphQL or Cypress, to name a few Extensive know-how in system design and software architecture Extensive experience with the use of Single Page Applications (SPA) and Server Side Rendering (SSR) Solid experience with setting up backend services and storing user data (incl. authentication services) Solid knowledge of testing and design concepts Fun, pragmatic, dedicated and willing to dive into new domains Fluent in English (German not mandatory)    Benefits    Vacation: 30 paid vacation days Working time: 40h per week Place of work: flexible, hybrid or completely remote working culture with an easily accessible office in Berlin-Mitte Bahncard 50 Work from abroad 12 weeks per year Community days Team-Workations "We love to create" To create a significant positive impact in the world we want work to be fulfilling, engaging and fun. As a group, we value constructive feedback. Authentic, honest and fair communication is important to us. We hope to welcome more nationalities, genders, sexual orientations, ages, races, physical/mental abilities to our team - Fighting with us for a meaningful cause. "Push & Pull" Work here is about ownership and solving problems together. Ask questions and receive answers - no black holes in the communication chain. We like to keep communication and deep focus in a natural balance. "We trust and care for each other" Every contribution is valuable and everyone's impulse is important. We adapt work to individual needs and priorities and let everyone decide if remote work is suitable and what day plan fits best to their work-life balance. We trust and care about each other and want everyone to be engaged with passion. Help us define new tasks for the greatest impact! "Idea to realization in one day" We set our goals high! That’s why we need to be ambitious, have courage, and move fast, whilst staying healthily grounded in a strong team. Thinking big leads to great opportunities, making mistakes and overcoming doubts along the way is part of it - good thing, we are all one team.

Title: Junior Java Backend Developer
Description: What we have:  One of the best trading platforms in the USA, serving more than 200k online users each day working over desktops, mobile and web.  Platform backend services are responsible for all business processes related to trading: order issuing, validation, routing, execution, option price calculation, reconciliation, etc. High performance, low-latency and fault tolerance is our daily job. We strive for code quality performing careful code reviews and various types of testing.  Teams co-exist in a Scrum/Kanban environment backed by Atlassian suite, Slack, TeamCity, Sonar, Docker, etc.  Teams are multi-cultural and distributed, consisting of 3-7 BE engineers balanced by QAs, FEs, BAs and others.     Major parts of our stack:   Java 11+, Collections, Streams, Threads, Concurrency Spring, JUnit5, AssertJ, Mockito Docker, PostgreSQL, Liquibase, Splunk     What we expect from you:  We’re open to enthusiastic minds who are ready to demonstrate their powers via live-coding by solving Java leetcode-like tasks during an interview.    Come to join us if you have:   passion to code readiness to learn and develop by producing regular results B1+ English     What makes us happier:   knowledge of basic data structures, algorithms and their complexities Spring or other professional Java experience any database experience, relational DB is preferred trading and capital markets background readiness to develop more in computer science rather than frameworks

Title: Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)
Description: BayWa r.e.   At BayWa r.e.  we’re the planet’s renewable energy champions. Together, we’re taking a fresh look at how power is produced, stored, and used to meet the challenges of climate change. A career with BayWa r.e. lets you drive change globally. With locations in 28 countries, we have over 3,000 people already working across the world, collaborating with local businesses to proactively shape the future of the energy sector.   BayWa r.e. Global Services GmbH  is building software and big data algorithms for the renewable energy industry. Powered by our market-leading data analytics core, we provide a set of instruments and AI applications for business executives and users. With those, we disrupted what has previously been a manual, time-consuming and expensive consulting-driven approach to jump-start managing renewable assets and optimizing their performance and output.   We at BayWa r.e. Global Services GmbH  strive to make energy production better every day. We do this not only by developing the best data analytics software and AI algorithms, but also by being a great long-term solutions partner with a focus on continuous innovation. As a global innovation leader, we are committed to long-term partnerships and actively shaping the future of energy.    About The Role    Due to our dynamic growth, we are currently looking for a Full Stack Developer (m/f/d)  who will build up development capabilities at FrontRunner for PH4B.   The position can be located in our office in Rome, Berlin, Hamburg or Munich.    What You Will Do    You will design and develop highly scalable SaaS solutions (backend, frontend, and operations) focusing on the specificity of the renewable market, mainly operation and maintenance of the assets You will operate and manage the SaaS solution infrastructure with focus on automation and resource efficiency You will help define platform architectural direction that aligns with the product vision and system architecture You will evaluate relevant emerging technologies and provide recommendations on iterative improvements of the existing modules You will improve development efficiency by collaborating with the development team in streamlining and automating the integration and deployment process (CI/CD)   Your Profile   5+ years of overall software development experience with web application development using modern technology stack 3+ years of experience working with relational databases (Postgres, MySQL, …) and managing and designing RESTful APIs 2+ years of experience developing with any modern frontend framework (full stack) and using Node.js and unit test frameworks (Mocha, Jest, Jasmine, …) Experience working with MongoDB (or other NoSQL databases), Docker and Azure cloud (or AWS, GCP) Experience in architecting, building, launching, and maintaining SaaS applications Passion for writing well-crafted clean code and ability to act as a team player with strong communication skills Experience with DevOps automation, with Kubernetes/GraphQL, with data model design or developing a data analytics platform is a plus Fluent in English    What We Offer You    Drive the energy revolution forward together with a highly motivated ever-growing and multicultural team Enjoy creativity in building-up our internal data analytics tools and report automation Innovative and fast-changing market and working environment Low hierarchies and committed, multi-national, cross-functional team Mobile working and flexible working hours Attractive compensation with performance related bonus Employee share program JobRad (bicycle leasing) Attractive offices in major German cities Company pension allowance Discounted gym membership options / Gympass Access to "Corporate Benefits" portal   Contact  We look forward to your application!  Diversity and Equal Opportunity  At BayWa r.e. we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates.   All employment is decided based on qualifications, potential, merit, and business need.   We do not discriminate on the basis of origin, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, pregnancy, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law.   If you have any questions about the job offer, please get in contact with us.   Sibylle Müller HR Manager EMEA +49 89 383932 5950

Title: Python Engineer (f/m/d)
Location: Cologne Bonn Region, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany
Description: Anstellungsdetails  Permanent contract, full-time or part-time, Cologne / Darmstadt / Düsseldorf / Remote   Info   Who We Are    We operate Kaufland.de: Several thousand sellers and millions of products make us one of the fastest growing online marketplaces. Our work is characterised by a dynamic corporate culture, with a start-up mentality and the opportunities offered by a large corporation in the background. We combine knowledge and many years of experience in e-commerce with flat hierarchies and a highly motivated team. Whether you are an intern or a team lead: We take every idea seriously, because we want to work together in shaping the future of e-commerce!   We love flexibility! We offer you the best environment to work in a flexible and focused way: You decide whether you want to work in our office in Cologne // Darmstadt // Düsseldorf while at the same time having the opportunity to work remotely (Germany). We want to offer you the most attractive workplace in e-commerce and a maximum of flexibility for your personal work-life balance.   Day-by-day, our development team of about 250 experts pursues the goal of creating the best-possible customer shopping experience for the Kaufland.de marketplace. We are here to inspire millions of customers, to help them find, purchase and get the things they love. To enrich the lives of our customers, we collaborate in cross-functional teams, in which product owners, product designers, frontend and backend engineers, data scientists and lean managers join forces. Details regarding the challenges of the respective product areas can be found here: https://kaufland-ecommerce.com/en/team/tech/.   Detail   Your Tasks – This Is What Awaits You In Detail    As a Python Engineer (f/m/d) on our Data Engineering Team you act as an important interface between our DevOps, Data Science and software development divisions You develop scalable applications and systems for processing structured and unstructured data You deal comprehensively with many different data-related topics and have the right ideas for every situation: Whether it's data exchange between microservices, processing huge amounts of data for recommender models, or lightning-fast, interactive business intelligence applications, we have the right solution    Your Profile – This Is What We Expect From You   You have a university degree in (business) informatics or a comparable field of study You have a very high capacity for abstraction, a sound algorithmic understanding and affinity for working with data You have profound experience with Python and Package Management, as a bonus some knowledge of the flask framework, Click or Confluent libraries You have experience with: Relational and noSQL databases and data warehouses  Stream Processing Platforms such as Apache Kafka  Containers, preferably with Docker and Kubernetes  Ideally, you have experience in some of the following technologies and, as an autodidact, you are prepared to quickly familiarise yourself with the other technological forms: Public Cloud & Infrastructure as Code  ETL or distributed task scheduling frameworks  CI/CD  You have excellent communication skills, are willing to embrace our company culture and values and enjoy working in an international, english-speaking team    What We Offer    Create your own work-life! We offer you the best possible flexibility in terms of working hours and location A highly-motivated and qualified team from different fields and numerous nations The future is digital - Develop the e-commerce of the future with us and work on a product with millions of users with a broadly-based technology stack Power meets dynamic - flat hierarchies and start-up mentality meet and the power of a big corporate group and offers you an agile and secure working environment at the same time Free choice of hardware – we provide you with the development environment of your choice Personal & team growth: We love to have flexibility in terms of working location, but we also believe that personal interactions are important. That’s why we organize company events, and cover the costs to bring you there and to other (approved) get togethers with your peers. The same applies to conferences and other learning opportunities. We want everybody to grow personally and professionally, as a team and as a company Top conditions at the Urban Sports Club for fitness, team sports, yoga and more   Check out our Principles & our blog for even more insights into our company culture!   Refer an Engineer Program  You want to work for us, but not without your dearest colleague? Join us as a team and earn money by referring your buddy for one of our open Tech positions! Depending on the level we offer a bonus up to 1.300,- € per referral, which will be paid after successful recruitment (the first part with your first salary, the second part after your buddy passes the trial period).   Bewerben  Why are you the perfect fit for this position? Don't bother with cover letters - we're interested in facts and figures!   Ansprechpartner  Your contact person: Kristina Heymann  Kaufland e-commerce   Kaufland e-commerce Services GmbH   Postal address:   Habsburgerring 2   50674 Köln   We are looking forward to your application!

Title: Full Stack Software Engineer
Description: Growth is the top priority for every company. Yet the best tools and practices are restricted to a few elite companies who can hire hundreds of engineers and data scientists. Everybody else loses $19 out of every $20 on generic marketing. Mutiny is building a no-code platform that helps companies convert that waste into actual customers and revenue by personalizing experiences based on who is actually viewing. Our greatest differentiator comes from the machine learning models we’ve built that learn across our platform and help our customers make the content changes to convert their prospects.   This problem has not been solved in a decade and we are building an iconic company that will automate growth engineering for every company. That's why Sequoia, YCombinator, and CMOs of companies such as Snowflake and Airbnb invested. Mutiny is beloved by some of the fastest growing companies including Notion, Brex, Carta, Segment, Algolia and Qualtrics. We have quadrupled revenue year-over-year with even more on the horizon!   Our culture:  We started Mutiny by first codifying what type of company and culture we wanted to build. These values define how we approach our work every single day:   Work should feel like play Faster always wins Stir the pot, regularly Do the right thing when no one’s watching All hands on deck    Read more about our engineering values here.   The role, in a nutshell:  We are looking for a full-stack software developer to join our growing engineering team. You will build, test, and ship software across the stack including optimized APIs to distribute data in real-time, high-throughput data pipelines to power machine learning models (like OpenAI's GPT-3 and reinforcement learning algorithms from Azure), and intuitive UX to provide a powerful, easy-to-use interface. Work closely with our product, design, and CX teams to define how features will work to drive the most value for customers. Be a critical voice in choosing the right architecture for our core systems, help to define an inclusive product culture, and learn from a world-class team of experienced engineers.   What you’ll do at Mutiny:   Architect, build, test, and ship highly-available and secure services that process and serve data at scale. Use data to support product decisions and impact core business metrics with your work. Use the latest web technologies and tools. Currently, we have services in Ruby and TypeScript and invest in our tooling and automation to remain productive. Work with the most advanced machine learning services, like Open AI's GPT-3, to automatically generate optimized content for customers. Build great user experiences that allow customers to easily understand their web audience and create personalized experiences for their key segments.    What we are looking for:   2+ years of software engineering experience in a web development or infrastructure position. Fluency in a backend programming language of choice (e.g. Python, Ruby, Node, Scala, etc). Familiarity with PostgreSQL or other relational database. Advocate of automated testing. We always include a full suite of tests for a feature to verify and future proof our code. An exceptionally high performance bar for oneself and everyone on the team. Unafraid to communicate what’s working and what needs to change. Someone who is energized by ambiguity and can create structure in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. A kind human who wants to build an extraordinary product, culture and brand.    We are 100% remote. Mutiny does not accept agency submitted candidates for this posting.

Title: React Frontend Developer
Description: Orange Quarter are working with a Berlin based startup building a deep learning product to completely change modern day back office work. This company leverage machine learning to help the world’s biggest companies process complex documents across a huge range of domains. They help their clients automate back-office tasks, save masses amounts of money and improve efficiency.    Industry    OQ-industries Artificial Intelligence   Product    What To Expect    You will be building a simple to use a self-service Machine-Learning tool for business user where you’ll transform design files into real web app interfaces using React and Typescript.   You’ll integrate with a backend GraphQL-based API making and work closely with backend developers to make sure the application will provide a seamless experience to the end users. You’ll also ensure that codebase meets the highest standards by keeping it up to date and implementing linters and static analysis tools.    Perks    Be part of a fast growing and exciting startup with a clear plan You'll be part of a flat hierarchy where you'll work directly with C-level colleagues They're output focussed with flexibility around working hours An ability to work partially from home A nice compensation package with company shares    Requirements    2 years of working in Frontend with React Worked with Typescript before Experience (or a side-project) with Machine Learning is a plus Experience with interfacing a GraphQL API is a plus Solid software engineering, i.e., experience with UI/front-end testing   Sounds good?  Apply now

Title: Software Engineer, Control Systems - Cell Engineering (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
Description: What To Expect    Tesla is accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. Revolutionary strategies and products were developed within a few years and successfully launched on a large scale. This is only possible through extraordinary speed, innovation and efficiency. Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg forms the perfect basis for rolling out Tesla's incredible success story in Europe. The most important pillar for this are our employees. Their passion, motivation and engagement ensure that we achieve our goals. We are looking for you to continue and expand this success story together.    What You’ll Do    Cell Controls Engineering team is looking for a Software Automation Engineer to join our team. You will help to ensure the great quality of our equipment management software for current and next-generation application design. As a Software Automation Engineer the primary responsibility will be automated control processes that have never been automated before. You will work with the Automation Control team to plan, design, develop and execute the automated process, validate and deploy with the engineering team to the production line.    What You’ll Bring    Familiarity in a major programming language such as Java, C#, Python, Swift, Go, and strong scripting skills in at least one common language (JavaScript, ASP, JSP, PHP, Tcl, etc.). Have a strong understanding of software fundamentals including software design, CI/CD, algorithm development, data structures, code modularity, and maintainability. Demonstrate strong understanding of testing concepts including white box and black box testing, regression testing, performance testing, etc. Strong attention to detail Experience with GIT and version controls system, development workflow. Experience with system profiling or static code analysis tools a plus Qualifications B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or Computer Engineering Programming expertise in Golang/Java/Python/C#/JavaScript Experience in technology software product, manufacturing/hardware not required Software Engineering, Data Structures and Algorithms Able to demonstrate role in a large-scale software development project Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Modeling Apache Spark/Hadoop MySQL JupyterHub/Python MapReduce TensorFlow, Pandas GraphQL, REST API Additional Preferences: Familiar with Industrial PC/PLC controller and development environment like Beckhoff and Siemens Familiar with CAD simulation tools like Dassault Systemes 3DX Delmia or Siemens Process Simulate Familiar with industrial robot like Fanuc and KUKA robot Knowledge of WinAppDriver and/or Selenium Web Browser Automation and scripting Knowledge of HTML, XML, PHP, Perl, TCL, Angular programming/scripting languages is plus Self-motivated and able to work under minimal supervision Willingness and ability to learn new technologies and take on different assignments

Title: Software Developer (f/m/d)
Description: OCELL‘s software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of hectares of forestry are managed by introducing data-based decision making to improve health and carbon storage capacity. Our products need to handle information at massive scale and extend well beyond classical geodata applications. We are looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system   design, networking and data storage, artificial intelligence, UI design and mobile. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to OCELL’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full stack as we continue to push technology forward. We believe that, in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services. We hire people who are smart and passionate, and we favor ability and willingness to learn over experience. We are hiring full time positions as well as part time positions for students that are currently enrolled in a master’s degree.   Aufgaben   Responsibilities    Utilize your expertise to engage in and enhance the development of our product’s software components in all fields of software engineering Collaborate on scalability issues involving large scale data and processing Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software   Qualifikation   Minimum Qualifications    Bachelor‘s degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience Experience in coding Python, Dart or JavaScript Ability to speak and write in English fluently Ability to work in a small and agile team with quick decision making    Preferred Qualifications    Experience with Flutter Experience with additional general purpose programming languages, such as: Kotlin, Swift, Typescript Strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design Experience with AWS and containerized processing workflows Experience with Git, software testing and release processes    Benefits    Benefits   We want our employees to benefit from the success of this company and thus involve you not only with salary but also with virtual shares Central location, with great startup vibes Once the pandemic allows it, we’re going back to regular team activities outdoors Have a large influence in the development of a meaningful solution to an urgent topic for humanity   Our Corporate Culture   OCELL is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender.

Title: Software Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: Ihre Aufgaben   Design and develop software products for the Aircraft and Ground Segment functions Provide Data management solutions (networks, avionics and open platforms) Manage Aircraft sensors Insert state of the art technologies in the implementation of new capabilities matching the required safety, quality and performance levels according to the systems engineering processes and the needs of our customers    Ihr Profil   Completed studies in the field of computer science, engineering or data science Several years of professional experience in the field of IT/information systems Requirements Engineering experience and Model Based SW Lifecycle knowledge is mandatory Network management basic knowledge and experience in working using agile methodologies required Knowledge in Java and MS Office Linux, Windows and Image Processing knowledge appreciated GIS Technologies knowledge is a plus Proficient German and business fluent English skills Ability to work in an international team Proactive and independent way of working Working time model: 35h/week    Was wir bieten  Time for change – time for a new job! Are you a Software Development Engineer  and looking for a new professional challenge? Then stop searching! We have what you are looking for: a secure job, fair compensation and exciting new tasks at an attractive company from the aerospace industry  in Manching  . Apply online now! We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of any disabilities.    Up to 30 days vacation per year Extensive social benefits, incl. Christmas and holiday bonuses Option of permanent employment with our business partner Free online courses
