Title: JUNIOR DATA ENGINEER (m/f/d)
Description: There’s nothing quite like the pulsating and emotional power of sport. At SPORTFIVE, we are delivering pioneering partnerships in sports. We believe in the responsible commercialization of sports and connect brands, rights-holders, media platforms and fans by leveraging a global network paired with decades of experience and innovative spirit.  We operate as one team of over 1,200 local experts based in 15 countries around the world, active in Football, Golf, Esports, Motorsport, Handball, Tennis, American Football, Basketball, Ice Hockey, multi-sport events and many more. As market leader and with customer centricity and data intelligence at our core, we aim to be the most progressive and respected partner in sports. Because as sport continues to evolve and grow, so do we.  As a global data team, we support the digital transformation of SPORTFIVE. One topic of great importance is currently the establishment of a self-service / reporting infrastructure. The team is multifunctional and works according to agile principles. It is particularly important to us that each team member takes responsibility in their own work area and has the necessary creative freedom. If you see yourself as growing into this team, then we are looking for you as a       JUNIOR DATA ENGINEER (m/f/d)  In fulltime, at Hamburg or Frankfurt Office       Your Responsibilities   You develop data pipelines (ETL/ELT) for our analytics and data science applications You work closely with our internal and external stakeholders to translate their business requirements into dimensional data models Together with our other data engineers you further develop our cloud-based Big Data and data warehouse architecture       Your Profile   The foundation of your professional profile is a degree in computer science, business informatics, business mathematics or a comparable qualification. You have first practical experiences with databases, data warehousing and ETL development. Experience in cloud computing would be a plus. You have good knowledge in SQL and/or Python You have an analytical mindset as well as a structured and target-oriented way of working You are a team player and have a good sense of humor Your very good written and spoken English skills enable you to work in international teams       This is what you can expect from us   Your new environment: an exciting task in the sports business, a committed team with short communication and decision-making paths Our onboarding: You will start with a position-specific induction and as part of our 'Welcome on Board' initiative you will receive a comprehensive overview of the entire organization Your development opportunities: Freedom for personal and topic-related development, supported by individual development planning with complementary, further training measures and "training on the job” Work-life balance: support for work-life balance, including flexible working hours and mobile working, and a free family service for support in all situations Many corporate benefits: discounted partner offers as well as a wide range of additional benefits, e.g., company pension scheme Our culture: we demand a culture of diversity and "live" our values - regular training courses and clear internal processes form the formal basis for our open, respectful, and appreciative interaction with one another       SPORTFIVE values the diversity of its employees as an enrichment and is expressly committed to the goal of gender equality.    SOUNDS GOOD? Then apply directly to Kristina with your CV. Also, let us know briefly in two or three points why the position should be the next step for you.      We are looking forward to your application.       SPORTFIVE Germany GmbH  Kristina Rübsam | Business Partner People Operations  GER - Barcastrasse 5  22087 Hamburg

Title: Frontend Developer (Vue) (f/m/d)
Description: JOIN US!  __Comgy is an ambitious Berlin-based start-up in the field of energy / proptech and currently has a vacancy for a Frontend Developer!   We move, and are moved by, the generational topic of climate protection. If you also want to make a difference and have a desire to work with purpose, then you are exactly right with us!__   YOUR ROLE   You extend, improve and maintain the frontend of our meter-, tenant- and gateway management web app (Vue + Vuetify) You build our new tenant portal web app (Vue + Tailwind) You will become an expert for our jsonapi-conform REST API on the consumer side You implement visualizations for live data feeds (meter heartbeats, meter data, gateway data, decryption/decoding queue) You work alongside an experienced team of designers and implement flow-based UIs You take ownership of the UX and usability of the interfaces you build You make informed decisions about technologies, architecture and processes   OUR PERFECT MATCH   You have strong logical thinking skills and proven persistence in problem-solving (e.g. achieved through a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Maths, Computer Science or Engineering) You have +3 years of professional work experience in web development You have experience with component-based frontend technologies like Vue or React You have extensive knowledge of utility-first CSS libraries like Tailwind You have very good communication skills and are comfortable working in an English-speaking team Bonus: exposure to and interest in Agile development methods/practices (Scrum, Kanban, Lean, etc.) Bonus: You are more of a generalist than a specialist, meaning you have had exposure to adjacent topics like UI/UX design, QA, data science, design thinking or backend technologies like Ruby on Rails or Elixir/Phoenix   WE OFFER   A very deep stack, from low-level data to processing and visualization, not another CRUD app A promising startup within an exciting sector of property & energy management which we are disrupting via digitalization and innovation The option to take more responsibilities over time and take the next step in your career path, e.g. becoming Lead Frontend Designer Profit from working closely with experienced serial entrepreneurs who co-founded 3 successful companies within the last 10 years Freedom to design and use the latest technologies where relevant (“Best tool for the job” approach) Stay on top of current industry trends and join tech conferences to present your work, and meet-ups all around the globe A hybrid working model with the option of remote / mobile-work in order to allow room for your individual preferences In addition to 5 days of educational leave per year, we also offer further internal training and regular knowledge exchange Company pension scheme Urban Sports Club membership or heyday account with a variety of perks & benefits Access to regular sessions for physical and mental health (Actio Teams) An office in the heart of Berlin (Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg) with a good supply of drinks, fruit, muesli and snacks :)   REFERRAL  Sounds good, but not for you?  Feel free to spread the word. There is a €2000 referral bonus  for referrals that lead to employment.    Additional Information    Please note that for this position it is obligatory to include a cover letter.  Start  : immediately – Job type  : full-time, on site or remote – Location:  Berlin Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg – Timezone: ±1 h   OPEN APPLICATION  No suitable job found, but the area of Software Engineering sounds interesting?  Then feel free to apply on your own initiative!____

Title: SYSTEMS ENGINEER SEVILLA
Description: Capgemini Engineering is looking for talented Systems Engineers to join our Aeronautics, Space and Defence Division in Sevilla, Spain.   We need motivated and skilled Systems Engineers with experience in Communications, Aerospace or Defence industries, showing strong learning potential, team working philosophy and eager to take new professional challenges in a high demanding technological and international environment.    Your Main Tasks Will Be    As a Systems Engineer, you will collaborate in the systems development, integration and validation. From the requirement analysis phase to systems test and certification.   Requirement analysis and validation Systems design specification Generation of ICDs Systems test definition and execution Test analysis and results validation Suppliers management and monitoring System documentation control and supervision (HW/SW) Support to system certification activities and milestones Design modification proposal management   More than 52000 Engineers and Scientists are enrolled in Capgemini Engineering teams, which are highly diverse, dynamic and multidisciplinary and which are integrated by strongly qualified and motivated people from a variety of backgrounds and disciplines such as Aeroespace, Communications, Systems Engineering, Software and Data Science among others.    We Also Offer An Attractive Package Of Social Benefits    Medical, life and accident insurance. Flexible remuneration (restaurant and transport card, training, medical insurance for family members) Gympass Employee assistance service through Alares. Employee Club.   Additionally, you will have the opportunity to grow professionally within one of the best valued companies to work, being recognized with the TOP EMPLOYERS certification for our Human Resources policies.   For more information about our company: https://capgemini-engineering.com/es/es/    Skills And Knowledge    Systems Engineering. Requirements analysis. Architecture design. Systems integration. Testing. Certifications. Technical documentation.    Experience    Minimun 1 year of professional experience in a similar role within the aeronautical, defence or space sector.    Education    Bachelor's degree in Aeronautics, Aerospace, Industrial, Telecommunications o related engineering fields.    Technologies    DOORS    Languages    Professional working proficiency in english (B2 level or above).

Title: Software Engineer (d/f/m)
Description: Job Description    A vacancy for a Software Engineer (d/f/m)  has arisen within Airbus Defence and Space in Manching  .   If you are looking for a challenging task in a development team at Airbus Defence and Space in Manching and if you are interested in systems & software design around military aircrafts, you’re welcomed to our department.   We develop and maintain Electronic Warfare Ground Support Systems for our Tornado, A400M and Eurofighter platforms at the Airbus-sites in Manching.   Our systems enable Electronic Warfare mission data preparation, provide the interfaces to the flying platforms, and support the evaluation of the mission or flight.    Your Main Tasks And Responsibilities Will Include     Analysis of the use cases and needs in close cooperation with the various stakeholders of system engineering team Definition and realization of software architectures and the ability to evaluate different architectural solutions and choose the best solution Understand user workflows and define SW and Graphical User Interface (GUI) solutions using specific technologies to support and enhance different steps throughout the mission data production. Design and implementation of mission data preparation and validation solutions with the support of state-of-the-art technologies such as Eclipse, OSGI and Java. Preparation and execution of software tests to satisfy the different levels of verification and validation Integration of activities in the Software Development Lifecycle Develop according to Software Development Plan and accompanied standards     We are looking for candidates with the following skills and experience:     Bachelor degree in computer science or equivalent qualification Graduates and young professionals are welcome to apply Experience with Eclipse, OSGI and Java Good written and spoken German Good written and spoken English A proactive mindset and high teamwork Motivation for agile SW development processes and methods    Disabled applicants with equal qualifications will be given special consideration.    We Offer     Challenging tasks for/with unique services and products Pleasant working atmosphere in a professional and international work environment Exciting development opportunities and perspectives Extensive company training offers (eLearning and Classroom Trainings) Flexible working hours Compatibility of work and family life Attractive remuneration Company Pension Scheme Good connections to public transport and local parking facilities Catering facilities on site    This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.    Company    Airbus Defence and Space GmbH    Contract Type    Permanent Contract / CDI / Unbefristet / Contrato indefinido    Experience Level    Entry Level / Débutant / Anfänger / Recién titulado    Job Family    Software Engineering   By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.   Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.   Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.   At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Fullstack Javascript Developer (w/m/d)
Description: Küchenheld Tech disrupts the kitchen industry developing tools to allow employee and customer centric processes.   Who We Are Looking For    A passionate coder, who is curious and always longs for learning something new, A dependable person, who trust us and who we can rely on, A creative mind that always looks for alternative tools and approaches to develop our stack, and A team player, who is looking for a great team to belong to.   Ideally, you have more than two years of experience working in a predominantly JavaScript-driven environment. If you are at the start of your career or switched stacks, we would still love to hear from you. Here are some of the things we look out for:   At least 1 year experience in ReactJS / Node.js Understanding of the RESTful/GraphQL architecture Experience working with relational and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis,...) Mastery of TypeScript and React.js Experience with JavaScript ES5/ES6+, HTML5, CSS3 Familiarity with any server frameworks (ExpressJS/NestJS/SailsJS,...) Familiarity with any UI frameworks (AntD, Bootstrap, MaterialUI, …)   Our current challenges  After starting to operate in 2019, we quickly grew to more than 150 employees and are now the fastest growing kitchen retailer in Europe. All of this growth is enabled and supported by a variety of internal and external tools. To support and accelerate our growth we need to continue to deliver intuitive and robust web-based solutions.    Who We Are    We are a great team of different backgrounds (coding, data science, mathematics, business studies, product design) who enjoy working together and helping each other to become the best we can be. We are dedicated to the team and keep it a safe space where everybody can follow his heart, speak his mind, and thus excel. We help each other if we fail and party together if we shine.   Your tasks  Your tasks will depend on your interests and your qualification. Currently we image your tasks to be:   Collaborate with project managers to scope and refine product ideas Technically review and refine tickets Implement new features across our products Review code from freelancers and junior developers Support users with technical questions    What We Expect From You In An Interview    Depending on your background and experience, develop an opinion about our current challenges on an appropriate level, so we can have a fun and thriving discussion about it.    What You Can Expect In Your Job    You will join a compassionate team, on which you can rely, so you can grow on the challenges we will face together. We offer you the flexibility and the resources you need to be your best and accompany on your journey.   Wer wir sind:  Küchenheld ist das smarte Küchenstudio von heute. Wir durchbrechen die klassische Art des Küchenverkaufs und setzen auf Effizienz, Transparenz und Fairness sowohl für unsere Kunden als auch unsere KollegInnen. Mit modernster Technik und persönlicher Beratung bieten wir unseren Kunden ein einzigartiges Kauferlebnis Ihrer Traumküche. Klingt spannend? Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung inklusive Deines gewünschten Eintrittsdatums an recruitment@kuechenheld.de. Deine Ansprechpartnerin ist Anna aus dem People & Culture Team.

Title: Anti-Abuse Software Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: At IONOS, the leading European provider of cloud infrastructure, cloud services and hosting services, you will work together with a wide range of teams. We are characterized by open structures, a friendly working culture and flat hierarchies with a strong team spirit. We firmly believe that work and fun are compatible, and offer you the right environment for this. Our constant growth means that we are always looking for new colleagues. Become part of IONOS and grow with us.   Your Tasks:  For our department "Fraud & Abuse Management" we are looking for a Software Developer with immediate effect. As part of our departmental IT team, you will design, develop and maintain the department's software. You will work independently and confidently with the development tools relevant to the department. Initial experience in the area of anti-abuse or IT security completes your profile.   These are your tasks:   Planning, creation, and maintenance of high-performance software in a complex and distributed system landscape taking into account SSDLC methods. Maintenance of existing legacy systems. Implementing legal requirements regarding data protection and compliance. Documentation. Participation in compensated on-call duty (weekly 24/7).   We Appreciate:   Ideally full-stack developer, with focus on backend services. Academic degree in the field of computer science or a comparable achieved qualification, or relevant work experience (at least two years). Basic knowledge of GNU/Linux (Debian). Toolset: Java (Spring, Wicket), maven, perl (or willingness to learn perl), ansible, git, (no)SQL databases, Twitter Bootstrap. Passionate about teamwork, high motivation for learning, English, and ability to work independently and self-conscientiously.    About IONOS    1&1 IONOS is Europe's leading platform for cloud services and hosting services. We successfully support our customers in their business development.   More than 4000 employees in several countries around the world are working to meet the requirements and wishes of our 8.5 million customers.   We promote the development of our employees and their different talents, interests and languages.   We value diversity and welcome all applications - regardless of, for example, gender, nationality, ethnic or social origin, religion, disability, age as well as sexual orientation and identity, physical characteristics, marital status or any other irrelevant factor subject to applicable law.

Title: Full stack web developer
Description: allymatch is a deep tech startup continously working to develop the most customer-centric data driven SaaS platforms for seamless B2B matchings and beyond. Creating something new which was never built before, requires a team of dedicated and passionate people who share all the same mission - making innovation possible.   Tasks  We are looking for a motivated and bright Software Engineer / Full-Stack Web Developer to join our growing team to work on various innovative cloud based software projects solving real world problems within the B2B sphere. Interest in data science applications would be great as you will work closely with our data scientists. As Full Stack Developer, you should have knowledge in all stages of software development, utilizing both front-end (react js.) and back-end languages (node.js, python) with test-driven development, and will take a key role in our team.    Requirements    Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or other related field Experience working with graphic designers and converting designs to visual elements. Knowledge of and proper experience with both front-end and back-end languages Understanding and implementation of security and data protection. Highly experienced with back-end programming languages especially Node JS and also Python, Ruby, Java, JavaScript. Experienced in Node.JS or Python/Django based REST API Experienced in JWT based authentication Experience with postgresql as a Database which should be configurable via environment properties Proficient experience using advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks mainly ReactJS, WuJS, AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, DurandalJS etc. Understanding of server-side languages including such as Jade, EJS, Jinja, etc. Experience with cloud message APIs and usage of push notifications. Knowledge of code versioning tools such as Git, Mercurial or SVN. Ability to troubleshoot and debug browsers Familiarity with layout requirements Understanding of SEO standards Must be fluent in English, German language skills would be a plus.   If your experience (min. 5 years) and skillset are a good match for our requirements. we will ask you to work on a task after a short phone chat and there will be two interviews.   We look forward to getting to know you better.

Programming skills in Python language. Knowledge of at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask ...) is a plus. Programming skills in Java is a plus. Strong knowledge of Relational Databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server ...) and SQL language. Knowledge of NoSQL databases is a plus. Knowledge of AWS is a plus / Knowledge of data visualization tools, mainly Tableau, is a plus. Ability to work in a team environment. Strong problem-solving skills and analytical skills. Resilience and a determination to succeed. Independent thinkers with growth mindset. Must be passionate, self-motivated, and able to learn quickly. Strong sense of integrity. Personal values that match our company values.

Title: Backend Developer (m/f/d)
Description: In this role, you will manage all aspects of the software life cycle and develop a modular architecture. Our role is located in our office near Munich and can be placed immediatly. (Currently located in Feldkirchen and moves to Garching in Summer)   Your Responsibilites   Design and implement low-latency, high-availability, performance applications, security and data protection Build RESTful APIs with Node.js or other frameworks and build logic in isolated, independent modules Build ready to containerize backend applications    Your Profile   Bachelor/Master degree in Business Computer Science or similar and 3+ years experience Strong understanding of REST API principles and best practices Expertise with Node.js, npm, SQL/NoSQL databases Proficient use of Git, Typescript, JavaScript and Phyton Familiar with cloud services, AWS Fluent English verbal and written    We offer   An international, innovative agile working and start up environment A responsible position that requires teamwork and a high level of personal commitment Join a cross-cultural and diverse team    Sounds like your next challenge? Then we are eager to meet you! Please apply via Oerlikon job portal.   Contact   Robin Derichs   Phone: + 49 (0) 6142 6033 281   #joinoerlikoneu  About Us  The Oerlikon Digital Hub is the place to be for those who want to create the new digital world, within and around Oerlikon, the leading global technology and engineering group headquartered in Switzerland. We are engineering the future - together with our innovative teams in the core business that craft market-leading, high-tech solutions for expanding markets in automotive, aerospace, energy, tooling and additive manufacturing. Sustainability is a living principle for Oerlikon.   https://www.oerlikon.com/sustainabilityreport-2020/en/   #joinoerlikon

Title: Full-Stack Software Engineer (m/f/d) // Remote
Description: Venture Team  Our Venture Team Loady is developing a new partner platform that aims to improve relationships and efficiency in logistics. The venture is looking for a Full-Stack Software Engineer to join the growing development team. You get the opportunity to become part of a high-performance startup team that works with enthusiasm and great professionalism in developing a unique, industry-wide partner platform.   You will work in an agile team with latest cloud-native technologies to build modern, scalable and high-quality solutions for our customers. Our team has an end-to-end responsibility for the system, including system design and architecture, writing code with high standards, hosting the services in the Azure cloud, monitoring services, measuring quality, and guaranteeing service reliability and security. There is plenty of space for your own ideas to provide the best user experience.   Passion for our idea and commitment, experience as a Full-Stack Developer, and high motivation for continuous learning is essential in this role.   Your role   Be part of an agile DevOps team with end-to-end responsibility along the complete product lifecycle Design and develop frontend and backend solutions for our innovative logistics platform according to business requirements Build, test and ship features using modern frameworks such as Vue.js Implement and integrate APIs for external systems Take responsibility for high code quality and long-term maintainable software Ensure a great user experience including high performance, reliability, stability and security Participate in architecture decisions Drive automation, e.g., testing, monitoring, deployments, CI/CD pipelines, etc.    Your offer   Remote work - based in Germany Several years of experience as a Full-Stack Developer, Software Engineer or similar role Several years of experience in software development, ideally with .NET/C# Experience with designing and developing scalable cloud-based solutions, ideally with Microsoft Azure Experience with API development and integration Experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript and ideally Vue.js Experience with developing and shipping user-facing features using component-based UI frameworks Experience with designing reusable components Experience with responsive web design Experience implementing CI/CD pipelines, ideally with Azure DevOps Experience with relational and NoSQL databases Experience with unit testing and testing frameworks General understanding of data protection, data security and governance Experience in working within an agile environment Experience in a DevOps Team with end-to-end responsibility for the entire product lifecycle Bachelor or Master of Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Business Informatics, or similar Self-organization, team collaboration, agile mindset, problem solving, positive attitude and high motivation Good communication skills in English and German    What You Can Expect From Us   Become part of a great team and enabler of an emerging business supported by the business incubator CHEMOVATOR of a leading chemical company Exciting challenges in a dynamic market environment A highly motivated and open-minded team Attractive working environment Competitive salary  Join the founding team of an early venture idea with plenty of space for your own ideas.   Apply for this position   About Us  Chemovator is the business incubator of BASF. We provide a protected space to build commercial ventures from unconventional ideas. Our Venture Teams take full ownership of their idea, creatively explore their business, learn fast and pivot beyond corporate boundaries.

Title: Graduate IT / Software Developer - STEM subjects / programming
Description: Graduate IT / Software Developer - STEM subjects / programming    Opportunity with a growing IT & Software problem solving company in Germany, Austria, Hungary (Remote). They work with leading companies across industries and are looking for graduates from STEM subjects who are interested in SW development, coding, Implementation and project solving.     You will have the chance to work on various challenging projects in AI, big data, Backend, middleware, Frontend and general software development.     Experience needed    Very strong academic background with a Bcs, Msc or PhD (grades between 1 - 2.2),  in either  Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Electrical engineering, Informatics or similar.  Ability to work in a fast paced environment, and pick up new projects and technologies quickly. Interest / experience in Software Systems / software architecture / implementation / large software systems / big data / AI / problem solving knowledge of programming languages (Python, C++, Java etc) and tools (Jenkins or Hibernate).  German Language  is a  MUST  (B2 and above)    #Consulting #problemsolvers     By applying to this role you understand that we may collect your personal data, store and process it on our systems. For more information please see our Privacy Notice (https://eu-recruit.com/about-us/privacy-notice/)

Title: Data Engineer/ Data Platform Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Location Berlin, Germany or Ihringen, Germany   THE HELLA GUTMANN PROMISE  Curiosity is our driving force. We do know and understand the vehicle like no other. Our vast store of knowledge is neither limited to brands and models nor to technology. We are interconnecting this knowledge intelligently so that our customers worldwide are able to use it in combination with practicable products and services.   Our main product range features professional equipment for automotive workshops, car dealerships and automotive testing agencies. With about 500 employees and our head office in Ihringen near Freiburg im Breisgau we belong to the Hella Gutmann Group which is a corporation of the HELLA KGaA Hueck & Co.   Hella Gutmann is the birthplace of a whole host of good ideas that bring that little bit of extra success to vehicle workshops across the globe every single day. Getting this innovative strength on the road requires a strong team – and you can be part of it. Find out more about us and fast-track your career with Hella Gutmann.   We are looking for a Data Platform Engineer to strengthen our newly formed international Data Management Team. This team enables data exchange between Hella Gutmann’s data sourcing entities and data consuming products and services, and makes sure data is available, quality approved and up to date. This role has an outsized impact on the organization: the effectiveness of data platform enables greater digital products portfolio and effects company revenue directly.   DEMONSTRATE YOUR POTENTIAL AND JOIN US TO SHAPE THE FUTURE OF THE DIGITAL WORKSHOP   You design our cloud-based data platform, monitor and improve the overall performance and stability of the system. You develop, customize, and manage integration tools, databases, and data access solutions in agile product environment You develop reliable, scalable and maintainable pipelines to bring data to central data storage in cloud. You make sure quality assured and modeled data can be easily discovered and accessed by applications or services.   THE REASONS WHY YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT FOR OUR COMPANY   Background in data engineering (ETL, data modelling, foundation in relational as well as document-oriented databases) with an interest in the product side. Initial experience in AWS stack, with focus on serverless architecture. Proficiency in one of OOP programming languages, preferred Python. You believe in automated testing, continuous integration, infrastructure as code, SLOs, and other SRE best practices. Strong desire to learn and the ability to take ownership are essential. You communicate effectively in English.   WHAT WE ARE OFFERING TO MAKE YOUR EVERYDAY WORK EVEN MORE ENJOYABLE   Interesting tasks, innovative products and great colleagues An open and cooperative business culture with direct and friendly communication and cooperation Development measures and further education that is tailored to you personally A safe workplace in a continuously growing company Modern infrastructure at the workplace "Eldercare": care program for relatives Employee discounts and much more   Take the opportunity to reveal your potential within a global, family-run company that offers you the best possible conditions for progressing in your career.   HELLA Gutmann Solutions GmbH  Arkadius Birkner   Am Krebsbach 2   79241 Ihringen   +49 (0) 7668/9900-1995
