Title: Full Stack Software Developer (w/m/d)
Description: About Workist    Founded in 2019 and supported by Serial Entrepreneurs and VCs, we turned on the turbo this year and are on a strong growth path to become the leading provider of B2B transaction automation. We already connect thousands of companies and automate transactions with a volume of several million euros every week.   So that even more companies can automate their B2B transactions with our product, we are looking for passionated and talented employees who will take the product and the company to the next level.   This is your mission  We are looking for a Fullstack Developer (w/m/d) who is passionate about what they do and ready to take on responsibility. You will be an integral part of the product team where we build AI-based applications to automate repetitive business processes such as data extraction and entry, email classification, email data extraction, and business transaction routing.   Decide on technical architecture and infrastructure Develop software along our Definition of done Develop software in the entire tech stack Provide feedback to team members on where and how to improve Help out and mentor other team members to ensure overall development quality & velocity Live “Continuous improvement” by identifying opportunities for streamlining work and reducing waste Be accountable for service levels Write documentation where necessary Take care of IT Security and Data Privacy   Your profile  We’re looking for people that are passionate about what they do and ready to take over responsibilities. We’re creating a work environment where people should follow their curiosity and have a strong urge to put the business forward to help fulfill our mission.   Since you will work very closely with our founding team on our AI Technology we believe it is important that you feel comfortable with at least some of the points below.   Fluent in Python or if you consider yourself polyglot Experience with Typescript, React JS, and Apollo Experience with Django, Flask, or similar CI/CD Experience Experience working with Graphql Kubernetes Experience   It would be even greater if you find your self in the next list:   Due to our customer base, German is a plus Some first experience with Machine Learning You have some experience in setting up cloud infrastructure with terraform   Why us?  Do you want to really take over responsibilities and do not face micromanagement from an incompetent boss? Then you’re at Workist in the right place. We commit as founders and as a company to build an organization that promotes domain ownership and gives people the freedom to decide within their domain independently. This does not mean that you’re on your own.   On the contrary, we believe in teamwork and helping each other out. We want to achieve great things together and believe in working in small iterations towards a big goal. Therefore we follow agile best practices in business and tech teams and set sprint, quarterly, and yearly goals to work efficiently towards them. Everyone is welcome to contribute to our company goals and also raise red flags when something is not going as planned.   At Workist, we strive to build an organization that encourages ownership and gives employees the freedom to make independent decisions in their own areas. This doesn't mean you're on your own.   We believe in teamwork and helping each other. We want to achieve great things together and believe in working towards a big goal in small steps. That's why we follow agile best practices in business and tech teams and set sprint, quarterly and annual goals to work together efficiently. Everyone is welcome to contribute to our business goals and also to point out challenges when something is not going as planned.   Your benefits as a Workie:   With strong ownership from day one, you will actively shape an early stage SaaS startup 30 days annual leave BVG ticket or JobRad for the way to work Annual budget for personal training Tax-free benefits Work equipment of your choice Flexible home office plan and the opportunity to work completely remotely outside Germany for 4 weeks a year Regular team events, fresh fruit and beverages in our modern office in Berlin Mitte Competitive salary, extensive individual feedback sessions and great development opportunities Work in a flat hierarchy with an open and transparent communication culture Participation in the (Virtual) Stock Option Plan

Title: Software Engineer (Java) - Data Science
Description: Headquartered in San Diego (USA) and with offices in big major European metropolitan cities like London, Paris, Berlin, Munich, Milan, Eindhoven & Krakow, more than 300 employees around the globe are constantly working on Mapp Cloud to provide our customers cross-channel marketing insights continuously and reliably. Mapp Cloud brings customer acquisition and customer engagement together in one simple marketing cloud infused with data intelligence. Our business is tech, but tech depends on people. As the people of Mapp, collegiality is in our DNA. Therefore, we are committed to build the best product along with a place of belonging. We work together, we win together and we proudly extend this to our customers.   What you will do:  To further our growth, we’re looking for a Java Software Developer in our data science team, you will be responsible for the design, implementation and automation of new algorithms for predictive analytics and recommender systems for Mapp Intelligence which is designed to process more than 350 TB raw data and up to 60k requests/sec.   Understand and expand a thrilling tech stack for fully automated marketing Build business applications in our Spring Boot micro service landscape Enable our customers to get the most of their data by developing data science products Be responsible for the continuous optimization of our development infrastructure Apply continuous integration / continuous delivery Principles    The assets you bring to the team:   Bachelor or Master’s Degree in Informatics, business informatics or similar Multiple years of professional experience in Java language and Spring ecosystem (ideally reactive) Knowledge of Software Engineering Principles, DDD and Clean Code Experience in DevOps Tools (like Jenkins, Ansible, Vagrant, Docker) Independent, committed, pragmatic, customer focussed, but also a good team player Fluent in English, German a plus    We offer:   Prospect: We are a continuously growing team with experts in the most future-oriented fields of customer intelligence. We are dealing with real big data scenarios and data from various business models and industries. Apart from interesting tasks we offer you considerable freedom for your ideas and perspectives for the development of your professional and management skills. Team oriented atmosphere: Our culture embraces integrity, team work and innovation. Our employees value the friendly atmosphere that is the most powerful driver within our company. Goodies: Individual trainings, company tickets, team events, table soccer, fresh fruits and a sunny roof terrace. TechCulture: Work with experienced developers who share the ambition for well-written and clean code. Choose your hardware, OS and IDE. Bring in your own ideas, work with open source and have fun at product demos, hackathons and meetups.    Now that we've got your attention...  We look forward to receiving your application, including your salary expectations, in addition to your earliest possible starting date. If available, please provide a link to any additional online resources like a Linkedin profile, GitHub and/or Stack Overflow profile.

Title: Women in Tech - all levels (f/x) - Munich or Remote
Description: FINN makes mobility fun and sustainable. With a flexible car subscription, we bring a true e-commerce experience to car ownership and offset all CO2 emissions along the way. Join our fast-growing startup to build the most popular auto e-commerce platform. We work with the best car brands in the world and are backed by leading global investors.   Your Role   With this program, we are primarily targeting women working in Software Engineering to join our team and make massive contributions to the growth of FINN. As a Woman in Tech at FINN, you will have the opportunity to work in either Frontend Development, Backend Development, Data Engineering or API technical writer in a high-growth tech startup. You will get to work in cross-functional teams and insights into how we are building the most popular auto e-commerce platform.   Your Benefits   You have the flexibility to work either in our Munich office or remotely ±3 hours of the Munich time zone (CET/CEST). In case of relocation, we are offering full visa support for you and your family. With massive growth potential, FINN allows you to quickly develop and succeed in a highly motivating startup environment with exciting projects in cross-functional teams. Excellent fixed salary, significant virtual equity share of the company, along a yearly personal development budget of 1,500€ and access to learning platforms. We pay all our engineers equally regardless of gender. Our open, modern office in the middle of Munich is known for loads of fun with amazing colleagues and frequent team events. You want to drive your own car with FINN? – Get one with our employee discount program.    Your Responsibilities   Best software to support business: You actively participate in delivering the best software possible for our customers and business units. Together with your team, you ship new features for our cloud platform. Strive for excellence: Strive to deliver the best possible user experience and to follow engineering best practices. Build it, run it: Build features with a ‘build it, run it’ mindset and be responsible for testing, deploying, and monitoring your code. We believe in Serverless!    Available Tracks   Frontend Development: You will be responsible for creating customer-facing and internal web applications that will manage thousands of vehicles and customers on a daily basis. Backend Development: You will be responsible for creating software that will manage thousands of vehicles and customers on a daily basis. Data Engineering: You design, implement and maintain a state-of-the-art data architecture for our teams to facilitate our choice making with easily available data. API Technical Writing: You play a key role in building our product by creating useful and engaging software documentation. Business Automation: You optimise and automate crucial business processes with state-of-the-art webtools such as Integromat    Your Profile   Graduated or about to graduate top of your class with a Bachelor's or Master degree in computer science or similar field. Experience in software engineering, preferably B2B, B2C, or SaaS products, Juniors are welcome! Knowledge of Python, JavaScript (NodeJS or React), Go or TypeScript. Strong solution finding abilities with new, creative approaches on how to overcome obstacles. Highly passionate about hands-on coding. You have a “never-stop-learning” attitude and a desire to develop and grow. You are fluent in English.    Interested in Joining Our Fast-Growing Startup?   Please upload your CV and transcripts online. Andreas Wixler and Anna Kaiser are looking forward to your application!   Equal Opportunities for Everyone   FINN is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive and safe environment for all employees. Experience comes in many forms and we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team. We encourage you to apply even if your experience doesn't perfectly align with what we have listed. We'd love to hear from you!

Title: Software Developer - SCADA Systems (m/f/d)
Description: Are you a Software Developer looking for innovative application development?  Do you want to accelerate your career?  Join our cutting-edge Software Development team  Our Oilfield-Services-Digital-Team works with our business to provide intelligent, connected technologies. We develop and maintain applications and tools for our internal and external customers for data acquisition, data processing and visualization. We collaborate with development teams in science, mechanical and electrical engineering, physics, and geoscience, to develop innovative application software.   Partner with the best  As a software developer, you will work in a team developing systems to monitor and control the drilling process. Within the team, you will develop and improve applications for an OPC UA based SCADA system for various drilling processes and services. Additionally, this position offers the opportunity to participate in the long-term development of a platform with a multitude of ongoing and future planned projects. Besides project work, the position offers the opportunity to improve existing development practices, especially with regards to system specification and verification. Furthermore, the position includes participation in the Baker Hughes training and development program for continuing personal and technical education.   As a Software Developer, you will be responsible for:    Being responsible for specification, concept definition and development of drilling automation applications together with signal processing & control engineers Developing interfaces to external systems such as rig control systems Sustaining of existing components of a drilling automation system including the OPC UA infrastructure    Fuel your passion  To be successful in this role you will:    Have profound experience in development of technical software for Linux and/or Windows systems Demonstrate proven development experience with C++ or Java using modern software development principles Have a graduate degree in computer science, software engineering or related field Show experience in requirements documentation, verification and validation Be proficient in English, both spoken and written Demonstrate experience with agile software development approaches, e.g. SCRUM, Kanban Have experience with OPC UA Have practical experience with real-time monitoring and control applications    Work in a way that works for you  We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:    Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive    Working with us  Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.   Working for you  Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:    Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities Safety net of life insurance and disability programs Tailored financial programs Additional elected or voluntary benefits    About Us:  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.   Join Us:  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.   Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.   R35874

Title: Full Stack Developer
Description: We’re offering a position for an intermediate to senior level full stack developer. You will join a small and lean team where you will have a chance to make an impact right from the start. Setting is one of the leading flex office providers in Germany that operates a marketplace that aims to make space more accessible to startups and fast growing companies.   Tasks  You will help maintain and extend our software components for modernizing the entire office rental experience from space discovery, contracting, and payments to handover, support and access processes.    Hard Skills    Requirements  We’re looking for an experienced developer, who will play a critical role in maintaining our back office applications and advancing our user facing office marketplace. You should be well versed in object oriented languages and popular web frameworks like Rails, Django or React. Practical experience with relational databases, interest in data modeling and knowledge of test driven methodologies are also essential.   Experience with Javascript, CSS, HTML, Python or Ruby are essential Proven experience with writing and maintaining code for both frontend and backend Decent level of UI/UX knowledge Excellent forward-thinking and initiative skills Good time management and organization skills Ability to visualize and plan user-interface improvements Degree in computer science or similar qualification in software development    Soft Skills    Software is a team sport. So besides a strong analytical and problem solving mentality, you should have a collaborative spirit and show responsibility and ownership towards colleagues and customers. Getting things done is a quality that we practice and appreciate throughout the company.    Benefits    What we offer:   A competitive remuneration package with fixed and variable components Weekly team lunch. Enjoy delicious, healthy lunch with the team and learn about the crew Intensive coaching from experienced serial entrepreneur with steep learning curve Part of a dynamic and fast-growing company with flat hierarchies, short decision-making processes and the opportunity to make a strong strategic and conceptual contribution Always Learning. Team-based training and coaching, as well as a yearly book allowance to expand your knowledge   About Us:  At Setting, our mission is to connect people with spaces. We help entrepreneurs, businesses and companies find, lease and transform oﬃce space for modern work.   We want to bridge the gap between the traditional values of real-estate owners and the modern needs of a new generation of entrepreneurs, startups and fast growing companies.   Our vision is to make space work. But our vision of space is more than just renting, brokering, or leasing spaces. What we see is that the traditional real estate market is not made for today’s generation of companies. Dynamic companies are seeking fresh, flexible, and pragmatic solutions in an evolving real estate market. Through understanding what they want, we want to help entrepreneurs, companies, and organisation find the perfect space to work at their maximum potential.   Our Values:  Our core values are the beliefs and principles we share. These are the elements that best describe the type of company we are and continue to strive to be.   Help each other grow. We personally commit to the success and development of our team, and actively involve others in decisions and plans that aﬀect them. Be dynamic. Our work is never the same one day to another, and we thrive through thinking about the transformation of the real estate market. Use honesty. We’re open to personal change, and strive for our environment to be as transparent as possible. Get things done. Every detail matters. We’re reliable, and we pick our own stuff up. That means we find a solutions to any problem. Value openness. We’re not afraid to ask the right questions, and we are true to ourselves and each other. Don’t forget to laugh. Smile. Have fun, enjoy the task at hand, and promote an energising and optimistic environment.

Title: Scientific Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: About DeepSpin  DeepSpin is a DeepTech startup developing next-gen MRI machines powered by machine learning. Headquartered in Berlin, we are now expanding our world-class technical team after another round of investment. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a team motivated to bring a life-saving technology to the 5 billion people that cannot currently afford it.     About the Role  At DeepSpin, you will be joining the software R&D team in the Berlin office. This team will develop the algorithms that the MRI machine relies on, from the network defining the operation and design of the machine to the layers that post-process the results.     About You   Expert knowledge in Python and C/C++ programming languages Minimum of 2 years experience in software development in a production environment, preferably in a technical/engineering industry MSc degree or higher in computer science, mathematics, physics or similar, or equivalent amount of education and experience Experience designing, building and maintaining complex software solutions from the ground up based on business requirements Experience with quality software process tools and methodologies, such as Git, continuous integration, and automated testing First principles thinking, excellent communication skills in English and a proactive, positive attitude Preferred: Experience with machine learning frameworks (pytorch, tensorflow) in a production environment Preferred: hand-on knowledge of high-performance computing and/or CUDA development     What we offer:   The opportunity to truly make a difference in the world by shaping a ground-breaking product early on A diverse and multicultural English-first office A creative workplace with flat hierarchies and open communication among a cooperative team Working directly with the founders and the team of senior advisors supporting us (ex-McKinsey, ex-Siemens and ML/MRI professors) on cutting-edge ML techniques An entry point into the field of AI-generated medical devices A total compensation package value of up to 110.000 € per year consisting of 60.000 - 80.000 € salary, stock options, benefits and 30 days of yearly vacation A great penthouse office in the center of Berlin, free lunch with the entire team and beers on Friday!

Title: Fullstack Javascript Developer (w/m/d)
Description: Küchenheld Tech disrupts the kitchen industry developing tools to allow employee and customer centric processes.   Who We Are Looking For    A passionate coder, who is curious and always longs for learning something new, A dependable person, who trust us and who we can rely on, A creative mind that always looks for alternative tools and approaches to develop our stack, and A team player, who is looking for a great team to belong to.   Ideally, you have more than two years of experience working in a predominantly JavaScript-driven environment. If you are at the start of your career or switched stacks, we would still love to hear from you. Here are some of the things we look out for:   At least 1 year experience in ReactJS / Node.js Understanding of the RESTful/GraphQL architecture Experience working with relational and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis,...) Mastery of TypeScript and React.js Experience with JavaScript ES5/ES6+, HTML5, CSS3 Familiarity with any server frameworks (ExpressJS/NestJS/SailsJS,...) Familiarity with any UI frameworks (AntD, Bootstrap, MaterialUI, …)   Our current challenges  After starting to operate in 2019, we quickly grew to more than 150 employees and are now the fastest growing kitchen retailer in Europe. All of this growth is enabled and supported by a variety of internal and external tools. To support and accelerate our growth we need to continue to deliver intuitive and robust web-based solutions.    Who We Are    We are a great team of different backgrounds (coding, data science, mathematics, business studies, product design) who enjoy working together and helping each other to become the best we can be. We are dedicated to the team and keep it a safe space where everybody can follow his heart, speak his mind, and thus excel. We help each other if we fail and party together if we shine.   Your tasks  Your tasks will depend on your interests and your qualification. Currently we image your tasks to be:   Collaborate with project managers to scope and refine product ideas Technically review and refine tickets Implement new features across our products Review code from freelancers and junior developers Support users with technical questions    What We Expect From You In An Interview    Depending on your background and experience, develop an opinion about our current challenges on an appropriate level, so we can have a fun and thriving discussion about it.    What You Can Expect In Your Job    You will join a compassionate team, on which you can rely, so you can grow on the challenges we will face together. We offer you the flexibility and the resources you need to be your best and accompany on your journey.   Wer wir sind:  Küchenheld ist das smarte Küchenstudio von heute. Wir durchbrechen die klassische Art des Küchenverkaufs und setzen auf Effizienz, Transparenz und Fairness sowohl für unsere Kunden als auch unsere KollegInnen. Mit modernster Technik und persönlicher Beratung bieten wir unseren Kunden ein einzigartiges Kauferlebnis Ihrer Traumküche. Klingt spannend? Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung inklusive Deines gewünschten Eintrittsdatums an recruitment@kuechenheld.de. Deine Ansprechpartnerin ist Anna aus dem People & Culture Team.

Title: Junior Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/x)
Location: Cologne Bonn Region, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany
Description: 👋🏼 Hello, we are dexter health!   We are an innovative healthtech start-up and want to improve the healthcare system and thus the health of all people. We have taken it upon ourselves to solve the lack of care  and other problems in hospitals and nursing homes by means of technology  , for which we have developed a voice user interface and smart speaker with an interdisciplinary team.   The global pandemic has revealed and highlighted a fractured system - the healthcare system. We have developed a Smart Speaker called dexter  to support healthcare professionals, especially nurses. We believe that nurses deserve to be at the forefront of tech and benefit from it. Do you agree?   Tasks  As a part of our team, you will...   Use and build ML pipelines and algorithms to improve our product Work on Speech-to-Text, Natural Language Processing, Dialogue Management, and Text-to-Speech, .. Track and analyze the status-quo of the literature and implement it Make this company your own and be responsible - Hands-on mentality! Learn about the healthcare sector and our customer's needs to better design our solution Report directly to our Chief Technology Officer Balance speed and quality, with a focus on tangible results.    Requirements    Do you think that the following lines describe you?   A relevant degree, experience as a ML Engineer (preferably 2+ years experience) Willingness to learn new skills and grow with the company You know common programming languages, concepts, and architectures (Python in particular) Experience working with cloud infrastructure and data pipelines Preferably interest in healthcare Attention to detail & excellent communication skills Able to work fully remote    Benefits    Flexible & remote (!) working hours Fair and competitive salary + attractive employee stock option plan Growth opportunities: lead your own team soon, become head of.. 😃? A diverse, interdisciplinary team and the chance to improve people's life and health The once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of something big 🌍? Choose your Equipment/Laptop 💻!   dexter health is fixing a broken healthcare system. We believe that by supporting nurses 👩🏻‍⚕️ with tech, we equip professionals to continue delivering the biggest good we have: health.   We aim to go big and global 🌍. This won't be a tiny company, we plan to become one of the biggest things in Europe. Do you want to be part of it?

Title: AI Backend Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: At paretos, we deliver Data Science to go. This means, that we are eager to make data-informed decision-making available for everybody. As a “remote-first company” with team members all over the world, we strongly believe that this ambitious path is only possible with a great and diverse team.   Paretos is an inclusive company with equal opportunities for everybody. Our culture is guided by the principles of GUNG HO – we believe in the synergy of worthwhile work, being in control of achieving a shared goal, and the importance of cheering each other on. We are proud to have brought together passionate, high-performing, and caring individuals of all genders, cultures, backgrounds, and viewpoints. All together, we make up the heart of the company and push us to the next level on a daily basis.   Tasks  At paretos, you are part of the engineering team to develop and operate the paretos software. As a part of this product-focused team, you will work together with our geeks (mathematicians, physicists and AI specialists) and engineers on the solutions of tomorrow. Your focus is to make the great ideas of our geeks accessible for our current and future customers!    Requirements    2+ years of experience as a backend or full-stack developer, preferably in an AI or mathematic intensive environment Good knowledge in Python (especially Flask), relational Databases and HTTP API Design would be a great fit Knowledge in infrastructure technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and system engineering (12-Factor-App, system quality attributes) would be appreciated You are used to work autonomously and self-determined Motivation to work together in a team of brilliant minds Bonus Point: You follow the SRE (Site Reliability Engineering as Google calls it) practices and mindset    Benefits    These little perks will be waiting for you if you become part of the paretos-family:   We are a remote first company – nevertheless you’re still very welcome to work at the office and enjoy the great view over Heidelberg At the office you can test your barista skills and brew some great coffee to keep you going throughout the workday or enjoy some coffee talks with your fellow paretoneers. (You might even be awarded the next “paretos office barista of the year” at our Christmas party!) Talking about the team: you’ll complement a highly skilled & motivated team of paretoneers ready to hit the road and have fun along the way We regularly enjoy professional and fun events online and IRL with the whole team You’ll get the office equipment you need to show off your full potential. We believe that your capabilities shouldn’t be limited by hardware components Work whenever it fits best for you with flexible working hours Receive a mobility budget to access various kinds of transportation whilst setting off your carbon emissions If you are part of the paretos dog club, feel free to bring your furry friend to the office   We are continuously expanding our benefits as we grow to ensure an environment where our team members feel comfortable and happy to work at.   This is it from our side for now. What about you? Are you ambitious to disrupt the AI and Optimization world with us? Then send us your application!   Note: We encourage you to apply for this role, even if you don’t match all the requirements 100%. As long as you inherit the eagerness to learn, we are happy to be convinced that you are the right fit for us.

Title: Fullstack Developer (f/m/d)
Description: Who We Are    Codepan is a boutique AI Lab building cutting-edge, AI-driven products and solutions.   We believe in augmenting humans with smart algorithms and look for technologies that co-exist, augment and enhance, rather than replace, humans.   Codepan is pioneering in building the AI Operating System of the future to enable organizations to build and scale Machine Learning products. Our mission is to transform the way organizations use data and technologies to harness the true potential AI holds.   We seek exceptional minds, creative thinkers and proactive doers to join us on this fascinating journey. Are you one of them? Come and join us!   We offer you...   a focused, innovative and collaborative environment that leverages diverse perspectives a place to thrive through autonomy, challenging tasks, work on latest technology trends as well as collaboration with industry leaders and experts a unique opportunity to co-create the future of AI in pioneering an AI Operating System a company culture built on integrity, trust, joy, openness and passion a flexible schedule and remote working opportunity an attractive compensation package and various employee benefits fun team events including hackathons a beautiful office in a waterfront repurposed warehouse in Berlin-Kreuzberg    About The Role    We are looking for a pragmatic self-starter to work with a cross-functional team of software- and data engineers who enjoy hands-on involvement in building innovative technology products and solutions.   Tasks  As a part of the team, you will...   work closely with our Product Managers, Data Scientists and Technical Leadership and contribute to product development from the design stage through to delivery collaborate with your team to analyze requirements and customer wishes to bring them to a successful conclusion manage the lifecycle of existing software solutions participate in design, planning and the development of new and additional features using cutting-edge technologies and frameworks in a service-oriented platform    Requirements    In terms of skills and experience, you have...   a University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience a minimum of 3+ years of professional experience working as a Fullstack developer strong experience with Javascript and React strong knowledge of the Web stack proficient in database design and integration of different data sources knowledge of recent infrastructure ecosystems including cloud technology providers, Kubernetes, infrastructure automation, and are able to work independently on such environments proficient written and spoken English language skills   As a plus, you have…   experience with Python interest or prior experience in machine learning, manufacturing and IoT proficient written and spoken German language skills   As personal qualities, you have...   keen curiosity and intellectual agility strong sense of ownership, can-do attitude and creative solution-orientation integrity and altruism readiness to self-reflect and learn from mistakes enthusiasm to work in a diverse team and an agile environment excellent communication skills   Curious? Come join us! Jessica Fraser is looking forward to receiving your application or answering your questions.

Title: Intelligence Data Engineer (d/f/m)
Description: Job Description    We are looking for a brilliant and dynamic Data Engineer (d/f/m)  to join our Image & Media Mining Analytics and Data Management team in Friedrichshafen. He/ she will be integrated in a group gathering data scientists, artificial intelligence experts and software development engineers who daily bridge the gap between R&T and R&D in the domain of Intelligence information systems for external customers as well as internal Airbus products.   Your activities will be contributing to the development of our Massive Intelligence platform: this system integrates and synchronizes multi-source processing, exploitation and dissemination of all collective assets and own Intelligence data bases of a customer. With functions including the processing, exploitation and fusion of huge volumes of heterogeneous data, supported by automated processing and smart dissemination, it directly supports decision makers at all levels of command.    Missions    The Intelligence Data Engineer (d/f/m) will be part of a SAFe Train and belong to an agile team building common assets for our solutions for further delivery to our program lines and/ or proof of concept.    His/ Her Main Missions Will Encompass     Contribution to the development of the backend / services platform Design and development of data workflows, data processing chains in a big data/ massive analysis context Integration at component level in cloud environments (internally developed components as well as partners’) Deployment of the backend platform according to customer needs and selected infrastructure Active participation to engineering reviews and SCRUM ceremonies and support to risk and opportunities analysis Permanently track new technology streams in the field of big data engineering and feed the team with this knowledge     Key Skills And Competencies    The Intelligence Data Engineer (d/f/m) will master key backend development as well as DEVOPS technologies in a big data context (data lake, data engineering as well as need to know, of utmost importance for our defense and security customers:    Java (with fastAPI, SpringBoot, Swagger) Docker (and possibly Kubernetes, Helm, Ansible, Rook Ceph) Bash, JSON, Curl Git MongoDB, PostgreSQL Linux and Windows platforms Team development experience in an Agile environment     Moreover You Will Be Working With     Intelligence experts: we are looking for candidates with basic knowledge on Intelligence information systems in order to tackle IMINT, HUMINT, COMINT and SIGINT challenges Analytics experts: at least awareness skills on artificial intelligence frameworks and mindsets matter to us (deep learning and Tensorflow for example)    We are looking for a team worker, flexible and adaptable to new challenges.Our team is located on several sites and several countries: daily communication will be done in English.   Please apply for this vacancy at our careers site (www.airbus.com)   This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.    Company    Airbus Defence and Space GmbH    Contract Type    Permanent Contract / CDI / Unbefristet / Contrato indefinido    Experience Level    Entry Level / Débutant / Anfänger / Recién titulado    Job Family    Software Engineering   By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.   Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.   Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.   At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Software Engineer, 3D graphics (m/f/x)
Description: You are a passionate Software Engineer, experienced with modern object-oriented design and the use of design patterns?  Do you enjoy working in an international, agile and dynamic environment?  Job Purpose  As part of our growth strategy, we have 3 newly created full-time vacancies as Software Engineers (Associate to Senior) with an immediate starting date, available at our Software Hubs in Madrid, Spain or Berlin, Germany. In this role you will assist in developing, maintaining, and deploying ClearCorrect's custom applications as part of a growing team of specialists, working for a world market leader in dental technology.   Main Responsibilities   Gathering requirements and translating them into designs, documentation, and ultimately working Software that delivers business value Developing and maintaining automated tests Developing stable, flexible, scalable, and maintainable product architectures, software, and infrastructure Planning and executing work in an incremental and iterative software development process Using, developing, and debugging on Linux Performing peer code reviews Identifying and researching new technologies and software development improvements Capturing and communicating best practices and recommending new technology solutions Mentoring other software engineer team members and supervising engineers building products Translating prototype algorithms into production code Maintaining a strategic point of view and keeping customer success in mind throughout the project lifecycle Collaborating with peers on software design, work estimation and implementation of new features Contributing ideas to continually improve the team's productivity & code quality   Qualifications   Degree in computer science, mathematics, or similar field. Master’s degree highly preferred for Senior roles 5+ years of experience developing software and web applications Proficiency in java, C++, javascript or typescript Experience in computational algorithms development Good understanding of 3D geometry (vectors, matrices) Ability to design, code, and debug applications in various software languages And to dive into a polyglot codebase and contribute while learning. Experience in Test Driven Development (TDD) Experience with good object-oriented design, design patterns, and domain driven design principles Broad knowledge of data structures and algorithms Excellent problem solving, communication and presentation skills Strong collaborative skills coupled with the ability to question Professional fluency in English   Desirable   Proficiency with ansible or other devops tool Experience in 3D engines and libraries (OpenGL, DirectX, WebGL, Unity) Experience with cloud computing: AWS, GCE, CloudStack, OpenStack or equivalent Experience developing on Unix Experience with SQL, RDBMS, and NoSQL concepts Experience working on large software systems, preferably distributed systems, event driven architectures, and microservice architectures Experience with machine learning Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations   What We Offer   exciting and innovative projects for renowned customers in the medical technology sector short decision-making processes and a friendly, competent team of developers and dental technicians modern office with a familiar working atmosphere no dress code flexible working hours and the possibility for home office individual further training opportunities   All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.   Employment Type:  Full Time   Alternative Locations: Madrid (Spain) or Berlin (Germany)  Travel Percentage:  0 - 10%   Requisition ID:  6061   6061

Title: Software Engineer / Full Stack Developer (m/f/d) PHP
Description: Location Ihringen, Germany   THE HELLA GUTMANN PROMISE  Curiosity is our driving force. We do know and understand the vehicle like no other. Our vast store of knowledge is neither limited to brands and models nor to technology. We are interconnecting this knowledge intelligently so that our customers worldwide are able to use it in combination with practicable products and services.   Our main product range features professional equipment for automotive workshops, car dealerships and automotive testing agencies. With about 500 employees and our head office in Ihringen near Freiburg im Breisgau we belong to the Hella Gutmann Group which is a corporation of the HELLA KGaA Hueck & Co.   Hella Gutmann is the birthplace of a whole host of good ideas that bring that little bit of extra success to vehicle workshops across the globe every single day. Getting this innovative strength on the road requires a strong team – and you can be part of it. Find out more about us and fast-track your career with Hella Gutmann.   DEMONSTRATE YOUR POTENTIAL AND JOIN US TO SHAPE THE FUTURE OF THE DIGITAL WORKSHOP   You will develop and design web applications and micro services for our workshop products You will conduct feasibility studies using the latest technologies and create concepts and architectures for sophisticated web projects You will be part of an interdisciplinary team made up of IT specialists, embedded and web developers as well as data mining specialists You will roll out your work in on-premises systems and cloud environments using container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes You will ensure the quality and functionality of the software components using unit tests and integration tests You will actively contribute to requirements management and will take over the technical management of subprojects   THE REASONS WHY YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT FOR OUR COMPANY   You have several years of work experience in software and web development You integrate your practical experience in the field of software architecture into your everyday work You have experience of working with micro services concepts as well as their distribution and operation in on-premises systems and cloud environments You have outstanding PHP knowledge, ideally in combination with the Symfony Framework You are experienced in working with relational and document-based databases Your command of German and English is excellent and you are happy to work with experts and teams at different locations Your profile is rounded off with a knowledge of requirements management and Node.js.   WHAT WE ARE OFFERING TO MAKE YOUR EVERYDAY WORK EVEN MORE ENJOYABLE   Interesting tasks, innovative products and great colleagues An open and cooperative business culture with direct and friendly communication and cooperation Attractive remuneration in a company subject to a collective agreement, along with holiday pay and a Christmas bonus A safe workplace in a continuously growing company Development measures and further education that is tailored to you personally Modern infrastructure at the workplace A modern company restaurant - subsidized by our company Company pension scheme with subsidy "Fit with HGS": Free fruit and water, running events "Eldercare": care program for relatives The option to charge your electric vehicle for free during working hours An attractive location where the borders of three countries meet with good connection to public transport network Employee discounts and much more   Take the opportunity to reveal your potential within a global, family-run company that offers you the best possible conditions for progressing in your career.   HELLA Gutmann Solutions GmbH  Arkadius Birkner   Am Krebsbach 2   79241 Ihringen   +49 (0) 7668/9900-1995
