Title: Software Developer C# (m/f/d)
Description: Überblick  As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker covers a broad spectrum of advanced solutions in all fields of research and development. All our systems and instruments are designed to improve safety of products, accelerate time-to-market and support industries in successfully enhancing quality of life. We’ve been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years now. Today, worldwide more than 7,200 employees are working on this permanent challenge, at over 70 locations on all continents.   To complement our LC-MS software development team in Bremen (Germany) and Fällanden (Switzerland) , we are looking for a software developer C# (m/f/d). We offer a diversified job in an interdisciplinary project team with flat hierarchies and short decision processes, and a secure, unlimited employment relationship in an international group with flexible working hours and a wide range of benefits.   Aufgaben/Verantwortlichkeiten   As a software developer you contribute to our hyphenation platform, which connects chromatography separation devices to our mass spectrometers and enables the automatic data acquisition from batches of samples using integrated auto samplers. You contribute to the design, implementation, testing and documentation of plug-ins for chromatography systems. You implement new requirements and extend the existing functionality. You coordinate work packages with other teams and external partners and integrate them into our products.   Qualifikationen   You have a degree in computer science, or comparable knowledge and skills accompanying an engineering or natural sciences degree. You have a profound knowledge in .NET C# under Windows with Visual Studio. You are able to understand, maintain and extend an existing source code. You have a basic knowledge in multithreading. You have a basic knowledge in common communication technology, e.g. RS232, USB, LAN. Knowledge of Windows Forms or WPF is a plus. Experience in data acquisition, process control or the operation of analytical instruments is a plus. You like hardware-related work, which includes testing your own software on real instrumentation. You enjoy working in an interdisciplinary team and are a good communicator. You are able to discuss technical matters with colleagues who do not have an IT background. You are fluent in English and German, both written and verbal.

Title: GRADUATE SOFTWARE ENGINEER - Dubai, UAE
Description: Starting salary of 50,000 USD per annum  in a zero-tax environment.   Fast progression for strong performers.   Job location:  Dubai, UAE   About us:  Cobblestone Energy is a proprietary trading firm that specializes in the wholesale electricity market across Europe. Electricity is fundamental to the world's economic activities. We trade enough electricity every day to power a small country, and in doing so, we help to address the mismatch between electricity generation and consumption.    Job Description    At Cobblestone Energy we are on a mission to build the most advanced European electricity trading and analytics platform, with our technology being used by our teams of commercial traders to create significant value. We are looking for enthusiastic and resourceful developers who are passionate about building exceptionally reliable and performance data processing solutions. You want to help the commercial team make data-informed decisions, have a curious mindset, and are motivated to understand our business better. Developing a strong domain knowledge of our industry over time is key to long term success in this role.   If you have excellent programming skills, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for developing and improving applications utilizing cutting edge technologies, then we would like to meet you.    What We Offer In This Role    Competitive remuneration, with fast progression for strong performers. A challenging but exciting, open, and fun work environment. An opportunity to work with remarkably talented colleagues. Vast growth potential in every aspect. 15% target bonus with further upside. Employee share scheme participation International relocation support Opportunity to be embedded within a commercial team for those with strong commercial interest     Responsibilities    Write software applications and programs for backend/frontend purposes. Analyse programs and apps to improve their features and functionalities. Test & debug programs and fix any reported bugs. Collaborate with the tech team to improve the performance, efficiency, and scalability of our tools.     Requirements    BS/BE in Computer Science/Computer Engineering/Electrical & Computer Eng. Programming skills in Python language. Knowledge of at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask ...) is a plus. Programming skills in Java is a plus. Familiarity & Knowledge in front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS, JQuery, JS, etc. Strong knowledge of REST APIs and webservices. Strong knowledge of Relational Databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server ...) and SQL language. Knowledge of NoSQL databases is a plus. Knowledge of AWS is a plus / Knowledge of data visualization tools, mainly Tableau, is a plus. Ability to work in a team environment. Strong problem-solving skills and analytical skills. Resilience and a determination to succeed. Independent thinkers with growth mindset. Must be passionate, self-motivated, and able to learn quickly. Strong sense of integrity. Personal values that match our company values.

Title: Frontend-Entwickler (gn)
Description: Beschreibung der Stelle: Die Abteilung "Predictive Modeling and Decision Support" des Innovationszentrums der IABG setzt sich aus Experten in den Bereichen Operations Research, Kognitionswissenschaft, Machine Learning und Software-Engineering zusammen. Wir entwickeln innovative Lösungen und Dienstleistungen in neuen Geschäftsfeldern der IABG. Dabei unterstützen und beraten wir auch die operativen Bereiche der IABG methodisch und technologisch. Darüber hinaus sind wir in Forschungsprojekten aktiv und führen Projekte im Kundenauftrag durch, in denen wir mit aktuellen Data Science Methoden Entscheidungsprozesse unterstützen. Unsere derzeitigen Projekte umfassen Themen wie Cyber Security, Krisenfrüherkennung und Social Media Monitoring, jeweils mit eigenen Designvorgaben für interaktive Demonstratoren und Webanwendungen.   Als Frontend-Entwickler sind Sie für die Konzeption und Implementierung von benutzerfreundlichen Webanwendungen und Dashboards für unsere Projekte verantwortlich. Wir brauchen Ihre kreative Vision und UX/UI-Kenntnisse, um unseren Kunden die bestmöglichen Datenvisualisierungen unter Verwendung modernster Webtechnologien zu liefern. Ihre Ideen und UI/UX-Kenntnisse werden sowohl bei der Gestaltung unserer internen, als auch unserer öffentlich verfügbaren Anwendungen entscheidend sein.   Sie arbeiten Seite an Seite mit unseren Data Scientists und Softwareentwicklern in einem offenen und modernen Arbeitsumfeld mit vielseitigen und herausfordernden Fragestellungen zu wichtigen Schlüsselthemen und Technologien der Zukunft. Als Teil eines hochmotivierten, agilen Teams und mit einem hohen Maß an Eigenverantwortung gestalten Sie außerdem die Entwicklung unserer Abteilung aktiv mit.    Tätigkeit:    Sie entwickeln, implementieren und pflegen projektspezifische Dashboards und Webanwendungen Sie optimieren Benutzeroberflächen Sie übernehmen die Verantwortung für die technische Performance und die laufende Pflege unserer Build-, Test- und Deployment-Pipelines Sie erstellen und pflegen die entsprechende Projektdokumentation Sie beteiligen sich an der Entwicklung und kontinuierlichen Verbesserung unserer Toolbox    Voraussetzungen:    Sie sind versiert in Web-basierter Front-End Entwicklung (bspw. HTML, JS / TypeScript, CSS / Responsive Design) Sie haben Erfahrung mit einigen der bekannten SPA-Frameworks (z.B. Angular, React, Vuejs, Blazor) und Templating Engines (z.B. jinja2, razor) Erfahrung im Umgang mit Git, Docker und CI/CD Pipelines ist von Vorteil Erfahrung mit gängigen Visualisierungsframeworks (z.B. plotly, d3, vis.js, apex) ist von Vorteil Erfahrung mit agilen Vorgehensmodellen oder Arbeiten in einem agilen, interdisziplinären Team ist von Vorteil Fullstack Kenntnisse (bspw. REST, GraphQL, Nutzung von Relationalen/NoSQL-Datenbanken, ORM-Frameworks) ist von Vorteil Sie haben sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse Sie stecken voller Ideen und sind bereit, neue Technologien auszuprobieren    Ziele:   In einem spannenden Umfeld werden Sie komplexe Fragestellungen zusammen mit einem innovativen Team aufgreifen, Lösungen konzipieren und softwaretechnisch umsetzen.

Title: Projektingenieur (w/m/d)
Description: Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams im Bereich Corporate Research & Technology am Standort Tuttlingen suchen wir Sie als     Projektingenieur (w/m/d)     Ihre Aufgabe:   Konzeption und Erstellung anwendungsorientierter Demonstratoren im Anwendungsfeld der computerassistierten Endoskopie, Surgical Data Science, Kognitive Chirurgie, Computer Vision und Machine Learning Schnittstelle zum Produktmanagement, Produktentwicklung und Forschungspartnern Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen und Umsetzung von Anwenderanforderungen bzgl. Funktionalität und Dokumentation der Entwicklungsergebnisse     Ihr Profil:   Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Elektrotechnik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung Erfahrungen im Bereich der Softwareentwicklung wünschenswert Kenntnisse im Bereich der medizinischen Informatik (IT Standards, Daten- und Bildverarbeitung, grundlegende anatomische Kenntnisse) wünschenswert Bereitschaft komplexe Aufgabenstellungen sowohl eigenständig als auch im Team erfolgreich zu bearbeiten Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie Deutschkenntnisse von Vorteil     Ihre Bewerbung:  Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns, Sie kennenzulernen. Bitte bewerben Sie sich mit Ihren vollständigen Unterlagen (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf und Zeugnisse) online über unser Karriereportal. Bei Fragen steht Ihnen Frau Julia Merkle gerne per E-Mail zur Verfügung unter Julia.Merkle[AT]karlstorz.com.    Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!

Title: Fullstack Javascript Developer (w/m/d)
Description: Küchenheld Tech disrupts the kitchen industry developing tools to allow employee and customer centric processes.   Who We Are Looking For    A passionate coder, who is curious and always longs for learning something new, A dependable person, who trust us and who we can rely on, A creative mind that always looks for alternative tools and approaches to develop our stack, and A team player, who is looking for a great team to belong to.   Ideally, you have more than two years of experience working in a predominantly JavaScript-driven environment. If you are at the start of your career or switched stacks, we would still love to hear from you. Here are some of the things we look out for:   At least 1 year experience in ReactJS / Node.js Understanding of the RESTful/GraphQL architecture Experience working with relational and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis,...) Mastery of TypeScript and React.js Experience with JavaScript ES5/ES6+, HTML5, CSS3 Familiarity with any server frameworks (ExpressJS/NestJS/SailsJS,...) Familiarity with any UI frameworks (AntD, Bootstrap, MaterialUI, …)   Our current challenges  After starting to operate in 2019, we quickly grew to more than 150 employees and are now the fastest growing kitchen retailer in Europe. All of this growth is enabled and supported by a variety of internal and external tools. To support and accelerate our growth we need to continue to deliver intuitive and robust web-based solutions.    Who We Are    We are a great team of different backgrounds (coding, data science, mathematics, business studies, product design) who enjoy working together and helping each other to become the best we can be. We are dedicated to the team and keep it a safe space where everybody can follow his heart, speak his mind, and thus excel. We help each other if we fail and party together if we shine.   Your tasks  Your tasks will depend on your interests and your qualification. Currently we image your tasks to be:   Collaborate with project managers to scope and refine product ideas Technically review and refine tickets Implement new features across our products Review code from freelancers and junior developers Support users with technical questions    What We Expect From You In An Interview    Depending on your background and experience, develop an opinion about our current challenges on an appropriate level, so we can have a fun and thriving discussion about it.    What You Can Expect In Your Job    You will join a compassionate team, on which you can rely, so you can grow on the challenges we will face together. We offer you the flexibility and the resources you need to be your best and accompany on your journey.   Wer wir sind:  Küchenheld ist das smarte Küchenstudio von heute. Wir durchbrechen die klassische Art des Küchenverkaufs und setzen auf Effizienz, Transparenz und Fairness sowohl für unsere Kunden als auch unsere KollegInnen. Mit modernster Technik und persönlicher Beratung bieten wir unseren Kunden ein einzigartiges Kauferlebnis Ihrer Traumküche. Klingt spannend? Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung inklusive Deines gewünschten Eintrittsdatums an recruitment@kuechenheld.de. Deine Ansprechpartnerin ist Anna aus dem People & Culture Team.

Title: Cloud Engineer
Description: South Pole is an energetic, global company offering comprehensive sustainability solutions and services. With offices spanning all continents across the globe, we strive to create a sustainable society and economy that positively impacts our climate, ecosystems and developing communities. With our solutions, we inspire and enable our customers to create value from sustainability-related activities.   Our Corporate Functions team is the “enablement engine” of South Pole. Behind the scenes, we provide the business with world-class solutions and best practices that sustain business growth and success. We cover key areas such as Finance, HR, Office Management, Legal, IT, Operations, etc. If you are a smart, ambitious and dynamic professional with a strong passion to make a real difference in the fight against climate change, the below position may be right for you!   Job summary:  The purpose of this role is primarily to manage and develop our Google Cloud Data Platform and to support other cloud initiatives across South Pole. As such the role is part of the Data and Insights team within the Information Technology in Corporate Services and reports directly to the Global Head of Data and Insight with significant collaboration with our Infrastructure and DevOps team. You will be responsible for the build, delivery and maintenance of our cloud data infrastructure on Google Cloud. You will be part of our production team which includes data engineers, visualisation experts, data analysts, business analysts and data scientists with PM support.   You will ensure our cloud is engineered and set up to build scalable and automated analytics solutions in an agile environment on the cloud. You have experience building cloud infrastructure to support product development and platform production and will probably be Google Cloud Certified. You come from a highly technical background and are enthusiastic about the potential of cloud, data products and the opportunity to be a significant part of a company that delivers real impact. You will be comfortable supporting multiple initiatives at once. Please note that this is a new initiative at South Pole and therefore will suit a candidate who enjoys a start-up environment.   This exciting opportunity will suit an individual who has significant previous experience in building cloud platforms to support data and analytics products. You are detail-oriented and happy to get stuck in and support the organisation as we grow and develop. You are enthused by the opportunity to be part of a rapidly expanding global company (with all the solution changes that accompany such growth) in the sustainability sector.   Main tasks & responsibilities:   Design and implement the cloud infrastructure to support analytics product build Implement our cloud data platform Architect a cloud solution to support client-facing analytics/data products Analyse and address risk factors in deliverables and propose risk mitigation Work as an integral part of the production team Understand business needs and functions to answer key business questions Manage, maintain & improve the company’s cloud services Work with our Legal team to implement the correct cloud security and data compliance Advice and support on setting up APIs    Requirements:  Essential   Degree educated Significant experience in architecting and building cloud infrastructure to support analytics productions at scale inc. data platforms Google Cloud Certified Knowledge of Kubernetes or other Container solutions Proven experience in architecting, implementing and maintaining cloud solutions in GCP using BigQuery Experience with business requirements gathering and agile ways of working Previous experience working with global teams    Desirable   Have experience working with Tableau, Salesforce and Python Data Analytics experience and knowledge of machine learning, forecasting and statistical techniques Knowledge of open standards, such as XML (Extensible Markup Language), SOAP (Simple Object Access Protocol), WSDL (Web Services Description Language) and UDDI (Universal Description, Discovery and Integration), and an understanding and practical experience of how APIs are engineered.    What we offer:  At South Pole, we care about our employees as much as we care about the planet. South Pole is not just an employer, we are a Team. South Pole does not just offer people a job, we offer you a career. By joining our team, you will find strong purpose and deep meaning in everything you do. You will have the chance to make a real difference for our clients and for the planet, working alongside a passionate team of like-minded colleagues, while building your knowledge/skills and developing your career in a fun, dynamic, international and fast-growing organisation.   We’re a planet of 7.5 billion unique and different people. We all have a contribution to make and South Pole is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, marital status or disability. Our recruitment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

Title: Bioinformatics Software Developer (d/f/m)
Description: Computomics brings sustainable economic success to our clients by enabling them to produce stable, added-value crops, thus contributing to resource-efficient agriculture that can feed the   planet.   Tasks  Computomics is looking for a bioinformatics software developer.    Requirements    Advanced university degree in bioinformatics, software development, programming, or a similar discipline Experience with Linux shell (bash, zsh, fish, screen etc.) commands and scripting Experience with Java/Javascript/Vue UI and MongoDB Workflow languages, nextflow preferred, otherwise snakemake, WDL (workflow definition language), CWL (common workflow language), or similar Experience with containerized workflows with Docker Experience with Python and R programming Experience with Python libraries (pandas, numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, or similar) Software development in a team using version control (i.e.. git), CI/CD testing and issue tracking Knowledge of genetics are desirable Knowledge in plant breeding or agricultural science are advantageous Knowledge of statistics, machine learning and data visualization are advantageous Fluent in English Strong problem solving skills Proactive team player Capable of working autonomously    Benefits    Flexible work hours Full-time position with unlimited contract Working in an innovative, dynamic and international company based in Tübingen, Germany Healthy working environment with fresh fruit, coffee, tea and water free of charge Ergonomic office furniture and working equipment Continuous training, education and in-house knowledge transfer   We are a growing company and we want you to grow with us.   Working for Computomics is a great way for you to become part of a company where you will make a difference.   If you are passionate and up for a highly interesting challenge, please send us your application.

Title: Backend Developer (Python)
Description: The time is now to start your next career step at Process&, one of the most innovative global data science and tech companies.  At Processand, we are building a market  leading product  that defines the new category of Data Intelligence Platforms  (DIP).   We give data-driven & AI technologies  context and let them speak in a wholly new way based on our innovative intelligence graph technology,  which is powered by our in-house developed Real-Time  Parsing Engine  . The Processand Data Intelligence Platform can be placed right on top of any existing IT landscape to automatically extract, manage, and distribute critical data knowhow to data workers who need it the most. In addition, our Intelligence Graph is deeply integrated with a set of instruments and applications that help companies drastically increase efficiency in every facet of data engineering, from data transformation and documentation, to governance, and automations.   Our technology helps bring immediate value  to the biggest enterprises around the globe, and makes a direct impact  on how people work day-to-day. For Global 2000 companies, transforming to an intelligent enterprise has become a key strategic priority. Processand has many global customers including BMW, Swisscom, DB, Sabic, Eon, R+V, or Rational. All of them rely on Processand knowhow and technology to unlock their full analytics capacity and drive change to business processes.   Processand has grown massively in 4 years with over 200% in the past year. We are continuously expanding, especially in Europe, US and Asia, to be able to serve local markets. We have offices in Prague (Czech Republic), Austin (Texas), and Taipei (Taiwan) as Centers of Excellence for international tech talent. Our current headquarters are in Munich, Germany.   At each and every Processand office, we get things done quickly  by cultivating an open-minded culture with creative, collaborative, autonomous teams  in which the best ideas win. As part of Product & Engineering you will have the opportunity to grow  with a steep learning curve,  being equipped with responsibility  from day 1.   At Processand, we believe that every company can unlock their full data intelligence - and for that we need you as a Backend Engineer  .   Be ready to participate & join a multicultural family at Process&!  You are passionate about data analytics & developing web applications? Read on!  Tasks  As BE Engineer at Processand, you are responsible for optimizing & implementing existing product features  & winning our users through your brilliant applications. You will work with Python, SQL and various micro-services  creating innovative and intelligent data solutions. You will further work on our in-house developed components library that is being used by multiple teams & applications.   You will be working in a cross-functional team closely with our UX designer, Product Manager and Frontend Engineers. You will also get a chance to improve and share your skills among our backend guild.    Requirements    have 2+ years of experience in building Python applications professionally write clear, understandable and testable code with continuous focus on maintainability have strong algorithmic and problem-solving skills with a good understanding of complex data structures (optionally) have experience with graph theory and machine learning libraries such as Pytorch, Tensorflow or Scikit-learn show a high level of motivation and commitment have excellent English skills (German optional)    Benefits    Benefits (at) Process&:   A highly ambitious and skilled team of international talents Chance to become one of the first employees in a fast-growing venture-backed tech startup Opportunities to actively shape and accelerate your professional and personal development Very fast decision-making processes and flat hierarchies cutting-edge tech stack: Docker, Node.js, React+Redux, Redis, GraphQL, Cypress, Kafka, AWS/GCP/Azure and many more training from experts in the field of data science and intelligence applications Flexible working hours, work from home and a top-equipped workplace in the middle of Munich An attractive compensation package and multiple career development paths fresh fruit, drinks, water, and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) A multicultural, open-minded team with start-up spirit, company retreats & events   Processand is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.   Apply today! We are happy to receive your CV & application documents and learn more about you.

Title: Software Engineer – Backend
Description: Thoughtfish develops games and gamified apps for mobile devices. We strive to create innovative products and technologies with areas of applicability beyond the scope of gaming. We are looking for professionals to strengthen our friendly, highly-motivated team.   Tasks   Research and present data solutions for customer specific problems Conduct unit tests and create prototypes for these research results Implement database-related features, including data modeling and query tuning Identify and overcome technical and developmental risks/obstacles Responsible for low-level profiling of performance and memory issues Optimization of existing code in regards to performance and memory leaks Monitor database and server performance – troubleshoot, tune, refactor and adjust capacity as needed    Requirements    At least 2 years of professional experience with the C/C++ programming language At least 1 year of professional experience working with database implementation of SQL databases Multi-threaded programming and parallel processing experience Ability to clearly document written code and features, knowledge of UML diagrams is a plus Solution driven mindset A passion for videogames Good communication and team skills   Bonus Points for:   Deep understanding of PC networking and data communication behavior Knowledge of Unity3D and C# Experience with MySQL or similar databases Experience with iOS/Android native development Experience with HTML, CSS, Java Script and PHP (AJAX) Experience in Linux system administration    Benefits    Transparent salary with regular, fixed increases A positive feedback culture featuring “Thank yous”, motivation, and room for mistakes Cool and unique projects We appreciate working parents and the need for a proper work-life balance   Please send your application with a cover letter, curriculum vitae, references and/or certifications.

Title: (Junior) Data Scientist (w/m/d) bei KPMG
Description: Als (Junior) Data Scientist (w/m/d) analysierst und bewertest Du große Datenmengen und hilfst unseren Kunden und Kundinnen dadurch die besten Entscheidungen für ihr Unternehmen zu treffen. Ob im Bereich Tax, Audit, Consulting, Deal Advisory oder Finance - mit Dir werden Daten zu Informationen.    Du willst Big Data in Smart Data verwandeln? Dann kannst Du Dich hier einbringen:   Du schaffst aus großen strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenbeständen unterschiedlicher Datenquellen eine Datenbasis, analysierst und interpretierst diese. Mithilfe von Data Mining, Data Science und Machine Learning-Methoden erkennst Du Muster und erstellst daraus Prognosen für die Zukunft. Die Betreuung von nationalen und internationalen Kund:innen in Projekten an der Schnittstelle zwischen Fachbereich und IT fällt ebenfalls in Deinen Aufgabenbereich. Du arbeitest an der Entwicklung neuer Analysemethoden, um die Datenbasis optimal zu prüfen und zu interpretieren. Du konzipierst, erstellst und modellierst Datenbankanwendungen.     Dein Profil   Um bei uns als (Junior) Data Scientist (w/m/d) an Bord zu kommen, hast Du Dein Bachelor- oder Masterstudium mit sehr guten Noten abgeschlossen – vorzugsweise in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Statistik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Ingenieurwesen, Wirtschaftsmathematik, Mathematik oder Physik. Deine Expertise konntest Du bereits praktisch im Beratungsumfeld oder anderweitig in der IT unter Beweis stellen. Du besitzt erste Kenntnisse in funktionalen/objektorientierten Programmiersprachen, wie C/C++, Python, R, Java oder JavaScript sowie Kenntnisse in Cloud-Technologien, Business Intelligence-Tools wie Tableau, PowerBI, SAS, oder Umfeld von SAP oder SQL-Datenbanken. Du punktest mit einem soliden Methodenwissen in Statistik, Machine Learning und IT-Infrastrukturen, das es Dir ermöglicht, neuen Entwicklungen zu folgen und innovative Lösungen zu entwickeln. Deutsch und Englisch beherrschst Du auf C1-Niveau. Daneben bringst Du Reisebereitschaft mit, um unsere Kund:innen auch vor Ort beraten zu können.     Deine Benefits   Willkommen im Team Damit Du von Beginn an voll bei uns durchstarten kannst, begleiten wir Dich mit strukturierten Onboarding-Maßnahmen während der gesamten Orientierungsphase. Zudem fördert Deine Führungskraft gezielt Deine fachliche und persönliche Integration ins Team. Vielfältige Karriereperspektiven Wir legen Wert auf die individuelle Entwicklung Deiner fachlichen und persönlichen Stärken: Deine eigenen Ambitionen reflektieren wir in strukturierten Entwicklungsgesprächen. Systematische und regelmäßige Feedback-Gespräche unterstützen Dich beim Erreichen dieser Ziele. Als Teil des weltweiten KPMG-Netzwerks bieten wir Dir interessante Karrieremöglichkeiten im In- und Ausland und somit wertvolle Einblicke in die Vielfalt unserer Tätigkeitsbereiche. Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Privatleben Wir sind überzeugt, dass es vor allem Vielfalt und Flexibilität braucht, um Innovationen zu fördern und langfristige Erfolge zu sichern. Nur so können wir die besten Ideen entwickeln und wirklich innovative Lösungen finden. Mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, Homeoffice-Option, Zeitkonten und Auszeiten schaffen wir Räume, um Privat- und Berufsleben miteinander zu vereinbaren. Darüber hinaus unterstützen wir Dich monatlich mit bis zu vier Stunden Freistellung für Dein soziales Engagement. Fort- & Weiterbildung Durch regelmäßige Trainings, Workshops und Weiterbildungen entwickelst Du Dich stetig weiter. Zudem fördern wir Berufsexamina sowie berufsbegleitende Master-Studiengänge. Mit unseren Rotationsprogrammen ermöglichen wir Deinen fachübergreifenden Einsatz. Diese Einblicke in die vielfältigen Aufgabenfelder bei KPMG erweitern Deinen Horizont und fördern Synergien in der Zusammenarbeit. Die abgebildeten Leistungen können je nach Position und Standort leicht variieren.    Bei KPMG arbeiten wir an einer bedeutsamen Schnittstelle von Wirtschaft, Öffentlichkeit und Gesellschaft. Deshalb suchen wir Menschen, die mit uns gemeinsam die Zukunft angehen und lebenslang lernen. Informiere Dich jetzt über Deine Einstiegs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten und die Themen, die uns antreiben.  Werde Teil eines unserer Teams, die gemeinsam das angehen, was die Wirtschaftswelt bewegt. Wir freuen uns auf Deine Online-Bewerbung.

Title: Software Engineer at Wybe
Description: Wybe is looking for a Software Engineer – based in Freiburg and surrounding area – to help build the first social network that connects people in the real world, bridging the gap between online and offline world, and helping millions of users to shre what really matters: happiness. We're looking for makers with wide-ranging technical knowledge who thrive in leadership roles, but are not afraid to venture into the unknown and build features that defy and shape social norms.   The best candidates will have experience developing cross-platform mobile applications with Dart and Flutter, be proficient with Firebase and Firestore, and have successfully deployed and maintained apps on both iOS and Android.   Wybe's mission is to digitalize social life all around the world. As part of the team, you will work, do business, and have fun in technical hotspots everywhere, including, but not limited to, San Francisco, London, and Berlin.   Tasks   Build and maintain mobile application features, working with a Flutter frontend and Firebase backend Work with user interface designs to build rich, intuitive mobile user experiences Quickly test and iterate existing product features with the help of user insights Take ownership of features at a product level, and actively shape the direction of the company Lead future technical hires by building agile work flows, ensuring efficiency and accountability across the company    Requirements    Significant experience with Dart and Flutter Significant experience with Firebase Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to influence and lead cross-functional teams Comfortable working in a fast paced start-up environment Bonus: Experience wir ARCore Bonus: Experience with TensorFlow or other machine learning frameworks Bonus: An appreciation for behavioral psychology and social dynamics    Benefits    Competitive salary and meaningful equity: Seeing millions of people interacting with your technology every day, can be the most rewarding work you will ever do. Free travel: Full compensation of flights, food, and accommodation. Free selection of meals, drinks and snacks: No predetermined choices – choose whatever helps you feel and perform best. Free gym membership and access to meditation classes: Choose where and how you want to unwind, stay fit, and relax. Parties, sports, movies, and more: What other people call leisure, you will call work. Take part in our mission to connect people, as we meet users at house parties, basketball matches, movie marathons, study sessions, and more.   If you are smart, driven, and dedicated to impact millions, we look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Full Stack Web Developer
Description: We are looking for a Software Engineer to develop internal and customer-facing applications that demonstrate how developers can leverage Vonage APIs and SDKs to develop innovative media-rich experiences in their applications. You will work with the Vonage Product Management team to map business requirements to technical requirements, design solutions, and develop software solutions. Your success will come from mastering the Vonage platform   APIs and using that knowledge to provide solutions to our customer’s hardest problems.    About The Team    Center of excellence for client-side WebRTC and media processing features. We develop and maintain the Vonage WebRTC libraries and provide client-side media processing innovation for products and services across several different Vonage business units. We collaborate across an array of Product and Engineering teams to deliver innovative audio and video processing features to a wide variety of Vonage customers.   What will you do?   Build the full stack for applications that demonstrate the innovative features built into the Vonage WebRTC libraries. Leverage Machine Learning technologies to demonstrate how advanced media processing technology can be used to deliver rich user experiences for our customers. Collaborate with engineers who are developing 3D rendering technologies to demonstrate how the Vonage WebRTC libraries combined with Vonage client media SDKs can be used to deliver immersive application experiences. Collaborate with fellow engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders. Become accomplished with data analysis tools so that you can visualize application performance and automate problem solving. Engage in all aspects of the software development life-cycle, including research-oriented exploratory programming, design, implementation, testing, debugging, and data-driven impact analysis.    Must Have    Strong front end and back end software development skills with 4 or more years of experience. Demonstrated experience developing Node.js applications. Knowledge of computer science fundamentals including algorithms, data structures, web development frameworks, and user interface design along with a BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field. A working knowledge of CI/CD technologies to facilitate automated testing and application deployment . Ability to independently plan and manage your work and communicate with members of a geographically distributed team. Experience developing with UI frameworks such as React, Vue.js, or similar.    Nice To Have    Experience developing streaming media applications OpenGL/WebGL WebXR/ARKit/ARCore Webassmbly

Title: Solution Engineer - Entry level
Description: SailPoint is currently in a hyper-growth phase. As a result, we are looking for Solution Engineers to join our team. Everything at SailPoint is driven by our four key values “Innovation”, “Integrity”, “Impact” and “Individuals” (https://www.sailpoint.com/company/).    What your role includes:  For successful applicants, we will work together to develop a tailored on-boarding plan, highlighting your experience and focusing on development in other areas of the role. This may include product training, assigning a buddy or coach, research of the identity market and partner integrations, shadowing other members of the SE team, while practicing messaging and demonstrations.    As a part of the sales organisation your responsibilities will include:   Actively participate in the sales process and work closely with the direct and channel sales teams Discover and understand customer requirements and align our solutions to those requirements Present SailPoint business functions, value and competitive differences   Provide product demonstrations to prospective customers Answering technical questions, for example responding to RFPs and pre-sales queries. Participate in onsite and remote Proof of Concept evaluations    You’ll also have time to develop your skills, and attend internal training sessions, along with supporting the wider SE team with any questions or advice.    We are looking for confident, motivated individuals to join our EMEA Solutions Engineering team in EMEA. Existing SaaS pre-sales experience is very advantageous, as is any background in selling or running an Identity platform.   You have a growth mindset and welcome the ability to continually learn and develop skills across an expanding product portfolio. You have a positive attitude and enjoy working as part of a team. First customer and/or consulting experience.    .. and more technical ..   1+ years professional (or graduate) experience in working in the Security space OR Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Bachelor- or higher school required Excellent written and verbal communications skills, including fluent German (a MUST) and English You are comfortable presenting professionally to a wide audience – including technical demonstrations. Certifications in security, cloud or AI/ML topics would be an advantage    The lists above are neither exclusive nor exhaustive. At SailPoint, we value the contribution of each of our team members - as a result if you have alternative skills or only limited experience in some areas, please don’t be discouraged.    Ready to apply?  Please follow the link in this job advert to apply or reach out to the person who posted the job listing for more details.    Still not sure?!  Have a look into our awards.  Our technology, leadership and culture set us apart. As a workplace and a company: https://www.sailpoint.com/company/accolades/        SailPoint is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome everyone to our team. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Title: Development Engineer (d/m/f) Software and Data Management
Description: Job description:   The area of electro-optical testing of LED and LASER semiconductor wafers (4, 6 and 8 inches) requires the use of various special software. This includes a test sequence software for controlling the measurement technology (current/voltage sources, special measurement cards and microcontrollers, spectrometers, detectors, new special measurements, etc.), software for controlling of the test equipment, and various software for production control.     Further development and realignment of the software and its IT architecture in the area of wafer probing according to the strategic requirements for measurement accuracy and measurement speed Independent programming of solutions, participation in project teams Quality control of the software throughout the development phase according to the respective project requirements Creation of preliminary process tests, test concepts and automated unit tests Accompanying the go-live of the completed software systems/projects worldwide Responsibility for handing over a robust, high-quality and cost-effective measurement process to the production facilities in Regensburg and Malaysia Coordination of the test sequence generation. Monitoring and support of the process until the readiness for production. Support in the administration and further development regarding the test sequence process flow (Support of) definition, testing and release of test sequence database replacement Optimization of the data management (post-evaluation, data mergen, data flow). Evaluation of process improvements and documentation  Profile description:    Successfully completed university studies in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a comparable technical/natural scientific degree Several years of professional experience in the field of Software development and data science Experience in the electro-optical characterization of LED-Wafer Experience in different programming languages (C, C#, Pascal,..) and in design of software architecture Communicative and team-oriented personality Self-motivated and responsible way of working Excellent German and English language skills High flexibility and willingness to travel - also for extended periods of time (ca. 10%)  We offer:    30 days vacation entitlement Attractive salary and our company pension scheme Christmas- and vacation bonus Flexible working hours Flexible home office arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance  Emine Canipek  EMINE.CANIPEK@AMS-OSRAM.COM  +49 (941) 850 1966

Title: Werkstudent (w/m/d) RPA-Developer
Description: Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied  Siemens Mobility  ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere 39.600 Mitarbeiter sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.   Dein neues Aufgabenfeld – herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert   Du unterstützt uns bei der Entwicklung von Software Robotern (RPA) mit UiPath zur Automatisierung von Geschäftsabläufen im internationalen Umfeld. Darüber hinaus hilfst Du uns bei der Automatisierung unserer eigenen Abläufe mit MS PowerAutomate, Scripten und kleineren Programmiertätigkeiten. Du erstellst Anwender- und Entwicklerdokumentationen und unterstützt uns bei der Aufbereitung von Präsentationen. Zudem arbeitest Du in unseren Projekten zum Ausrollen bestehender und neuer RPA Lösungen innerhalb der gesamten Siemens Mobility mit.   Deine Qualifikationen – fundiert und adäquat   Du bist eingeschriebener Student (FH, Universität) mit Schwerpunkt Informationstechnik, Data-Science, Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder vergleichbar und stehst uns für ca. 16-20 h/Woche zur Verfügung. Du verfügst über sehr gute Kenntnisse in mindestens einer Programmiersprache (wie C#, .NET oder Java) und aktuellen Webtechnologien. Du besitzt gute IT-Kenntnisse im Umfeld von MS Office Produkten und kennst idealerweise Robotic Process Automation mit UiPath. Kenntnisse im Bereich von ERP-Systemen, Phasen der Softwareentwicklung und der Entwicklung von Fachkonzeptionen sind von Vorteil. Deine hervorragenden Deutsch- und sehr guten Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab.   So trittst Du mit uns in Kontakt – einfach und direkt  www.siemens.de/mobility  wenn Du vor deiner Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchtest.   +49 (9131) 17 52430  wenn Du erste Fragen gern persönlich mit unserem Recruiting Team klären möchtest. Ansprechpartner für diese Stellenausschreibung ist Frau Julia Greff.   www.siemens.de/karriere  wenn Du mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchtest.   Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.   Organization:  Siemens Mobility   Company:  Siemens Mobility GmbH   Experience Level:  Student (Not Yet Graduated)   Job Type:  Part-time

Title: Frontend Developer
Description: Everything we do is about helping organizations master their processes with data and analytics.  We have a simple vision: Deliver the future. Join our team and strive for excellence with us!  Processand is a german startup in an exciting growth and expansion phase. We have specialized in Process mining implementation and are currently developing and refining an innovative and promising Analytics Management software with multiple sales already.   Tasks  We are looking for a Frontend  Developer  for our Munich office  . As a Frontend Developer, you will optimize and implement existing software features, convincing our clients through your brilliant applications. You will collaborate with our team in germany and the local team to create innovative data and code management solutions in the field of data science, process mining and process optimization. You will further work on our in-house developed components library that is being used by multiple teams and applications. Furthermore, you will be encouragedto bring in your own ideas, experience and ambitions. We believe that simplicity and reliability are key factors for leading a business and they need to be taken into account in decision-making - do you believe that as well?   Do you enjoy working in a collaborative and feedback-oriented working atmosphere? Love challenging tasks and to work independently and organized? Do you have solid experience with JavaScript/TypeScript? Then join our team!    Requirements    Who are we looking for?   Strong university degree in the area of computer science, IT, software engineering or anything similar. Knowledge of or exerpience with React, Typescript 2, HTML5 and SASS Knowledge of or experience with LINUX, JavaScript, SQL / PL Good JavaScript / TypeScript skills Fluent in English, Mandarin or Cantonese are a plus    Benefits    What can we offer you?   A collaborative atmosphere in a german startup which recently expanded to the US, Taiwan and Czech Work in a young and dynamic team Working with innovative services that many one day reshape how businesses do analytics Great learning curve Free drinks and free coffee (of course!)   Apply today! We are happy to receive your CV & application documents and learn more about you. Apply through indeed_or send us an e-mail  .   Processand is a german software and consulting company with offices in Munich, Austin, Czech and Taiwan. Being a global leader in the implementation of process mining technology and the consultation of enterprise clients, our goal at Process& is to improve their business processes to an unprecedented level. In order to achieve that, we want to establish our "Intelligent Data Hub" platform as a standard SaaS solution for data scientists in any company.

Title: Software Developer - Core Search (m|f|x)
Description: Job Description  Our team helps millions of customers every day to find the right products at the best price. The search team focuses on finding new ways and technologies to serve the most relevant results for our users. You will be part of a team that’s constantly exploring and improving solutions in query understanding, result ranking and recommendations to name just a few. To achieve this, as Software Developer - Core Search (m|f|x) in full-time or part-time, you’ll be working together with Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers and Java Engineers – as we strongly believe a cross-functional team finds the best solutions!   About Your New Role   As a Search Engineer you are responsible for idealo’s business critical B2C search and matching for millions of customers internationally, based on an organically grown complex custom solution (Lucene based). You design, develop, operate and maintain AWS cloud infrastructure to run our search services. You will also help migrating on premise solutions into the cloud. You build up knowledge and share best practices in search for continuous improvements and innovation for our solutions. You improve search query understanding/interpretation and search result generation/ranking. In order to personalise our customer's search experience, you make use of our data lake infrastructure and Customer Data Platform.    Skills & Requirements  Job requirements   You are experienced and knowledgeable with Lucene based search services (Lucene, Solr, Elastic). You are proficient in establishing and maintaining AWS cloud services and applying Infrastructure as Code principles. You are proficient with Java and the Spring ecosystem. Message streaming platforms such as Apache Kafka and NoSQL databases like MongoDB are a plus. You need to be proficient in German and English to contribute to our core markets. You are comfortable with remote teamwork.    Helpful   You understand concepts of semantic modelling in graph databases. You're comfortable communicating and collaborating with cross-functional teams and roles to achieve the team's goals.    At idealo you can expect   You don't live in Berlin and want to work from home? Our hybrid work model offers you the freedom to work from all over Germany in a mobile and flexible way. Together we will find the best solution that works for you. In return, you get everything you need for your work (noise-canceling headset, laptop, etc.). You need vacation? We offer you 30 days of vacation. Not enough? You can "buy" an additional 15 days every year by converting your salary and it's seen as a positive thing. You want to further your education? We take your personal development goals seriously and, in addition to our idealo Learning Hub, eLearning offerings (e.g., Udemy, DataCamp), coaching & mediation, we also offer you the opportunity to benefit individually from additional learning and development budget. And what about the office? Our office in the heart of Berlin offers free organic breakfast, excellent subsidized lunch, as well as free coffee, lemonades and after-work beer, in addition to the "standard foosball". It also has a fabulous rooftop terrace with view of the whole of berlin where you can network with colleagues from our group of companies You want full flexibility on your way to work and beyond? No problem with a job bike or BVG company ticket - and it's environmentally friendly, too! You don't live in Germany yet? We support you in the visa process and with your relocation.    About idealo  idealo is a Berlin success story: in 2000 we started out with the mission of helping consumers make the best purchasing decisions. Today, with 1.5 million visits per day, 50,000 shops, and more than 330 million product offers, we are one of the most popular German e-commerce websites and one of the leading European shopping and comparison platforms. We are active as a price comparison platform in six countries (Austria, France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy, and Spain).   We are located in the heart of Berlin and offer a unique idealo spirit. Your ideas are the driving force that moves our business forward. Not only our product portfolio is diverse, but also the people who work on it. We want you just as you are! Origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or a degree of disability are irrelevant.   If you are passionate about improving the world of online shopping alongside 1200 idealos from 60 nations, apply with us today.   Work in the office and from wherever you like.  idealo allows you to work from wherever you are. As part of our Hybrid Work at idealo, you decide whether and how often you work from our office in Berlin or remotely because you live in another city within Germany or the café down the street makes the best coffee cream. Only about once a month, there will be mandatory office days to bring idealos together at company, department or team level, including stunning views from our roof terrace. Find out what Hybrid Work at idealo is all about here and in a personal conversation in the interviews!

Title: Software Engineer (m/f/d) GitLab
Description: AVANTGARDE Experts places Software Engineering Experts for web development, mobile, data science, AI and many other areas throughout Germany - apply now for an exciting job with one of our well-known clients!   We are filling from now on the following position for our client in the energy sector on a freelance basis:  Software Engineer (m/f/d) GitLab   YOUR TASKS   Implement and deploy changes to the global GitLab setup with Geo servers in regions and runners on Linux, Windows and MacOS systems Implement and maintain customization around GitLab Implement monitoring solution that allows SW engineers and IFX admins to oversee GitLab usage, CI/CD resources and status Support penetration tests and fix the issues that arise Consult SW development teams on best fit GitLab pipeline setup that optimizes throughput, runtime and stability Migrate GitLab pipelines to integrate with Artifactory binary management in close alignment with users Bring in working concepts to host GitLab Geo server and Jenkins Master with high-availability and stability on an OpenShift cluster Implement automations and customizations to provide and adjust these application hosting to integrate in Infineon infrastructure and standards Test and proof functionality, performance and stability of these hosting on staging setups Plan the migration of GitLab Geo from virtual servers to OpenShift Concepts for monitoring and automated action based on thresholds based on pre-defined resources or measures Upgrade and Roll-Back of Gitlab and Jenkins Masters as automated Service Align and agree all concepts with SW vendors and Redhat Document IT administrative tasks for lifecycle management of these solutions    Your Qualifications   At least 5 years of professional experience in Software Development, Continuous Integration and agile development Advanced skills in administering GitLab, knowhow on GitLab Geo is a plus Experience in software development lifecycle and application management lifecycle Hands-on experience with IT operations of standard tools for configuration management and test automation Advanced experience in Python Experience in working in Windows, MacOS and Linux environments Fluent communication skill in English - German would be a plus    FACTS   Start: 10.07.22 Duration: 2 MM Fulltime 100% remote    INTERESTED?  Then we look forward to receiving your portfolio incl. hourly rate and availability via our online portal.

Title: AI Full Stack Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: At paretos, we deliver Data Science to go. This means, that we are eager to make data-informed decision-making available for everybody. As a “remote-first company” with team members all over the world, we strongly believe that this ambitious path is only possible with a great and diverse team.   Paretos is an inclusive company with equal opportunities for everybody. Our culture is guided by the principles of GUNG HO – we believe in the synergy of worthwhile work, being in control of achieving a shared goal, and the importance of cheering each other on. We are proud to have brought together passionate, high-performing, and caring individuals of all genders, cultures, backgrounds, and viewpoints. All together, we make up the heart of the company and push us to the next level on a daily basis.   Tasks  At paretos, you are part of the engineering team to develop and operate the paretos software. As a part of this product-focused team, you will work together with our geeks (mathematicians, physicists and AI specialists) and engineers on the solutions of tomorrow. Your focus is to make the great ideas of our geeks accessible for our current and future customers!    Requirements    2+ years of experience as a full-stack engineer, preferably in an AI or mathematic intensive environment Experience with JavaScript/TypeScript/Node.js, React, Redux and a passion to develop great front-ends would be a great fit Knowledge in Python (especially Flask) and HTTP API Design would be appreciated Understanding of cloud technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and system engineering (12-Factor-App, system quality attributes) would be appreciated You are used to work autonomously and self-determined Motivation to work together in a team of brilliant minds Bonus Point: You have practiced end-to-end testing and know tools like Selenium to automate them    Benefits    These little perks will be waiting for you if you become part of the paretos-family:   We are a remote first company – nevertheless you’re still very welcome to work at the office and enjoy the great view over Heidelberg At the office you can test your barista skills and brew some great coffee to keep you going throughout the workday or enjoy some coffee talks with your fellow paretoneers. (You might even be awarded the next “paretos office barista of the year” at our Christmas party!) Talking about the team: you’ll complement a highly skilled & motivated team of paretoneers ready to hit the road and have fun along the way We regularly enjoy professional and fun events online and IRL with the whole team You’ll get the office equipment you need to show off your full potential. We believe that your capabilities shouldn’t be limited by hardware components Work whenever it fits best for you with flexible working hours Receive a mobility budget to access various kinds of transportation whilst setting off your carbon emissions If you are part of the paretos dog club, feel free to bring your furry friend to the office   We are continuously expanding our benefits as we grow to ensure an environment where our team members feel comfortable and happy to work at.   This is it from our side for now. What about you? Are you ambitious to disrupt the AI and Optimization world with us? Then send us your application!   Note: We encourage you to apply for this role, even if you don’t match all the requirements 100%. As long as you inherit the eagerness to learn, we are happy to be convinced that you are the right fit for us.

Title: Fullstack Developer C# / Azure - (m/w/d) – Field Mobility Solutions
Description: Since 1989 we are one of the pioneers in software development of mobility solutions in the B2B field. Starting with a software solution for the largest short-term rental company in Berlin, our product has become the standard for medium-sized car rental companies. Meanwhile the customer base includes car rental companies, carsharing-, leasing-, workshop- and insurance companies as well as car manufacturers and providers for eBikes and other means of transport. In cooperation with strong partners, we implement ambitious projects for our customers based on our cloud-based mobility platform.   Tasks  From conception to development and testing to delivery, you will be responsible for your project and your customers in all phases of software engineering. You can develop data-driven and value-oriented products, work closely with your team and our customers and bring ideas to life.    Requirements    Degree in computer science, physics or mathematics. Experience in Java, JavaScript, C#. Interest in data modelling and cloud architectures as well as machine learning. Know how to work with legacy code and how to adopt it to new technologies and architectures Fun in solving difficult problems. You want to work in small teams with creative people and be part of the process of redesigning the future of mobility from the very beginning. You enjoy learning something new every day. Honesty and humour. The will to make a difference with your ideas and your skills!    Benefits    An agile growing team. An open, personal and idea-driven corporate culture. Challenges! A bright and spacious office in the center of Berlin near Potsdammer Platz. Free coffee, tea and water. Flexible working time models. Good work-life balance. A permanent workplace that you can set up personally.   You want to be part of our team? Then send us your application via JOIN. If you have any questions regarding your application or the application process, please contact us at (030) 7828381.

Title: Backend Developer (TypeScript)
Description: The time is now to start your next career step at Process&, one of the most innovative global data science and tech companies.  At Processand, we are building a market  leading product  that defines the new category of Data Intelligence Platforms  (DIP).   We give data-driven & AI technologies  context and let them speak in a wholly new way based on our innovative intelligence graph technology,  which is powered by our in-house developed Real-Time  Parsing Engine  . The Processand Data Intelligence Platform can be placed right on top of any existing IT landscape to automatically extract, manage, and distribute critical data knowhow to data workers who need it the most. In addition, our Intelligence Graph is deeply integrated with a set of instruments and applications that help companies drastically increase efficiency in every facet of data engineering, from data transformation and documentation, to governance, and automations.   Our technology helps bring immediate value  to the biggest enterprises around the globe, and makes a direct impact  on how people work day-to-day. For Global 2000 companies, transforming to an intelligent enterprise has become a key strategic priority. Processand has many global customers including BMW, Swisscom, DB, Sabic, Eon, R+V, or Rational. All of them rely on Processand knowhow and technology to unlock their full analytics capacity and drive change to business processes.   Processand has grown massively in 4 years with over 200% in the past year. We are continuously expanding, especially in Europe, US and Asia, to be able to serve local markets. We have offices in Prague (Czech Republic), Austin (Texas), and Kaohsiung/Taipei (Taiwan) as Centers of Excellence for international tech talent. Our current headquarters are in Munich, Germany.   At each and every Processand office, we get things done quickly  by cultivating an open-minded culture with creative, collaborative, autonomous teams  in which the best ideas win. As part of Product & Engineering you will have the opportunity to grow  with a steep learning curve,  being equipped with responsibility  from day 1.   At Processand, we believe that every company can unlock their full data intelligence - and for that we need you as a Backend Engineer  .   Be ready to participate & join a multicultural family at Process&!  You are passionate about data analytics & developing web applications? Read on!  Tasks  As BE Engineer at Process&, you are responsible for optimizing & implementing existing product features  & winning our users through your brilliant applications. You will work with TypeScript, Docker, SQL and various micro-services  creating innovative and intelligent data solutions. You will further work on our in-house developed components library that is being used by multiple teams & applications.   You will be working in a cross-functional team closely with our UX designer, Product Manager and Frontend Engineers. You will also get a chance to improve and share your skills among our backend guild.    Requirements    have 2+ years of experience in building TypeScript web applications professionally have solid experience developing with Node.js write clear, understandable and testable code with continuous focus on maintainability know how to build good REST APIs have a high level understanding of domain, product and architecture can solve complex problems with limited supervision have excellent English skills (German optional)    Benefits    Benefits (at) Process&:   A highly ambitious and skilled team of international talents Chance to become one of the first employees in a fast-growing venture-backed tech startup Opportunities to actively shape and accelerate your professional and personal development Very fast decision-making processes and flat hierarchies cutting-edge tech stack: Docker, Node.js, React+Redux, Redis, GraphQL, Cypress, Kafka, AWS/GCP/Azure and many more training from experts in the field of data science and intelligence applications Flexible working hours, work from home and a top-equipped workplace in the middle of Munich An attractive compensation package and multiple career development paths fresh fruit, drinks, water, and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) A multicultural, open-minded team with start-up spirit, company retreats & events   Processand is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.   Apply today! We are happy to receive your CV & application documents and learn more about you.

Title: Frontend Engineer (m/f/d) // Remote
Description: Venture Team  Our Venture Team Loady is developing a new industry platform that will become a reliable standard of loading and unloading requirements. It will improve relationships along the supply chain network and efficiency in logistics processes. The venture is looking for a Frontend Engineer to join the growing development team. You get the opportunity to become part of a high-performance startup team that works with enthusiasm and great professionalism in developing a new, world-wide unique partner platform.   You will work in an agile team with latest technologies to build modern, scalable and high-quality solutions for our customers. Our team has an end-to-end responsibility for the system, including system design and architecture, writing code with high standards, hosting the services in the Azure cloud, monitoring services, measuring quality, and guaranteeing service reliability and security. There is plenty of space for your own ideas to provide the best user experience.   Passion for our idea and commitment, experience in frontend development or web development, and high motivation for continuous learning is essential in this role.   Your role   Be part of an agile DevOps team with end-to-end responsibility along the complete product lifecycle Design and develop the frontend of our innovative logistics platform according to UI/UX designs and business requirements Build, test and ship features using modern frameworks such as Vue.js Take responsibility for high code quality and long-term maintainable software Participate in frontend architecture decisions Ensure a great user experience including high performance, reliability, stability and security Collaboratively work with backend engineers to define APIs and data models    Your offer   Remote work - based in Germany Experience as a Frontend Developer, Web Developer or similar role Experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript and ideally Vue.js Experience with developing and shipping scalable user-facing features using component-based UI frameworks Experience with implementing frontends according to UI/UX designs and mockups Experience with designing reusable components Experience with responsive web design Familiarity with unit testing and testing frameworks Knowledge of data visualization frameworks would be a plus Ability to create wireframes, mockups or user flows using prototyping tools would be a plus General understanding of data protection, data security and governance Experience in working within an agile environment Experience in a DevOps Team with end-to-end responsibility for the entire product lifecycle Bachelor or Master of Computer Science, Business Informatics, or similar Self-organization, team collaboration, agile mindset, problem solving, positive attitude and high motivation Good communication skills in English and German    We offer   Become part of a great team and enabler of an emerging business supported by the business incubator CHEMOVATOR of a leading chemical company Exciting challenges in a dynamic market environment A highly motivated and open-minded team Attractive working environment Competitive salary  Join the founding team of an early venture idea with plenty of space for your own ideas.   Apply for this position   About Us  Chemovator is the business incubator of BASF. We provide a protected space to build commercial ventures from unconventional ideas. Our Venture Teams take full ownership of their idea, creatively explore their business, learn fast and pivot beyond corporate boundaries.

Title: Software-Entwickler
Description: Ihre Aufgaben   Wir haben uns zum Ziel gesetzt, mit intelligenten Analyselösungen und innovativen Plattformsystemen einen nachhaltigen Wertbeitrag für heute, morgen und übermorgen zu leisten. Der Einsatz unserer Services verbessert die Interaktion in unserer Gesellschaft branchenübergreifend durch Transparenz, Vernetzung und Mobilität.  Unsere Innovationen entstehen durch die Nutzung von Wissen, welches sich aus einer sinngebenden Verknüpfung von Daten, Informationen und Erfahrungen entwickelt. Neueste Methoden im Bereich Data Analytics und Data Science kombiniert mit skalierbaren Service-Architekturen fügen wir zu leistungsstarken Plattformen zusammen und legen damit den Grundstein zur digitalen Wertschöpfung unserer Kunden.   Entwickeln von Softwarelösungen für Desktop-, Server- oder Cloud-basierte Anwendungen, Plugins und Tools  Implementieren in der toolgestützten Umsetzung von Prozessen  Modellieren der Softwarearchitektur / Design mit UML  Integrieren von REST API auf Serverseite  Implementieren von User Interfaces auf Clientseite  Erstellen von Lösungskonzepten   Ihr Know-How   Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Elektrotechnik oder vergleichbare Fachrichtung oder eine Ausbildung mit Berufserfahrung im IT-Umfeld  Kenntnisse von Programmiersprachen wie Java, Javascript oder Python sowie in Technologien wie SQL, HTML, XML, JSON und deren Anwendung  Vertraut mit UML zum Erstellen von Software Architekturen und Design  Know-how im Bereich User Interface Gestaltung und Webentwicklung  Kenntnisse von Frameworks wie z.B. JQuery, React, Django und Methoden wie Object Oriented Programming von Vorteil  Umgang mit Software Repositories wie Git / SVN wünschenswert  Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse    Wir freuen uns, Sie in unserem dynamischen und leidenschaftlichen Team begrüßen zu dürfen und gemeinsam unsere Vision der Zukunft nachhaltig zu gestalten - bewerben Sie sich!   Ihre Vorteile bei invenio   Ein dynamisches Umfeld mit breitem Aufgabenspektrum, weil wir Sie fordern und fördern möchten  Eine Unternehmenskultur, in der Ihre Meinung gefragt ist und Sie mit Ihren Ideen etwas bewegen können  Bei Fragen, Schwierigkeiten oder zum Austauschen können Sie sich auf Ihr Team immer verlassen  Für den gesunden Ausgleich: 30 Urlaubstage im Jahr  Exklusiver Zugang zum Corporate Benefits-Portal (Sonderkonditionen für namenhafte Hersteller und Marken)   Innovation – Nachhaltigkeit – Agilität   https://www.invenio.net/de/stellenangebote/T-1866/

Title: Software Developer C++ (w/m/d)

We are looking forward to receiving your application with your salary expectations and earliest starting date per email at: info@ee-t.de.
