Title: C# / Xamarin / App Developer - remote option, international
Description: Who we are    NeuroNation is the personalised training app that empowers more than 20 million people all over the world in staying brain healthy and happy in their lives.    We collaborate closely with scientists and universities to achieve the best results possible. Our engaging apps have received awards from major health insurance companies, such as the AOK, funded by the German Federal Ministry of Health. Also, we've been awarded by Apple and Google as one of the best apps available.    To improve the training experience our app provides and make the product more effective and engaging to users and patients, we are looking for a passionate developer who knows well about C# development for Mobile devices and is up for a new challenge.  So, if you want to help us shape a better tomorrow, join us on our journey!     Responsibilities   Develop and maintain Mobile Apps in C# / Xamarin, shared code libraries and internal tools Contribute to the product and have an impact on people’s lives Continuously check App health data to keep it running Collaborate with the team to develop and estimate ideas for improvement     Requirements   Must-Have: You are located in a timezone +-2h from Berlin (CET) in EUROPE Must-Have: 2+ years of experience with C# in full-time jobs Must-Have: Solid understanding of Object Oriented Programming and design patterns / practices Must-Have: You have studied Computer Science or similar Bonus: App Development experience with Xamarin / Unity / Flutter, including work on UI for iOS or Android Bonus: Experience in Xamarin.Android and Xamarin.iOS Bonus: Experience in Game Development Bonus: Experience in Unity Bonus: Experience in Flutter Bonus: Experience with working under standardised Quality Management Systems (e.g. ISO 13485) or Medical Products     Our offer   Create something that is of real value to people Have a big impact on our platform that reaches out to millions of people all over the world Create something exciting, instead of spending your life with boring corporate, agency and advertising jobs Revolutionise the health and education systems Work partially or fully remote Flexible working hours (our core working times: 9:30am - 4:30pm CET) If you prefer regularly working in the office, a desk can also be provided in our Berlin office     Please apply here:  https://tinyurl.com/nn-app-dev    Looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Software Developer Engineer in Test
Description: Headquartered in New York City, Dataiku was founded in Paris in 2013 and achieved unicorn status in 2019. Now, more than 1,000 employees work across the globe in our offices and remotely. Backed by a renowned set of investors and partners including CapitalG, Tiger Global, and ICONIQ Growth, we’ve set out to build the future of AI.   Our R&D team (based in Paris) creates Dataiku, a cutting-edge product that allows data analysts to discover hidden insights. As a software developer engineer in test, your mission will be to ensure that we only deliver highest-quality products to our customers. You will play a crucial role in our success by helping our users have the best possible experience.   Dataiku's platform is built on modern Web technologies (single page webapp with Angular/AngularJS) and integrates with a very large ecosystem of big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, MPP databases, Cloud services, ...).   Our software testing stack is based on python, pytest, selenium, and allure for the integration tests. Our CI is based on Jenkins with intensive usage of AWS’s features.   At Dataiku, developers are involved in writing part of the automated integration tests together with the QA team.    In This Role, You’ll Help The Team    Coding advanced automated test suites to exercise our applications at all levels Defining manual testing plans, test strategies and define priorities Working with the developers to ensure that they deliver testable code Improving existing test infrastructure and frameworks (virtual machines, containers, auto-provisioning, UI testing, ...) Mentoring and helping new QA team members  You might be a good fit if:   You have at least 3-4 years of experience as a Software Developer Engineer in Test with a significant part in automation (API and/or UI Testing) You think collaborating with developers is the key for a good testing strategy You have worked with at least one Object Oriented language (as Python, Java, C#, or C++) You discuss choices before implementing them  Bonus points for any of these:   Experience with big data technologies, such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kubernetes Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and GCP Basic knowledge of machine learning  Benefits:   Ability to have a significant impact on the quality of our product Ability to work on the latest and greatest data science technologies Learn everyday and teach others Startup atmosphere: free food and drinks, international atmosphere, remote first culture, general good times, and smart/friendly people    About Dataiku    Dataiku is the platform for Everyday AI, systemizing the use of data for exceptional business results. By making the use of data and AI an everyday behavior, Dataiku unlocks the creativity within individual employees to power collective success at companies of all sizes and across all industries. Don’t get us wrong: we are a tech company building software. Our culture is even pretty geeky! But our driving force is and will always remain people, starting with ours. We consider our employees to be our most precious asset, and we are committed to ensuring that each of them gets the most rewarding, enjoyable, and memorable work experience with us. Fly over to Instagram to learn more about our #dataikulife.   Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please contact us at: reasonable-accommodations@dataiku.com

Title: (Junior) IT Application Specialist (w/m/d)
Description: Begleite KPMG bei den zukünftigen Herausforderungen unserer Kunden und Kundinnen. Begeistere auch Du Dich für die Vielfalt unserer Fragestellungen - und mach gemeinsam mit uns den Unterschied. Die KPMG IT Service GmbH ist die IT-Beratung und -Dienstleistung der KPMG AG Wirtschaftsprüfungsgesellschaft. Du verantwortest gemeinsam mit Deinem Team die IT-Infrastruktur und unterstützt die Fachabteilungen bei der Bereitstellung von effizienz- und effektivitätssteigernder Business Software.   Deine Aufgaben  Du denkst nicht in Problemen, sondern gehst lösungsorientiert jede neue Herausforderung an? Dann kannst Du Dich hier einbringen:    Du übernimmst als (Junior) IT Application Specialist (w/m/d) die Administration und Implementierung von fachspezifischen Anwendungen. Die eigenverantwortliche Analyse und Behebung von Störungen sowie die Koordination von Serviceanfragen im 2nd/3rd Level Support gehören ebenfalls zu Deinen Aufgaben. Du spielst Updates, Hotfixes und neue Releases ein und übernimmst die dazugehörige Abstimmung. Du begleitest die Applikationen über den gesamten Application-Life-Cycle. Darüber hinaus bist Du für Anforderungsanalyse, Bewertung neuer Requirements, Umsetzung und Überführung in den Betrieb zuständig. Du verantwortest den Betrieb von Plattformen für Datenlösungen. Du pflegst und erstellst die Dokumentationen und die teaminterne Wissensdatenbank. Die kontinuierliche Mitarbeit an aktuellen Projekten sowie die Weiterentwicklung bestehender Anwendungen fallen ebenfalls in Dein Aufgabengebiet. Du automatisierst und optimierst bestehende Prozesse und Schnittstellen. Du unterstützt und berätst bei technischen Fragestellungen.    Dein Profil   (Junior) IT Application Specialist (w/m/d) wirst Du bei uns mit einem abgeschlossenen Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung und/oder einer informationstechnischen Ausbildung (z. B. Fachinformatiker:in – Systemintegration). Du bringst fundierte Kenntnisse in der Administration von Datenbanken (MS SQL-Server) und Webservern (Internet Information Service) mit. Du verfügst über praktische Erfahrungen bei der Durchführung von IT-Projekten und der Überführung von Anwendungen in den produktiven Betrieb. Einen sicheren Umgang mit Microsoft Technologien (Windows Server, Microsoft SQL Server, Internet Information Service) und gängigen Web Technologie setzen wir voraus. Du bringst bereits Erfahrung in der Analyse von Problemen in Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Fachbereichen sowie in der Erarbeitung und Umsetzung von Lösungskonzepten mit. Idealerweise hast Du bereist Praxiskenntnisse im Bereich von Datenplattformen wie Power BI und Alteryx sammeln können. Von Vorteil sind erste Erfahrungen mit dem Microsoft Business Intelligence Stack (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI Report Server). Du verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift. Deine eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise sowie Motivation für variantenreiche Aufgaben und Projekte zeichnen Dich aus. Dein Geschick im Umgang mit Menschen, Deine gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit und Freude an der Arbeit im Team runden Deine Qualifikationen ab.    Deine Benefits   Willkommen im Team  Damit Du von Beginn an voll bei uns durchstarten kannst, begleiten wir Dich mit strukturierten Onboarding-Maßnahmen während der gesamten Orientierungsphase. Zudem fördert Deine Führungskraft gezielt Deine fachliche und persönliche Integration ins Team. Vielfältige Karriereperspektiven  Wir legen Wert auf die individuelle Entwicklung Deiner fachlichen und persönlichen Stärken: Deine eigenen Ambitionen reflektieren wir in strukturierten Entwicklungsgesprächen. Systematische und regelmäßige Feedback-Gespräche unterstützen Dich beim Erreichen dieser Ziele. Mit unserer Vielfalt an spannenden Kunden und Kundinnen sowie Fragestellungen bieten wir Dir interessante Karrieremöglichkeiten und somit wertvolle Einblicke in die Vielfalt unserer Tätigkeitsbereiche. Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Privatleben  Wir sind überzeugt, dass es vor allem Vielfalt und Flexibilität braucht, um Innovationen zu fördern und langfristige Erfolge zu sichern. Nur so können wir die besten Ideen entwickeln und wirklich innovative Lösungen finden. Mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, Homeoffice-Option, Zeitkonten und Auszeiten schaffen wir Räume, um Privat- und Berufsleben miteinander zu vereinbaren. Darüber hinaus unterstützen wir Dich monatlich mit bis zu vier Stunden Freistellung für Dein soziales Engagement. Fort- & Weiterbildung  Durch regelmäßige Trainings, Workshops und Weiterbildungen entwickelst Du Dich stetig weiter. Die abgebildeten Leistungen können je nach Position und Standort leicht variieren.

Title: Software Developer / Engineer: Portfolio Optimization (m/f/d)
Description: Your mission  In this role, you will be part of our portfolio construction and backtesting squad, developing and improving on our cutting-edge capabilities for portfolio construction, trading simulations and detailed quantitative inspection of an investment’s behaviour. As a member of our squad your work will have direct impact on the performance of our investment strategies and on the development of our state of the art research and live-trading system. The squad is characterized by a culture of collaboration and technical excellence. We are looking for a professional who can build solutions that make an impact across the whole organisation, who has a strong sense of ownership and the drive to build a system with usability and scalability that is unique in the professional asset management landscape. You will work in close collaboration with our experienced quant finance and machine learning experts.       Your skillset   Degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, physics, computer science, statistics, or any other strongly quantitative field Experience in solving mathematical programming problems, especially convex constrained optimisation Strong programming skills in Python and experience in the clean design of maintainable software systems and APIs Excellent reasoning and mathematical skills are critical: off-the-shelf methods don't always work for our use cases, so you need to understand the potentials and limits of existing methods very well Proactive and independent work style with a can-do attitude and the ability to learn quickly Strong interpersonal skills and a genuine passion for working in a team environment Ability to communicate complex analytical concepts clearly and concisely Experience with portfolio optimisation and working with real-world financial data would be a plus       Why us?   An exciting and involving role with significant impact on shaping the future of AI-based sustainable investing A company culture that is based on a spirit of cooperation and is characterized by a high level of quality awareness, openness and attention to detail in all areas of our work Flexible working hours, 28 days paid leave and a competitive salary and equity package A modern loft office in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg, healthy food (including coffee, juices, fruit, vegetables, sandwiches) and high-end hardware from Apple Internal workshops, unique learning possibilities across a wide range of domains as well as amazing team events       ﻿About us  We are a deep tech pioneer, providing AI-based investment solutions to our clients. Building on the best practices of quantitative asset management we tap the potential of machine learning for sustainable investments on capital market.Our interdisciplinary team consists of experts in the fields of finance, computer science, software engineering, machine learning as well as mathematics, physics, and neuroscience. Othoz is embedded in the global AI community, through a close exchange with leading universities and as a member of Inquire Europe. To date Othoz is one of the leading drivers for AI-based analyses and decision-making processes in asset management. Othoz has been founded in 2017, is headquartered in Berlin, Germany and is backed by leading international business angels and VCs.

Title: Backend Developer (Python)
Description: The time is now to start your next career step at Lyntics, one of the most innovative global data science and tech companies.  The Company Lyntics leads a technological revolution in the field of data literacy. It is seen as a modern solution to complex problems through the democratisation of data knowledge and efficient data analytics. Lyntics’ satisfied customers are some of the largest companies around the globe. Years of experience has shown that indepth data knowledge is a critical key to generating real business value in analytics. However, to acquire such a knowledge, years of hard work, training and efforts are required. Today, Lyntics Data Literacy Platform provides companies with a ground-breaking new way to instantly scale data literacy across the entire organisation, cut costs and accelerate digital transformation. The Team Lyntics is rapidly expanding and looking to bring on a communicative, collaborative, and dedicated individual for our fast-growing technology company.   Tasks  As BE Engineer at Lyntics, you are responsible for optimizing & implementing existing product features  & winning our users through your brilliant applications. You will work with Python, SQL and various micro-services  creating innovative and intelligent data solutions. You will further work on our in-house developed components library that is being used by multiple teams & applications.   You will be working in a cross-functional team closely with our UX designer, Product Manager and Frontend Engineers. You will also get a chance to improve and share your skills among our backend guild.    Requirements    have 2+ years of experience in building Python applications professionally write clear, understandable and testable code with continuous focus on maintainability have strong algorithmic and problem-solving skills with a good understanding of complex data structures (optionally) have experience with graph theory and machine learning libraries such as Pytorch, Tensorflow or Scikit-learn show a high level of motivation and commitment have excellent English skills (German optional)    Benefits    A highly ambitious and skilled team of international talents Chance to become one of the first employees in a fast-growing venture-backed tech startup Opportunities to actively shape and accelerate your professional and personal development Very fast decision-making processes and flat hierarchies cutting-edge tech stack: Docker, Node.js, React+Redux, Redis, GraphQL, Cypress, Kafka, AWS/GCP/Azure and many more training from experts in the field of data science and intelligence applications Flexible working hours, work from home and a top-equipped workplace in the middle of Munich An attractive compensation package and multiple career development paths fresh fruit, drinks, water, and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) A multicultural, open-minded team with start-up spirit, company retreats & events   Lyntics is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.   Apply today! We are happy to receive your CV & application documents and learn more about you

Title: C++ Engine Developer - (m/f/d)
Description: We are looking for an experienced and passionate C++ Engine Developer - (m/f/d)  to join our team in Frankfurt  , Germany.   As C++ Engine Developer at GritWorld you will be part of a team designing and developing the core systems of a modern and extensible real-time rendering engine for the cinematic industry.   Your resume and cover letter are required documents, to be able to carefully evaluate your application.  Any additional samples / private projects (such as github) are welcome.   You don't have to move to Germany for this position. We are also willing to hire you from abroad. If you would still like to relocate to Frankfurt, we will support you with the relocation process.   Key Responsibilities    Designing and developing new features in our core systems. Work with our existing codebase and contribute to workflow optimizations. Collaborate closely with other engineers, artists, and designers to achieve the best result. Write clear, maintainable and robust code.    Qualifications    Strong programming skills in C++ and modern standards 11/14/17. 3+ years of professional work experience as Engine Developer. Excellent debugging and optimization skills in a multi-threaded environment. Data-driven design and software architecture. Knowledge about common game engine systems, such as asset pipelines, entity component systems. Finished Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience. Good English skills (written & verbal).    Bonus Qualifications    Experience with C#. Basic experience in Network programming.   If this position sounds exciting to you, apply for the job here. We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Junior Product Data Scientist
Description: Ankorstore is an ecosystem that enables independent brands and retailers to thrive.   We’re on a mission to rewild retail and restore it to its natural order by empowering brands and retailers to grow freely, embrace their creativity, and stay competitive.   Our platform harnesses the power of technology to create a mutually beneficial community that reinvents the way brands and retailers work together.   With decades of experience in retail and building marketplaces, in 2019, the Ankorstore founding team knew it was time to create a global wholesale solution to swing the balance in favour of independents and return them to their rightful place – at the centre of their communities.   Just two short years later, we’ve grown to a team of over 700 employees operating across seven offices worldwide, and we’ll grow even more in 2022. After fundraising in January 2022, taking our total funding to €365 million, Ankorstore is thrilled to have achieved “unicorn” status in just two years. 🦄   We’re scaling fast and looking to grow our team with world-class candidates to support our vision of rewilding retail ! 🌿   About the role:  Ankorstore has the ambition to bring technology in a world where both our buyers & sellers are used to phone calls, basic emails & physical trade shows. It’s a world where everything needs to be invented! Product Managers will lead Ankorstore’s effort to transform & innovate in an ecosystem only starting to digitize.   What will be your responsibilities:  You will own a Product project, a be accountable to reach the objective on your scope:   Help Product Managers prioritize projects based on data Find new features / revenue opportunities to feed the Product Roadmap Build our understanding of retailers conversion funnel, and how to monitor it over time Define how to analyze & test ranking / recommendation algorithms Build smart user segmentations, based on data science methods Lead the implementation & evolution of our Product data structure & tools    The experience we require:   At least 1 year experiences in Data Analyst / Scientist Ideally you have experience in SQL and e-commerce conversion understanding Advanced Analytical skills - you can handle data science-grade analysis, either to understand behaviours, or to analyze AB tests Structured - you like to answer complex business questions through data. You are able to structure and process qualitative or quantitative data and draw insightful conclusions from it Excellent written and verbal communication in English Attention to detail & curiosity - you do not let important details slip through the cracks! You like to dig into ‘strange’ trends and find the story behind them Creativity & proactivity - you can find creative and simple solutions to tricky problems, using new approaches, tools and/or testing new ways of leveraging data You are a team player - you always demonstrate a ‘can-do’ attitude and want to work in a team    Other qualities that would add value:   Entrepreneurial experience. Experience working with small retailers or brands. German, Dutch or Spanish is a plus.    Why work for Ankorstore?   Working with a very ambitious & mission driven team backed by powerful VCs (Index Ventures, GFC, Alven, Aglae). Location can be based in one of our offices in Paris, Amsterdam, Berlin, London, Barcelona or remote anywhere in the UK, Sweden, Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Germany, France and Spain Attractive package.    Ankorstore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to promoting diversity. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Title: Data Engineer Autonomous Driving (m/w/d)
Description: Aufgabe   Als Data Engineer hast Du Spaß daran datengetriebene Software-Lösungen zu entwickeln und in die Praxis umzusetzen. Du interessierst Dich für moderne Web- und Cloud-Technologien zur Applikationsentwicklung für das autonome Fahren? Dann erwartet Dich folgendes bei uns   Entwicklung von Cloud-Anwendungen zur Analyse von Daten für autonomes Fahren Mitarbeit bei der Konzeption und Spezifikation von Architekturen und deren Realisierung Erstellung von data driven Software in Java oder Scala Zusammenarbeit in einem agilen DevOps Team      Profil    Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation Du hast bereits in Java oder Scala programmiert und interessierst Dich für neueste Cloud-Technologien wie AWS oder Microsoft Azure Die agile Softwareentwicklung ist Dir vertraut. Du besitzt gute Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse.

Title: Working Student - Data Analyst & Project Manager
Description: Our Accommodation Profile team is looking for a versatile team player with a business head and an analytical brain to support with technical and non-technical project management and coordination of tasks. In this role, you'll work with product managers, analysts and other stakeholders to execute several projects which contribute to our company strategy.   Take your next career steps with us and apply if you are self-motivated, enthusiastic, and have a keen eye for detail!   How you’ll make an impact:   Use your analytical skills by digging through our data and providing meaningful insights Support product managers by preparing various business analyses Collaborate with our engineers and analysts to improve our processes and better measure our KPIs Plan, execute, and monitor technical and non-technical projects based on team needs    What you’ll learn:   How to sharpen your time management and organizational skills How a data-driven company works internally and how decisions are made How to collaborate with an international team of experienced developers, data scientists, and product managers How data and our business impact the travel industry    What we’re looking for:   Attention to detail. You can spot inconsistencies in our data and determine improvement points An entrepreneurial attitude towards your responsibilities. You take ownership of your work and gain confidence on your projects Solid communication skills A positive attitude and the eagerness to work in a lively, multicultural environment A student with the capacity to work 20 hours a week for at least 6 months. Minimum of 4 days per month in-office Fluent English (our company language) skills    What makes you stand out:   Knowledge of SQL 1+ years’ experience in Project Management, Data Analytics or a similar role-relevant field    Don’t let these nice-to-haves stop you from applying for the job! As long as you have relevant experience and the right attitude, we’d love to hear from you.   What you can expect from life at trivago:  Entrepreneurship:  The freedom to take ownership of your work and drive initiatives independently. It’s the idea that counts, not the position.   Growth:  Support for your development, constant new opportunities, regular peer feedback, mentorship and training.   International  workforce  :  Collaboration with international talents from 80+ nations bringing different perspectives, backgrounds and expertise together to ensure a truly global focus.   Flexibility:  Self-determined working hours and the opportunity to split your time between home and our campus in Düsseldorf: At least 4 days in the office per month and the rest at home. We also offer further flexibility for parents of young children and talents with severe disabilities or health conditions.   Relocation  and integration  :  Support with relocation costs, insurance, work permit and visa questions.   Equal  o  pportunity:  Commitment to creating an all-inclusive workplace, because we know representing the diversity of our users in our talent base enables us to create a more meaningful product.    A note from our recruitment team:     We know that applying for a new job can be both exciting and intimidating, but don’t worry, we’ve got you. Our recruiting team will be on hand every step of the way, but if you have any questions or concerns before applying, feel free to reach out to us at   joinus@trivago.com  . You can also find out more about our hiring process  here  .  We look forward to your application!

Title: Data Engineer (m/d/f) FinTech
Description: One of the most successful FinTech companies in Berlin is looking for Data Engineers. If you like to work in a driven, fun and ambitious work atmosphere, this is your chance.   Benefits   An attractive base salary Participation in our virtual Stock Options Programs A fun and driven atmosphere office in the heart of Berlin A great diverse team Flexible working hours Work closely with our CEO/founder and Chief of Staff and seasoned industry experts with a rich network    Task:   Designing and building fault-tolerant, horizontally scalable systems using a Microservice architecture powered by Docker and Kubernetes Building event-driven applications using Kafka Developing data cleaning, data transformation, data aggregation, and schema management components Working on improving the reliability of the data infrastructure Establishing or developing innovative tooling to facilitate low-maintenance data pipelines, rich data tooling for product and operations, and user-focused dashboarding. Working with an agile methodology with flexible processes Working with the cutting edge technologies (Go, Kafka, Looker) without a legacy codebase    Your Profile:   Prior experience with distributed systems and data pipelines Love for clean and structured data and experience with schema management Experience in Go (or willingness to make Go your day-to-day language) Fluency in analytical SQL and other data languages (e.g., LookML, numpy/pandas, Airflow DAGs, GraphQL, etc.) Fluency with event-driven architecture and concurrent algorithms Being proactive in learning new stacks and having a high sense of ownership Being able to present your work and enjoying to teach your newly learned skills and technologies to your colleagues It's nice if you have: Experience with Investment products or the Fintech domain, in general, is a big plus Experience with managing end-to-end data pipelines (from the creation of an event to making it visible as a KPI to the CEO) Experience in event-driven architectures and event sourcing systems. Experience with ETL/ELT tools and technologies Experience with Kafka Streams, KSQL, or related streaming aggregation technologies. Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and modern monitoring and tracing tools    If you are interested in discussing this role in a little more detail click apply. Even if you are not actively looking at this time but interested in other opportunities we may have, please reach out to Eva Sassnick

Title: Software Engineer
Description: Sysdig is driving the standard for securing the cloud and containers. We created Falco, the open standard for cloud-native threat detection, and consistently contribute to open source software projects. We are passionate, technical problem-solvers, continually innovating and delivering powerful solutions to secure the cloud from source to run.  We value diversity and open dialog to spur ideas, working closely together to achieve goals. We’re an international company that understands how to cultivate a strong culture across a remote team. And we're a great place to work too — we've been named a Bay Area Best Place to Work  by the  San Francisco Business Times and the Silicon Valley Business Journal  for three years now! We were recognized by Deloitte as one of the 500 fastest growing organizations in 2020 and 2021. We are looking for team members who have a passion for container and cloud security and are willing to dig deeper to help our customers. Does this sound like the right place for you?  What You Will Do   Build, ship and own features related to the discovery, analysis & remediation of vulnerabilities in bare-metal, Kubernetes and Cloud assets Build distributed & scalable services in Go to process, store & analyze customer's asset metadata & runtime insights Be a player of a major re-architecture of the Vulnerability Management product Build microservices in Go to expose API to both internal and external use cases Handle security related data as part of the software lifecycle   What You Will Bring With You   Strong computer science fundamentals in design, data structures, and algorithms Good teamwork mentality Ability to take ownership of features you ship   What We Look For   A positive "can do" attitude and startup / entrepreneurial approach Analytical approach to take technical decisions in a traffic intensive and distributed architecture Clean coding and automation practices Experience with technologies such as Postgres, Elastic, Redis Experience with Open Source contribution and Container runtimes knowledge is a plus   Why work at Sysdig?   We’re a well-funded startup that already has a large enterprise customer base We have a pragmatic, transparent culture, from the CEO down We have an organizational focus on delivering value to customers Our open source tools ( https://sysdig.com/opensource/ ) are widely used and loved by technologists & developers   When You Join Sysdig, You Can Expect   Competitive compensation including equity opportunities Flexible hours and additional recharge days Mental wellbeing support through Modern Health for you and your family Monthly wellness reimbursement Career growth   Some of our Hiring Managers are globally distributed, an English version of your Cv will be highly appreciated!

Description: Your Responsibilities    As a future data-services team member you will:   Develop and operate (DevSecOps), in a test-driven manner, diverse services and user visible systems of highest quality, scalability, and security Build up a unified Data Hub for Zeppelin by connecting and consolidating multiple internal and external data sources (API’s, databases, filesystems, operational systems like CRM, ERP, etc.) Enhance & maintain the deployment chain and our infrastructure Collaborate cross functionally with Zeppelin’s Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Developers and Product Managers to define and deliver digital products   Your Profile   Completed studies in computer science, or related field or equivalent work experience Mandatory: Willingness to learn Python and Cloud-Computing Services, such as provided by AWS We expect from a Junior at least theoretical, from a Senior practical, experience in some of the following areas: Backend tools in a microservice architecture: Python Backends [FastAPI | Flask | Django] with REST or GraphQL, Kafka, MQTT, RabbitMQ, Airflow  Data Layer: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, S3, AWS Athena, AWS Glue, JSON, AVRO, Parquet  Languages: SQL, Python, Go, Shell Scripting (bash)  Infrastructure: AWS (Amazon Web Services), Kubernetes, Kubernetes Operator, Helm, Helmfile, Terraform, Terragrunt, Docker, Docker-Compose, CircleCI, GitOps, ArgoCD, Istio, Unix-based OS  Frontend: SPA using VueJS, ES6+  Optional: Combination of Python with scala or Java, or Python with PHP would be exciting Willingness to learn and apply new Concepts and technologies, eg.: Spark, CitusDB, Exasol... Title: Full Stack Software Engineer (m/f/d) at TWAICE Technologies
Description: Within our TWAICE Predictive Analytics Platform, we are building an incredibly powerful and versatile software backbone in the cloud. We’re using this platform to build solutions for our customers and enabling them to integrate our advanced battery models and predictive analytics into their own products. As we scale, we will be processing large amounts of data from varied sources such as our own battery lab, connect vehicles, and energy storage farms. This data will power our mattery models, machine learning engine, and predictive analytics.   As a Full Stack Software engineer, you will be part of a team responsible for implementing both web-based UIs and backend services to be used internally and by our customers. In the true startup fashion, we are looking for candidates that are unafraid of doing what’s needed to delight our customers, grow our business, and establish TWAICE as the leader in advanced battery analytics.   Tasks   True full stack engineering: You are not afraid of implementing web UIs or API based platform microservices depending on what’s needed with a strong focus on customer value You will actively help driving and shaping the feature set of our SaaS battery analytics platform in a lean and result-oriented way You like getting your hands dirty in database systems (NoSQL e.g. DynamoDB/ Elasticsearch) and streaming data processing frameworks (e.g. Kinesis, Kafka, Spark) You are interacting with different IoT protocols and standards (e.g. MQTT, CANbus) as well as building advanced dockerized solutions for IoT customers You are designing, implementing, and deploying scalable micro-services / serverless functions in established cloud environments You will closely collaborate with our Battery Analytics and Machine Learning engineers to jointly deliver products to our customers You are contributing to a motivated tight-knit team solving hard problems the right way    Requirements    You have a BS/MS in computer science or equivalent experience You have 3+ years of professional experience in architecting, building & running cloud solutions You have experience in multiple parts of our tech stack: Python, Node.js, Angular, AWS deployments You know how to work in a fast-paced agile environment, e.g. in a startup You are fluent in English combined with very strong communication skills    Benefits    Apart from you having a meaningful activity in one of the most exciting areas of our time, we care about your mental and physical health. We care about your flexible working time and your time off, about your social environment and your personal growth.We offer you:A very competitive salary Training budget 2000€/year and further training possibilities within the company Free healthy breakfast, free healthy lunch, free snacks, drinks and coffee Free access to a tool of your choice (skillshare or Coursera) Gympass Membership (subsidized access to gyms - not only for you but also for your family and friends) Flexible working hours and flexible home office - work wherever and whenever you want Mobile and remote working (working from another city? No problem!) A high degree of personal responsibility, creative freedom and opportunities Strong team culture with regular team events and off-sites (Summer and Christmas party, at least one big off-site, Oktoberfest (Wiesn) event, Cocktail and Movie nights once a month, regular team and sports events, company kitchen with cooking events) International team and relocation budget of 800€ Borrow our e-Golf for private purposes and free EV-charging at our company Book circle (Order a book via TWAICE - we pay for it, you read it)   Would you like to find out more about TWAICE as an employer? Then take a look at Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn or Kununu .

Title: Software Engineer - BI Tools Integrations
Description: About Starburst  Starburst is the fastest, most efficient analytics engine for a data warehouse, data lake, or data mesh. Our software provides fast and easy access to data, no matter where it lives, with a best-in-class MPP SQL engine that shortens the path to value for data. The Starburst Enterprise Platform leverages the power of the open source Trino (formerly PrestoSQL) to query data across any database, making it instantly actionable for data-driven organizations. Our SaaS offering, Starburst Galaxy provides all the benefits of Trino and Starburst in an easy to use, fully-managed enterprise-ready multi-cloud SaaS platform designed by Trino’s original creators and experts.   With Starburst, teams can lower the total cost of their infrastructure and analytics investments, prevent vendor lock-in, and use the existing tools that work for their business. Though Starburst has achieved a unicorn status and raised $414M in venture funding from top investors, we were founded with customers and revenue from the very beginning. Our customers love us, we operate globally, and we are proud to be named a Best Place to Work . Come join our team of All-Stars!   About The Role  To complement Starburst’s ability to access data anywhere, our goal is to make it easy for any business intelligence tool to connect to Starburst. Our vision is that any business analyst should be able to access any data source through the tool of their choice. We are looking for a BI Tools Integrations Engineer to help us make that a reality.   Note  that this is a role focused on integrating BI tools with our software so that our customers can build dashboards easily with Starburst driving data access. Rather than a role where you’ll be building dashboards or actively doing analytics using BI tools, this role requires you to get into the “guts” of the BI tools and how they play with Starburst.   Responsibilities:   Design: Research and design integrations with business intelligence software Develop: Build custom connectors for business intelligence tools like Power BI and Tableau Test: Implement test automation, design and write tests Collaborate: Collaborate with teams globally across multiple time zones and operate in an Agile development environment    Some things we will look for:   At least 3 years of experience Familiarity with BI tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc. Experience with JDBC and ODBC integrations An understanding of authentication mechanisms like LDAP, Kerberos, OAuth2.0 Experience with Java or Python Comfortable with SQL and scripting languages Experience working with Microsoft technologies    Bonus points:   Familiarity with Trino Windows development experience, particularly with ODBC    Benefits  At Starburst, we’re constantly striving towards building a place where people come first by creating an environment of transparency, honesty, and respect. We take care of our global workforce by making sure employees enjoy competitive salaries and attractive stock grants, remote-friendly work options, access to quality and affordable insurance, and flexible and generous paid time off to start a family, travel, or just relax!   Headquartered in Boston MA with offices in Warsaw and London and employees across Europe and the Americas, we are committed to hiring where the talent is.   Starburst provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.   #BI-Remote

Title: Software Developer
Description: Als Management Beratung begleiten wir seit über 30 Jahren Unternehmen bei der Gestaltung einer  erfolgreichen und nachhaltigen Zukunft. Dieses Ziel verfolgen wir mit Empathie und Leidenschaft.  Werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams! Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!  Sende uns Deine aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen an:  Lena Keutgen (karriere@schuh-group.com)

Title: Digital Engineering and Manufacturing Services: Model-Based Systems Engineer (w/m/d) - Aerospace

We employ around 3,500 people across Europe, around 300 of whom work in Germany.   Enrich our team – professionally and personally.   To strengthen our "Smart Engineering" business group, we are looking for motivated colleagues as a model-based systems engineer (f/m/d) for our aerospace division in Munich.   [cg_button url="https://emp.jobylon.com/applications/jobs/136035/create/" id="btn-1654272152929" label="Apply Now" align="left" target="_blank" ]   THIS IS THE JOB   Actively shape the digital transformation of future developments Software development to support on MBSE Customize tools Create automatization scripts Development of data exchanges Take responsibility step by step Be part of an international team    This Is What We Need    Successfully completed studies in computer science, engineering or comparable Good knowledge of programming skills like Java, UML, SysML, OCL Know-how in process, methods and tools environment is a plus Additional knowledge in digital transformation Experience with the Cameo Systems modeler Good presentation skills European citizenship is mandatory   [cg_button url="https://emp.jobylon.com/applications/jobs/136035/create/" id="btn-1654272152929" label="Apply Now" align="left" target="_blank" ]   More information on Smart Engineering   We offer you room for development, personal responsibility from day one, cooperation, varied and challenging tasks, fun at work, flexibility, teamwork, a constantly growing international team and a smart business. Your tasks   Prototypical implementation in R Statistical support of our development team Creating concepts for the implementation of new statistical methods Collaboration in the development of analyses Inventory of the software Evaluation of the results     Your professional qualifications   Master's degree in the field of statistics, data science, computer science, mathematics or comparable studies Programming knowledge in R, ideally experience in the development of R-Packages Experience with Git Solid knowledge of statistics Experience in sharing statistical expertise Expertise in solving problems with analytical and descriptive statistics Independent, structured, and quality-conscious approach to work and strong teamwork skills Fluent in English and German     camLine offers   An interesting, challenging job A pleasant, modern, and international working environment (Asia / US / EU) with flexible working hours and remote work / hybrid workplace possible Comprehensive, personal, and individual onboarding Possibility to contribute to the development of a statistical software Different perks for a better work-life balance     Interested? Title: Web Developer (w/m/d) für Inhouse-Startup
Description: Infosim® ist ein international tätiges Unternehmen mit Hauptsitz in Würzburg und Niederlassungen in Münster, Singapur und Austin, TX.   Mit unserer Software StableNet® sind wir führender Hersteller von automatisierten Service Fulfillment- und Service Assurance-Lösungen. StableNet® umfasst Fault-, Performance-, Configuration- und Services Management auf einer einzigen Plattform.   Als Mitglied unseres Inhouse-Startups hilfst Du mit, unser neues Produkt im Bereich der Circular Economy zu einem erfolgreichen Plattform-Geschäft zu entwickeln.   Aufgaben   Mitwirken bei der technischen Konzeptionierung einer digitalen Plattform mit neuartigen Services Entwickeln von Lösungsansätzen im Team und Implementierung der Lösungen im TypeScript-Umfeld Kommunikation mit unterstützenden Entwickler-Teams Anforderungsanalysen mit Stakeholdern und Übersetzung in User Stories Bei Interesse aktives Mitwirken in internationalen Forschungsprojekten   Qualifikation   Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder im Bereich Natur-/Ingenieurwissenschaften mit vergleichbarer Berufserfahrung Erfahrung in der Web-Entwicklung (Front- und Backend) Fundierte Kenntnisse in JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML und CSS/SCSS sowie in einem gängigen Webframework (Angular, React, Vue) Idealerweise Kenntnisse in NodeJs, REST, GraphQL Eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise, mit "Hands-on"-Mentalität und Qualitätsanspruch Ausgeprägte Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit   Zusätzliche Vorteile   Einschlägige Praxiserfahrung im industriellen Umfeld Kenntnisse in Industrial IoT (z. B. MQTT, OPC-UA) Kenntnisse in Datenanalyse und Machine Learning    Benefits    Stabilität eines erfolgreichen Unternehmens – kombiniert mit der Vielseitigkeit eines Startups Spannende Projekte in einem internationalen Umfeld Hoher Grad an Forschung und Innovation Mitgestaltung des eigenen Aufgabenbereichs Flexible Arbeitszeiten Möglichkeit zur Remote-Arbeit   Zufriedenheit ist der Schlüssel zum Erfolg.   Wenn unsere Mitarbeiter glücklich sind, werden auch unsere Kunden zufrieden sein. Dies zeigt sich in wirtschaftlichem Erfolg, welcher wiederum zu zufriedenen Mitarbeitern führt. Grundlage ist das Wissen, dass jeder Mitarbeiter eine Person mit eigenen Ideen, Wünschen und Fähigkeiten ist. Unser Ziel ist es, diese Vielfalt zu bündeln, um eine erfolgreiche Geschäftsstruktur aufzubauen, von der alle Beteiligten ganzheitlich profitieren.   Wir freuen uns über deine Bewerbung!

Title: Full Stack Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: RapidMiner  is reinventing enterprise AI so that anyone has the power to positively shape the future. We’re doing this by offering an enterprise-ready data science platform for people of all skill levels.   RapidMiner has been designated as leaders in our white-hot market by both Gartner and Forrester, over the past 8 years. More than 40,000 organizations in over 150 countries rely on RapidMiner to increase revenue, cut costs, and reduce risk.   We are venture capital (VC) backed with a work from anywhere policy, though our headquarters is in Boston (MA, USA) and we have locations in Dortmund (Germany), Budapest (Hungary), and London (UK).   Job Description  Title:  Full Stack Software Engineer   Hiring office:  RapidMiner GmbH, Westfalendamm 87, 44141 Dortmund, Germany   RapidMiner builds machine learning and data science software and provides the leading unified data science platform for easy-to-use data science and for lightning fast business impact. Our visual user interface and software accelerate the process of creating predictive analytics models and makes it easy to automate processes and embed automatically generated predictions and results in business operations. We make data analytics teams more productive through a single platform that unifies data preparation, machine learning, model validation, automation, and deployment. The Java-based RapidMiner platform supports heterogenous teams and diverse user groups from experienced coding data scientist to application domain experts and business analysts without coding skills. For data scientists, RapidMiner seamlessly integrates Python, R, and Groovy scripts, provides a Java API, and allows easy-to-develop extensions. For non-coding data analysts and application domain experts, RapidMiner provides guided analytics, automated machine learning (AutoModel / AutoML) and optimization, as well as visual data mining process design, application templates, a built-in recommender system, and result visualization.   Our Research team  is part of our mission to take our existing machine learning platform to the next level. The team is focused on implementing innovative extensions to the platform and to deliver web-based solutions for data scientist who are keen on adding value to their work quickly, without compromises. The Research team at RapidMiner seeks passionate software developers to be part of our agile team, to develop innovative machine learning and predictive analytics solutions, shape the future of what is possible with machine learning, and to enable others to leverage these opportunities.   Your activities include:   Contribution to and responsibility for R&D projects with the goal to design and build innovative data mining algorithms, solutions, applications, and pilot projects. Collaboration with R&D project partners, i.e. universities, research organizations, and companies. Documentation of software, solutions, applications, and results. Support of the RapidMiner product development team and the overall RapidMiner team.    You will be contributing to one of our key projects by taking your fair share from conceptualizing an idea to bringing it into production. We understand that the developers are attached to the software they are building, so you are welcome to be vocal about your own ideas and about product decisions.   While we have a work-from-anywhere policy, we require the applicant to be in the same time zone as the rest of the team to support efficient collaboration. Since culture and in-person meetings are important to us as well, being located in Germany is preferred.   Major Responsibilities:   Work on innovative data mining and predictive analytics solutions in diverse industries. Cooperate with partners from various companies, research organizations, and universities. Develop innovative extensions for our predictive analytics software platform RapidMiner. Analyze new use cases and generalize your solution to create re-usable application templates. Take full responsibilities from the design and implementation of features to their delivery in our platform architecture. Help to ensure high source code quality and product quality by writing meaningful tests and reviewing your colleagues’ pull requests. Participate in product related discussions like backlog refinement meetings, weekly reviews, user tests, and discovery sessions. Being a full-stack developer, you master frontend and backend infrastructure and development. Help to grow the organization together by supporting other teams which are affected by your work.    About You  Requirements  You’re passionate about Java and React. You are also a team player who loves to work within a small and agile team to quickly provide high quality results that improve the life of users. You have distinctive analytical and conceptual skills and you enjoy working with innovative technologies. Plus, the ease of use of the software you’ve developed is important to you.   Required Skills  Here are some things we are looking for.   Keep in mind that this isn't a checklist – if you think you would be a good candidate, apply!   Analytical skills and the ability to translate application problems into data mining solutions Strong programming skills with modern software architectures Knowledge of Java Experience of Java back-end development and JavaScript front-end development Experience with frontend and backend development for web-based applications Experience with modern cloud architectures (SpringBoot etc.) Good verbal and written communication skills in English Ability to work in an agile team as well as autonomously    Nice to Have  We welcome applications by experienced software developers as well as by fresh graduates.   Experience in any of the following areas is a plus:   Experience with Spring offerings (Boot, Security, Data, etc.), Hibernate Experience with any of the modern JavaScript frontend frameworks, preferably React Experience with messaging and distributed services architecture Experience with any of the cloud providers, preferably AWS Experience building complex web applications using React Experience with Gradle, Jenkins, Jenkinsfile, Git, Docker Experience with Machine Learning algorithms and implementing ML-based solutions Experience with performing data science and machine learning projects Experience with the RapidMiner platform (e.g. as a user or as an extension developer) or other modern data science platforms and tools Machine learning libraries like scikit-learn, MLPy, TensorFlow, Keras, DL4J, etc. German language skills (optional)    Benefits  RapidMiner offers highly competitive salaries and development opportunities – all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment:   Flexible working hours and possibility to work from home if desired Modern office equipment (e.g. standing desks) Free beverages, fruit, and other goodies Table tennis and football table to challenge your peers after lunch Social events (e.g., escape rooms, office golf) Fantastic team of people    RapidMiner is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.   RapidMiner doesn't accept unsolicited agency resumes and won't pay fees to any third-party agency or firm that doesn't have a signed agreement with RapidMiner.

Title: Data Science & Cloud Application Specialist (m/f/diverse)
Description: Description  Developing the future. As ADAS operations lead plant we shape upcoming trends and work internationally together with our partner locations in China, USA, Romania, Lithuania, and the Philippines.   We are looking for you to support our area Safety and Motion   at the location, Ingolstadt.   Your tasks will focus on the following activities:    Conception and development of complex big data and data analytics software solutions in the operations area Responsibility for project management, implementation and rollout of customer-oriented software solutions using innovative technologies such as cloud services and web frameworks Utilize machine learning and artificial intelligence to optimize manufacturing processes Creation of tools, reporting- and monitoring-systems Application of business intelligence systems to improve our productivity and quality Drive and promote digitalization Coaching and coordination of worldwide colleagues and teams to build up manufacturing software and data analytics competencies and skills Coaching in agile software development and project management    Qualifications   Academic degree in computer science, information technologies or other comparable fields Strong experience in building web applications using relevant framework such as Angular, React or SignalR Experience in working with Microservice Architecture and in working with AWS cloud platform Experience in big data, data analytics and business intelligence methods and tools Experience of CI/CD tools and methodologies is a plus Knowledge in Python, R, R Shiny and data science toolkit such as Pandas Excellent written and spoken German and English language skills Self-motivation, detail-orientation, engagement, and strong sense of accountability Fun in development of solutions in future trend industry 4.0    Applications from severely handicapped people are welcome.   What We Offer  We want our employees to do well with us. That's why we offer them not only an exciting job in an international technology group, but also numerous additional offers such as flexible and hybrid working, sabbaticals and other benefits.   Click here to find out more.

Title: (Junior) Data Engineer - Remote (m/w/d)
Description: Um unsere Vision “gesunde Tiernahrung im Mainstream zu etablieren“ zu erreichen und auch in Zukunft beim Thema Digitalisierung immer einen Schritt voraus zu sein, benötigen wir motivierte Talente, Know-how von Experten und eine gehörige Portion „Passion for Pets and Technology“.   Deine Aufgaben   Du arbeitest an der Weiterentwicklung der Datenmodelle in unserem Data Warehouse und in Looker Du stellst den reibungslosen Betrieb unseres Data Warehouse und unserer ETL-Prozesse sicher Du entwickelst Software-Lösungen, die unsere datengetriebenen Prozesse vorantreiben Du berätst interne Abteilungen in allgemeinen Fragen zur Datenanalyse, zum Datenverständnis sowie zur Datenmodellierung   Wir suchen dich   Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik oder Natur- oder Ingenieurwissenschaft oder kannst eine vergleichbare Qualifikation vorweisen Idealerweise verfügst Du über erste relevante Berufserfahrung in einem ähnlichen Umfeld Du hast Erfahrung mit relationalen Datenbanken und SQL Du verfügst über ein Grundverständnis von Softwareentwicklung und mindestens einer für Automatisierung geeigneten Skript-Sprache wie Python Du zeichnest Dich durch Deine analytische, strukturierte und gewissenhafte Arbeitsweise aus und bist ein absoluter Teamplayer Deine fließenden Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch runden Dein Profil ab   Was dich bei uns erwartet   Verantwortungsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum in einem dynamischen und großartigen Team in München, Leipzig und Albourne mit ca. 230 Mitarbeiter und mehreren lieben Bürohunden Flache Hierarchien mit kurzen Entscheidungswegen, eine offene Unternehmenskultur und eine angenehme freundschaftliche Arbeitsatmosphäre (alle „per Du“) Flexible Arbeitszeiten & Mobile Office Regelungen, regelmäßige Team-Events & Mitarbeiter-Rabatte Kostenlose Getränke & Kaffee sowie Obst & Snacks   Interesse  Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung mit Motivationsschreiben und Lebenslauf sowie die Angabe Deines frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins und Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.

Title: Technical Support Engineer
Description: Summary    We are looking for a Technical Support Engineer  to join our team to help deliver an amazing experience to our global customers. This involves helping our highly technical customers use Rasa and debugging machine learning models. You are enthusiastic about working for a small, dynamic company and motivated by solving a challenging and extensive range of very technical and less technical problems. You have exemplary communication skills and are able to maintain good customer relationships. You are keen to take on new challenges and learn new technologies and skills. You will collaborate closely with Rasa's Engineering team to solve and address issues, while also helping to shape the product.   We have openings for this role in multiple locations. We're currently hiring in the  UK, Germany, or Serbia.   About You    You have experience with programming languages, ideally Python, strong experience with container based deployments, and have an understanding of machine learning basics. You are great at finding the root cause of a bug, when the obvious fix doesn't work you are quick to find a workaround.   You want to gain more experience with natural language processing, applied machine learning, and putting AI systems into production.   Please keep in mind that we are describing the background we imagine would best fit the role. Even if you don't meet all the requirements, yet you are confident that you are up for the task, we absolutely want to get to know you!  Things You Will Do  We're a startup, so you'll have lots of opportunity to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is required to support our mission. However, you can definitely expect to:   Respond to and troubleshoot customer queries reported in Zendesk Perform in-depth investigations, finding ways to reproduce and diagnose customer issues Take ownership of customer issues reported and see problems through to resolution Diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues, including bot configurations Work alongside engineering team to identify and propose solution Properly escalate unresolved issues to appropriate internal team (example: engineering) Advocate for the customer by passing on product feedback to the product team Use your learnings from our customers to help make our product more usable and valuable Contribute to develop and maintain our public-facing documentation Flexibility to cover a support rotation for Holiday coverage     Requirements    Experience working with Python or another programming language Good experience in a technical, client facing role Familiarity with machine learning concepts Excellent problem-solving and communication skills Ability to provide step-by-step technical help, both written and verbal Familiarity with remote desktop applications and help desk software (eg. Zendesk) BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or relevant field    Nice to have   Practical experience applying machine learning Strong experience with container based deployments (Docker, Kubernetes, Openshift etc) Experience applying NLP     What You Can Expect From Us    Flexible hours and a dedicated remote budget A stipend for personal development & 6 paid education days to help you grow within your role 26 days paid holiday per year A Macbook, and other Tech to help you to do your job We have regular remote team events, as well as regular remote social event. But we can't wait for off-sites to be in-person when it's safe again! In-person meetups are postponed due to Covid-19. Healthcare Benefits Options - Vitality Health (UK Only)     About Rasa    Rasa is the leading conversational AI platform, enabling enterprises to build next-level customer experiences. Rasa's conversational AI platform allows companies to build better customer experiences by lowering costs through automation, improving customer satisfaction, and providing a scalable way to gather customer intelligence. Rasa runs in production everywhere from startups to Fortune 500s, and provides the data privacy, security, and scalability needed by enterprises of every size. Rasa is privately held, with funding from Accel, Andreessen Horowitz, and Basis Set Ventures. www.rasa.com   Rasa is an equal opportunity employer. We are still a small team and are committed to growing in an inclusive manner. We want to augment our team with talented, compassionate people irrespective of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, physical or mental disability, or age.

Title: Full Stack Developer NodeJS/TypeScript/React (m/f/d)
Description: We are looking for a Full Stack Javascript Developer familiar with NodeJS, TypeScript, and React, who will drive our Web-Application. The Web-Application serves as the central place where stenon users are interacting with our data. It is responsible for collecting, evaluating, and visualizing spatial data over time, doing agronomic calculations like a fertilizer recommendation or how much CO2 equivalent is captured in soil, as well as exporting data into various formats, e.g. as a map that can be directly transferred onto a tractor. The application is written in TypeScript and consists of an Express backend that performs most of the heavy lifting with regards to geo-spatial data processing, handling file imports, and other functionality. The frontend is a React/Redux app (also written in Typescript) that handles GeoJSON data and renders it on a map using MapboxGL. We also utilize worker threads, socket communication, and d3 for data visualization.   Tasks   Design, build and maintain backend systems, including services and API interfaces that serve Web Front Ends as well as 3rd party DaaS-Integrations Improve our Single-Page Frontend(s) to make it easier for our users to plan measurement sessions, plot soil and satellite-based data on interactive maps, create actionable insights with very few clicks Be part of the ideation and product development together with Product and Design Define the technical roadmap together with the CTO and the VP of Software Engineering    Requirements    Customer Focused: You measure the success of your work with the actual value created for the user and the business. You don't consider your job to be done until you receive this feedback. Up To Code: You have more than 4 years hands-on experience with writing clean code in multiple languages (e.g. TypeScript/NodeJS, JavaScript) that not only works but is maintainable. You always strive to pick the appropriate tools and technologies for the given problem. End-to-end responsibility: If you work on a project, you care about the whole life-cycle: Ideation, planning, prototyping, coding, testing, deploying and fixing things in case they break. A Problem Solver: You enjoy solving challenging problems. You are comfortable starting with problems as the input to your work instead of highly detailed lists of tasks. You enjoy understanding problems in detail, becoming an expert in them and then working to implement solutions that can be validated with the team and our customers.    Benefits    A role within a highly productive and supportive team full of dedicated, hard-working professionals An agile work environment with flat hierarchies and an international team Working fully remote (within Germany) or from our Potsdam office The opportunity of being a valuable contributor to Stenon’s success Permanent full-time position with flexible work hours Laptop of your choice Coffee, tea, and snacks in our office ABC Berlin/Potsdam Travel pass   We are on a mission to make soil data accessible in real-time, thus changing how farmers can cultivate their land. To achieve this, we put our customers first and try to understand the challenges they have deeply. This understanding combined with world-class engineering has allowed us to build a game-changing product.We value transparency and honesty in our mission to develop an open and constructive company culture that allows our team to perform at the highest level. We strive to learn from each other and improve continuously.

Title: Software / Machine Learning Engineer
Description: Who we are:  At molab.ai, we accelerate the drug and compound discovery process for patients, people, and the planet by fusing cutting-edge AI technologies with latest insights from the natural science frontier. To this end, our team of excelling scientists has been developing data science models to predict molecular properties with market-outperforming accuracy. Now, together with top investors we have secured the funds to expand our team and elevate digital drug discovery to an entirely new level. If you are looking for a purpose-driven AI company that combines scientific excellence, impact and entrepreneurial drive, let’s create better molecules, faster, together!     What we are looking for:  We are seeking an experienced Software / Machine Learning Engineer to build the very infrastructure upon which our prediction models will run. You will lead our Data Engineering, Cloud Infrastructure and Development & Operations efforts working side-by-side with our excellent Data Science team. You will succeed in this endeavor with your outstanding mindset, both from an analytical, as well as entrepreneurial and personal perspective.     What you’ll specifically do:   Create, maintain and optimize the cloud architecture based on latest best practices for AWS/Azure/Google Manage the deployment within a hybrid setup of cloud and on-prem with a focus on securing the molab’s Intellectual Property Build and maintain the data infrastructure on which our top-notch models can run effectively & efficiently Manage and configure Linux-based servers and take over operations tasks     What you need to succeed:   3+ years of practical experience as Software or Data Engineer in top-notch environment Experience working with Cloud Infrastructure (e.g. Azure or AWS), virtualisation and containerisation environments (e.g. VMware, Docker, Kubernetes) Knowledge of the entire software development process including testing, continuous integration/delivery, automated deployment and verification/maintenance Experience with operating Linux-based systems, solid Bash scripting skills and application of configuration tools Solid development experience with application of Python, Pytorch, Numpy, Pandas, CUDA High-degree of ambition for self-improvement and self-initiative Very good written and spoken English     Any of the following is a plus:   Knowledge in applying Jupyter Notebooks Experience in data warehousing and data modeling Cluster computing with Apache Spark     What we offer:   Partly remote, yet fully interdisciplinary and exciting-to-work-with team (CET-friendly timezone), occasional team gatherings Merit-based, and outcome-oriented team culture, i.e. team effort, spirit, and success translate into substantial growth opportunities - we celebrate results over hours worked Competitive Salary Mentoring and personal development opportunities and budget Reserved time off to acquire new skills

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/x)
Location: Cologne Bonn Region, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany
Description: 👋🏼 Hello, we are dexter health!   We are an innovative healthtech start-up and want to improve the healthcare system and thus the health of all people. We have taken it upon ourselves to solve the lack of care  and other problems in hospitals and nursing homes by means of technology  , for which we have developed a voice user interface and smart speaker with an interdisciplinary team.   The global pandemic has revealed and highlighted a fractured system - the healthcare system. We have developed a Smart Speaker called dexter  to support healthcare professionals, especially nurses. We believe that nurses deserve to be at the forefront of tech and benefit from it. Do you agree?   Tasks  As a part of our team, you will...   Use and build ML pipelines and algorithms to improve our product Work on Speech-to-Text, Natural Language Processing, Dialogue Management, and Text-to-Speech, .. Track and analyze the status-quo of the literature and implement it Make this company your own and be responsible - Hands-on mentality! Learn about the healthcare sector and our customer's needs to better design our solution Report directly to our Chief Technology Officer Balance speed and quality, with a focus on tangible results.    Requirements    Do you think that the following lines describe you?   A relevant degree, experience as a ML Engineer (preferably 2-5+ years experience) Willingness to learn new skills and grow with the company You know common programming languages, concepts, and architectures (Python in particular) Experience working with cloud infrastructure and data pipelines Preferably interest in healthcare Attention to detail & excellent communication skills Able to work fully remote    Benefits    Flexible & remote (!) working hours Fair and competitive salary + attractive employee stock option plan Growth opportunities: lead your own team soon, become head of.. 😃? A diverse, interdisciplinary team and the chance to improve people's life and health The once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of something big 🌍? Choose your Equipment/Laptop 💻!   dexter health is fixing a broken healthcare system. We believe that by supporting nurses 👩🏻‍⚕️ with tech, we equip professionals to continue delivering the biggest good we have: health.   We aim to go big and global 🌍. This won't be a tiny company, we plan to become one of the biggest things in Europe. Do you want to be part of it?

Title: Junior Softwaredeveloper ML Computer Vision (m/w/d)
Description: IUNA AI ist ein Tech-Startup, das 2020 in Heilbronn gegründet wurde. Wir entwickeln intelligente Kamerasysteme und Bilddatenanalysesoftware auf Basis von Deep Learning. Mithilfe von Computer Vision automatisieren wir Prozesse in der industriellen Qualitätssicherung, wie z.B. die Oberflächenprüfung von Fahrzeugen. Dabei sind unsere Kunden u.a. große Automobilhersteller und deren Zulieferer. Um unser Wachstum in den nächsten Monaten noch weiter zu beschleunigen, brauchen wir jetzt Dich in unserem Team.   Aufgaben   Du nimmst maßgeblich Einfluss auf die weitere Entwicklung unserer Produkte und Software Du bist verantwortlich für die Architektur, Entwicklung und Pflege unserer Bilddatenanalysetools Du befasst Dich mit der Forschung und Entwicklung von Deep Learning-basierter Bilddatenanalyse Du arbeitest an der Standardisierung unserer Software, Weiterentwicklung unserer Kamerasysteme sowie Konzeptentwicklung bei neuen Anwendungsfeldern und Funktionen Im Rahmen der Auftragsabwicklung wandelst Du Trainingsdaten um und bereitest diese auf Du bringst Dein Wissen und eigene Ideen ein, um Herausforderungen bei der Produktentwicklung kreativ zu lösen   Qualifikation   Du hast Programmiererfahrung im Bereich C++ und Python Bestenfalls kennst Du bereits die folgenden Frameworks: Pytorch, OpenCV, Qt Du studierst im Bereich der Informatik oder vergleichbar (Bachelor/ Master), bei uns sind aber auch Autodidakten willkommen Du sprichst fließend Deutsch Knowhow und Interesse in den Bereichen Deep Learning und Data Science ist von Vorteil    Benefits    TEAM MIT VISION   Dich erwartet ein Team mit großen Visionen. Bei unseren Produkten gilt bei uns das Motto: Das beste oder nichts. Wir arbeiten alle auf Augenhöhe und versuchen uns immer gegenseitig zu unterstützen.   HAVE AN IMPACT   Bei uns kommt es auf jedes einzelne Teammitglied an. Du bist von Beginn an ein essenzieller Teil des Teams und trägst dazu bei unsere Ziele als Unternehmen zu erreichen.   WORK LIFE INTEGRATION   Wir vertrauen Dir. Bei uns hast Du die Flexibilität zwischen Office und Homeoffice zu wechseln oder auch mal ganz woanders remote zu arbeiten. Unsere Arbeitsatmosphäre ist sehr familiär und unser modernes Office bietet Dir alles was Du für einen angenehmen Arbeitstag brauchst.   Wir suchen motivierte Leute mit eigenen Ideen und Drive. Wir sind ständig dabei dazu zu lernen und uns als Personen sowie als Startup weiterzuentwickeln. Um diese Entwicklung zu beschleunigen, brauchen wir jetzt die richtigen Leute in unserem Team. Zeig uns, warum Du zu uns passt und warum Du für unser weiteres Wachstum wichtig bist.

Title: Werkstudent (m/w/d) im Bereich Softwareentwicklung mit Fokus Makros und Algorithmen
Description: Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied  Siemens Logistics ist eine 100-prozentige Tochtergesellschaft der Siemens AG. Siemens Logistics ist ein führender Anbieter innovativer und leistungsstarker Lösungen für die Flughafenlogistik. Das Portfolio umfasst Produkte und Lösungen für die Gepäck- und Frachtabfertigung, Software zur Digitalisierung der Logistikprozesse sowie ein umfangreiches Instandhaltungs- und Serviceangebot. Siemens Logistics ist mit regionalen Gesellschaften international vertreten und in mehr als 60 Ländern aktiv. Zu den Hauptkunden zählen namhafte Flughäfen und Fluggesellschaften weltweit.   Werden Sie jetzt Teil unseres Teams der Siemens Logistics  GmbH  als Werkstudent (m/w/d)  im Bereich Softwareentwicklung mit Fokus Markos und Algorithmen  in Nürnberg oder  Frankfurt am Main.  Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld - herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert  Als Werkstudent (m/w/d) sind Sie für folgende Aufgaben verantwortlich:    Als Teil des Teams wirken Sie bei der Erstellung von verschiedenen Algorithmen, beispielsweise für Pivot Tabellen, mit Sie beteiligen sich aktiv am Design einer Zuordnungstabelle zwischen mechanischen Fördertypen und elektrischen Ausstattungen und erstellen Algorithmen für die Verbindung Des Weiteren sind Sie zuständig für das Erstellen von Excel-Makros zum Abruf elektrischer Daten sowie das Testen von Funktionen Sie unterstützen außerdem bei der Berichterstattung und Dokumentation der Ergebnisse und nehmen an Alignment-Meetings teil   Ihre Qualifikationen - fundiert und adäquat   Sie absolvieren derzeit ein Bachelor- oder Masterstudium im Bereich Informatik, Data Science, Engineering oder vergleichbar Sie verfügen über fundierte Kenntnisse im Bereich der Entwicklung von Makros und Algorithmen Neben einer Affinität für technische Themen bringen Sie Wissen zur Industrieautomation von Produkten mit Im Umgang mit PowerPoint, Excel und Word sind Sie versiert, insbesondere in der Excel-Makroerstellung Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für Sie selbstverständlich Teamfähigkeit gepaart mit hoher Eigeninitiative sowie einer strukturierten und selbstständigen Arbeitsweise runden Ihr Profil ab   So treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt - einfach und direkt  www.siemens-logistics.com  , wenn Sie vor Ihrer Bewerbung mehr über Siemens Logistics GmbH erfahren möchten. +49 (7531) 86-2334  wenn Sie erste Fragen gerne persönlich mit unserer Personalabteilung klären möchten. Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung.   Organization:  Portfolio Companies   Company:  Siemens Logistics GmbH   Experience Level:  Student (Not Yet Graduated)   Job Type:  Part-time
