Title: Data Engineer (m/f/x) Automotive
Description: Reference Number: 50022668   Data Engineer (m/f/x) Automotive   What we do - And why!   You want to develop mobility for the future and for everyone. You want to redefine the boundaries of technology and think outside the box. You want to fully develop and enter the next level. Then you don't have to look any further!   We are a young, dynamic division of the FEV company. We are looking for people like YOU!  YOU are someone who …   Processes and manages large amounts of data Analyses and visualises data partly with Big Data methods and technologies Is Responsible for requirements management, system concepts and architecture, as well as implementation and testing Idealises diverse data sources and synthesises unstructured data with structured data Deployes cloud storage and services Programmes scripts for data processing and validation Developes customised solutions by embedding expertise in the automotive context and language    YOU have ...   A university degree in the field of data engineering, data science, computer science, natural or engineering sciences First practical experience in working with databases and in the field of data processing General knowledge in at least one of the areas of data engineering, machine learning, cloud computing, parallel programming, data protection, Hadoop ecosystems, etc. Good knowledge of programming languages such as Python, R, Scala, Java, Matlab etc. and SQL Experience in topics such as visualisation, Docker containers, edge computing is a big plus Business fluent English, German is a plus A high degree of flexibility, creativity, commitment, ability to work under pressure, motivation, ability to act independently and ability to work in a team    What we offer   Shape the mobility of tomorrow  Work on innovative and cutting-edge challenges.   Work flexibly  Our flexible model of scheduling work and our attractive remote-work-model will allow you to find a perfect balance between your personal and professional life.   Expand your horizons  Not only will working on new technologies every day help you improve yourself, but our continuing education program will also help you stay up to date at all times.   Experience Appreciation  An attractive base salary and numerous other benefits offer new opportunities for you.   And what else?  Whatever you need to face new challenges.

Title: Real-World Data Programmer
Description: Our Company  At Boehringer Ingelheim we develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company, we focus on long-term performance. We believe that, if we have talented and ambitious people who are passionate about innovation, there is no limit to what we can achieve; after all, we started with just 28 people. Now, we are powered by 50,000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture.   Tasks & Responsibilities   In your new role as “Real-World Data Programmer”, you will write respective sections of research protocols on data management, study reports and resulting publications for peer-reviewed scientific journals. Moreover, you will conduct verification and re-calculation of results from non-interventional studies (NIS) based on existing data, in close collaboration with the RWE Analyst and the Study Lead. In addition, you will develop and implement critical routine data quality and validity assessment and resolve database problems, queries and error reports in accurate and timely manner. One further task will be to maintain records for all assigned projects and archive project analysis and associated documentation following internal BI rules. Furthermore, you will apply the selected appropriate codes and algorithm for patient’s selection to build disease and / or product cohorts and ensure maintenance of the cohorts at each database update. In close collaboration with the IT team, you will: Assist in planning and implementing the data integration and data migration activities related to licensed-in data sources and in tracking of the dataset’s updates. Provide valid inputs in database architectural discussions. Assist in identifying process improvements for database performance, reliability and stability. Test database systems and perform bug fixes.    Requirements   Graduate degree (e.g., BS, Master) and/or post-graduate training in (pharmaco-) epidemiology, computer science, mathematics, statistics, biostatistics, and/or health-economics with a focus on applied statistics, econometrics or related fields Profound SQL, R, Python, SAS programming knowledge Mandatory experience on statistical-epidemiological programming and handling complex large real-world datasets from automated healthcare databases (EMR and / or claims) Knowledge of coding systems used in healthcare and pharmacovigilance databases (e.g., ICD9/10, CPT, HCPCS, READ codes, ATC classification, MedDRA, etc.) Knowledge of common data models (e.g. OHDSI OMOP) Knowledge of multifaceted internal validity checks in large databases Understanding of the principles of and experience in the design, conduct and issues in epidemiological/ observational research and/or Health Economics and Outcomes Research Aptitude to work under pressure, strong performance orientation, used to work in matrix structures Delighted to engage in a cross functional team English fluent (written & spoken)    EFFECTS OF COVID-19  We will continue to hire talented people and we look forward to receiving your applications. As a result of COVID-19, we have introduced alternative working arrangements to ensure that our employees can stay safe and healthy, because the health of our employees is among our top priorities. At all company locations, we work remotely whenever possible. Additionally, we are now hosting virtual video interviews for applicants. During the limited in-person interviews we still have during this time, we pay special attention to distance and the hygiene rules recommended by the Robert Koch Institute. New employees who do not start on site in production or the laboratories are sent the necessary IT equipment, our Welcome Days take place online, and we plan to conduct their onboarding training virtually whenever possible.   WHY BOEHRINGER INGELHEIM?  This is where you can grow, collaborate, innovate and improve lives.   We offer challenging work in a respectful and friendly global working environment surrounded by a world of innovation driven mindsets and practices. In addition, learning and development for all employees is key, because your growth is our growth. We also offer a competitive salary, generous amount of vacation time, and numerous benefits towards your wellness & financial health and work-life balance. Plus, an onsite gym (Ingelheim), in-house doctor and best-in-class cafeterias and coffee bars to keep you energized and healthy. To learn more about what benefits could be waiting for you, please visit our Career area .   Want to learn more about us? Visit https://www.boehringer-ingelheim.com/   Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment, which benefits our employees, patients and communities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.   READY TO CONTACT US?  Please contact our Recruiting EMEA Team, Tel: +49 (0) 6132 77-173173   Not exactly the position you are looking for but have someone else in mind? Share it via the button on the bottom of the page with friends or colleagues who might be interested.   Job  : Epidemiology  Primary Location  : Europe-DE-Rhinland-Palatinate-Ingelheim  Organization  : DE-BI International GmbH  Schedule  : Full-time

Title: VIE Perception Software Analyst
Description: Ready to tackle the challenges of the vehicle of the future? Join us and take part in the autonomous and connected car revolution at Valeo!   With more than 110,300 employees and a turnover of €16.4 billion, we are proud to have been the market leader in automotive suppliers for a century. The site of Germany in Bietigheim-Bissingen is focused on Comfort. Our department is looking for a VIE Software Developer for 12 months, within the R&D team.   Valeo's LiDAR organisation is embarking on an exciting journey. It makes automotive mobility a reality and ensures an entirely new level of safety on the road. We produce and develop cutting-edge technology on an international stage, shaping the future of the automobile.   At our Bietigheim-Bissingen site, we successfully develop innovative products that reinvent driving comfort and safety. To drive our growth and further development, we are looking for you to join our team.   Your challenges?   You will work on ADAS (Autonomous Driving & Assistance Systems) development with the evaluation of algorithm results (use cases, legal framework) You will work on perception software based on LiDAR systems You will work on acquiring new technologies coupled with their broad know-how in software development to design creative ideas for the optimization of development processes You make and implement development proposals You will do market analysis and market resource, competition evaluation and market trend analysis   Let’s talk about you…   You are graduated from a University degree/ Engineering degree in computer science, physics, mathematics, electrical engineering, natural or engineering sciences or comparable Ideally, you have experience in Python and C++ language Ideally, you also have a broad know-how in the area of programming libraries such as OpenCV, Qt. You have basic knowledge of neural networks, deep learning and machine learning You have a fluent level of English You have good communication skills, have an international mindset and are open-minded to new cultures and new ways of working and thinking You are humble, listening, positive attitude oriented, professional, and have the sense of diplomacy   Why Valeo?   To participate in innovative projects with our experts To be part of an inclusive and multicultural company For career opportunities at national or international level To be a committed link in favor of green mobility To find meaning in your commitment   => Recruitment process in several steps: first exchange with the talent acquisition specialist, interview with your future management and then with site human resources department. We are ready, and you ?   Primary Location  HCC2-DE-Baden Wurttemberg   Job  Research and Development   Organization  G02E Lidar DE Bietigheim-Wemding   Schedule  Full-time   Shift  Day Job   Employee Status  Fixed Term   Job Type  Cooperative / VIE   Job Posting  30/06/2022, 6:29:37 AM

Title: Full Stack Data Engineer (m/f/*)
Description: About Peregrine    Peregrine empowers teams to build a safer and more sustainable mobility ecosystem for all.   Bringing connected, perception-technology behind the windshield of any vehicle, Peregrine uses AI-powered video analytics to turn miles driven into valuable information. Peregrine’s unique visual data intelligence uses insights from the edge to identify road risk in commercial fleet operations, monitor traffic and understand road infrastructure.   Our Berlin-based diverse and international team brings together academic excellence and industry experience in robotics and autonomous driving from both Silicon Valley as well as from Europe - including leading automotive OEMs and suppliers such as Bosch, Volkswagen, HERE, and TomTom. We’re looking for smart, driven and passionate people motivated to solve hard problems. Are you ready to join us on this mission?   Tasks  As part of our development team, you will own our infrastructure engineering. This includes the design, development and contribution to the cloud infrastructure, web services and web apps of Peregrine, dealing with millions of data points gathered by our intelligent video telematics solution. The backend components are the backbone of Peregrine - responsible for collecting, combining and mining all kinds of data in order to generate and provide insights to our customers in an easily accessible way, through diverse API services. The frontends present the data to our customers by showing e.g. statistics, heat maps, etc. in a comprehensible and actionable format.    Requirements    Proven knowledge in developing, orchestrating and maintaining highly responsive and reliable web services, as well as the underlying related tools needed to maintain these services (e.g. experience on AWS, GCP or Azure with Kubernetes, Docker, Infrastructure As Code, ...) Expertise with big data, big data analytics databases and scalable data architectures Experience with design and development of web APIs and web apps (e.g. using Typescript, React, Node.js, Go, …) Knowledge of DevOps tools: CI/CD, scripting (e.g. Shell, Python,..), monitoring (e.g. Prometheus, ...). Experience with managing distributed infrastructures and knowledge in networking (routing, SDN) You develop with security and data privacy in mind You have a strong feeling for clean code and well-tested codebases You embody a collaborative, team first mindset Fluency in Git   We don’t expect anyone to check all these boxes mentioned above! If a few of these points apply to you, we definitely want to talk!    Benefits    We are committed to having a diverse and inclusive work environment as well as a flat organizational structure that promotes open communication. We value new opinions and ideas from all members of our team and foster a culture where we all learn from each other. We celebrate people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We encourage active participation in our design, innovation and development process. And of course we offer free drinks and snacks and flexible working time because we aim to create the working environment that we envision for ourselves, for everyone at Peregrine.   Notes on working at Peregrine in times of COVID-19 ---   The health of our team and their families has top priority. That’s why we have been choosing to work from home since mid of March 2020. Even more today, we want to enable the entire team to easily collaborate remotely as well as meet up for virtual social events.  Do you want to empower teams to build a safer and more sustainable mobility ecosystem for all using video analytics with us?

Title: Global Automation and Data Science Engineer
Description: Littelfuse is one of America’s Best Mid-Sized Companies (Forbes) and has been named one of the Best Places to Work in Illinois (Best Companies Group) for 11 consecutive years. With its global headquarters in Chicago, Illinois, USA, Littelfuse is a leading, global manufacturer of electronic components serving more than 100,000 end customers across industrial, transportation, and electronics end markets. We have more than 17,000 employees with operations in 15 countries. From semiconductors to sensors… switches to fuses and more… we produce billions of electronic components that help our customers empower a sustainable, connected, and safer world. In 2021, Littelfuse had net sales of $2.1 billion.   Reporting to Semiconductor Equipment Technology Manager, you as Global Automation and Data Science Engineer,  in a global, young, and agile team will actively co-design the future of Littelfuse systems. You will go out of predefined and specified automation structures and systems to provide your own unconventional ideas drawing new paths in digitalization, providing technical expertise and recommendations in assessing new software projects and initiatives.   About The Job   As Automation Engineer / Data Scientist of analytics and automation hub you are scraping, modeling, analyzing and visualizing data from a variety of data sources and you develop statistical/mathematical methods (e.g. data mining, predictive modeling, adopted machine learning) You will be the interface between the SBU Automation Team (Factory SW Systems) and IT (SW development) working closely with the different facilities to establish automatic data gathering while identifying and developing necessary APIs to support connecting more and more data sources for a digitalized automated manufacturing landscape You apply the latest information technologies within our Factory Systems environment to guide the digitalization towards Industry 4.0 You will create live dashboards and reports (Power BI/Python Stack on Azure) to drive harmonization of data analytics across the business unit     About You   Bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, business information technologies, robotics, automation, industrial engineering, or other similar physical science with high IT affinity Some experience in programming languages (e.g. .NET Core, C#, Angular, CI/CT, GIT, Java, Python, SQL, Flutter, Kotlin/Android) Understanding of development of data bank architectures, data bank inquiries (SQL) as well as data structure analytics methodologies Knowledge in hardware close programming (e.g. Raspberry, microcontroller) Good written and verbal communication skills in English Experienced in Semiconductor Factory Automation Systems would be beneficial Passion for machine learning and discrete optimization as well as statistical modeling support in the field of Business Intelligence (BI), physics, mathematics, or related fields Interests in automation systems and the integration of legacy systems/equipment with older interfaces such as RS232 would be a plus Analytical and team-minded     Littelfuse strives to empower associate growth and development in a culture of ongoing collaboration and respect for diverse global perspectives and expertise. Our Core Values – Customer Focus, Integrity, Innovation, Teamwork and Results Driven – supports us on our mission to improve the safety, reliability, efficiency, and performance of our customers’ products and systems.   We are an equal opportunity employer that takes pride in giving every associate the means and courage to make a difference – everywhere, every day.   We offer a competitive salary package and a variety of benefits, including work from home, flexible working hours as well as development opportunities.

Title: Data Visualization Specialist with focus on D3 - 40 Hours- Fixed
Description: Ready to shake up old habits from the corporateworld with AIand VR? Keen to go tech to the future and create the new norm of HR management? If yes, you just found THEplace to work!     Resourceful Humansis an award winning technology company ,creating bleeding edge performance management software to visualize companies as networksinstead of hierarchies. We create VR video games inspired by the adventures of great leaders. Our main goal is to support organizations on the quest to understand and benefit from the true potential of their (human) teams.     How could you contribute?     Able to deal with big amounts of data, and to create and edit visual content  including charts, and graphs in our app.   Transforming data sets  into compelling visuals through programming. Providing  visual, technical and editorial guidance.  Working closely with the Business and Tech team to help to develop the best insights  for the software users.   Meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.      Technologies:   D3.js  is a must JavaScript: React  and/or React Native (would be great) Data management: Apollo GraphQL An interest in three.js and VR web applications. These will be the next steps in our products. HTML5. Advanced CSS features such as animations, Grid CSS. CSS: Bootstrap and any other frameworks. Preprocessors: LESS, SASS.     The tools we use:React, React Native, Sentry, Github, Gulp and Webpack, npm, unit testing, e2e testing, integration testing.     As a new crew member in our development team, you ideally…   have +4 years software engineering experience  are self-organized, passionate & fully committed  speak English fluently  (fluent German  would be a plus) are caring  and think of others first are okay with Harvey  (the office dog)     Working at RH, but why?     We offer you a flexible and geeky work environment  with amazing coffee! :) (Flexibility means you can determine your working hours and where you work from as long as it is aligned with your crew and your contributions.) Competitive salary including a peer validated bonus  and employee shares  You will work in one of the coolest European cities: Berlin  You will be part of a crew that will impact  the way collaboration is approached at a large scale (inducing a shift in overall working culture) You will work in and shape a committed  and truly diverse, growing team You are never alone.  The crew members are always happy to support you. We aim to stay together until retirement or until a learning journey stops - but don’t worry, we have much room for learning and development  And… get an individual budget for development  that can be spent without any approvals      Curious? What are you waiting for? Apply and meet us.   Want to know more about us?check our website: https://resourceful-humans.com/

Title: IEG Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.  IEG Data Engineer (m/f/d)   Your Tasks And Responsibilities    Perform data mining, engineering and analytics on RWD sources, to inform our IEG strategic planning and support its execution Collaborate with research teams, including both internal and external stakeholders, to help translate business and research questions into observational studies with rigorous statistical and analytic plans Maintain efficiency and reliability of production of the critical datasets and engage with data scientists in data preparation and additional data connections Conduct quality control measures to ensure integrity of data and program design Establish links with other data engineers and data scientists across Bayer to form a learning community Build new as well as evaluate and improve existing solutions to support IEG across observational research functions    Who You Are    PhD, MSc or BSc in data science, engineering, computational science, (bio-) informatics, mathematics, statistics, physics, engineering, econometrics, machine learning and/or other related fields Experience in working with large volumes of health data as well as strong Python/R/Scala and good SQL skills Profound SQL/Pyspark skills and hands on experience with machine learning packages like Scikit Learn, Tensorflow, Pytorch, etc. as well as experience with big data platforms like Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, with based services (AWS S3, EMR, Glue) and with containers (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, EKS) Knowledge of workflow management tools like Airflow/Prefect/Dagster is a strong plus Knowledge of building ML Pipelines or MLOps Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Ability to solve problems and to structure, simplify, explain and communicate complex tasks Business fluent in English, both spoken and written   YOUR APPLICATION  This is your opportunity to tackle the world’s biggest challenges with us: Maintaining our health, feeding growing populations and slowing the rate of climate change. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something big. Be Bayer.   Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.   Location:  Germany : Berlin : Berlin   Division:  Pharmaceuticals   Reference Code:  407943

Title: Junior Python Software Developer (m/w/d)
Description: Wir sind die Positive Thinking Company. Wir suchen Dein Talent und Deine Leidenschaft zur Verstärkung unserer Developer Experten. Schließ dich uns an, entfalte deine Fähigkeiten und Talente und stecke unsere Community mit deiner Begeisterung und deinen Ideen an.   Was uns wichtig ist? Die 3 W’s: Wissensaustausch,Weiterbildungen und Weiterentwicklung. Interessiert? Dann wird’s jetzt spannend:   Aufgaben  Deine Leidenschaft   Programmierung von anspruchsvollen Anwendungen auf Basis von Python, Django, Flask Numpy Erfahrung mit den Machine Learning Libraries z.B. TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch Evaluierung und Implementierung neuer Techniken und Frameworks. Konzeption und Entwicklung neuer Features zur Lösung komplexer Kundenanforderungen durch Nutzung modernster Technologien Kommunikation mit dem Kunden sowie Aufnahme und Analyse von spezifischen Anforderungen fällt ebenfalls in Ihren Aufgabenbereich   Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kunden echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.   Qualifikation  Dein Talent   Abschluss, vorzugsweise in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftsmathematik oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung Erste Erfahrung in der Python-Entwicklung Kenntnisse des Python Framework Flask oder Django Vorkenntnisse und Erfahrung mit SQL- und NoSQL-Datenbanken oder Streaming-Plattformen (z.B. PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Apache Cassandra, Apache Kafka, usw.) Mind. 2 Jahre Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung und Testing Erfahrung in Datenverarbeitungsfunktionen Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region    Benefits    Unser Versprechen   Onboarding: Du bist ab dem ersten Tag intern vernetzt: Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentorenprogramm Entwicklung: Entwicklung ist bei uns individuell auf Deine Stärken ausgerichtet: regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online Trainingskatalog, Internationales Arbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Kulturen Work-Life Balance: Raum für Deine persönliche Lebensplanung (Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, hochflexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg) Events: fachlich und mit Spaßfaktor (Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern) Netzwerken: connecte Dich mit Deinen Kollegen: innen: Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions Fehlerkultur: mache Fehler und teste Dich aus: wir geben Dir den Freiraum neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten Prämien: eine Vielzahl an Prämien für Dein zusätzliches Engagement Weitere Vorteile: digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement   Schaue Dir gerne an, was Deine zukünftigen   Kollegen auf Kununu (https://www.kununu.com/de/positive-thinking-company1/kommentare)   über uns gesagt haben!   Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du dran.   Du hast noch Fragen? Kontaktiere uns gerne.   Bereit ein Positive Thinker zu werden? Dann geht es hier entlang.   Kein Kandidat wird jede dieser gewünschten Anforderungen erfüllen. Wenn deine Erfahrungen etwas anders aussehen und du denkst du kannst dieser Stelle einen anderen Mehrwert verleihen, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen.    Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du dran.  Hast Du Fragen zu Deiner Bewerbung bei PTC/Steep/Versett? Unser HR-Team beantwortet Sie Dir gerne, jeden Donnerstag von 12-13 Uhr unter der Telefonnummer 0151 72618189.

Title: Project Engineer(m/w/d), Vision Automation - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
Description: What To Expect    Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg marks a defining moment in Europe for Tesla’s mission of accelerating the world’s transition to sustainable energy. Here we will launch revolutionary products on a massive scale, using extraordinary speed, innovation and efficiency. Our employees will ensure that we achieve our goals, and we welcome you to help us write the next chapter of our success story. Tesla’s Vision Automation team is currently seeking a Project Engineer to master our automated defect detection systems and assist in expanding its capabilities. The Vision Automation team is part of the Vehicle Engineering organization. We own the centralized technical aspects of our multi-continent Gigafactory network and product line, including Tesla’s most important programs, such as the four S3XY models, Cybertruck, cell production, Robotaxis, Optimus, and new factories. The Vision Automation team plays a role in making the factories every bit as revolutionary as the products themselves. As a Project Engineer on the Vision Automation team, you will contribute to Tesla’s in-house efforts to purpose-build automated inspection systems. The ideal candidate will start learning our current technologies used for model training, deployment, and inspections. Once onboarding is complete, they will act as the subject matter expert of our defect detection system, and guide our engineering technicians in training and problem solving. As the Project Engineer for the local Gigafactory, you will be the project owner in taking new use cases from quality inspection engineering’s prototype through the stages of deployment and integration with manufacturing in order to be successfully maintained within Vision Automation’s existing local operation. In addition, you will assist in expanding the capabilities of our current automated detection system as the bridge between our quality inspection engineering team and operations team through successful teamwork, coordination, and by leaning on your basic understanding and aptitude for signal processing (especially image processing) and deep learning methodologies.    What You’ll Do    Learn how Tesla’s automated inspection systems currently work, then suggest and implement improvements using machine learning principles Drive special projects and new use cases from prototype to deployment to maintainable integration for the local Vision Automation operations team Work within the local Vision Automation technical operations team to deploy and maintain our fleet of automated inspection cameras as the local subject matter expert Investigate technical issues with inspection models that malfunction, then improve our process to set them up, maintain them, and respond to deviations Train new members of the technical operations team and create/improve upon the onboarding/training processes Work with the Vision Automation software team and product manager to define requirements based on processes that you develop in the field Own the process of model building for our automated defect detection system start to finish, using the quality inspection engineering team as subject matter experts    What You’ll Bring    A study in Computer Science or related field Basic understanding of computer vision fundamentals including but not limited to inference, deep learning, and object detection Experience in end-to-end machine learning solution design Experience in running tests, performing statistical analysis, and interpreting test results Willingness to work full time on a production floor environment What we offer: You will be working in our state-of-the-art Gigafactory where you solve the world's most interesting problems with the best and brightest people who share a passion to change the world. Tesla’s compensation package includes competitive salary and Tesla shares or bonusses. Typical benefits that are offered are a pension program, 30 vacation days, employee insurances, relocation and commuting support.

Title: Software Developer Frontend / Backend (m/w/d)
Description: Deine Aufgaben bei uns:    Du bist für die Konzeption, Implementierung und Entwicklung moderner Applikationen verantwortlich, ob webbasiert, mobil oder auf dem Desktop. Du unterstützt Kunden aus vielen Branchen dabei, Geschäftsprozesse konsequent digital zu denken und die zugehörigen Workflows darauf anzupassen. Du entwickelst neue Features, schreibst Tests und verantwortest Code Reviews. Du entwickelst in wöchentlichen Sprint-Zyklen und deployst regelmäßig. Du hast Spaß daran, Dein Wissen proaktiv mit neuen Kollegen zu teilen und Dich und Dein Team weiterzuentwickeln.    Wann Du zu uns passt:    Du kannst einen Abschluss in Informatik / Informationstechnik oder eine Berufsausbildung mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung nachweisen. Die 16 Sustainable Development Goals haben für Dich nichts mit Fussball zu tun. Git, Quasar, DOM, Java, Scala, SQL, Docker, Jira sind für Dich keine Fremdworte. Du bist als Frontend- oder Backend-Entwickler spezialisiert oder bringst den Full Stack mit. Du konntest praktische Erfahrungen mit agilen Entwicklungsmethoden sammeln und hast Spaß daran. Du schätzt eine systematische und strukturierte Arbeitsweise und bringst analytische Fähigkeiten mit. Du bringst vielleicht eine besondere technologische Fähigkeit, Kenntnis oder Erfahrung, z.B. aus Machine Learning, KI oder Datenanalyse bei uns ein. Du bist ein offener und facettenreicher Mensch – hinter Dir steckt mehr als nur Code. Du sprichst und liest Deutsch mindestens auf dem Niveau C1.    Was wir Dir bieten:    Brayn.io setzt digitale Geschäftsprozesse für unterschiedliche Branchen um: Abwechslung ist garantiert! Du arbeitest in einem motivierten Team, wo „Lean“ und „Agil“ gelebte Praxis sind. Unser Standort ist in Berlin und wir gestalten unsere Arbeitsweise so flexibel, dass wir uns einmal pro Woche im Office treffen. Dennoch haben wir aber inzwischen Kolleginnen und Kollegen deutschlandweit. Daher ist die Entscheidung schlussendlich bei dir, wie oft Du ins Büro kommen möchtest. Unsere Wege sind kurz und nicht hierarchisch - daraus entsteht ein Team-Klima, in dem wertvolle digitale Produkte entstehen. Unsere Open-Door-Policy fördert aktiv den offenen Dialog. Wir fördern individuelle Entwicklungs- & Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten in Deinem Fachgebiet. Wir bieten mehrere Add-Ons im Arbeitsvertrag und wenn du mal vor Ort dabei sein solltest, gibt es auch gratis Kaffee, Tee, Obst und Snacks :-)  Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig wo wir nur können und erfüllen eine gemeinsame Mission.   Wir wachsen – nutze die Chance und wachse mit uns.   Wir von brayn.io sind passionierte Digitalisten. Wir bauen nicht nur Software, Plattformen & Lösungen - wir sorgen auch dafür, dass diese erfolgreich in der Praxis „funktionieren”. Neben einer hohen Coding- und Technologie-Expertise verfügen wir über alle relevanten digitalen Kompetenzen, um Geschäftsmodelle oder Projekte stabil zu konzipieren, umzusetzen und zum Erfolg zu führen. Das sagen natürlich viele andere auch, aber wir haben es einfach gemacht! Wenn es richtig rockte, haben wir uns selbst als Unternehmer daran beteiligt.  Unsere kurzen Projekte mit qualitativ hochwertigen MVPs für die Gründer- und Startup Szene sind vielfältig und bringen viel Abwechslung. Wir sind zuständig für die Digitalisierung von Werkzeugen und Prozessen für Firmen, die bereits langjährig am Markt sind. Wir haben sogar unser eigenes Produkt entwickelt, dass wir als SaaS Lösung vertreiben.  Kurzgefasst: Agilität und Lean Management sind für uns keine Buzz Words - wir leben diese Kultur täglich. Für erfolgreiche Digitalprojekte benötigt man Passion und brayn.io.  Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt und du glaubst, dass du in unser dynamisches Team passen würdest? Dann bewirb dich jetzt!

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d) in Allianz Partners in Munich
Description: Job Purpose/Role  Reporting to the Head of Analytics, you as Data Engineer will be supporting us with our ambitions in data analytics, predictive modelling and data quality improvements. You’ll help to support the ambitious growth & profitability targets. We have recently launched an to enhance the technical excellence in all core insurance domains like underwriting, sales, operations, and claims of all lines of business (Automotive, Travel, Assistance and Health).      As part of this initiative a team is developing state-of-the-art machine learning models in cooperation with the subject matter experts in the lines of business, hence we need you with your high expertise in building, enhancing and maintaining reliable and performant data pipelines to supply our analytical solutions.       Key Responsibilities  As the data engineering expert you will be responsible for raw data analysis, for the design and implementation of data collection pipelines and data quality improvement, as well as for contributing to the core data model.       Build data pipelines for holistic solutions to bring together data from various systems with different granularity to create a data environment which can be used for analytics and further applications, e.g., dashboards and reports Work on integration and harmonization of external data sources to augment our internal data Contribute to a global core data model and how to create, maintain and continuously refine and extend it Collaborate with business experts to understand our data and its quality, how it is generated and can be utilized Investigate new data technologies and collaborate with other Allianz Group functions and Operating Entities to adopt state-of-the-art technology in accordance with Group standards Participate in internal & interdisciplinary projects Collaborate with colleagues from international operating entities, hub functions as well as other Allianz Partners or Allianz Group departments on ad-hoc basis       Key Requirements/Skills/Experience  Qualifications:   University degree in a numerical field, preferably with a strong focus on Computer Science or Data Engineering or qualified by experience Excellent verbal and written English required; proficient German as well as additional foreign language skills are of advantage Proficient user of Python and SQL; additional programming languages and knowledge of BI tools of advantage       Experience & Key Skills:   Proven history of data model design and implementation Experience in developing in Python and SQL Ability to take over responsibility, develop concepts and drive models into implementation Willingness to think out-of-the box and search for external data to improve model quality Experience in working in a fast-paced, dynamic and international environment Intercultural sensitivity and international experience Highly developed interpersonal skills (i.e. communication, presentation and negotiation)      Strong internal candidate identified       What we offer  Our employees play an integral part in our success as a business. We appreciate that each of our employees are unique and have unique needs, ambitions and we enjoy being a part of their journey.      We are there to empower and encourage you with your personal and professional development ensuring that you take control by offering a large variety of courses and targeted development programs. All that in a global environment where international mobility and career progression are encouraged. Caring for your health and wellbeing is key priority for us. This is why we build Work Well programs to providing you with peace of mind and give the flexibility in planning and arranging for a better work-life balance.      Allianz Partners is a world leader in B2B2C insurance and assistance, offering global solutions that span international health and life, travel insurance, automotive and assistance. Customer driven, our innovative experts are redefining insurance services by delivering future-ready, high-tech high-touch products and solutions that go beyond traditional insurance.      Our products are embedded seamlessly into our partners’ businesses or sold directly to customers, and are available through four commercial brands: Allianz Assistance, Allianz Automotive, Allianz Travel and Allianz Care. Present in 75 countries, our 21,100 employees speak 70 languages, handle over 71 million cases each year, and are motivated to go the extra mile to offer peace of mind to our customers around the world.      We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.      We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.      Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

Title: Anwendungsentwickler / Developer (m/w/d)
Description: Vertragslaufzeit:unbefristet   Arbeitszeit:Vollzeit   Einsatzort:Düsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, München, remote (deutschlandweit)   Eintrittstermin:zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt      d-fine ist ein kontinuierlich wachsendes europäisches Beratungsunternehmen mit über 1.000 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern. Wir sind mit acht Standorten in vier Ländern nah bei unseren Kunden. Im Fokus unserer Projekte liegen quantitative Fragestellungen rund um Data Analytics, Data Science, Modellierung und den Aufbau nachhaltiger technologischer Lösungen. Unser Beratungsansatz basiert auf langjähriger Praxiserfahrung und dynamischen Teams mit klarer analytischer und technologischer Prägung.      Die d-fine IT-Abteilungsucht zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen engagierten Anwendungsentwickler (m/w/d)zur Verstärkung unseres internen Developer-Teams.    Sie möchten Ihre Erfahrung und Kenntnisse in der Entwicklung maßgeschneiderter Tools für unsere Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen einbringen und Teil eines erfolgreichen und expandierenden Beratungsunternehmens werden?    Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt!       Aufgaben   Allein oder zusammen mit dem Team entwickeln Sie speziell auf die Anforderungen interner Abteilungen zugeschnittene Software In unserem ERP-System erstellen und optimieren Sie ETL-Jobs und Reports, erkennen und beheben Fehlerursachen und leisten den 3rd-Level-Support Test und Implementierung von Anwendungen in unserer Systemumgebung Dokumentation, ggf. Weiterentwicklung der Tools anhand von Feedback unserer Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter     Anforderungen   Abgeschlossenes Studium oder eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung im Bereich IT/Informatik Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Web-Front- und -Backends (Angular, React oder Vue.js) Sicherer Umgang mit SQL (MS SQL, Queries, Stored Procedures) sowie Kenntnisse in MS SQL Integration Service runden Ihr Profil ab Praktische Erfahrung mit Reporting Tools und sicherer Umgang mit MS Excel werden vorausgesetzt Grundkenntnisse in der Server-Administration (MS Windows Server) Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Prozessverständnis sowie ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung Eigenständige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise sowie die Bereitschaft zum selbstständigen Einarbeiten in neue Technologien Teamfähigkeit, Flexibilität und ausgeprägte Kommunikations-Skills       Wir bieten   Einen modernen Arbeitsplatz in Frankfurt, München oder Düsseldorf und die Möglichkeit, remote zu arbeiten Eine abwechslungsreiche und verantwortungsvolle Tätigkeit, lockere Teamatmosphäre und offene Kommunikation Flache Hierarchien, ein kollegiales Betriebsklima und kurze Entscheidungswege Freiraum und Flexibilität bei der persönlichen Arbeitsgestaltung (z. B. Mobile Work Policy) Attraktive Sozialleistungen (30 Tage Jahresurlaub, betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Fahrtkosten- und Verpflegungszuschuss etc.) Individuelle Trainingsmöglichkeiten und regelmäßiges Feedback Tolle Mitarbeitenden-Events und vieles mehr      Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung inklusive der Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung und Ihres möglichen Eintrittstermins.    Bei Fragen stehe ich Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung   Ihre Ansprechpartnerin:Frau Michaela Barcza   Telefon:+49 69 90737 556   E-Mail: careers.cs@d-fine.de

Title: Data Scientist
Description: As a Data Scientist at QuantCo, you will learn what it takes to create impact from data: identifying the right framework to translate a business question into a statistical problem; locating and combining data sources as well as transforming large datasets; running in-depth analyses; building machine learning models that automate large-scale decisions and integrating them into live business processes; and interpreting, visualizing, and communicating results to internal and external stakeholders.    Aspiring data scientists should be team players with excellent quantitative abilities and:     A degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, industrial engineering or similar fields from a leading university Experience in coding and working with data using a wide range of tools and languages: Python (Pandas, XGBoost/LightGBM), R (dplyr, ggplot2), and git Bonus: SQL, Tensorflow/Keras, Cloud infrastructure, Docker, and a lower-level language like C/C++/C# In-depth understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts behind most common machine learning techniques Ability to see solutions and opportunities that others do not see High level of commitment and reliability, good balance of pragmatism and perfectionism Business proficiency in English and ideally conversational proficiency in German     Compensation  We are looking for exceptionally motivated and highly skilled candidates for available data scientist positions. We offer a generous compensation package that includes a base salary, bonus, and stock options along with additional benefits based on location.     About QuantCo  We leverage expertise in data science, engineering, and economics to help organizations turn data into decisions. Started by 4 PhDs from Harvard and Stanford, we are now more than 90 professionals with extensive quantitative, engineering, and business experience.    QuantCo’s product line includes algorithmic pricing, data-driven claims management, and high-dimensional forecasting solutions. Our clients are some of the largest financial, retail, and healthcare organizations in the U.S. and Europe.    We are excited about writing code that affects millions of people and impacts billions of dollars. If you feel the same way, we look forward to hearing from you.     QuantCo does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Software Developer Full Stack (m/f/d)
Description: Hi! We’re happy that you’re here.  PRIOjet Logistics, the SaaS-platform for arranging and processing extremely time-critical logistics orders, is the trusted partner all over the world for companies, logistics agencies, service providers, and on-board couriers AND possibly your next great place to work.   What if spare parts, important production components, documents for immediate and safe delivery or medicines must be transported around the world directly, no matter what? In time-critical logistics, a courier jumps on the next plane for the delivery. PRIOjet Logistics brings all parties on one platform and offers them all the tools they need to excel. What has previously been a tangled combination of phone calls, SMS, chats, emails and faxes, is now conducted via a mobile and scalable SaaS solution.   Aufgaben  The Challenge  Our cross-discipline team builds and run a leading-edge platform for the international very sensitive emergency logistics sector. Hence, for our success, high-quality software development is a very important aspect.   We are looking for a great Software Developer with some years of experience as Full Stack Developer working on Backend, Web and Mobile, and anything it takes to delight users and solves problems, to join our growing team in Hamburg or part-remotely. This position offers the opportunity to possibly receive company shares (VSOP).    Your Key Responsibilities    Build across the full stack, from backend APIs to mobile and web frontend user interfaces to deliver end-to-end solutions based on user requirements and objectives by working on our NestJS (Node) backend written in Typescript in connection with out React Native (expo . io, also Typescript) frontend apps. Plan, architect and implement new features in our backend. Be a part of decisions about architecture and features of the apps. Influence the development roadmap with the development team and be able to prioritize. Implement, iterate and release features in a cross-functional team. Be self-driven and come up with new ideas on how to improve our product. Connect the dots on your own and be able to fill in the gaps as necessary. Pay attention to detail when needed and break complex tasks into smaller chunks without losing sight of the bigger picture. Don't accept quick and inaccurate solutions but find a good balance in software development (usability, maintainability, extensibility, usability, acccuracy, reliability, etc.). Extend and maintain our GraphQL API. Integrating third-party services and APIs into our system. Work with our product owners to deliver high-quality UI and UX. Build reusable, scalable, and reliable software solutions. Build the technical documentation and contribute to the internal knowledge and codebases.   But that´s not all.  There is also a part which is up to you: What are you passionate about? What do you want to learn, and where else would you like to contribute?   Qualifikation  What we’re looking for:   3+ years of relevant experience as a Full Stack Software Engineer in building scalable backends (e.g. Python, NodeJS, Ruby, Go) as well as frontend apps using React/ReactJS/ React Native or similar frameworks. Experience in functional, object-oriented and other programming paradigms as well as the appropriate use and application of software patterns in the code. B.Sc or M.Sc in Computer Science, Information Systems or similar technical discipline. Additional experience in HTML, CSS, Javascript, Typescript, Expo. io, Mobile apps, CI/CD, DevOps, Docker, functional approach in React using Hooks. Experience as a software architect (database, APIs, service architectures) with a profound database knowledge (e.g. Postgres, MySQL, NoSQL), Linux/Unix skills, Cloud Services (Azure, AWS or/and Google Cloud), Git Workflows, and Dev/Ops is required. Knowledge of security best practices and understanding the most common security vulnerabilities. Experience with Agile Software Development Techniques and Tools. Experience in debugging, testing, and problem-solving skills. Professional written and verbal fluency in English, same in German will be a plus but not a must have.   Who you are:   You have a hands-on attitude as a builder and maker – not a theorist. You are self-motivated. You take initiative, are naturally curious, and can learn new things quickly while continuing to deliver value on the job. You are a shipper. You respect deadlines, accomplish your work autonomously, and have experience setting a positive example for self-management to your team members. You are people-centric. You can thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts, and enjoy helping others grow. You are open to new ideas, demand and act upon feedback, are always constructive and are radically honest about the state of things.   It would be great if you also have:   Experience to work in a small and high motivated team of developers. Experience working with international and/or distributed teams. Knowledge in Data Science and/or Business. Professional written and verbal fluency in German.    Benefits    A chance to work in a great start-up on an exciting problem space that becomes more and more important in an ever more connected world and supply chain. A diverse international team backed by international investors. Flexible schedule & remote-friendly workplace culture. Team activities. In addition to the salary, we have the option of a VSOP program. Optionally, we offer cash allowance for lunch or private internet connection. And sure, free warm and cold drinks and some fruits in our office in Hamburg and Frankfurt ;)   PRIOjet's mission enables a wide scope for personal growth and development for experienced, creative and motivated talents who work independently and reliably towards the common goal.   If this looks like a great match for you to be a part of a growing Start-up, please get in touch with us as soon as possible.  Quick tip: Please make sure to send us your CV and to tell us briefly and informally why you are the perfect match for PRIOjet.   Looking forward to getting to know you. Talk soon!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer: Natural Language Processing (NLP) at l1r1 technologies GmbH
Description: l1r1 changes the way humans use software. l1r1 builds a system that understands human language and executes tasks automatically in the domain of business software.   We are l1r1 and we are building a cognitive AI for your business. Software today needs to be directed by humans, it does not plan and execute by itself. You as a user do not have to use software any longer via an interface but with pure verbal communication. Therefore, we are building a cognitive system by combining semantics, AI and language technology. We are not inventing something new, but we are using current software in such a way that it uses its full potential.   We need highly qualified employees that take the lead and responsibility to build something great. The top experts are needed.   Tasks  Mission:  Engineer for the development of NLP services.   Outcomes:   Design APIs for a set of AI services, including classification, recognition, extraction and sentiment analysis. Implement services for these APIs. Identify, evaluate and train language models. Harden services using A/B testing. Optimize.    Requirements    Competencies:   language models transformer models NER model fine tuning pipeline design coding experience independent logical thinking linguistically talented interested in engineering creative problem solving analytical structured persevering team player > solo star flexible    Benefits    l1r1 is an ambitious start-up built by a team of experts. The benefits are:   ambitious idea -> the leverage is high experienced team (2 successful IPOs) one of the first 10 employees -> you shape the company you get % of the company great environment to learn and grow you get responsibility from day one   We are looking forward to hearing from you.

Title: Fullstack Web Developer (react) (m/w/d) at LIFEBONUS Gesundheitsmanagement GmbH
Description: Du bist Fullstack Web-Entwickler:in (m/w/d), hast Erfahrung mit React und möchtest die Verantwortung für die Entwicklung von Web-Anwendungen übernehmen, die sowohl intern als auch im Produktbereich zum Einsatz kommen?Du möchtest außerdem etwas Sinnvolles tun und deine Fähigkeiten für eine Gruppe von Arbeitnehmern einsetzen, die lange Zeit vernachlässigt wurde? Hier ist deine Chance, unser analoges Gesundheitsprogramm für Pflegekräfte zum digitalen Leben zu erwecken.   Wir entwickeln eine innovative videobasierte Bewegungsanalyse zur Schulung von Pflegekräften und suchen Unterstützung, um unserem Machine Learning Team bei der Entwicklung interner webbasierter Tools unter die Arme zu greifen.   Zudem wirst du bei der Entwicklung der Weboberfläche zur Verwaltung unserer Gesundheits-App aktiv werden.   Aufgaben   Wir suchen dich zur Unterstützung unseres Machine Learning Teams: Deine primäre Aufgabe ist die Weiterentwicklung einer Web-App, die das Team verwendet, um ihre Datensätze von Videos zu verwalten. In enger Absprache mit dem Team kümmerst du dich selbstständig um die Umsetzung neuer Features im Frontend (TypeScript, React) und im Backend (Python, Django). Mittel- bis langfristig wirst du uns auch bei der Entwicklung einer der Weboberfläche unterstützen, die zur Verwaltung unserer mobilen App für Pflegekräfte zum Einsatz kommt.   Qualifikation   Du hast 2-5 Jahre Erfahrung in der selbstständigen Umsetzung moderner Webapplikationen im Frontend und Backend Du hast bereits intensiv mit dem Frontend Framework React gearbeitet und fühlst dich sicher im Umgang mit dem gängigen Tooling Erfahrung mit JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js, HTML, und CSS Idealerweise hast du bereits mit Python und Django gearbeitet, oder hast zumindest Interesse, dich in diese Technologien einzuarbeiten Fit im Umgang mit REST APIs und verwandten Standards Du bringst Database Basics im SQL und NoSQL Bereich mit Du möchtest mehr als nur statische Websites bauen. Dass man in JavaScript auch interaktiv mit der Webcam-Schnittstelle des Browsers arbeiten kann, schreckt dich nicht ab, sondern begeistert dich Nice to have: Erfahrung mit D3.js oder einem ähnlichen Visualisierungs-Werkzeug Mit der Kommandozeile fühlst du dich wohl. Bash Scripting, SSH und Git sind Tools, die du sicher benutzen kannst, um deine tägliche Arbeit zu unterstützen. Erfahrung mit automatisiertem App Testing und dem üblichen Tooling (unit testing, e2e testing, integration testing) Erfahrung mit CI/CD build und deployment pipelines (Github Actions, Docker, AWS) Vertrautheit mit Web Application Security und Data Privacy Konzepten Du arbeitest selbstständig und bist in der Lage, in Absprache mit dem Team Features selbst zu definieren und umzusetzen. Du fühlst dich in einem Team wohl, indem sowohl Deutsch als auch Englisch gesprochen wird. Du selbst sprichst mindestens Englisch    Benefits    Ein internationales Team mit unterschiedlichsten Persönlichkeiten mit offenem, herzlichem und wertschätzendem Umgang Flache Hierarchien und schnelle Entscheidungswege Flexible Gestaltung der täglichen Arbeitszeit (Gleitzeit) und Arbeiten im Homeoffice Ein Büro direkt im Terminal des Hamburg Airport Individuelle Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten Verschiedene kostenfreie Benefits: Nutzung unseres Fitnessstudios, Getränke und Obst, Beratung durch unsere BGM-Ärztin Mögliche Zimmeranmietung in unseren Werkswohnungen bei Bedarf oder eine günstige Mietwohnung Keinen Stillstand – wir entwickeln uns, unsere Produkte immer weiter und sind immer auf der Suche nach neuen Trends, die zu uns passen Arbeitsplatz in einer Zukunftsbranche   Wir freuen uns dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Software Development Consultant (all genders)
Description: Cologne here we come! Kölle Alaaf!     What does it mean to be an IT Consultant in Software Development at Netlight?    As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the software products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow together with your team at the client. We care not only for the digital product but also for the team and the business. Based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest and market needs it is your call how your career at Netlight will develop, ranging from which clients you will work with and what role you want to take. Your mentor, coach and Netlight network (1800 Netlighters) will help you with that. We will grow together technically and personally and unleash the potential in each other.    You have the chance to work in fields such as Fullstack, Backend, Frontend, Web Development, System Development, Cloud, Mobile Development, Architecture, Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, Data Science, DevOps, Infrastructure, Scrum Master, Agile Coaching, Product Owner, UX-/UI-/Interaction Design and more.       Netlight    We know that if we want to be at the forefront of digitalisation, we have to rely on people. That is why we have an organisation built on trust and responsibility, with a comprehensive personal development program that works without bosses. Ever wondered how that works?  When our consultants work on-site with our local-only clients (no travelling needed #sustainability), they have all of Netlight’s combined (tech) knowledge available (more than 1800 Netlighters across Europe), never afraid of turning to each other for input – because knowledge sharing, diverse experiences, equality and personal values are what working at Netlight is about.    “The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.”     Minimum Qualifications   Master’s Degree in Computer Science, IT, Technology or similar OR a Bachelor degree in Computer Science, IT, Technology or similar plus 2 years of full-time working experience in a relevant IT-field Verbal and written proficiency in English Working student and/or internship experience in agile software engineering roles Living or willing to move to Collogne - no travelling required!       DON’T BE SHY–GET IN TOUCH WITH US!     If we find that your profile matches what we are looking for, you will hear from us within two weeks of applying.    We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: (Junior) IT Application Specialist (w/m/d)
Description: Begleite KPMG bei den zukünftigen Herausforderungen unserer Kunden und Kundinnen. Begeistere auch Du Dich für die Vielfalt unserer Fragestellungen - und mach gemeinsam mit uns den Unterschied. Die KPMG IT Service GmbH ist die IT-Beratung und -Dienstleistung der KPMG AG Wirtschaftsprüfungsgesellschaft. Du verantwortest gemeinsam mit Deinem Team die IT-Infrastruktur und unterstützt die Fachabteilungen bei der Bereitstellung von effizienz- und effektivitätssteigernder Business Software.   Deine Aufgaben  Du denkst nicht in Problemen, sondern gehst lösungsorientiert jede neue Herausforderung an? Dann kannst Du Dich hier einbringen:    Du übernimmst als (Junior) IT Application Specialist (w/m/d) die Administration und Implementierung von fachspezifischen Anwendungen. Die eigenverantwortliche Analyse und Behebung von Störungen sowie die Koordination von Serviceanfragen im 2nd/3rd Level Support gehören ebenfalls zu Deinen Aufgaben. Du spielst Updates, Hotfixes und neue Releases ein und übernimmst die dazugehörige Abstimmung. Du begleitest die Applikationen über den gesamten Application-Life-Cycle. Darüber hinaus bist Du für Anforderungsanalyse, Bewertung neuer Requirements, Umsetzung und Überführung in den Betrieb zuständig. Du verantwortest den Betrieb von Plattformen für Datenlösungen. Du pflegst und erstellst die Dokumentationen und die teaminterne Wissensdatenbank. Die kontinuierliche Mitarbeit an aktuellen Projekten sowie die Weiterentwicklung bestehender Anwendungen fallen ebenfalls in Dein Aufgabengebiet. Du automatisierst und optimierst bestehende Prozesse und Schnittstellen. Du unterstützt und berätst bei technischen Fragestellungen.    Dein Profil   (Junior) IT Application Specialist (w/m/d) wirst Du bei uns mit einem abgeschlossenen Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung und/oder einer informationstechnischen Ausbildung (z. B. Fachinformatiker:in – Systemintegration). Du bringst fundierte Kenntnisse in der Administration von Datenbanken (MS SQL-Server) und Webservern (Internet Information Service) mit. Du verfügst über praktische Erfahrungen bei der Durchführung von IT-Projekten und der Überführung von Anwendungen in den produktiven Betrieb. Einen sicheren Umgang mit Microsoft Technologien (Windows Server, Microsoft SQL Server, Internet Information Service) und gängigen Web Technologie setzen wir voraus. Du bringst bereits Erfahrung in der Analyse von Problemen in Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Fachbereichen sowie in der Erarbeitung und Umsetzung von Lösungskonzepten mit. Idealerweise hast Du bereist Praxiskenntnisse im Bereich von Datenplattformen wie Power BI und Alteryx sammeln können. Von Vorteil sind erste Erfahrungen mit dem Microsoft Business Intelligence Stack (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI Report Server). Du verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift. Deine eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise sowie Motivation für variantenreiche Aufgaben und Projekte zeichnen Dich aus. Dein Geschick im Umgang mit Menschen, Deine gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit und Freude an der Arbeit im Team runden Deine Qualifikationen ab.    Deine Benefits   Willkommen im Team  Damit Du von Beginn an voll bei uns durchstarten kannst, begleiten wir Dich mit strukturierten Onboarding-Maßnahmen während der gesamten Orientierungsphase. Zudem fördert Deine Führungskraft gezielt Deine fachliche und persönliche Integration ins Team. Vielfältige Karriereperspektiven  Wir legen Wert auf die individuelle Entwicklung Deiner fachlichen und persönlichen Stärken: Deine eigenen Ambitionen reflektieren wir in strukturierten Entwicklungsgesprächen. Systematische und regelmäßige Feedback-Gespräche unterstützen Dich beim Erreichen dieser Ziele. Mit unserer Vielfalt an spannenden Kunden und Kundinnen sowie Fragestellungen bieten wir Dir interessante Karrieremöglichkeiten und somit wertvolle Einblicke in die Vielfalt unserer Tätigkeitsbereiche. Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Privatleben  Wir sind überzeugt, dass es vor allem Vielfalt und Flexibilität braucht, um Innovationen zu fördern und langfristige Erfolge zu sichern. Nur so können wir die besten Ideen entwickeln und wirklich innovative Lösungen finden. Mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, Homeoffice-Option, Zeitkonten und Auszeiten schaffen wir Räume, um Privat- und Berufsleben miteinander zu vereinbaren. Darüber hinaus unterstützen wir Dich monatlich mit bis zu vier Stunden Freistellung für Dein soziales Engagement. Fort- & Weiterbildung  Durch regelmäßige Trainings, Workshops und Weiterbildungen entwickelst Du Dich stetig weiter. Die abgebildeten Leistungen können je nach Position und Standort leicht variieren.

Title: IT Engineer - Graduate Program
Description: Huawei is a leading global provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. With integrated solutions across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.     At Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs. We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward. We have more than 197,000 employees, and we operate in more than 170 countries and regions.     Huawei's end-to-end portfolio of products, solutions and services are both competitive and secure. Through open collaboration with ecosystem partners, we create lasting value for our customers, working to empower people, enrich home life, and inspire innovation in organizations of all shapes and sizes.       Job title:IT Engineer   Location:Düsseldorf, Germany       Main responsibilities:     Analyze business requirements and initiate IT projects; Implement IT Standards/Policies of Huawei in Western Europe Region; IT infrastructure project management, including Cloud, WAN, LAN, servers, server room, telephone system, video conference system, IT cabling, door access control, CCTV, etc.; IT service solution planning and management, change management, capacity management, business continuity management (BCM), data backup & recovery management; IT infrastructure maintenance and IT desktop support, research IT new technology with solution.       Required experience:     Recently graduated (2021-2022) with a Bachelors or higher degree in IT, computer science, telecommunications or another related major; Knowledge of network communication, building and maintaining corporate networks, preferably having certificates such as CCNA; Knowledge of operating systems, e.g. Windows/Linux operating system; Knowledge in development language such as Java, C++, Python, etc.; Experience or knowledge in project management / certificates like PMP, ITIL, COPC can be an advantage; Problem solving skills - getting many pieces of hardware and software to work in harmony is an ongoing and challenging task. Strong deductive reasoning and patience serve engineers well here; Customer service – infrastructure engineers tend to work with internal rather than external partners. Communicating well with these “customers” helps the engineer resolve outages quickly and build strong working relationships; Teaching ability – engineers may need to explain complex technical concepts to nontechnical colleagues and train them to use software and hardware; Organization skills – whether keeping cable sprawl to a minimum, documenting their work, or prioritizing requests for support, IT infrastructure engineers need to stay organized to keep on top of their tasks; Open-minded to work in an international business environment; Candidates must be eligible to work in Germany; Fluency in English is a must; further languages can be an advantage.       Fresh Graduate Program in Germany:     Professional Career Path: We offer you an exciting professional career in one of the leading and fastest growing multinational telecommunication companies; Personal Development is ensured through training and workshop opportunities: Comprehensive training programs throughout the first 6 months; Firsthand experience in customer engagement and new technology innovation; Challenging and diverse assignments that enable you to continuously develop your personal and professional strengths; Competitive salary package; Mentor/Buddy Program: A mentor that will guide you through both business and inter-cultural development; After onboarding, internal networking activities with other fresh Graduates take place.    To get more insights about our work, life and culture at Huawei West Europe, follow us on Instagram! @WeAreHuawei https://bit.ly/2ZbGgPY       Privacy Statement:    We therefore commit to protecting your privacy following the local legal data privacy legislation. Please read and understand our West European Recruitment Privacy Notice before submitting your personal data to Huawei so that you fully understand how we process and manage your personal data received (http://career.huawei.com/reccampportal/portal/hrd/weu_rec_all.html).    If you have any queries in regards to Huawei WEU Data Privacy please feel free to contact our WEU Data Protection Officer by clicking here (https://www.huawei.com/en/personal-data-request).

Title: Software Developer for Machine Learning Remote (m/f/d)
Description: <span class="artdeco-inline-feedback__message"> This job is sourced from a job board. <button aria-label="Learn more" class="artdeco-inline-feedback__linktext" type="button">Learn more </button>

Title: Data Engineer (m|f|d)
Description: What You Will Accomplish Together With Us    Collaborates with business teams and data analysts to understand business problems and implement scalable and sustainable data solutions Design, build, deploy and document data pipelines, model and integrate the data to service key business use cases and workflows Ingest new data sources into data platforms with the help of the most modern tools and technologies Provide guidance and mentorship to development teams to build data competencies Actively contribute to our Data Community    What Will Convince Us    You have a university degree in mathematics, computer science, physics, or related courses Several years of experience of data engineering, designing, developing, and implementing data solutions Strong knowledge and experience in Python/ PySpark/ Spark SQL Experience with Palantir foundry is a plus Proficiency in development best practices (e.g. Git workflows) Experience and skills in Snowflake is a plus Experience in several of the following areas are a plus: software development, big data, IoT, machine learning, business intelligence, advanced analytics High analytical skills, self-responsible, quality-oriented way of working, strong teamwork, good communication and presentation skills You have excellent written and spoken English skills Identification with our core values: Sustainability, Openness, Enjoyment    What We Offer    Our ambition is to simplify progress in life science research and the biopharmaceutical industry to help translate scientific findings into new therapeutics faster and more efficiently. So that more people can obtain access to better medicine. Nearly 14,000 employees at more than 60 production and sales locations worldwide are committed to this vision. And together, we have grown strongly over the past years. Do you also want to contribute to our vision? Grow with us and benefit from working with a Global Player that has kept its familiar atmosphere:   Opportunity for international career development: a global network offering seminars and training sessions, expert and manager career paths Open and highly collaborative culture: mutual support within teams and working as equals, team spirit and international collaboration Work-life balance: Working from home at many sites Intelligent working environment: working in smart buildings with the latest technology and equipment Ambitious goals: Sartorius plans to double its sales revenue approximately every five years and expects to grow its global team to approximately 15,000 people in 2025.   We look for employees who would like to grow with us and move the innovative life sciences sector forward. In the process, we focus on agile project work, mutual support within teams and working as equals. Sartorius thrives as a company with people who give their very best every day and who are eager to develop personally and professionally.   Further insights into our world of work can be found here  .

Title: Software Developer for Machine Learning Remote (m/f/d)

Du interessierst Dich für moderne Web- und Cloud-Technologien zur Applikationsentwicklung für das autonome Fahren? Dann erwartet Dich folgendes bei uns   Entwicklung von Cloud-Anwendungen zur Analyse von Daten für autonomes Fahren Mitarbeit bei der Konzeption und Spezifikation von Architekturen und deren Realisierung Erstellung von data driven Software in Java oder Scala Zusammenarbeit in einem agilen DevOps Team      Profil    Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation Du hast bereits in Java oder Scala programmiert und interessierst Dich für neueste Cloud-Technologien wie AWS oder Microsoft Azure Die agile Softwareentwicklung ist Dir vertraut.
