Title: Data Engineer for Growth
Description: We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet  Who We Are  Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.   We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.   Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.   Job Role  In our new unit called customer journeys, we're looking for a data engineer for audience segmentation  in marketing automation.   In this role, you'll support our marketing automation teams with finding and using relevant audiences and segments, and with reporting. You will own the concept, design, execution, and data quality of our marketing audiences. You'll ensure that we can continue our fast growth, by providing the basis for effective and efficient marketing campaigns.   You'll be at home in a team of three engineers. You'll organize your team and collaboration with others in a lean way. Apart from doing the work, you will also help us develop better ways of working.   Minimum Skills   2 years as a data engineer 2 years experience working with Databricks and Spark; Azure, Kafka or Devops Server a plus 2 years in working with .NET or Python; Pyspark a plus Good understanding of marketing, and marketing automation Data visualization, e.g with Salesforce, Tableau, or Google Analytics Ability to transform large amounts of data into actionable insights Clear verbal and written communication skills in English Can tell stories with data to both technical and non-technical audiences Collaborative mindset Robust analytical, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skills    Desirable Skills   Experience in academia and research communities Degree in software engineering, marketing, or analytics    Benefits  With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.   Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.   This includes:  100% remote working  Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Business Support jobs due to nature of role).   Learning and development  All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.   Wellbeing  We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.   Volunteering opportunities  Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.   Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

Title: Software Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Overview    Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. Bruker's high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular and microscopic levels. Today, worldwide more than 7,200 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 70 locations on all continents. Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems and a strong reputation among its customers.   The Bruker Nano Analytics (BNA) Division, headquartered at Bruker Nano GmbH in Berlin, Germany, develops, manufactures and markets state of the art systems and components for elemental and structural analysis on micro- and nano-scale.   We are looking for a Software Developer (m/f/d)  for our Xray Spectrometers to support our software development team at Berlin.    Responsibilities    Drive the software development for our next generation XRF spectrometers M4 Tornado, M6 Jetstream und S4 T-Star Design, implementation, test und documentation of device and PC software to control our spectrometers and process measurement data Coordinate work packages with other teams and external partners and integrate them into our products Implement test    Qualifications    Master’s degree in computer science or a related field Expert of object-oriented software development Two years of relevant working experience Graduates are welcome to apply also Fluent in German and English, both written and verbal You are a team player who likes software development    Additional Experience    Developing scientific software or device control software UML and design patterns   At Bruker, you can expect an interdisciplinary work environment in an expanding business. You will be part of a highly qualified and dedicated team. Alongside above average employee benefits, we offer training and seminars that support your further development.   Start your career and apply now for your new job at Bruker!   Please include your salary expectations and the possible starting date in your cover letter .

Title: DevOps Engineer (m/f/d)
Company Name: IU International University of Applied Sciences
Description: Grow with us – Start your career at IU International University!  Since its founding in 1998, IU International University has developed into the largest private university for online and dual study programs in Europe. We offer more than 120 career-oriented Bachelor & Master programs in various fields of study. These English and German language programs are all accredited and state approved. As a pioneer in digital education, we continuously improve the learning experience of our students with the help of innovative technologies and a constant focus on student satisfaction. Our ambitious goals and a constant growth rate of over 50 % are only possible thanks to our great team of entrepreneurial thinking & acting employees.   Become part of our team as DevOps Engineer (m/f/d)  . Start immediately  in full-time  at our location in Munich  or Remote  (Germany-wide).   Your tasks   Responsibility for the further development and operation of the AWS cloud architectures for the areas of data warehouse and data science Set up and maintenance of CD/CI for service development Hosting, connection, and maintenance of AWS/Azure environments and other third-party services Infrastructure tasks to provide and operate internal services Analysis of the existing setup and proactive development of security, scaling, and automation concepts. Provision of an easily maintainable infrastructure for dev, staging, and production described as code Driving the company-wide cloud strategy using AWS technologies Identification of weaknesses in access rights, managed domains, DNS & SSL Supporting the further development and optimization of continuous integration, continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines Monitoring, reporting, failover, and recovery, as well as accompanying documentation and implementation of regular and proactive audits   Your profile   Successfully completed studies in the field of computer science or a comparable field of study and practical experience as a DevOps developer (m/f/d) Excellent knowledge of AWS, basic skills in Azure and Linux-based environments Relevant experience in the use of virtualization, containerization, monitoring, continuous deployment, and integration Knowledge of a language for automation (e.g. python) Distributed systems and high availability are more than just buzzwords for you Confident team player, organizational talent, and strong communication skills Independent, goal-oriented, and structured way of working Fluent in English, knowledge of German is an advantage   We offer   A versatile and responsible job in a cooperative atmosphere A lot of freedom to develop ideas and create personal impact Attractive career prospects in a strongly expanding entrepreneurial environment 100% cost coverage of bachelor's and master's degree programs with a tech focus Numerous upskilling opportunities Competitive compensation and performance-based salary increase Several employee discounts and benefits Options of temporarily working from abroad State-of-the-art equipment Flex work and home office 30 vacation days   Are you interested in shaping the education sector and becoming part of a great team? Then start your job application now via our careers page .   Learn more about IU International University at www.iu.de .

Title: JavaScript UI Engineer (m/f/x)
Description: Introduction   At Dedrone we’re building high performance distributed sensor systems for drone detection, identification and mitigation. Our sensors are state-of-the-art computing devices which use signal processing and machine learning to detect and identify drones and communicate with our cloud-based platform for sensor data fusion, alerting, reporting and analytics.   We are looking for an expert in JavaScript UI development. You will join a team of experts for UI, API and backend development and help architect and build our future solutions for drone detection. You will be working on the UI for our DedroneTracker software, our internal tools as well as help creating our new cloud-based solution.    Responsibilities    Architecting, developing and maintaining JavaScript-based web applications Writing UI-relevant backend code for data aggregation and transfer in Java Working with our field engineers to analyse and solve UI issues coming up during day-to-day use of our system Writing and maintaining tooling for day-to-day development in Python Peer-reviewing your colleagues‘ JavaScript code Documenting your work in a SCRUM-based issue management system    Qualifications    At least 5 years of experience in professionally designing and writing code in JavaScript Good working knowledge in JavaScript (ECMAScript 2015+), HTML5, REST, CSS3 Knowledge of object-oriented programming and software design patterns Experience with web technologies such as Qooxdoo, Websockets, WebGL, WebAssembly Experience in other programming languages (e.g. C/C++, Java, Python) is a plus Degree in computer science or similar field or experienced autodidact Basic Linux CLI knowledge Experience with agile methods in software development   We offer   At Dedrone, you can expect to work in a startup-like atmosphere, expect excitement, and expect tasks that are diverse in nature. We’re a highly-qualified, international team that’s passionate about what it does and where it wants to go. Our hierarchies are flat and we offer plenty of room for individual ideas to develop. We are quick in our decision-making and like to keep our processes lean. We also offer permanent positions from day one, flexible working hours, joint events, fresh fruit, sweets, refreshments and much more like a match at the table soccer.

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Realtainment is changing the way people get together and experience creativity. With our events we revolutionize the world of entertainment and bring variety and a high fun factor into the everyday life of our customers.   We are developing Europe's leading platform for creative experiences and by doing so, we are helping more than 600 workshop leaders throughout Germany to generate additional income and make a living from their art. The headquarters of Realtainment is in Berlin. From here we bring our vision and events to over 60 cities throughout Europe and are constantly expanding our entertainment platform.   Data Engineer (m/f/d)   Your challenge:   Being part of our Data team you will help us transform Realtainment into a fully data-driven company You own, shape and continuously extend the Data Warehouse model You import data from a variety of sources into our Postgres Database You apply filtering, normalization and aggregation to model effective Data marts You perform deep-dive analysis and generate meaningful, easy-to-understand insights    About you:   You are a Data Engineer with at least three years of experience, working in a Data (Warehouse) team You love Data and help others to understand and interpret them You can transform requirements into designs and implement solutions fulfilling the user's needs You know how to set up, maintain and continuously extend a scalable ETL/ELT pipeline You feel comfortable with SQL, Python and other programming languages Data Processing tools like Airflow, Stitch and dbt are your daily business You speak English on a fluent level, German is a plus    Our offer!   Become part of an amazing team that works with passion and purpose to achieve incredible results. Together we break people's daily routines and inspire them to experience their creative flow Your development is our goal by offering an annual training budget of 1.000 euro and organizing bi-yearly feedback cycles for you! We focus on a topnotch employee experience by providing insightful newbie days & a personal welcome package, regular team events and unlimited tickets for joining our events for free! We offer 30 vacation days. Moreover our office is closed on December 24th and 31st! We care about your future & top up your pension plan contribution with 20% A nice office with a wonderful view over the pier, where you will be provided with cereals, fruit & drinks!    Looking for a challenge in an ambitious company? Then apply now. Our People Operations Manager Stella, is looking forward to your application!  We live diversity and equal opportunities. In our teams we welcome every applicant, regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or other grounds of discrimination. Personal formulations in the job advertisement are to be considered gender-neutral.

Title: Data Engineer
Description: We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet  Who We Are  Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.   We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.   Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.   Job Role  We are looking for a Data Engineer to help us build and maintain scalable and resilient pipelines that will ingest, process, and deliver the data needed for predictive and descriptive analytics. These data pipelines provide different stakeholders with the necessary resources to improve our user-centric platform and create the best visibility for our open access research.   Key Responsibilities   Work in a team of software engineers and data engineers responsible for developing, maintaining, and improving our cloud data platform to ingest and process raw and structured data coming from different sources Collaborate with data scientists, machine learning engineers, and other data engineers to design scalable, reliable, and maintainable ETL processes that ensure data scientists and automated ML processes have the necessary data available Research and adopt the best DataOps & MLOps standards to design and develop scalable end-to-end data pipelines. Identify opportunities for data process automation. Establish and enforce best practices (e.g. in development, quality assurance, optimization, release, and monitoring).    Requirements   Proven experience as a Data Engineer Proficiency in Python Experience with a Cloud Platform (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP) Experience with Google BigQuery and Google Dataflow Experience with Orchestration Frameworks (e.g. Airflow, Composer) Experience with Databricks or Spark Great communication, teamwork, problem-solving, and organizational skills.    Benefits  With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.   Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.   This includes:  100% remote working  Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis.   Learning and development  All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.   Wellbeing  We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance. Title: Working Student (f/m/d) Communications for Innovation Lab
Description: Mode of Employment:  Limited   Your Extra Treasure Of Experience.  You always wanted to work in an Innovation department for a global company? This is your chance to join! We care about our workings students because you are part of our Team! Here you will get chances to grow and drive your own projects!   At the Data Visions team of Siemens Digital Industries, we build solutions for various use cases within Data Science and Robotic Desktop and Process Automation (RDA/RPA). For our Innovation Team in Munich and Nuremberg, we are looking for a working student to support us with community management and communication.   We Make Real What Matters. This Is Your Role.   You are responsible for the preparation and announcement of our events (Trainings, expert talks, etc.) in our internal social media channels, newsletter, in email campaigns, etc. You will help us creating content: research, writing, be open for new projects like podcasts and Videos You support us coordinating and contributing to our newsletter, taking responsibility for a target group-oriented content mix You research and propose new Data Science and Automation-related topics for knowledge sharing   We don’t need superheroes, just super minds.   You are currently studying and already have experience in communication, marketing and/or content creation You always find the right words, love to tell stories and are good at translating them into different digital formats You are familiar with social media in a business context and know which content works best on which platform. You text engagingly and confidently in English (at least C1 level) and German, have an eye for image composition and at the same time bring an interest in analytics and automation with you You can work 12- 16 hours a week for at least 6 months as a working student   Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.  www.siemens.de  if you wish to find out more about Siemens before applying.   Do you have questions about the application? Here you will find answers to frequently asked questions.   If you have more questions please contact: www.siemens.de/fragenzurbewerbung   www.siemens.com/careers  if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.   As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.   Organization:  Digital Industries   Company:  Siemens AG   Experience Level:  Student (Not Yet Graduated)   Job Type:  Part-time

Title: Solution Engineer (m/f/o) - Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Description: You make the difference.  Whether in business Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory, Tax & Legal, Financial Advisory or Consulting: at Deloitte, we help our global clients continuously evolve. Discover a diverse working environment that is constantly in motion and always revolving around one central hub: you and your expertise. What impact will you make?   We enable our clients to find the right balance in the field of cloud transformation between technology, organisation and people and thus realise the maximum potential of products and services, cost reduction, scalability and sustainability of the relevant business models. We consult our clients on their individual cloud journey, from strategy to agile implementation methods.   Our teams support, design, modernise and implement cloud services and act in reliable partnership on the journey to the digital future. To be more specific, we support our clients with the implementation of their digitalisation strategies with current areas of focus such as connected car, IoT, Industry 4.0, digitalisation, automation as well as streaming analytics and cognitive computing.   We are looking for motivated staff to join our teams at the Berlin  and Leipzig  sites.   Exciting tasks await you   Supporting projects in the implementation, testing as well as go-live Realisation of flexible architectures in agile teams in compliance with clean code and good software crafting Development of best practices for testability, maintainability and scalability to support an open team culture Active support in the knowledge transfer of best practices Technical support of internal teams as well as clients with the assessment of technologies to be used Participation in the Community, e.g. by actively taking part in conferences or meetups    Your skill set   Very successfully completed Austrian HTL degree, bachelor’s or master’s degree with strong focus on IT, such as (business) informatics, industrial engineering, mathematics or physics, or equivalent education/training/experience You have gained some first experiences in at least one of the following fields: Programming with Python, Java, C#, Kotlin or Scala Software development in a cloud environment, e.g. Cloud Functions, Cloud Spanner or CDAP Implementation of cloud infrastructure solutions (especially IaaS & PaaS with IAM Cloud, App Engine, Linux, Terraform or Ansible) and of microservices and security concepts in cloud-based applications Interface development with Apigee or streaming solutions such as Kafka or Google Cloud Pub/Sub. Containerization/serverless architecture (e.g. Kubernetes, Openshift) Continuous integration and deployment (e.g. git, Dataflow, Airflow, etc.), with using PowerShell as well as cloud deployment models at an enterprise level (especially public, private, hybrid) Machine learning libraries and natural language processing (Tensorflow, Cloud AutoML), database technologies such as Hadoop, Hbase or Cassandra Istio, Grafana for monitoring and visualising dashboards Ideally, you are already certified in the GCP domain (e.g. Cloud Engineer, Cloud Developer, Cloud DevOps Engineer) You have successfully completed a bachelor’s or master’s degree in informatics and/or an equivalent training You have an analytical and structured mind capable of responding to complex client enquiries You have good (B2) German and very good English skills Occasional travels to client meetings are not a problem for you.    What You Can Expect From Us  In addition to a pleasant, collegial atmosphere, we offer you a promising and international working environment. We have flat hierarchies and an open door atmosphere. Another plus point: Thanks to a large number of education programs, we take you one big step forward in your professional and personal development.   You are interested? We look forward to seeing you!  Please submit your application to the Deloitte Recruiting-Team.   You are more interested in a career in our Austrian offices  ? Please click here.  The inclusion of people with disabilities is our mutual understanding. We very much appreciate your application. Due to our German data protection law, please note that we can only accept online applications via our online recruitment system.   Our FAQs will help you with questions concerning applications at Deloitte and will give you specific advice on how to apply successfully via our online portal:   ⇒ FAQs  What impact will you make?  Job-ID: 31434

Title: Software Engineer, Data Scientist, Computer Scientist or similar (f/m/x)
Description: Your mission:   The DLR Institute of Data Science in Jena is developing solutions to the new challenges of the era of digitalization. Research focuses on the areas of data management, IT security, smart systems (industry 4.0) and citizen science.   Software plays a crucial role in various domains and parts of day-to-day life, for example in aerospace, industry and also public administration. Development of reliable, robust, and secure software is fundamental, especially if it is a part of critical systems and infrastructure. An outage or a vulnerability to cyber attacks can lead to catastrophic damage and consequences, in satellites as well as digital public administration. Hence, it is important to support developers in realizing secure, robust and reliable software systems and architectures.   The group "Secure Software Engineering" in the data analysis and intelligence department researches methods, tools and processes of secure software development and needs your support!   Your tasks include:   research and development for current problems and research gaps, e.g. cross-project learning and knowledge integration, starting from current state of the art machine learning research development of new research areas in machine learning for software engineering through continous exchange with peers in the field, literature research and cross-discipline collaboration identification of funding opportunities, planning, application and potentially management and execution of research projects   This vacancy also includes responsibilities in the area of high-performance data analytics (HPDA):   scientific and technical advancement of the HPDA system consulting fellow researchers in applying their methods to the dynamic architecture of the HPDA   Your qualifications:   completed scientific studies (diploma/master) in software engineering, data science, computer science, or a similar degree. special knowledge and multiple years of experience in software engineering/development, datascience, machine learning, AI, or related fields basic knowledge of IT security and privacy joy of working in a scientific environment very good oral and writting English and German language skills PhD in computer science or similar desirable willingness to travel desirable   Your benefits:   Look forward to a fulfilling job with an employer who appreciates your commitment and supports your personal and professional development. Our unique infrastructure offers you a working environment in which you have unparalleled scope to develop your creative ideas and accomplish your professional objectives. Our human resources policy places great value on a healthy family and work-life-balance as well as equal opportunities for persons of all genders (f/m/x). Individuals with disabilities will be given preferential consideration in the event their qualifications are equivalent to those of other candidates.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.  Data Engineer (m/f/d)  The vision and mission of our Enabling Function Global Data Assets organization is to transform the Bayer Company Functions such as Finance, Supply Chain and Logistics, HR, Procurement, Law, sustainability etc. and become more insights- and data-driven. To achieve this goal the team’s objective is to deliver the required data foundation and FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) data assets that enables the business in improving their decision-making ability. You will become part of the Data Engineering team and assist with the delivery of data assets and ensure that our customers can efficiently consume those data assets using a state-of-the-art data platform built on Microsoft Azure cloud. The team responsibility include delivery of solutions involving work ranging from designing data pipelines, data modeling, system configuration, data storage, processing and transformation tasks typical of a building and operating a data warehouse, data mart and data analytics platform.    Your Tasks And Responsibilities    You support data asset leads in creation of data assets for both our business and our IT community You create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture and drive automation - wherever possible and feasible actively ensure that automation is in place to increase efficiency and quality (deployments, monitoring and remediation, etc.) You assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional/non-functional business requirements and identify, design and implement internal process improvements, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability when necessary You build optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources including SAP and non-SAP systems You work with stakeholders such as Data Asset leads, Data and Design teams and assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs You work with data and analytics experts and strive for greater functionality in our data platform You evaluate best solution options as well as provide advantages and disadvantages as a decision helper (m/f/d) and provide recommendations based on prior experience You ensure that Bayer architecture principals, coding and compliance guidelines are followed and met You work in agile project style - regularly communicate status, blockers, opportunities as well as shape the future - influence our overall data strategy with your technical and tool know how    Who You Are    University degree in computer science or similar education or equivalent work experience You have prior experience working in Azure Cloud - knowledge of services, including infrastructure as code, setup of Vnet etc. You have proven experience with Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Snowflake, Azure Data Factory You have prior experience in building data warehouses, data marts, RDBMS and SQL You have experience in creating data models and be well versed in data engineering and data architecture principles You have expert knowledge in coding in Python or similar and related work with code; repositories like GitHub, CI/CD pipelines, etc. You have a good understanding of SAP ERP and SAP BW systems You have strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills Fluent in English, both written and spoken   YOUR APPLICATION  This is your opportunity to tackle the world’s biggest challenges with us: Maintaining our health, feeding growing populations and slowing the rate of climate change. You have a voice, ideas and perspectives and we want to hear them. Because our success begins with you. Be part of something big. Be Bayer.   Bayer welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, physical characteristics, social origin, disability, union membership, religion, family status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or any unlawful criterion under applicable law. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.   Location:  Leverkusen, St. Louis   Division:  Enabling Functions   Reference Code:  559912

Title: IEG Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Bei Bayer sind wir Visionäre und entschlossen, die größten Herausforderungen unseres Planeten zu überwinden und zu einer Welt beizutragen, in der genug Nahrung und ausreichende medizinische Versorgung für alle Menschen keine unerreichbaren Ziele mehr darstellen. Wir tun dies mit Energie, Neugier und purer Hingabe, lernen stets von den Menschen um uns herum, erweitern unsere Denkweise, verbessern unsere Fähigkeiten und definieren das „Unmögliche“ neu. Es gibt viele Gründe, sich uns anzuschließen: Wenn Sie nach einer abwechslungsreichen und bedeutungsvollen beruflichen Zukunft streben, in der Sie gemeinsam mit anderen brillanten Köpfen wirklich etwas bewegen können, möchten wir Sie in unserem Team haben.  IEG Data Engineer (m/w/d)  IHRE AUFGABEN UND VERANTWORTLICHKEITEN   Durchführung von Data Mining, Engineering und Analysen von RWD-Quellen, um unsere strategische IEG-Planung zu informieren und deren Ausführung zu unterstützen Zusammenarbeit mit Forschungsteams, einschließlich interner und externer Stakeholder, bei der Umsetzung von Geschäfts- und Forschungsfragen in Beobachtungsstudien mit statistischen und analytischen Plänen Aufrechterhaltung der Effizienz und Zuverlässigkeit der Produktion kritischer Datensätze und Zusammenarbeit mit Data Scientists bei der Datenvorbereitung und der Aufbereitung zusätzlicher Daten und Verbindungen Durchführung von Qualitätskontrollmaßnahmen zur Gewährleistung der Integrität von Daten und Programmdesign Aufbau von Verbindungen zu anderen Data Engineers und Data Scientists bei Bayer, um eine Lerngemeinschaft zu bilden Entwicklung neuer sowie Bewertung und Verbesserung bestehender Lösungen zur Unterstützung der IEG in allen Bereichen der beobachtenden Forschung   WAS SIE MITBRINGEN   PhD, MSc oder BSc in Data Science, Ingenieurwesen, Computational Science, (Bio-) Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik, Physik, Ingenieurwesen, Ökonometrie, Machine Learning und/oder andere verwandte Gebiete Gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python/R/Scala und gute SQL-Kenntnisse sowie Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit großen Datenmengen, vorzugsweise Gesundheitsdaten Praktische Erfahrung mit ETL-Operationen mit SQL/Pyspark sowie Erfahrung mit Big-Data-Plattformen, z. B. Spark, Hadoop, Kafka und Cloud-basierte Dienste (AWS S3, EMR, Glue) und Container (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, EKS) Kenntnisse von Workflow-Management-Tools wie Airflow/Prefect/Dagster und von Paketen für maschinelles Lernen (Scikit Learn, Tensorflow, Pytorch) sind ein Vorteil Kenntnisse im Aufbau von ML Pipelines oder MLOps Ausgezeichnete zwischenmenschliche und kommunikative Fähigkeiten Fähigkeit, Probleme zu lösen und komplexe Aufgaben zu strukturieren, zu vereinfachen, zu erklären und zu kommunizieren Verhandlungssicheres Englisch in Wort und Schrift   IHRE BEWERBUNG  Dies ist Ihre Chance, sich mit uns gemeinsam den größten globalen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit zu stellen: die Gesundheit der Menschen zu erhalten, die wachsende Weltbevölkerung zu ernähren und den Klimawandel zu verlangsamen. Sie haben eine Stimme, Ideen und Perspektiven, die wir hören möchten. Denn unser Erfolg beginnt mit Ihnen. Seien Sie dabei!   Bayer begrüßt Bewerbungen aller Menschen ungeachtet von ethnischer Herkunft, nationaler Herkunft, Geschlecht, Alter, körperlichen Merkmalen, sozialer Herkunft, Behinderung, Mitgliedschaft in einer Gewerkschaft, Religion, Familienstand, Schwangerschaft, sexueller Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentität oder einem anderen sachfremden Kriterium nach geltendem Recht. Wir bekennen uns zu dem Grundsatz, alle Bewerberinnen und Bewerber fair zu behandeln und Benachteiligungen zu vermeiden.   Standort:  Deutschland : Berlin : Berlin   Division:  Pharmaceuticals   Referenzcode:  407943

Title: Graduate Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description: Our Business Analyst Daniel Marais Shares It Here    At Picnic, we’re revolutionizing the way people buy groceries with our innovative and sustainable app-only service. We do almost everything in-house, developing cutting-edge technologies and processes to ensure we continue to grow rapidly without missing a beat. If you’re passionate about beginning your career as a Data Analyst, we’re offering you the opportunity to join the diverse team at our Düsseldorf office and make a real difference in our scale-up environment. How.   🥜 In a nutshell  The role of a Data Analyst at Picnic is versatile and changes based on your team and the projects you are involved in. We have Data Analysts in all teams and you can grow by collaborating on complex projects, moving into different teams, or even to different countries. It’s an opportunity to put all you’ve learned about Data Analysis into practice in a fast-growing, varied environment, in which you can make a real difference in your domain!   Ultimately, you’ll join one of several teams, based on your interests and goals, as well as where we think you would be best suited. The areas in which you could be a Data Analyst at Picnic include Commercial, Distribution Operations, Fulfillment Operations, Growth & Acquisition, Product, and Tech.    🎯 What You’ll Do    You’ll work on a wide range of exciting projects, which, depending on your team, might include:   Perform analyses on our store assortment and products ranking Perform fleet analyses and capacity modeling Develop algorithms and operating procedures to spot damaged products before they leave the warehouse Demand forecasting: Develop forecasting models to predict future customer demand Develop cost-benefit analyses to design a scalable cloud infrastructure that fits our automation projects Onboarding program: Develop gifting and communication strategies to maximize engagement and retention of new customers Determine the impact of improving our planning and routing algorithms in our supply-chain systems . . . and many more projects!   Take a look at two of our projects in Strategy & Analytics: Picnic plays it cool: a data-driven cold chain for groceries and Finding Product Alternatives at Picnic !    ⭐ About You    Master’s degree in Engineering, Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics or an equivalent quantitative study 0-1 years of work experience Excellent Excel and data analysis skills Fluency in both verbal and written English Full-time availability For bonus points: knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and Python (but don't worry if you’re not familiar with these yet, our training has you covered)   You're still wondering if this is the right role for you and you'd like to hear more about the role?  Send an e-mail to our recruiter Verena ( verena.schilmann@teampicnic.com ) and ask her for a short call together in order to get more insights before actually applying. (Please make sure that you fit the requirements in the "About you" section and that we can only count applications via the form below as valid).   📖 Picnic Perks  Every expert was once a beginner!  You’ll get plenty of opportunities to challenge yourself and grow, including the Picnic Tech Academy, Lunch & Learn sessions, and tailored soft skills training. We also offer free professional weekly language courses.   Make a difference  You’ll work in an awesome scale-up environment with the freedom to drive your own projects and create a visible impact. Our fully electric vehicles and sustainable business model mean you’ll also be contributing to making the world a better place!   Teamwork makes the dream work  With more than 80 nationalities across 3 countries, you’ll be part of a diverse company with plenty of cool stuff to get involved with, from board game evenings to after-work drinks to our company ski trip and more!    You Are What You Eat    You’ll get freshly prepared, healthy lunches, as well as snacks and drinks—enjoy!   Stay healthy  Mental health is important. As well as having the option to speak with Picnic colleagues who act as confidential advisors, our collaboration with OpenUp gives you easy access to professional psychologists, along with workshops and materials. There are plenty of sports communities and events to get involved with, from tennis to yoga to climbing!   Attractive package  We offer competitive compensation and a pension plan that looks out for your future self.   Work-life balance  Where possible, we like to enable people to work in ways that suit their working styles , which is why we have a hybrid-working model. Our teams generally like to have at least one team day per week at the office (the tasty lunch may be a factor), but besides that, it’s up to you and your team.    Benefits For Expats    It can be daunting starting a new job AND moving to a new country. That’s why we offer lots of support for our many expat colleagues, including:   Relocation package: If you join Picnic from abroad, we’ll cover your trip to Düsseldorf, sponsor your Visa, and offer you a month of accommodation while you settle in (as long as regulations allow) From health insurance to living arrangements to pet passports, there are always colleagues who’ve faced the same challenges and are more than happy to help!   Commitment to equal opportunities  Picnic is an equal opportunity employer—this means that all decisions regarding applications will be based on qualifications and merit. Applicants will be regarded independently of age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity, skin color, civil status, religious beliefs, physical or mental disability, or any other factors protected by law.   At Picnic, we celebrate and value our differences and are committed to building a safe and inclusive working environment where everyone can be themselves.

Title: Data Engineer
Description: We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet  Who We Are  Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.   We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.   Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.   Key Responsibilities:   Work in a team of data engineers, cloud architects, and software engineers to implement solutions, pipelines, and integrations over our Cloud Data Warehouse. Understand the ecosystem of applications, services, data storage devices, and synchronization mechanisms in our platform and how they interact between them. Collaborate with data scientists, machine learning engineers, and other data engineers to design scalable, reliable, and maintainable ETL processes that ensure data scientists and automated ML processes have the necessary data available Research and be aware of IT Trends, technicals, and methodological innovations, suggesting the best use of them to follow Frontiers' IT Strategy. Provide support to the development teams to build data-intensive applications and design flexible solutions for data-oriented products.    Requirements:   Degree in Computer Science or similar Proven experience as a Data Engineer Proficiency in Python Experience with Hadoop & Spark Experience with SQL and NoSQL (e.g. MongoDB) databases Great communication, teamwork, problem-solving, and organizational skills.    Nice To Have:   Experience with a Cloud Platform (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP) Experience with a workflow engine (e.g. Data Factory, Airflow) Stream-processing frameworks (e.g. Kafka)    Benefits  With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.   Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.   This includes:  100% remote working  Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis.   Learning and development  All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.   Wellbeing  We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.   Volunteering opportunities  Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.   Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

Title: Trainee Data Science/Analytics (m/w/d)
Description: Finden Sie Ihren Grund, bei uns zu arbeiten.     Trainee Data Science/Analytics (m/w/d)    Wir sind eine der größten Krankenversicherungen in Deutschland und es gibt viele individuelle Gründe, bei uns zu arbeiten. Aber eines haben unsere rund 16.000 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter gemeinsam: Wer bei uns arbeitet, setzt sich täglich für die Gesundheit von Millionen von Kunden ein. Weil wir den Menschen helfen, gesünder zu leben, bei Krankheit die bestmögliche Versorgung sicherstellen und bei Vorsorge unterstützen. Mit diesem Anspruch entwickeln wir uns weiter. Hin zu einem dynamischen Unternehmen in einem digitalen Markt, mit Freiraum für neue Impulse und gesellschaftlicher Verantwortung. Unsere besondere Kultur macht es möglich: Wir stehen füreinander ein, über Standorte, Fachrichtungen und Karrierelevel hinweg. Wir arbeiten miteinander, denn nur gemeinsam können wir das höchste Gut des Menschen erhalten und Gesundheit weiterdenken.     Ihre Aufgaben:   Während des 12-monatigen Trainee-Programms tragen Sie als Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams maßgeblich zur unternehmensweiten Koordination der Themen Data & Analytics bei. Dabei erhalten Sie einen umfassenden Einblick in die gesamte Organisation der BARMER mit dem Schwerpunkt Data Science und Analytics. Sie übernehmen Mitverantwortung für unsere Data-Science-Infrastruktur und entwickeln diese aktiv weiter. In diesem Zusammenhang erwecken Sie neue Ideen selbstständig und kreativ in Prototypen zum Leben. Zusätzlich beteiligen Sie sich auch an strategischen Themen wie Data Literacy oder Explainable AI. Durch die Mitarbeit in Projekten sammeln Sie erste Erfahrung in der Konzeption und Umsetzung von Datenprodukten sowie der Kommunikation der Konzepte und Ergebnisse.     Ihr Profil:   Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachbereich, gerne mit Erfahrung in empirischer Forschung. Erste Kenntnisse im Umgang mit R, Python oder gängigen Statistik-Anwendungen besitzen Sie ebenfalls und der Umgang mit SQL und relationalen Datenbanken ist Ihnen bestenfalls auch vertraut. Sie arbeiten gerne eigenverantwortlich und haben Freude daran, sich in neue Themen einzuarbeiten. Durch Ihre Kommunikationsfreude sind Sie in der Lage, auch schwierige Themen adressatengerecht zu vermitteln. Die deutsche Sprache beherrschen Sie fließend in Wort und Schrift.     Gründe, die für uns sprechen     Work-Life-Balance  Eine ideale Balance zwischen Beruf und Privatleben ist bei uns Alltag. Individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle ermöglichen Ihnen mehr Flexibilität.     equal pay  Bei uns erwartet Sie gerechte Lohngleichheit. Es entscheidet die Leistung, nicht das Geschlecht. Unsere Gehälter sind tariflich vereinbart. Feste Gehaltssprünge inklusive.     gesundes Arbeiten  Ihre innere Stärke ist uns ganz wichtig. Dafür bieten wir innovative Bewegungs- und Entspannungskurse, Selfcare-Trainings aber auch Seminare für gesundes Führen. Für den Wiedereinstieg nach Krankheit sind wir ausgezeichnet.     familienfreundlich  Ihre Familie liegt uns am Herzen. Ob Organisation der Kinderbetreuung Elternzeit oder Wiedereinstieg – wir unterstützen Sie.     Rückhalt  Mit uns setzen Sie auf Sicherheit. Ein umfangreiches soziales Leistungspaket von Beihilfen bis zur Altersvorsorge sind bei uns Programm.     modernes Arbeiten  Bei uns sind Sie am Puls der Zeit. Innovationsmethoden, neueste Produkt- und Prozessentwicklungen oder Design-Thinking stärken Ihr Know-how.     Weiterentwicklung  Bei uns hat jeder die Chance sein Know-how zu erweitern, sich zu verändern. Zum Beispiel durch interne und externe Bildungsmaßnahmen sowie E-Learning-Angebote.     Tarifverträge  Sie genießen bei uns mehr Rückhalt und Orientierung. Denn bei uns gelten einheitliche Tarifverträge für alle Beschäftigten.     Corporate Benefits  Über den Partner Corporate Benefits bekommen Sie hochwertige Sonderkonditionen namhafter Hersteller und Marken.    Weitere Gründe unter: www.barmer.de/benefits     ID: J000001021 Vollzeit, 38 Stunden wöchentlich, Teilzeit möglich Wuppertal 01.10.2022, Befristet, 30.09.2023     Ihr persönlicher Kontakt:  Tim Marcel Graf: 0800 333004 99-1595*  *Anrufe aus dem deutschen Fest- und Mobilfunknetz sind für Sie kostenfrei!    Die BARMER fördert aktiv die Gleichstellung von Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern. Frauen werden bei gleicher Qualifikation bevorzugt berücksichtigt. Wir stehen für Chancengleichheit und begrüßen ausdrücklich Bewerbungen von schwerbehinderten sowie gleichgestellten Menschen.

Title: Application Software Tester
Description: FintechX is a well-funded fintech start-up founded by experienced executives that strive to create the "next level banking experience for European SMEs” - and that starts with a brilliant team. We are based in Frankfurt/Main and provide an international team with flat hierarchies for people to both grow and develop their skills. Fun and creativity are inherently built into our company culture and this translates into everything that we do. Working with us means that you will be part of a team that will help you reach YOUR next level. We guarantee you a steep learning curve, work with amazing people and deep insights into the fintech space. We are keen to hear from capable, highly motivated and creative individuals who want to help us accomplish our mission.   Aside from our people, culture, and mission, there are a variety of additional benefits that help make FintechX a great place to work! Work with us and receive:  Competitive compensation package that includes salary, and benefits One paid impact day you can use to have an impact on the environment and society at your own discretion Paid vacation; flexible working hours and hybrid working model; parental leave Annual personal development budget for conferences, courses, books, etc. Meal allowance; free drinks and snacks Corporate benefits that provide discounts across a range of brands so you can save money while shopping at Adidas, D&M, LG, Bosch, Apple, Dia, etc.   Your responsibilities   Reviewing software requirements and preparing test scenarios. Executing tests on software usability and stability. Analyzing test results on functional completeness, data consistency, errors or bugs, and usability. Preparing reports on all aspects related to the software testing carried out and reporting to the design team. Interacting with business owners to understand product requirements. Participating in design reviews and providing input on requirements, product design, and potential problems.   Your profile  This is how you score with us:  You have a degree in computer science. You’re passionate and experienced in driving software quality. You have testing experience in mission critical applications. Up-to-date knowledge of software test design and testing methodologies. Working knowledge of test techniques and compatibility with various software programs. You have a problem solver mindset with attention to detail. You have great communication skills in both written and oral format. You are a strong team player and an open personality with the ability to inspire and motivate others. You have strong organizational and project management skills. Solid German language skills. Bonus: you have experience in the financial services sector.   Interested  Are you ready to tread new paths with us as an Application Developer? Then waste no time and apply now. Send your application documents totalent@fintechx.eu  . We look forward to meeting you!

Title: User Research - Part Time (Remote) (m/f/x)
Description:
About Us We are Una, a mission driven company tackling the ever-increasing burden of metabolic disease . We are combining the latest medical research, data science, bio-sensor technology, and human centred design to enable sustainable behaviour change and improve health outcomes. We are creating the first medical-grade digital therapy that sustainably solves metabolic dysfunction. We are backed by Atlantic Food Labs and part of its portfolio network, which includes some of the most inspiring startups in the field such as Clue, Meditopia, Cara Care, and Casper, as well as companies such as SoundCloud and Gorillas. We are a fast growing, fully remote team that is just getting started . There is a lot of opportunity to shape the direction of the product from the start. Who you are You are an empathetic person that loves to get to the heart of people's needs. You enjoy working collaboratively to bring your findings to life and help shape future product direction. You're well organised, hypothesis driven and comfortable working in a fast paced environment. Most importantly, you are excited about the prospect of helping to improve the health of our members. What you'll do Conduct primary and secondary user research with our members and target users. This can involve early exploratory interviews, surveys, prototype and design testing and post launch validation. You will advocate research findings throughout Una in both written and oral presentations. Working closely with product, engineering and design your insights will help us build a product that has tremendous health impacts for our members.

Desired Skills and Experience

Must have skills This role is a part time role and also available as a working student. We expect it to be up to 20 hours per week. Fluency in German and English A good understanding of user research as a job Experience working with people and understanding their needs Ability to quickly and effectively share research results A degree in a relevant discipline such as Human/Computer Interaction, UX Research, Psychology, Digital Assets, Social Science, Anthropology or Digital Assets Research shows that there is a Confidence Gap between different groups (e.g., gender, age, ethnicity) leading some to apply when they meet 60% of the criteria, and others only when they check every box. So if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit. What we offer 💪 The opportunity to tackle one of the world's leading health problems 💰 A competitive package with salary and equity potential relevant to experience 🏡 Fully remote work environment 🌴 Unlimited holiday policy 🤸 Healthy work-life balance and flexible working hours 👩‍🏫 Personal growth and training budget 🗺️ An international team 🤝 A network of inspiring peers within the Atlantic Labs network Una Health Values Purpose We care deeply about our members' (users') health. We build fast for our members because they should not have to wait. We recognise that helping people improve their health is hard, and this motivates us. Compassion We are open and kind with each other. We take time to make sure we understand our members and each other. We embrace everyone's uniqueness. Innovation & Learning We are curious. We constantly ask 'why?' We are unafraid to challenge the norm. We thrive on diverse perspectives**,** such as those that come from different cultures, identities and ideas. We learn from and support each other to be our collective best. Honesty & Transparency We are evidence-based and use data to guide our decisions. We are honest about our intentions and aware of our limitations. We trust our colleagues to do the right thing for our members first and foremost. We are reliable. We openly admit to our mistakes and collectively learn from them. Autonomy We focus on outcomes not outputs. We default to individual autonomy over centralized control.

Title: Backend Developer (Ruby) (f/m/d)
Description: JOIN US!  __Comgy is an ambitious Berlin-based start-up in the field of energy / proptech and currently has a vacancy as a Backend Developer (Ruby)!   We move and we are moved by the generational topic of climate protection. If you also want to make a difference and have a desire to work with purpose, then you are exactly right with us!__   YOUR ROLE   You implement highly scalable solutions with state-of-the-art technologies together with our team You build and maintain different products and microservices that will run on cloudbased hosting environments as well as physical gateways You build and maintain our APIs, infrastructures and data pipeline You write clean code, automatically test and continuously deploy it You are eager to learn new technologies that will improve our products and development flow   OUR PERFECT MATCH   You have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering or similar You have 2+ years of work experience in web development and software engineering (preferably Ruby) You are highly interested in learning new technologies (Elixir, GraphQL or similar) and providing or implementing suggestions for improvements where applicable You bring experience with stream processing and / or message-driven architectures (e.g. Kafka, Cassandra, Spark) in production environment as well as with Agile Development, Git, BDD/TDD You have very good communication skills and full proficiency in English (nice to have: a (limited) working proficiency in German) You have an entrepreneurial drive to create successful products You are constantly interested in improving things and proactively bring in your own new ideas You value transparency, friendly interaction and diversity just as much as we do! You are a team player and fun to work with :) You come from a time zone ±1 h   WE OFFER   A job with purpose: working on a socially very meaningful topic (more energy transparency, clear CO₂ savings, fair billing of energy costs). A young and performance-oriented team in an innovative, ambitious company First-hand insights and co-design options in building a Start-up, that will soon also find its way into other European countries Freedom to design and use the latest technologies where relevant (“Best tool for the job” approach) Stay on top of current industry trends and join tech conferences to present your work, and meet-ups all around the globe Fair compensation with the opportunity to quickly take on more responsibility and move up within the company Hybrid working model with the option of remote and mobile work in order to allow room for your individual preferences In addition to 5 days of educational leave per year, we also offer further internal training and regular knowledge exchange Company pension scheme Urban Sports Club membership or heyday account with a variety of perks & benefits Access to regular sessions for physical and mental health (Actio Teams) An office in the heart of Berlin (Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg) incl. a good supply of drinks, fruit, muesli and snacks :)   REFERRAL  Sounds good, but not for you?  Feel free to spread the word. There is a €1000 referral bonus  for referrals that lead to employment.    Additional Information    Please note that for this position it is obligatory to include a cover letter.  Start  : immediately – Job type  : full-time, on site or remote – Location:  Berlin Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg – Timezone: ±1 h   OPEN APPLICATION  No suitable job found, but area Software Engineering sounds interesting?  Then feel free to apply on your own initiative!____

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description: Position:  Graduate Data Analyst   Job Description:  Join Our Arrow's Graduate Program Designed for the Next Generation of Innovators  Every year, we welcome university graduates from various parts of the world to join Arrow Graduate Program. You bring your aspirations, talent, potential and excitement for the journey ahead.   This 12-month talent program is designed specifically for recent university grads, who graduated not more than 2 years ago and are seeking to build connections while taking part in a field-based, challenging, interactive and action-based learning curriculum. The program provides graduates with a platform to work hand in hand with experienced mentors to establish a solid foundation to build and develop their career at Arrow. During this program, participants will develop both professional and soft skills to upscale career growth and will be able to meet with and learn from experts across the business from multiple departments including sales, engineering, services, marketing, finance, operations, and others.   Our accelerated learning platform will take you from recent graduate to industry professional within 1 year and will allow you to build a successful career in Arrow by taking full ownership of your job responsibilities and contribute to Arrow's development and success.    What you should expect from the role:    Arrow believes that the best way for you to learn is by integrating you fully into the business and giving you full responsibility for your tasks. Therefore, you will complete practical work alongside your personal and group projects.You will work alongside highly specialized experts supporting them in the following tasks :    Supporting domain experts to build and validate conceptual models Performing data preparation: data cleaning, outlier detection, handling missing data etc. in order to get ready for building fast and accurate Machine Learning models Support in estimator selection as well as building, training and evaluating models which will provide the foundation of automating various business processes across EMEA   This 12-month journey will allow you to learn how we operate on the day-to-day basis and how you can make an impact in supporting our business   Visit our Graduate Program website for more information.    Mandatory Requirements:    You must have a legal right to work in the country where the position is located. You should have successfully completed your computer science, mathematics, statistics or similar quantitative field degree or other relevant degree (B.Sc., M.Sc. allowing you to have a full understanding of relational databases and ability to extract and query data independently with SQL) before October 2022 or maximum 2 years ago. You should be familiar with all or some of the following;  object oriented programming, knowledge of Python and writing scalable code  good understanding of Data Science and Machine Learning methods (clustering, regression, decision trees and random forests etc.)  experience with jupyter notebooks and sklearn (libraries numpy, pandas, SciPy etc.)  visualization of insights with Python (matplotlib, seaborn etc.) as well as with visualization tools (eg. Power BI, tableau, Qlik)  Advantageous but not essential to have experience in the following;  experience with cloud based platforms (Azure, AWS)  experience with statistical modelling with R  Business fluent English AND local language (oral & written) where the job is based is a must for this position. You must be flexible and have geographical mobility. Creative, outside-the-box thinker who brings something new to the table and is not afraid to share those ideas.   You ideally have an aptitude and attitude which exhibits the following :    Strong analytical skills, solution oriented mindset and team player who enjoys knowledge sharing Problem solving ability coupled with critical and conceptual thinking Curiosity and creativity when solving complex business problems in an innovative way    What’s in it for you?    At Arrow, we don’t just reward you with a fulfilling program of learning and development, we also offer:    A competitive salary, holiday entitlement and company benefits according to the standards in the country where you apply A permanent contract from day one A mix of professional and soft skills trainings Group projects to work on business solutions with other program members from multiple countries, cultures, and functions Networking in the organization Support and career guidance from a mentor Wide range of career development opportunities    How To Apply  In order to apply, please click on  apply  below and submit your CV with a letter of motivation (  both in English)  providing responses to the following questions:    What was your decision-making process in selecting your current course/degree discipline? What motivates you to join Arrow & our graduate program? What skills and experiences do you feel have prepared you for the job position? What personal qualities will you bring to the job position? Where do you see yourself in 3-5 years?   Note:  Your letter of motivation should not exceed one page.   Diversity & Inclusion  Arrow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, colour, family, gender identity or expression, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, race, religion, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by locally applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.   Location:  DE-Berlin, Germany (Kurfürstendamm)   Time Type:  Full time   Job Category:  Business Support

Title: Software Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Überblick  Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. Bruker's high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular and microscopic levels. Today, worldwide more than 7,200 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 70 locations on all continents. Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems and a strong reputation among its customers.   The Bruker Nano Analytics (BNA) Division, headquartered at Bruker Nano GmbH in Berlin, Germany, develops, manufactures and markets state of the art systems and components for elemental and structural analysis on micro- and nano-scale.   We are looking for a Software Developer (m/f/d)  for our handheld XRF Spectrometers to support our software development team at Berlin.   Aufgaben/Verantwortlichkeiten   Support the software development for our next generation handheld XRF spectrometer Design, implementation, test und documentation of device and PC software to control our spectrometers and process measurement data Coordinate work packages with other teams and external partners and integrate them into our products   Qualifikationen   Master’s degree in computer science or a related field Expert of object-oriented software development preferably C++ and C# Experience in developing for Linux based systems At least two years of relevant working experience, graduates are welcome Fluent in German and English, both written and verbal You are a team player who likes software development   Nice to have   Experience in developing scientific software or device control software Development for embedded Linux systems UML and design patterns Qt/QML   At Bruker, you can expect an interdisciplinary work environment in an expanding business. You will be part of a highly qualified and dedicated team. Alongside above average employee benefits, we offer training and seminars that support your further development.   Start your career and apply now for your new job at Bruker!   Please include your salary expectations and the possible starting date in your cover letter .

Title: Software Engineer (f/m/x) Python
Description: Your tasks   You set up and maintain Magazino's cloud based robot data infrastructure and data pipelines You support migrating our on-prem software solutions to our cloud infrastructure You develop features for our robot fleet management system    Requirements    You have a Master's degree in software engineering, computer science or similar studies You have a profound knowledge in Python and Terraform (or similar IaC frameworks) You are proficient in relational databases, SQL, ORMs (ideally Django ORM) and API design You have working knowledge of cloud technology, ideally with GCP, data pipelines and containerization You convince with a hands-on mentality, are motivated to find the right solutions and get things done while being structured and following an independent working style You are enthusiastic about robots that pick orders in the real world    What We Have To Offer    High personal responsibility & room to maneuver A creative, dynamic and international team with flat hierarchies A future-oriented job in an innovative environment Delicious, freshly cooked free lunch - everyday Free drinks, fresh fruits everyday and a breakfast buffet to start your day right 100% startup atmosphere, a loft style office and regular team events

Title: Trainee Data (AI / Big Data Analytics / Data Management) (all genders)
Description: Du willst dich in nur sechs Wochen zum/zur gefragten Data-Spezialist:in entwickeln? Mit einem Traineeprogramm, das so nah an der Praxis ist, dass du dein Know-how sofort anwenden kannst – und das auf intensives Lernen durch Spezialist:innen in kleinen Gruppen setzt? Das ist genau dein Ding?   Dann lebe deine Leidenschaft in einer Position, in der du als Data Engineer namhafte Unternehmen rund ums Thema Applied Intelligence berätst.   Das erwartet dich  Unser sechswöchiges Traineeprogramm bereitet dich systematisch auf deine Karriere als Berater:in im Bereich Applied Intelligence und damit auf deinen Einsatz in anspruchsvollen Kundenprojekten vor.  Du lernst, auf was es bei der Projektvorbereitung ankommt, schärfst deine Softskills und machst dich mit agilen Projektmethoden vertraut. Dazu vermitteln wir dir die Grundlagen kommender Data-Warehousing- und Analytics-Architekturen.  Im Anschluss lernst du die Tools und Technologien eines Data Engineers kennen. Abhängig von der aktuellen Marktentwicklung und technologischen Trends folgt eine Vertiefung in nachfolgende Module: Introduction to Big Data Management (Analytics, Machine Learning & AI); Data Integration; ETL & Streaming Technologies; Data Warehousing; Cloud Hyperscaler (GCP, AWS, Azure); Python Programming; Version Control Systems (Git) and CI/CD; Intelligent Automation/RPA; Process Mining; Agile Methodology & Scrum  Nach deinem erfolgreichen Programmabschluss erhältst du einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag und wirst Teil eines funktionsübergreifenden Teams.  Darauf freuen wir uns   Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder Naturwissenschaften bzw. eine solide IT-Ausbildung  Erste Kenntnisse in der Programmierung mit Python, Java, Scala und C++/C#), in der Programmierung von Datenbanken (SQL), in relationalen Datenbanken und Systemen sowie in der Datenintegration  Sehr gute analytisch-konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, eine hohe Lernbereitschaft und Begeisterung für innovative Technologien  Kommunikations- und Präsentationssicherheit in sehr gutem Deutsch und Englisch  Dein Kontakt  Du hast Fragen? Dann wende dich an unser Recruiting Team per E-Mail an recruiting_germany@accenture.com oder telefonisch unter 00800 45045045.   Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: As a Data Scientist at QuantCo, you will learn what it takes to create impact from data: identifying the right framework to translate a business question into a statistical problem; locating and combining data sources as well as transforming large datasets; running in-depth analyses; building machine learning models that automate large-scale decisions and integrating them into live business processes; and interpreting, visualizing, and communicating results to internal and external stakeholders.    Aspiring data scientists should be team players with excellent quantitative abilities and:     A degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, industrial engineering or similar fields from a leading university Experience in coding and working with data using a wide range of tools and languages: Python (Pandas, XGBoost/LightGBM), R (dplyr, ggplot2), and git Bonus: SQL, Tensorflow/Keras, Cloud infrastructure, Docker, and a lower-level language like C/C++/C# In-depth understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts behind most common machine learning techniques Ability to see solutions and opportunities that others do not see High level of commitment and reliability, good balance of pragmatism and perfectionism Business proficiency in German and English    Compensation  We are looking for exceptionally motivated and highly skilled candidates for available data scientist positions. We offer a generous compensation package that includes a base salary, bonus, and stock options along with additional benefits based on location.    About QuantCo  We leverage expertise in data science, engineering, and economics to help organizations turn data into decisions. Started by 4 PhDs from Harvard and Stanford, we are now more than 90 professionals with extensive quantitative, engineering, and business experience.    QuantCo’s product line includes algorithmic pricing, data-driven claims management, and high-dimensional forecasting solutions. Our clients are some of the largest financial, retail, and healthcare organizations in the U.S. and Europe.    We are excited about writing code that affects millions of people and impacts billions of dollars. If you feel the same way, we look forward to hearing from you.     QuantCo does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Duales Studium Informatik (m/w/d)
Description: Aufgabe   Als Bachelor of Science in Informatik (m/w/d) hast du die Chance, die Digitalisierung aktiv zu gestalten und dafür zu sorgen, dass die IT-Infrastruktur weiter ausgebaut wird.   In den 3 Jahren Studium bist du pro Semester ca. 12 Wochen an der Dualen Hochschule Stuttgart und die restliche Zeit in deiner Telekom-Abteilung eingesetzt.   Du kannst dich entweder für den klassischen Informatikstudiengang entscheiden oder zwischen den Vertiefungsrichtungen Computational Data Science oder Informationstechnik auswählen.   Diese Studienschwerpunkte erwarten dich:   Theoretische Informatik und Programmieren Software Engineering und Datenbanken Technische Informatik und Mathematik  Detailliertere Informationen über die Studieninhalte aller DHBW Studiengänge findest du hier .   Mögliche Einsatzfelder, in denen du dein Wissen in der Praxis einsetzen kannst, gibt es z.B. im Bereich Big Data, IT-Security Consulting oder IT-Projektmanagement.   Du willst wissen woran wir aktuell arbeiten? Hier findest du aktuelle Infos.   Nach erfolgreichem Abschluss deines Studiums kannst du deine erlernten Kenntnisse und Fähigkeiten z.B. als Junior IT-Administrator (m/w/d) oder Software Engineer (m/w/d) anwenden.   #IRE#      Profil    Bei uns stehst du immer im Mittelpunkt. Gemeinsam gestalten wir deinen individuellen Karriereweg und arbeiten an Projekten, die spürbaren Einfluss haben - auf dich und auf unsere Gesellschaft.   Um bei uns richtig durchzustarten, solltest du Folgendes mitbringen:   Gutes Abitur oder Fachabitur Mathe, Informatik, Physik und Englisch zählen zu deinen Lieblingsfächern Digitale Medien interessieren dich und du gibst dein Wissen gerne weiter Du hast Spaß am Lernen und hast das Ziel immer fest im Blick Die Arbeit im Team gefällt dir und du gehst aktiv auf andere Menschen zu

Title: Cloud Operations Intern for SAR (f/m/x)
Description: Your challenge    As the main operator of our Ground Deformation product, you’ll be responsible for configuring, executing, troubleshooting, and tuning our pipeline Working with our AWS-based infrastructure Coordinating with different teams and subject matter experts for bug fixes Coordinating project deliverables and deadlines with the project manager Proactive attitude and initiation for improvements are highly encouraged We encourage female applicants and applicants from diverse backgrounds.    Our tech stack:    AWS Docker Python Linux (Ubunto/Debian) Bash Git GitLab CI QGIS GDAL GMT Postman    Your profile    You are enrolled at least for a year in university (Ba/Ma) in the field of geosciences, geoinformation, computer science, data science, mathematics, physics, statistics, business informatics or alike High degree of self-management and process efficiency Strong verbal and written communication skills in English, German is a plus Open to full-time employment after the internship    Your Benefits    The opportunity to help create a product that can improve business processes & life across the globe Flat hierarchies as well as short and open communication Start-up culture with a high degree of freedom and responsibility Office located in the center of Berlin Kreuzberg, free fruits & drinks International team and frequent team events Learn and development opportunities    LiveEO is a well funded startup founded in 2018 and based in Berlin. Our primary service is modelling risk to our customers’ assets and infrastructure from vegetation, ground deformation and change detection. We currently have 90+ employees from all over the world with a variety of backgrounds
