Title: Test and Integration Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Toposens is the first company in the world to commercialize 3D ultrasonic sensors. Our sensors mimic the echolocation techniques of a bat to help autonomous systems perceive their environment. Ranging from intelligent robots to self-driving cars, our technology provides perception capabilities to multiple domains, making them smarter and safer with every product iteration. Our clients include some of the world's leading companies in robotics and automotive. At Toposens, we play an active role in accelerating the development of safety-critical autonomy and make the world a little better every day.   Aufgaben   System Tests and Functional Tests: By coordinating and executing system test tasks and functional tests for our sensor systems you play an essential role in bringing a new innovation to market. Enhancement/Development of Test Software: With your programming expertise you take our test software to the next level. Test Environments and Test Scenarios: You are in charge of the construction of test setups and laboratory test facilities as well as test automations. You analyse the hardware and software functional requirements of the system and define the test strategy. Specifications, Protocols and Reports: You create test specifications, test protocols test reports and bug reports that help us increase sensor performance and stability.   Qualifikation   You hold a degree in electrical engineering, computer science, information technology or similar. You enhance our testing software with your innovative mind and the following programming skills: Python C++ is a plus Ideally you have experience with UI development and data visualization as well as with Database Systems Experience with ROS/ROS2 is a plus You set high quality standards for the code you create, and you are familiar with git, code reviews and Linux. You are familiar with the design and construction of test benches. As the link between sensor development and application engineering you enjoy aligning both sides and working hand in hand with the other engineers. With your respectful, cooperative and pleasant personality you are a great contribution to our team. You are able to acquire new knowledge, tackle problems, create solutions and new concepts by yourself but also know how to contribute most efficiently to great teamwork. You have good skills in German and excellent English skills. You see problems as exciting challenges and you come up with creative solutions.    Benefits    Work in an aspiring high-tech startup with prestigious customers. Opportunity to actively shape your role and bring your own ideas to the table. A nurturing environment where we care for your personal and professional growth. A loyal, fun-loving team, that is looking forward to meeting you. Fresh fruits, cereals, coffee and other snacks to keep you fueled. A well-equipped lab and test room - spaces for creativity and solutions. We offer you a permanent contract, ESOP and a market-standard salary. Contribution to company pension scheme. New employee offers via corporate benefits every month. Our office is located in Northern Munich (U6 Alte Heide) with many food places in walking distance.

Title: Cloud Systems Engineer
Description: What We Do    Cambrium’s mission is to trigger the next wave of material innovation. We are leveraging the power of biotechnology to design and develop cutting-edge materials for a greener tomorrow. We enable new biomaterials in cosmetics, fashion and plastics by harnessing nature's building blocks. We have built a platform based on an automated laboratory, machine learning and synthetic biology to design and develop novel protein materials with enhanced chemical and physical properties.    We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity. We consider all applications equally regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity. We strongly encourage individuals from groups traditionally underrepresented in tech to apply, and we can help with immigration.    Your role  We are looking for a Cloud Systems Engineer who will be responsible for developing and maintaining cloud systems to power the engineering cycle going on in the laboratory and in the minds of our scientists. You will interface together with biochemists, automation engineers, and computational scientists to deploy these new solutions, which span from VPC management to data architecture or cloud policy-making. You will have the opportunity to shape our cloud architecture and help establish best practices for the introduction of new technology and processes within the company.   You will be one of the early employees, having an outsized impact, shaping the company through your efforts, scientific experience and industry expertise.    What You Will Do    You will expand and optimize our cloud architecture and pipelines, as well as their incorporation across different teams. This includes: helping design a data and network infrastructure for greater scalability, connecting the cloud to robots, orchestrating workflows. You will support our scientific computing initiatives by facilitating development of new apps and consistency throughout on-going projects through managing a robust cloud environment. You will work with several of our teams (laboratory or computational) to assist with related technical issues and infrastructure needs. You will also be tasked with keeping our data secure.   Your profile  We are looking for candidates that are proficient in data stack engineering and production-level software-engineering technologies, at the interface with biology and material science.   __What we think is important:   MS in computer science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience 1+ year of programming experience in an industry-like environment: usage of a version control software, production code vs development code, CI/CD integration Experience with cloud deployment of data infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP), including infrastructure-as-code such as Terraform or Cloudformation Keen interest in keeping up robust software engineering standards, and maintaining and continuously improving a complex code infrastructure Organizational, interpersonal and communication skills; ability to work within a collaborative environment where your voice will be heard Fluency in English   What we also like in applicants:   Proficiency in things we enjoy working with: Python, Git, Docker, (no-)SQL frameworks, Google Cloud, Terraform Statistical skills, with data science and/or machine learning experience is a plus Good self governance in planning, prioritizing and implementing, using discretion and independent judgment within broadly defined practices Curiosity and open-mindedness Desire to learn new things    What We Offer    In addition to a competitive salary and equity package, you can expect the following:   Employee Stock Options Flexible working hours (useful when you need to compose with kids!) Learning & Development Program for all our team members Regular team events Exchange with other Merantix sister companies Passionate lunch discussions about random topics from space glue to the differentiation of the pistachio nut Ugly holiday sweater competitions (we won the Halloween competition!) Free drinks, fruit, and breakfast (to keep your brain fed!)__

Wenn Sie schon immer die Digitalisierung vorantreiben wollten und Ihnen ein nachhaltiges Umfeld wichtig ist, dann ist diese Stelle genau passend für Sie. C1)     Benefits     30 Tage Urlaub   Individuelle Weiterbildungs- und Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten   BAV   Vermögenswirksame Leistungen   Flache Hierarchien und die Möglichkeit aktiv mitgestalten zu können   Weitere zahlreiche Benefits wie Firmenevents, Sportangebot und wechselnde Mittagsangebote       Ich freue mich auf Ihre Bewerbung!

Title: Automotive Tool Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Job Description    DXC Technology is the world's leading independent provider of next-generation end-to-end IT services. Our goal is to shape the digital transformation for our customers and thus generate added value for their business. With our global experience, our consulting capabilities, and our leading position as an IT service and solution provider, we support our customers in their digital transformation and in the exploitation of the opportunities presented by digitization.   One key business of DXC is developing Autonomous Driving Solutions (AD/ADAS) for the automotive industry with many OEM's and their suppliers as customers. DXC is selected as strategic partner of a major automotive supplier to develop new solutions on AWS platforms. There are various projects established in this environment for the upcoming years. Join our team to develop toolsets for the Robotic Drive environment on AWS platform. Our team   supports an international Robotic Drive development team based in several locations in Europe.   Technologies used:  AWS / Elasticsearch / Apache Airflow / Python / Docker    What You Will Do    Developing toolsets for the Robotic Drive Environment on AWS platform, containing a Robotic Drive Solution Development Suite, monitoring tools, reporting tools, and data analytics tools Testing, delivering, deploying, and maintaining the toolsets Suggesting innovative ideas to improve toolsets and solutions Collaborating with customer team to align on requirements Working in Agile mode    What You Should Bring    At least two years of experience in automotive industry with DevOps projects Understanding of architectural dependencies of technologies used in the Robotic Drive environments Good German language skills (in written and spoken) Experience with Meta Data DBS such as Elasticsearch Experience with Apache Airflow, Python, Docker, Elastic Search (at least 2 of these skills, 2 years experience) High motivation and team spirit Good communication skills with a customer and a global team    What We Offer You    Flexible working time models and Home-office contract An attractive salary packages Training and mentoring to support the implementation projects Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and products in state-of-the-art enterprise environments, providing services to a variety of worldwide customers' infrastructures Demanding and varied customer projects at one of the world's largest and most successful IT service providers paired with opportunities for rapid advancement and challenging activities with a high degree of freedom and responsibility Lived values that make us one of the most attractive employers worldwide - Top 25 of Comparably's list of companies with "Best Global Culture 2021" and Top 50 in "Best CEO 2020" ranking In addition, DXC Technology stands for equal opportunities and offers employees the compatibility of family and work as well as continuous development opportunities

Title: Trainee “Quantitative Models and Data Analytics” (m/w/d)
Description: Start zum Traumjob: jeweils zum 1. des Quartals    Wir finanzieren Fortschritt. Als Spezialbank fokussieren wir uns auf ausgesuchte Zukunftssektoren – national sowie international. Jeden Tag geben wir unser Bestes, um für jede Anforderung optimale Lösungen zu bieten – für unsere Kunden und unsere Trainees. Klingt nach Traumarbeitgeber? Willkommen bei uns.    Du stehst kurz vor dem Ende Deines Studiums? Oder hast es im letzten halben Jahr abgeschlossen? Dann starte mit einem unserer ausgezeichneten Traineeprogramme ins Berufsleben!  Dafür engagierst Du Dich     Anspruchsvolle und komplexe Fragestellungen, die mit quantitativen Modellen beantwortet werden können Mitarbeit bei der (Weiter-)Entwicklung und Pflege von quantitativen Modellen der Banksteuerung (z.B. Kreditportfoliomodelle, VaR-Modelle für Marktpreisrisiken, XVA-Modelle, Pricing-Modell für Handelsprodukte, Liquiditätsrisiko-Modelle), der Konzeptionierung neuer Produkte sowie der zugehörigen Begleitung bei der Implementierung in den IT-Systemen der Bank Strukturelle Analyse interner und externer Daten unter Nutzung moderner Analysesoftware (z.B. R, Python, Tableau, Ab Initio) sowie neuer fachlicher Methoden Unterstützung bei der Prozessoptimierung bzw. Automatisierung des Regelbetriebs in den Gesamtbanksteuerungseinheiten (z.B. im Risikocontrolling oder im Treasury) oder im Handel Einblick und Mitarbeit in übergreifenden Bankprojekten zur Harmonisierung der bankinternen Infrastruktur Wertvolle Einblicke und Mitwirkung in fünf verschiedenen Stationen, darunter auch eine Abteilung in einer unserer ausländischen Niederlassungen und/oder bei einer Konzerntochter (z.B. DKB AG) je nach Kapazität     Das bringst Du mit   Guter bis sehr guter Bachelor- oder Masterabschluss in Mathematik, Wirtschaftsmathematik, Statistik, Ökonometrie, Data Science, Physik, (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder in einem vergleichbaren Studiengang Interesse an einer facettenreichen Tätigkeit in der Bankenbranche Begeisterung für stetige Weiterentwicklung und Optimierung unserer Modelllandschaft unter modernen fachlichen und technischen Aspekten Engagement, Eigeninitiative, Kreativität und Spaß an der konzeptionellen und operativen Arbeit Freude an der Teamarbeit     Wir wollen, dass Du gerne bei uns arbeitest  Dafür geben wir als Bank und Arbeitgeber unser Bestes. Deshalb bieten wir Dir unter anderem:   Erfahrene Bank-Mitarbeitende als Mentor/innnen für die Dauer des Trainee-Programms Individuelle Schulungsmaßnahmen zur Ergänzung und Abrundung Deines Profils Eine individuelle Einsatzplanung unter Berücksichtigung Deiner Interessen, basierend auf Stationen mit quantitativem Fokus Einsatzmöglichkeiten in einer Niederlassung in Deutschland oder einem unserer Standorte im Ausland sowie unseren Konzerntöchtern je nach Kapazität Möglichkeit zu einem sozialen Auslandsprojekt über unsere Kooperation mit AIESEC Vielfältiges Seminarangebot und Möglichkeiten zum Networking auf verschiedenen Ebenen Eine moderne Kantine im Haus (München) Einen Sportclub am Englischen Garten Und vieles mehr.....    Bei Fragen vorab melde Dich gerne bei Katharina Hartmann, Bereich Human Resources,  Telefon +49 89 2171-23922.

Title: Powertrain Data Engineer, Drive Unit (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
Description: What To Expect    Tesla is accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. Revolutionary strategies and products were developed within a few years and successfully launched on a large scale. This is only possible through extraordinary speed, innovation and efficiency. Gigafactory Berlin forms the perfect basis for rolling out Tesla's incredible success story in Europe. The most important pillar for this are our employees. Their passion, motivation and engagement ensure that we achieve our goals. We are looking for you to continue and expand this success story together. Tesla is looking to hire an enthusiastic Data Engineer in Powertrain, supporting the Drive Unit business at Gigafactory Berlin. You will be responsible for building the reporting necessary to measure key performance indicators for Tesla’s production, quality and maintenance teams, increasing efficiency through data and analytics. During our ramp up phase in Berlin, you ‘d make sure data streams from new equipment are correctly implemented in the data architecture of our Manufacturing execution System. Provide proactive analysis and build models helping to drive business programs, inform decisions and optimize operations. Act as an advisor to the business, overcome challenges and build the future. This role will interact with numerous internal customers who consume and use data in their decision-making processes. The ability to work with and clearly understand these internal customers’ needs will be critical to succeed in this role.    What You’ll Do    Contribute to the commissioning of new production lines, ensuring data connectivity to factory systems and proper end-to-end Data flow. Support the analysis of manufacturing and equipment data. Extract useful statistics, insights, trends and drive corrective and meaningful improvements towards production quality excellence and best customer experience. Work effectively with engineers and conduct end-to-end analysis, from data requirement gathering, to data processing and modeling Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide reporting Monitor key product metrics, understanding root causes of changes in metrics Support the identification, analysis, and interpretation of trends or patterns in complex data sets and depict the story via dashboards and reports Maintain and extend existing data visualizations, data pipelines and dashboard enhancement requests Support data acquisition from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems to empower operational and exploratory analysis Support automation analyses and authoring pipelines via SQL and Python based ETL framework Drive underlying data systems improvement by working with key cross-functional stakeholders Perform data quality validations to ensure data creation is as per the business needs and expectations Work with management to prioritize business and information needs    What You’ll Bring    MSc or BSc degree in Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent in experience. Multiple years of relevant experience in an automated manufacturing environment is a strong plus. Experience writing software with Python Experience with multiple data architecture paradigms (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, Kafka, Spark) Experience and interest in frontend development Knowledge of various data communication protocols (e.g. REST API, Websockets) Able to work under pressure while collaborating and managing competing demands with tight deadlines Fundamental knowledge of statistical data analysis A passion and curiosity for data and data-driven decision making

Title: Analytics Engineer (open to full remote in Germany)
Description: Back Market is the world’s leading refurbished electronics marketplace with a team of more than 650, powering operations in 16 countries (and counting!).   Back Market is undergoing meteoric growth and has raised $884 million, with a valuation of $5.7 billion. Our mission is simple: empowering people to buy tech sustainably by offering folks a high quality, accessible, and more eco-friendly alternative to buying new electronics. Why? Refurbished tech helps lower our collective environmental impact .   Be part of a great and growing adventure that will change the way the world consumes tech.   Can you build bridges between the business and the data world? Do you like to inspire the business with your data know-how? Can you translate business needs into data use cases and lead them to success? Do you want to have a meaningful impact through your job?   Here is your opportunity.   As an analytics engineer, you will work on a daily basis with data engineers, BI analysts, developers, and business teams to build and maintain the source of truth of our data model.   You’ll be responsible for :   Building and maintaining the core source of truth of the company: the one that is transversal to the whole company Challenging the vision of the data model, i.e. what are the core concepts at Back Market and how to represent them, based on your keen business eye fuelled with exchange with BI and business partners Designing a data model that scales thanks to your architecture skills Mentoring the BI on building their source of truth on their specialized scope, e.g. finance, care…, while respecting your good practices In the end, you will be one of the key players in the adoption of the self-service of data in the company. The quality of the data in your data model thanks to your rigor and communication: you are building the source of truth of the company, and every change needs to be controlled and properly advertised You are ready to follow and accompany the change, from a team organization point of view, work methods, pace of delivery etc…    You're perfect for this role if :   A strong experience (4 years and more) as a technical data analyst / BI, during which you built some data models. Bonus points if you already have experience in the marketplace / scale ups You have a technical, analytical or scientific educational background (e.g. data analysis, business intelligence) or comparable professional experience You know your way around python, enough to adapt existing logicYou are expert in SQL You have worked with Google Analytics data before You have no problem with navigating ambiguous situations and have a profound problem-solver attitude using data and the user at the center of all your thoughts Your great communication and interpersonal skills help you in building strong relationships and handling business stakeholders and top management expectations You are rigorous, humble, curious and proactive. Team spirit is essential for you English is a no brainer, we are an international team.    WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US ?   A meaningful job: through hard work, you will help avoid thousands of tons of electronic waste and fight against planned obsolescence. It counts! An attractive salary, equity, multiple benefits (meal tickets, health insurance, etc...), parental benefits, #remote friendly company, relocation package, internal events, etc… Technical challenges all day every day: you will have the freedom to innovate and adopt new ideas! Work with passionate experts who will share their knowledge and help you develop and grow! (Backademy, technical guilds, Meet-up & Conference) Grow your career with a flexible career path, BackMarket can help you evolve! A booming scale-up: our environment is rapidly growing in Europe, the USA and soon in Asia! A lot of fun: you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, open-minded and friendly environment.    BackMarket is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Title: Software Engineer (Backend / Python) at Serviceware AI (m/f/d)
Description: back to the job offers   Your perspectives with us   What do you work on at Serviceware?   You develop cloud services that enable large service enterprises to automate their customer service with the help of natural language processing (NLP). These services consist of a combination of question answering, intent recognition, entity extraction, and clustering algorithms based on a modern Python stack. Building these services come with the challenge to adapt techniques from NLP and machine learning (ML) to modern cloud environments.   How is this special?   Solving problems on a high level of abstraction; each solution needs to usable for many enterprises (and not only for one). Extending existing solutions which an enterprise has been using for long time and through the availability of data show a high potential to be supported via ML.   What working environment do you enter?   The best mix of: personal interaction, the possibility to take responsibility and shape the future of our services offered by a small company, and the ambition and possibilities of a stock listed enterprise. Working with many experts in ML, covering a wide range of topics, and extensive cooperation with the TU Darmstadt.   What do you need to know about Serviceware?   Serviceware is a leading provider of software solutions that facilitate the digitization of service processes and includes more than 500 employees across 14 locations. In 2019, we started an innovation center focusing on Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning. Serviceware AI was born! In fast iterations, we take advantage of the recent progress in AI & ML to develop new features that run in production and are highly scalable.   These tasks are waiting for you   You design, develop, test, and deploy software services that leverage ML within our service management platform. You contribute to the selection of technologies and the design of IT architectures. You take care of the CI/CD pipeline and cooperate with our data scientists to bring new ML models to production. You will work on a modern tech stack including Python, Docker, Git, PostgreSQL, the HashiCorp Stack (Nomad, Terraform, Vault), Keycloak and the ELK Stack (Elastic Search, Logstash, Kibana).   What you have to offer   Passion for writing beautiful and maintainable code. Strong experience with Python or a similar programming language. Good knowledge of software architecture principles, data structures, and design patterns. At least two years of experience in building and shipping (enterprise) software. Effective communication skills (fluent in English).   What we offer you   You have the chance to substantially influence our service management platform, which is used by over 1,000 companies every day. We offer multiple options to improve your professional skills, in particular through our collaboration with the technical university in Darmstadt. You work two to three days per week in our office, which is located centrally in Darmstadt and offers a large roof top terrace and modern air conditioning. Taking responsibility of results and supporting each other is the core element of our company culture. You will join our international team which does not only build great software, but also likes cooking, biking, gardening, and playing the guitar.   Your contact at SERVICEWARE   Vanessa Rivera   Human Resources   +49 6434 9450 0    How To Apply    Are you thrilled to join the team?! We can’t wait to read your application. Please consider the following guidelines when applying at Serviceware AI:   Applications are possible in English as well as in German. We expect you to write a short cover letter that tells us why you like to work at Serviceware AI. (Please don’t use stock cover letters. We’d love to hear why you like this particular job.) While we enjoy reading about your experiences, please keep your CV focused on the main points. We are not looking for CVs with more than two to three pages.   back to the job offers

Title: Trainee Data (AI / Big Data Analytics / Data Management) (all genders)
Description: Du willst dich in nur sechs Wochen zum/zur gefragten Data-Spezialist:in entwickeln? Das ist genau dein Ding?   Dann lebe deine Leidenschaft in einer Position, in der du als Data Engineer namhafte Unternehmen rund ums Thema Applied Intelligence berätst.   Das erwartet dich  Unser sechswöchiges Traineeprogramm bereitet dich systematisch auf deine Karriere als Berater:in im Bereich Applied Intelligence und damit auf deinen Einsatz in anspruchsvollen Kundenprojekten vor.  Du lernst, auf was es bei der Projektvorbereitung ankommt, schärfst deine Softskills und machst dich mit agilen Projektmethoden vertraut. Dazu vermitteln wir dir die Grundlagen kommender Data-Warehousing- und Analytics-Architekturen.  Im Anschluss lernst du die Tools und Technologien eines Data Engineers kennen. Abhängig von der aktuellen Marktentwicklung und technologischen Trends folgt eine Vertiefung in nachfolgende Module: Introduction to Big Data Management (Analytics, Machine Learning & AI); Data Integration; ETL & Streaming Technologies; Data Warehousing; Cloud Hyperscaler (GCP, AWS, Azure); Python Programming; Version Control Systems (Git) and CI/CD; Intelligent Automation/RPA; Process Mining; Agile Methodology & Scrum  Nach deinem erfolgreichen Programmabschluss erhältst du einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag und wirst Teil eines funktionsübergreifenden Teams.  Darauf freuen wir uns   Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder Naturwissenschaften bzw. eine solide IT-Ausbildung  Erste Kenntnisse in der Programmierung mit Python, Java, Scala und C++/C#), in der Programmierung von Datenbanken (SQL), in relationalen Datenbanken und Systemen sowie in der Datenintegration  Sehr gute analytisch-konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, eine hohe Lernbereitschaft und Begeisterung für innovative Technologien  Kommunikations- und Präsentationssicherheit in sehr gutem Deutsch und Englisch  Dein Kontakt  Du hast Fragen? Title: Cloud Application Developer (m/f/d) IIoT
Description: AVANTGARDE Experts places Software Engineering Experts (m/f/d) all over Germany in the fields of web & mobile development, data science, AI and a lot more different areas. Apply today and find your exciting job at one of our prestigious costumers!   For our client, a leading IIoT & industry 4.0 application manufacturer, we are currently filling following position in a permanent employment:   Cloud Application Developer (m/f/d) IIoT   YOUR TASKS   Design, integration, maintenance and further development of highly scalable, secure & reliable cloud services and applications Responsibility for the whole application life cycle with focus on backend development Contribution of own development best practises as well as involvement in strategic & architectural decisions Closely working together in a motivated & agile team following modern development methodologies like CI/CD    Your Qualifications   Several years of professional experience in cloud application development (preferably in AWS environment) Strong expertise in modern programming languages like Python and TypeScript Used to work with NoSQL as well as SQL databases (e.g. PostgreSQL) Experience with DevOps tools / methods like CI/CD and good understanding of IT security would be a plus Very good English language skills and passionate about working in an international, agile SCRUM team    Benefits   Start-up feeling with the security of a market leading enterprise in the back Being part of an established TECH department which forms the "heartpiece" of the company Taking on responsibility in an agile and international team in which you can really leave a footprint State-of-the art technologies and appreciative working atmosphere that fosters continuous training & knowledge sharing Attractive salary package and numerous employer benefits like additional company bonus, 30 days off, flexible working hours, remote option in Germany, company pension plan and much more    INTERESTED?  Then we look forward to receiving your application including salary and earliest starting date via our online portal.

Title: Data Entry for English Speakers in Germany
Description: Work From Home Opportunities at Appen     "Even if you're at home we will bring the best opportunity to you"       Are you creative, have a passion for photography, and want to work for a leading technology provider and help train a machine learning model for automatic color neutralization?      We are looking for individuals with specific camera equipment who may be professional, semi-professional, or avid enthusiasts/ hobbyists who can understand and set specific camera operations. You will be taking videos with a variety of lighting conditions, and different backgrounds and will be of people and/or pets performing specific activities as outlined.       Requirements:    *Must have ONEor MOREof the following types of hardware and specific device models to be used for video captures:       Mirrorless/ DSLR cameras    Sony rx100 V OR Sony ZV-1 | Capture format: LOG, HLG  Sony A7S III | Capture format: Log (S-Log3-Cine), HLG  Canon EOS R5 | Capture format: Log (Canon-log-3), HDR PQ (All I)  Panasonic GH5S | Capture format: Log (Panasonic vlog), HLG internal, ProRes HQ (with Atomos Ninja 5)  Fujifilm X-T3 or X-T4 | Capture format: Log (F-Log), HLG  Nikon Z6 or Z7 | Capture format: Log (N-Log) & ProRes Raw (with Atomos Ninja 5)       Action cameras    DJI OSMO Action 4K or DJI Pocket 2 | Capture format: HDR  GoPro HERO8 Black | Capture format: HEVC (H. 265), standard H. 264 (AVC)       Drones    Any DJI model | Capture format: 4K HDR       Atomos recorder    Any model | Capture format: ProResRAW       Apple    iPhone X OR iPhone 11 Or iPad Air | Capture format: SD  iPhone 12 | Capture format: HDR  iPad Pro (2021) | Capture format: HDR       Interested? To get started, please sign up using the link below.👇     https://connect.appen.com/qrp/public/jobs?sref=5bc237b472861276d48836658a0a41c7      Make sure to add all your native languages when creating your profile in the system. Once your account has been created, click the 'All Projects' Tab and "Continue" to complete your Profile and Unlock More Projects.      Thank you and we hope to work with you soon!      "A diverse, inclusive culture is vital to our mission of helping build better AI. We offer opportunities for individuals of all abilities and backgrounds."

Title: Salesforce Engineer (all genders)
Description: What To Expect    We are looking for a Salesforce engineer (all genders) - including administrative tasks - who is willing to take ownership of Salesforce within a MedTech startup growing rapidly with a strong focus on automation and data consistency. You will be taking requirements from our Business Analyst and working closely with the data, operations and sales departments to establish Salesforce data models allowing operational workflows, automation of operational tasks, insightful analysis and increased data consistency. Your work will contribute to one of the most transformative shifts emerging in healthcare.   Your Challenges   You will be maintaining, developing, documenting, and enforcing application changes, standards, and procedures. You will be responsible for Salesforce configuration and data object management (Salesforce administration). You will be taking and refining requirements and converting them into solutions. You will be integrating systems within Salesforce, including third-party applications. You will be responsible for modification of standard objects and fields and creation of custom objects and fields.   Your profile   You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, natural science, mathematics, physics or in a related field You bring at least 2+ years experience working with Salesforce You have a very good understanding of object-oriented programming concepts You have broad experience working with Salesforce Lightning framework and Developer Console You are proficient in Visualforce and Apex You have Salesforce administration experience You are a strong analytical thinker and problem solver Your high attention to detail is appreciated You can work independently You are a strong team player and enjoy working in a team You are a motivated and fast learner   Ideally, you bring in addition:   A good understanding of C#, Javascript, jQuery, AngularJS, Bootstrap, Python and / or SQL Dev 1 Certification Experience in an agile working environment Proficiency in German Language   Why Caspar Health?   Looking for commitment? Perfect match! We offer a permanent employment contract. You don't want to just be a number? Understandable. With us, the human-being is the focus. We currently have initiatives on diversity and inclusion as well as a common reflection room on our work culture in which every Casparian* can participate and thus actively contribute to your working environment and Caspar’s development. You appreciate feedback? We're happy to hear it. We encourage an open feedback culture to learn and grow together. You value a good work-life balance? So do we, and that's why we offer flexible working hours, mobile working and various models for part-time work. You want to develop yourself continuously? We support this with an individual annual training budget for all Casparians*. You value your health? So do we! We offer a generous remote policy to protect you according to your health needs during the pandemic. Plus, as a Casparian*, you can take advantage of our health app with mental health-, exercise -, and nutrition modules for free. Of course, we also offer fresh fruit and a variety of healthy snacks and drinks in the office.   Diversity and Inclusion:   At Caspar Health, we strive to provide a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for all Casparians* regardless of ethnic origin, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, limitations of any kind, physical appearance, social background, age or religion (or lack thereof).   When you apply, we purely focus on your experience and motivation. You decide what additional information you want to disclose (picture, marital status, religion, gender, nationality, etc). We value and treat all applications equally.   We are looking forward to getting to know you!

Title: Junior Software Engineer Java EE (m/w/d)
Description: Sie suchen Aufgaben mit gesellschaftlicher Relevanz? Sie möchten moderne und sichere Systeme für Millionen von Menschen erschaffen? Sie möchten mit uns die deutschen Verwaltungen in die digitale Zukunft führen? In unserer Brancheneinheit Public Sector können Sie in einem multidisziplinären Team Maßstäbe setzen. Abwechslungsreiche und verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben warten auf Sie – in einer Zukunftsbranche, die so schnell wächst wie kaum eine andere. Gute Zusammenarbeit als Team ist uns genauso wichtig wie ein individuelles persönliches Entwicklungskonzept, dessen Gestaltung Sie steuern können.   msg ist eine unabhängige Unternehmensgruppe mit weltweit mehr als 9.000 Mitarbeitenden. Unseren ausgezeichneten Ruf verdanken wir unserem ganzheitlichen Leistungsspektrum aus einfallsreicher strategischer Beratung und intelligenten, nachhaltig wertschöpfenden IT-Lösungen für eine Vielzahl von Branchen.   Das erwartet Sie bei uns   Mitarbeit bei der Digitalisierung der öffentlichen Verwaltung in spannenden, abwechslungsreichen Projekten Durchführung von Analyse, Konzeption, Programmierung, Test und Einführung von Softwaresystemen im Java- /JEE-/ Spring-Umfeld Mitgestaltung von Fach- und IT-Architekturen von Softwaresystemen Abstimmung von Anforderungen und Präsentation von Ergebnissen beim Kunden Unterstützung bei der Beratung unserer Kunden im technologischen Umfeld Java, JEE, Spring-Anwendungen (Client und / oder Server), Oracle und aktuellen Open Source Technologien Perspektivisch Option zur Teilnahme an unseren fachlichen Weiterentwicklungsprogrammen „Next Level: IT-Architektur“ oder „Next Level: Data Science“ „Grow Your Talent“: Methodisch fundierte Angebote u.a. zur Förderung persönlicher Stärken    Das bringen Sie mit   IT-naher (Fach-)Hochschulabschluss oder vergleichbare Ausbildung Idealerweise erste Erfahrungen in Konzeption und Realisierung von Softwaresystemen Kenntnisse in der Softwareentwicklung (Methoden, Datenbanken, Frameworks, Tools, Patterns) sowie ein Grundverständnis von IT-Vorgehensmodellen (V-Modell XT, Scrum o. ä.) Interesse in spannenden und innovativen Projekten die Digitalisierung des öffentlichen Sektors mitzugestalten Sie haben Spaß an kreativer Arbeit im Team und die Bereitschaft zur Mobilität    Das ist unser Angebot  Suchen Sie Abwechslung statt Alltagsroutine? Teamspirit statt starrer Hierarchien? Dann sind Sie bei uns richtig. Wir bieten Ihnen spannende verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben, attraktive Karrierechancen und internationale Perspektiven. Mehr noch: Bei uns finden Sie ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, großzügige Sozialleistungen und ein professionelles, kollegiales Arbeitsklima in einem hochmotivierten Team.

Title: Junior Softwareentwickler (m/w/d) Android
Description: Wir sind ein expandierendes Softwareunternehmen, das auf die Entwicklung komplexer Individualsoftware und Data Science spezialisiert ist. Um unserem Wachstum gerecht zu werden, suchen wir Verstärkung für unser Android-Team in Erlangen. Dich erwartet ein motiviertes Team, mit dem du die zukünftige Generation der Infotainmentsysteme im Premiumsegment der Automobilbranche gestaltest.   Aufgaben   In enger Zusammenarbeit mit deinem Team und dem Kunden bist für die Entwicklung und Wartung von Infotainment-Software auf Basis von Android zuständig Dein Schwerpunkt liegt in der Weiterentwicklung und Optimierung von Benutzeroberflächen zur Steuerung der Abläufe von Infotainment-Funktionsbereichen Du unterstützt beim Requirements Engineering und der Qualitätssicherung durch regelmäßiges Testen   Qualifikation   Ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes, technisches Hochschulstudium, z. B. Informatik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einschlägige Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung Gute Kenntnisse in der Android-Entwicklung in Kotlin oder Java Vorzugsweise Erfahrung mit agilen Methoden Kenntnisse von Test-Driven-Developement (TDD) und Clean Code von Vorteil Analytische und selbstständige Arbeitsweise, Qualitätsbewusstsein und Teamfähigkeit Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift    Benefits    Sorgfältige Einarbeitung durch ein motiviertes Team Vertrauensarbeitszeit und flexible Arbeitszeiten Flexible Homeoffice-Regelungen 33 Tage Jahresurlaub Gezielte fachliche und persönliche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten Ein eigenes Firmenfahrrad, VGN-Zuschuss oder Parkplatz Sehr gute Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr Familienfreundliche Unternehmenskultur Zuschuss zum Premium-Fitnessstudio Freie Getränke, Barista Kaffee, Eis, Obst uvm.   Bewirb dich jetzt!  Bei Fragen zur Stelle oder Bewerbung steht dir Julia Kern  unter +49 9131 972 93 90 zur Verfügung.

Title: Software Engineer Data Integration
Description: ESI Group is seeking an experienced software engineer to perform implementation, multiplication of expertise on PDM/PLM, and enterprise deployment within ESI teams.     Responsibilities include but are not limited to:    · Focus on the design, conceptualization, and implementation of service and integration architectures in the context of Digital Continuity for workflows, processes, and product data.  · Work closely together with product managers and fellow developers to build and integrate highly efficient service solutions in federation and interfacing of multi-vendor, multi-solution PLM / PDM environments with ESI’s portfolio of virtual engineering products.       Required Education, Experience, Skills    · Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.  · In-depth knowledge of data modeling, entity relation handling, and data management practices.  · Deep knowledge of PLM data handling (BOP/*BOM handling, data and process semantics).  · Expertise in interfacing with PDM/PLM systems for data exchange with other applications.  Fluent in English; German is a plus.
