Title: Fullstack Developer (m/w/d)
Description: Wir sind ein junges Team aus erfahrenen Software-Entwicklern, UX-Experten und Data-Science-Spezialisten und wir suchen Verstärkung.   Wir formen die smarte Energiewende mit und entwickeln innovative Software-Lösungen für die Städte von morgen.   Ohne Konzernstrukturen sind wir vor allem agil, flexibel, offen und motiviert. Bei uns zählen gute Ideen und gute Umsetzung und nicht die Hierarchie.   Aufgaben  Gemeinsam mit uns konzipierst und realisierst Du Lösungen für die Plattformen unserer Kunden und unsere eigenen Webservice-Anwendungen.   Du entwickelst coole Produkte in einem agilen Arbeitsumfeld und mit dem neusten Tech-Stack.   Qualifikation   Du hast Erfahrung in agiler Software-Entwicklung. Du weißt, wie man eine sichere und stabile serviceorientierte Architektur erstellt (zum Beispiel mit Python, Java oder Golang). Gebräuchliche Datenbankkonzeption und Hosting insbesondere mit MariaDB und Postgres gehört für Dich zu einem Fullstack-Profil dazu. Du beherrscht Java, SpringBoot und Angular. Du lernst gerne dazu und erweiterst Deine Skills. Optional hast Du schon mal ein Machine-Learning Model zu einem Service-Modell erweitert.    Benefits    Freie Arbeitszeitgestaltung  Du kannst selbst entscheiden wann und von wo Du arbeitest.   Leistung, die sich lohnt  Wir bieten eine ausgezeichnete Vergütung, Altersvorsorge und individuelle Zusatzleistungen.   Modernste, mobile Office-Ausstattung  Wir ermöglichen Dir mit neustem Smartphone und Notebook von überall aus zu arbeiten.   Kein Dresscode  Komplett Deine Entscheidung, was du anziehst. Allerdings sitzt keiner von uns mit einem Schlips vor dem Bildschirm.   Kurze und agile Entscheidungswege  Du arbeitest in einem kleinen Team, das Vorschläge direkt bespricht und sich agil weiterentwickelt.   Weiterentwicklung  Zwei mal im Monat gibt es einen Wissensaustausch im Team sowie einen Self Study Day pro Monat, damit Du dich auch persönlich weiterentwickeln kannst.   Snacks & Drinks  Obst und Getränke gehen im Office natürlich auf uns.   Weiterer toller Kram  Wir denken immer gemeinsame über neue, tolle Benefits nach. Es wird definitiv noch mehr dazu kommen.   Du willst dabei sein?  Klasse, wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennen zu lernen.

Title: Wissenschaftliche Hilfskraft
Description: Position as Student Assistant at the Data and Web Science Group (DWS)    Note: This is a part-time job for students enrolled at a german university.    We are looking for students (Bachelor or Master) to help us bring together the Semantic Web and Machine Learning.    In this context, we offer numerous opportunities for you to get involved in our research:     The development of completely new, domain-specific knowledge graphs or their derivation from existing, unstructured data Application of established knowledge discovery methods to knowledge graphs Development of new approaches for the transformation of structured data into numerical representations (embeddings)    Based on your application and the interview, we may share suitable assignments with you where we suspect you will be comfortable and able to help us. Together we will ultimately decide on your final tasks.    During your work at DWS we are always at your side and support you if necessary. Furthermore, there is also the possibility to work out topics so that they can be published as well.     What are our requirements?     Enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program with a technical orientation (ideally in the fields of computer science or mathematics). Interested in current research questions in the fields of Semantic Web and Machine Learning Ideally first experiences with RDF or data interchange formats like XML or JSON At least basic programming skills (e.g. Python)     Additional information?     A contract with 20-80 hours/week. The duration of employment is initially 3-6 months (but it can be extended). The salary depends on your academic degree and can be found here: https://www.uni-mannheim.de/media/Einrichtungen/Dezernat_V/Dokumente/Einstellungsunterlagen/Broschuere_Hiwis_Mai_2021_final.pdf Flexible working hours, as well as the freedom to choose where you want to work from (hybrid or home office) The possibility of continuing your work in a bachelor's or master's thesis (students who are not enrolled at the University of Mannheim may have to clarify this with their university)     Your application: Important    Besides your application with a short CV, please send a current confirmation of enrollment (Immatrikulationsbescheinigung) and a transcript of records to franz.krause@uni-mannheim.de.

Title: Data Engineer (all genders)
Description: Your Responsibilities    We are an independent team of technical diverse engineers and analysts taking care of the data platform at FRIDAY.   Our mission is to bring data & statistics to FRIDAY's products and processes which includes data ingestion, analysis and software development.   For instance, we are connecting a lot of different data sources and analyze data using statistical models in order to support our pricing team in designing competitive insurance tariffs.   Your first task could include an extension of this product. You would work hand-in-hand with our data analysts and scientist in order to improve statistical models that were developed by them,   add more data sources, improve the user interface and the overall architecture.   Ideally, you would also be involved in planning infrastructure and developing code that supports those models.   Our Tech Stack   Python  powers most of our microservices which are deployed to Kubernetes  .   We prefer quality over high output:   All code is committed to Git. We use GitLab CI and manage our infrastructure in Terraform. Our services are running on AWS exclusively. Data processing and business logic happens mostly in PrestoDB and Spark; workflow orchestration is done by Airflow.    Your Ideal Background And Skillset    You have relevant work experience in the field of data engineering You are curious and always question status quo. You have a passion and the skills required to ship high quality software. You like experimenting with cutting-edge technologies. You like to share and spread your knowledge. You are fluent in English   What you can expect from us:   Opportunity to work for one of the fast-rising InsurTech Startups in Europe. Culture of diversity and creativity with smart people who take pride in what they do. We offer you a fair salary, flexible working hours, the possibility of remote work, a permanent work contract and 30 vacation days. Get the best benefit for you: choose between a free BVG ticket, an Urban Sports Club M membership or a subsidy for your lunch meals. We maintain an open and friendly working atmosphere and offer you an exciting workplace in Berlin-Mitte.__

Title: Analytics Engineer (M/F/X)
Description: Proudly backed by EQT Ventures, Makers Fund and David Helgason. Popcore creates oddly satisfying entertainment for everyone, everywhere, like our number 1 game Parking Jam! We have been listed in the Top 10 hottest Berlin startups & Top 100 European startups by wired.com. Based from our Berlin HQ, our teams have developed and released chart-topping games that have been downloaded more than 500 million times across iOS and Android, including 5+ Top 10 hit games.   We are looking for an analytics engineer to join our data teams. In this role you will work closely with product and game teams, data engineers and analysts to transform their needs into reusable data models. You make sure to provide robust, efficient, clean and accurate datasets for all stakeholders.    What Will You Do    Model raw analytics data into clean reusable data sets Write data transformation jobs in DBT Work closely with stakeholders to understand their requirements and train them on how to use the data Define data quality, rules and standards if needed Create and maintain data documentation and data definitions Apply software engineering best practices for analytics code Work with implementation team to improve tracking     What We Are Looking For    Proficiency in SQL, DBT, Git and Python In-depth knowledge of data transformation Experience with analytics solutions Familiarity with data visualization tools Knowledge of version control, testing and continuous integration    Nice to have   Gaming, Adtech or Analytics domain experience    Why you will love Popcore:   Grow with us We want to enable you to take charge of your career and embark on opportunities that will challenge, motivate and grow you. Our learning and development budget will is one of our ways to help you achieve this. Be part of the team Join an international team of highly qualified and deeply motivated creative and technical people Work your way Set your own work hours, schedule, and location. It's your work, your choice Join the tech hub Learn and work with the latest tools and technology, and connect with the best talent in the industry Relocation aid Relocate seamlessly, we take care of visas, accommodation and support you with paper work Health and Wellbeing Your wellbeing comes first! Get secure health insurance and wellbeing package included* depending on location Hybrid/Remote working We can embrace this working environment and can be available depending on location and role Vacation days You deserve a well earned break! We offer up to 37 days holiday (inc public holidays) Planning ahead We offer a company pension as standard Office When traveling to the office we cover your BVG or bike/e-scooter rental along with free daily lunches and onsite snacks    If this sounds like it ticks all your boxes, stop reading and apply now!   Please don't worry if you don't have an up to date resume just send it along and one of our talent team will be in touch.

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Developer (m/w/d)
Description: #loveyourjob #muenchen #duisburg #essen   Deine Aufgaben   Weiterentwicklung des Data Warehouse als zentraler Baustein der BI-Anwendung Analyse, Umsetzung und Dokumentation von fachlichen Anforderungen im DWH-Umfeld Weiterentwicklung der BI-Testkonzepte (Integrations-, Belastungs- und Performance-Tests) Projektarbeit im interdisziplinärem Team in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Auftraggeber, dem BI Analyst sowie dem IT Betrieb Durchführung von Maßnahmen zur Erhöhung der Datenqualität Entwicklungsmöglicheiten im Bereich BI/DWH-Architekturen (Wherescape) sowie in Requirements Engineering, Weiterentwicklung der BI-Architekturstandards in einer komplexen Umgebung Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten im Bereich Datenmodellierung, in Konzeption und Realisierung von Datenmodellen und –Strukturen (Data Vault 2.0 Ansatz)    Dein Profil   Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Mathematik, Ingenieurs- oder Naturwissenschaften Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen (z.B. SQL) und Datenbankmanagementsystemen (idealerweise Oracle) Sehr gute Deutsch- sowie Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Teamfähigkeit, Belastbarkeit und eine ausgeprägte Kommunikationsstärke    Wir bieten dir   Attraktives Gehaltspaket Betriebliche Altersvorsorge Mobiles Arbeiten –unabhängig von der Covid-19 Pandemie Eine moderne Unternehmenskultur Vielfältiges Weiterbildungs-und Entwicklungsangebot (Inter-)nationale Karriereperspektiven bei der BNP Paribas Gruppe Zuschuss zu ÖPNV, Car- & Bike- Leasing Support für dein Familienleben – mit dem pme Familienservice und wds.eldercare Vergünstigte Sportangebote und Betriebssport    Gestalte mit uns in die Zukunft!  Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung   Dein Kontakt bei uns: Ralph Ullmann   Klick dich gerne durch unsere Karriereseite  Unsere Überzeugung  Wir bewerten alle Bewerberinnen und Bewerber nach ihrer Qualifikation – unabhängig von ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Alter, Geschlecht, sexueller Identität, Religion, Weltanschauung oder eines Handicaps. Wir sind überzeugt, dass gelebte Vielfalt eine positive Auswirkung auf die Gesellschaft und unser Unternehmen hat.   Wer wir sind - 100% BNP Paribas  BNP Paribas hat sich der nachhaltigen und zukunftsgerichteten Gestaltung der Gesellschaft verpflichtet. Dabei sind ethische Grundsätze, Risikobewusstsein und Verantwortung die Grundlagen unseres tagtäglichen Handelns. Die BNP Paribas Gruppe hat es sich zum Ziel gesetzt, ihre Stakeholder – insbesondere Kund:innen, Mitarbeitende, Partner:innen und auch Anteilseigner:innen – sowie die Gesellschaft für nachhaltige Themen zu sensibilisieren, zu motivieren und zu aktivieren. Das Commitment für Diversity hat BNP Paribas mit der Unterzeichnung der Charta der Vielfalt 2017 bekräftigt und ist Teil der Initiative JamaisSansElles, die sich für mehr Sichtbarkeit von Frauen einsetzt.   BNP Paribas ist eine führende europäische Bank mit internationaler Reichweite. Sie ist mit mehr als 193.000 Mitarbeitenden in 68 Ländern vertreten, davon nahezu 147.000 in Europa. In Deutschland ist die BNP Paribas Gruppe seit 1947 aktiv und hat sich mit 12 Geschäftseinheiten erfolgreich am Markt positioniert. Privatkund:innen, Unternehmen und institutionelle Kund:innen werden von rund 6.000 Mitarbeitenden bundesweit in allen relevanten Wirtschaftsregionen betreut. Das breit aufgestellte Produkt- und Dienstleistungsangebot von BNP Paribas entspricht dem einer innovativen Universalbank.   Über Consors Finanz BNP Paribas  In Deutschland und Österreich arbeiten unsere 1.500 Mitarbeiter:innen an sechs Standorten: Berlin, Braunschweig, Duisburg, Essen, München und Wien.Consors Finanz BNP Paribas steht für finanzielle Selbst-bestimmung in jeder Lebenssituation. Wir setzen auf Finanzierungs-, Bezahl- und Versicherungslösungen, die sich flexibel an die Zahlungsfähigkeit unserer Kund:innen anpassen lassen. Ob dynamische Kreditrahmen, individuelle Finanzierungen oder anpassbare Kartenprodukte – mit dem digitalen Banking von Consors Finanz nehmen unsere Kund:innen ihre Liquidität selbst in die Hand. Hierbei setzen wir auf innovative Technologien, höchste Sicherheitsstandards und eine verantwortungs-volle Kreditvergabe. So gestalten wir aktiv die Zukunft des digitalen Bezahlens und Finanzierens. Für unsere über zwei Millionen Kundinnen und Kunden und für unsere über 12.000 Handelspartner:innen.

Title: Big Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Ihre Aufgaben   You will be responsible for processing and preparing of solar and wind park data in the Microsoft Azure Cloud You will be in charge of the needs-based data processing using ETL/ELT processes to create reports You will be responsible for the development of new data sources as well as the analysis and processing of structured and unstructured data You will develop applications for data transformation, microservices and API connections for data exchange between existing applications and databases (SQL, NoSQL) You will create a group-wide data catalogue You will participate in the establishment and further development of a Data Lakehouse concept    Ihr Profil   Completed degree in computer science or comparable training Sound understanding and practical experience in Big Data technologies as well as SQL & NoSQL database systems (experience with CosmosDB desirable) Experience with ETL / ELT tools (experience with Azure Data Factory desirable) Good knowledge of NodeJS/JavaScript (ES6+) and Python Experience with RESTful web services Knowledge of Microsoft Azure Services (Azure Functions, Databricks, Event Hub, Data Lake Store Gen 2) Experience with modern concepts for (un)structured data, big data and data lakes Experience with Power BI desirable Familiarity with DevOps concepts and agile working methods Very good communication skills in English    Was wir bieten   Friendly and cooperative working environment Flat hierarchies, with short, fast decision-making processes Smartphone, also for private use Mobile working Flexible working hours Modern office atmosphere Other benefits apply according to office location (Company restaurant / barista bar, discounted fitness conditions, discounted online shopping...)

Title: Backend Engineer DevOps (m/f/d)
Description: The ultimate upswing in e-commerce was triggered by the pandemic and has surfaced the need for sustainability more than ever. Our mission is to enable conscious and sustainable online shopping.  We develop an AI-based SaaS technology that allows online shoe shoppers to measure their feet easily and accurately at home in order to always find the perfect fitting shoe. This way, we reduce size-related returns and help avoiding unnecessary CO2 emissions, while helping online retailers lower their operating costs.   We are a strong, experienced team, coming from award winning innovation hubs with the know how to build impact-making products. In product creation and development, we consistently place the user and data insights at the center of our decisions.   Tasks   Design and develop backend apps and APIs Develop reusable libraries Optimize the applications for performance and responsiveness Implement CI/CD pipelines and DevOps best practices in Azure Ensure cross-platform optimization for different eCommerce systems Perform root cause analysis for production errors    Requirements    Ideally a completed degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field Proven experience in developing backend applications in cloud, ideally using Node.js/ Nest.js and Typescript Hands-on experience with test-driven development (TDD) and CI/CD pipelines on MS-Azure cloud Genuine interest and good understanding of DevOps principles Having fun in solving complex problems Good level of English (minimum C1 level)   Nice to have:   Experience with Azure App Service, Kubernetes (AKS) and Docker Experience with Azure Active Directory Experience in using Grafana and Sentry (or similar) Working knowledge of frontend app development    Benefits    Confidence in you as the expert of your field and inclusion of your knowledge in company decisions Direct constructive feedback in a two-way manner, a great scope for creativity and mutual learning Maximum freedom and trust regarding working hours, location (preferably Germany) and vacations, so you can organize your work and private life according to your needs Opportunity to further develop your experience by certified trainings when required Guidance and coaching whenever needed as well as support in finding the right mentors from our broad network of experts A competitive salary and steep career opportunities thanks to continuous growth Monthly extra credit with Edenred, redeemable in a large store partner network   Being transparent is the bestway for us to find solutions and grow together. We pursue a culture where we frankly address anything that concerns us or affects our work. We bring in a rich combination of skillsets and individual strengths, making us a powerful team.   Do you care about our planet and want to connect it to your passion for software development? Then we are looking forward to getting to know you!   Your Footprint Crew

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you a problem solver and a fast learner? Would you enjoy working in a target-driven, entrepreneurial environment? Do you want to be part of a diverse and driven sales force striving for excellence? If the answer is yes, then keep reading! Who We Are: Atheneum is a leading global insights platform servicing various clients including distinguished strategy consulting firms, renowned investment houses and well known global corporations. Our mission is to provide faster insights to empower our clients’ decision making. Through our AI capabilities we accelerate the decision-making of our clients by connecting them to the world's top professionals and industry leaders. Atheneum is growing rapidly, with 500+ professionals in 11 offices across the US, South America, Europe, Middle East, and Asia. Our Opportunity: We are seeking a forward-thinking, proactive Data Engineer to join our rapidly growing, innovative Tech Team. We are actively looking for a candidate who can combine excellent technical skills with advanced soft skills such as communication and the ability to work effectively in a team. Responsibilities: As a Data Engineer, you'll be working on a modern platform, rapidly developing. You will contribute to the ongoing evolution of the platform by keeping up to date with modern technologies, using engineering best practices Use analytical and statistical rigor to solve complex problems and drive business decisions Write high integrity code to retrieve and analyze data from the database table, learn and understand a broad range of data resources and know-how, when, and which to use and which not to use Explore new datasets and onboard them Set up mechanisms to proactively measure the quality of outputs Create and maintain key program reports

Desired Skills and Experience

Profiles We Are Seeking Atheneum strongly believes in the power of diversity. We are seeking target driven team players with excellent emotional intelligence, problem solving and time management skills. 2+ years experience in a Data Engineer role Advanced SQL knowledge and experience with a variety of relational databases, particularly data warehouse engines like Redshift Experience building and optimizing big data pipelines, architectures and ETLs A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets Experience with AWS cloud services: Redshift, RDS, EC2, EMR Experience with modern programming languages – our language of choice is Javascript, but others commonly used in data manipulation are also useful, like Python What We Offer Public transportation discount Partially refunded lunches Urban Sports Club discount German classes Here at Atheneum, diversity and inclusion is not just part of our culture, it is ingrained in our DNA. We do not discriminate in any way when assessing applications. This June, Atheneum are proudly supporting Pride Month 2021.Head over to our Instagram page atheneum.ai and LinkedIn to see what we will be doing to celebrate meaningfully!

Title: Werkstudent IT / Digital Workplace (m/w/x)
Description: AVANTGARDE ist ein globales Unternehmen mit dem Schwerpunkt Brand Experience, das Kreativität, Media und Technologie unter einem Dach vereint.  Gegründet 1985 als Event-Agentur, hat sich die AVANTGARDE Group zu einem Multiplayer in der Experience Economy mit mehr als 850 Mitarbeitern entwickelt. Experience first – dieser Ansatz steht im Kern der strategischen Markenberatung von AVANTGARDE. An weltweit 11 Standorten schaffen Designer, Architekten, Strategen, Content Creator und Digitalspezialisten im präzisen Zusammenspiel innovative und holistische Markenerlebnisse. Darüber hinaus gründet und betreibt die AVANTGARDE Group eigene Unternehmen in der Experience Economy – auch in Kooperation mit Partnern.    DEINE AUFGABEN  Als Mitglied unseres Teams bist Du dafür verantwortlich, dass die Services Rund um den Digital Workplace reibungslos funktionieren und stetig weiterentwickelt werden.  Abhängig von Deinen Fähigkeiten übernimmst Du eine oder mehrere der folgenden Aufgaben:     Du administrierst und erweiterst unsere Digital Workplace Services (basierend u.a. auf Office 365, Azure Services und Powell Intranet) Du bearbeitest über den Helpdesk eingehende Anrufe und Tickets Du wickelst den IT-seitigen On- und Off-boarding-Prozess für unsere Mitarbeiter ab Du unterstützt Benutzer bei der Verwendung eingesetzter Technologien und / oder berätst in Fragen der IT-Sicherheit Du unterstützt bei der Planung, Koordination und Ausführung unterschiedlicher IT-Projekte    DEIN PROFIL   Du befindest Dich in einem Studium der Informatik, in einem der IT zugehörigen Fachgebiet oder hast starkes Interesse an IT Du hast bestenfalls tiefergehende Kenntnisse in einem der folgenden Bereiche: Digital Workplace, Public / Hybrid Cloud, IT-Sicherheit, IT-Administration, Data Science Du bist immer am Puls der Zeit, befasst Dich mit aktuellen Technologien und probierst diese aus Du hast eine positive Einstellung, bist kontaktfreudig und organisations- und kommunikationsstark Du bist ein Teamplayer mit der Eigenschaft selbständig zu denken und zu arbeiten    BENEFITS   Mit der AVA Academy bist Du immer up to date! Profitiere von regelmäßigen Talks, Workshops, Sprachkursen, individuellen Schulungen und Zugang zu LinkedIn Learning Bye, bye Langeweile – Wir bieten Dir flexible Modelle wie Home Office Option, individuelle Stundengestaltung, Job Rotation, globales Office Hopping und Sabbatical Mit dem Rad ins Grüne, schwitzen im Fitnessstudio oder eine ausgiebige Shoppingtour – Das Company Bike, eine vergünstigte Body & Soul Mitgliedschaft und zahlreiche Rabattaktionen machen‘s möglich Sei Teil unserer legendären Team-/ und Company Events. Hier geht es vor allem darum Inspirationen zu sammeln, Ideen auszutauschen und zu networken Nachhaltigkeit ist für uns nicht nur ein Buzz Word, deshalb sind wir Net Zero zertifiziert und verfolgen einen ökologischen Nachhaltigkeitsprozess für all unsere Projekte Und nicht zu vergessen: Bei uns verbringst Du Deine Coffee-/Lunch Breaks auf Münchens schönster Dachterrasse mit eigenem Barista und waschechten Schafen      INTERESSIERT?  Dann bewirb’ Dich mit Deinem Lebenslauf bei uns! Julia Buchner freut sich auf Deine Bewerbung!

Title: Frontend (Web-) Entwickler (m/w/d) - Anwendungsentwicklung, Webentwicklung, IT
Description: <span class="artdeco-inline-feedback__message"> This job is sourced from a job board. <button aria-label="Learn more" class="artdeco-inline-feedback__linktext" type="button">Learn more </button>

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: At Machine Learning Reply Germanywe strive to work on leading-edge data science projectswith our clients for which we are seeking engineering consultants to work on Machine Learning products.  Machine Learning Reply, with its sister company in Italy and over 10.000 employees at Reply globally, is a fast-growing consultancy focused on solving problems with Data Science and the right organizational frameworks as their backbone. We are a tight knit, laid back, but seriously motivated unit that aims to be involved at conferences and in community of practice with our tech partners.  We offer tailor-made end-to-end solutions in the Data Science area that cover the entire project life cycle - from initial strategy consulting to data architecture and infrastructure issues to data processing and modeling using machine learning algorithms.  We have extensive expertise in the broad Data Science spectrum in all key industries of the German HDAX-companies. With focus on open source and cloud technologies we enable our customers to successfully introduce and implement new data-driven solutions and to optimize already existing processes and products.   Tasks   You will support the successful implementation of customer products related to Big Data, Data Engineering, and/or Data Warehouses. Build and maintain scalable Data Platforms and ML Platforms on Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) or on-premise, considering DevOps paradigms. You enjoy brainstorming, conceptualization and final implementation. You therefore love to accompany the complete LifeCycle by creating specifications, code and presentations for your solutions. As part of the Reply network, you join communities of practice, participate in hackathons and use all available learning resources   Requirements    We are happy to see that you have a university degree in (business) computer science, mathematics, statistics or similar. You have experience with cloud services from AWS or Azure, alternatively you have substantial knowledge with on-premise solutions, and/or Kubernetes. You have interest in ETL, and workflow orchestration tools such as Airflow, Luigi.. Good Knowledge of databases, and have had some experience with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop or Kafka. You are familiar with a programming language such as Python, Scala, shell scripting or even Perl. Fluent German and English skills round out your profile   Benefits    What we offer you:   Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc.) Very active group social program - including conference funding, team building, group events, Reply Exchange Recognition for Innovation to foster your personal development Work in an open, flat environment, within a broad Reply knowledge sharing network (more than 90 autonomous Reply groups across 8 countries) Office space in downtown Munich with access to Stammstrecke Training and certification encouraged Home-office contracts State of the art work equipment (MacBooks, iPhones..) Award winning office spaces for an excellent work experience Public transport ticket within Munich Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice Company car scheme

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: Are you a passionate, experienced Data Analyst that wants to contribute to the evolution of the Internet?  We are a small team with big ambitions to improve Internet performance by improving how traffic behaves on Internet Provider Networks. If you are a creative problem-solver who wants to work with a world-class team, and enjoys learning new skills regularly, then we are interested in you!   Aufgaben   You will be responsible for prototyping, developing and maintaining scalable data pipelines You optimize and integrate code to correlate and process multiple data streams in real-time You debug, adapt and abstract network setups of customers to build scalable and generic solutions You improve current testing processes and create new testing automation practices You automate data loading procedures   Our TECH STACK:  Languages: C++, Perl, Python, Bash   Operating System: Linux   Tools & Frameworks: BENOCS sync, ClickHouse (SQL-based DBMS), Docker, GitLab (+CI/CD), git   Monitoring, Reporting & Alerting: Graylog, Kibana, bonefire   Qualifikation   You have 3+ years of professional experience in implementing and running data-intensive distributed systems You are proficient with scripting and object-oriented programming languages You are comfortable with analyzing complex data from varying sources You are fluent with SQL-based DBMS You are familiar with GNU/Linux Dev-Ops tool chain   NICE-TO-HAVE:   You have knowledge of carrier-grade network structures & routing protocols You have knowledge on Internet Control and Data plane measurement correlation    Benefits    Learning Opportunities:  Lifelong learning is essential for us. We offer the opportunity to develop not only software, but also yourself!   Flexible Working Hours:  We know you have a life outside of work, which is why we allow you work whenever it suits you as long as you are available during our core working hours.   Health Offers:  Your health is important to us. We offer free health checks, regular preventive medical checkups, seasonal flu vaccines, free beverages and fruits.   Company Pension Scheme:  Be well positioned for the future - we offer a company pension scheme and pay monthly contributions.   Virtual Stock Options:  Be part of a success story and benefit from the company’s growth.   JobRad:  Join our bike leasing program to get a new bicycle at a reduced cost.   Shopping Discounts:  Products and services at a discount from numerous providers and partners.   We are committed to a diverse workforce and strongly welcome all applications regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, disability or age.

Title: IoT Full-Stack Developer (f/m/d)
Description: Are you great at transforming product requirements into mobile apps? Are you aching to join a wildly dedicated team? Do you want to share your knowledge and build top-notch customer experiences with our team? Read on because we might have a spot for you at our table!   FYTA is on a mission to change the way we connect to plants. We create cool and intuitive products for a new generation of indoor gardeners and push the boundaries of what indoor gardening means today. We are devoted to creating new experiences in indoor gardening – including everything from house plants to mushrooms and microorganisms. In our work, we unify interdisciplinary backgrounds such as software and hardware engineering, plant science, data science, design, business, and sustainability to achieve this goal with a diverse team of people.   We are launching our first product – the FYTA Beam, the world's firsts AI-driven IoT smart plant sensor - in early 2022. Our product portfolio will be expanded into an IoT and E-commerce ecosystem covering all user touchpoints from plant to App.   We are looking for an experienced full-stack developer with a passion for building sophisticated serverless applications. In this role, you will work on advancing our IoT sensing solutions for indoor gardening, supported by our amazing team of frontend developers, designers, data- and plant scientists.   Tasks  You will have a direct impact on FYTA core products by designing and building products. Your responsibilities will include:   Develop awesome backend applications with JavaScript / node.js Take part in all steps of building our serverless systems - plan, develop, deploy, and maintain Improve and further develop the current deployment pipeline and infrastructure AWS CDK and CloudFormation Maintain, monitor, and improve existing services, libraries, and infrastructure Write code and tests, build prototypes, solve issues, profile and analyze bottlenecks Focus on quality of code through proper testing and developer experience for other team members    Requirements    Skills we appreciate and would help you do great work in your role   University degree in Computer Science or related subjects. But we honestly care less about formal education and degrees and more about talent, aptitude, and experience. Dazzle us with your work! Experience implementing or designing highroad, event-sourced or event streaming system Experience in working with IoT core applications including MQTT, device certification, OTA Experience in building serverless applications on AWS including services: Lambda, SQL, node.js, S3, CloudFormation, SQS, DynamoDB, RDS, API Gateway, and others Expert understanding of common software engineering practices (git, unit testing, code documentation, continuous integration, dependency management) Knowledge of CI/CD Good understanding of Secure Coding practices including common encryption (AES, RSA) and hashing (SHA) algorithms You are curious, analytically minded, and have structured work habits You like to take responsibility and initiative You work comfortably in a rapid prototyping environment with minimum guidance Get-things-done mindset: You are flexible and understand that working in the start-up means that you need to think and act like an entrepreneur, and pro-actively collaborate in an agile work environment with other team members Fluent in English    Benefits    Why you should join us:   Our team: It’s fun to work here! You are surrounded by a diverse, passionate and highly motivated team. Competitive Salary 28 days of vacation Amazing work environment: no office is greener than ours. You’ll literally work in a greenhouse and outdoor garden, surrounded by beautiful plants. Flexible Work: aside from regular working from home, post-COVID you can work from anywhere in the world up to 2 months a year Learning: you’ll get a flexible learning budget of €800/ year Health & mobility: We subsidize sports / memberships, health plans, and mobility passes Interdisciplinary: We know that an interdisciplinary exchange brings out the best solutions, so we encourage everyone to voice their opinion no matter your background. Independence & leadership: we give you a lot of space to work independently, drive innovation and empower leadership. Impact: By furthering our product development you are helping to redefine the indoor gardening space – towards more sustainability and happiness.   If you are curious about getting to know us, please send us your application with the earliest date you could start. No need to send a cover letter; a compelling CV is sufficient. We can clarify the rest in our interview. The position is free from now on.   We value diversity and welcome people from all walks of life, irrespective of age, gender, religion or cultural background. While we support relocation in principle, we favor candidates that are already based in Berlin or live within a radius of 200km. We are looking forward to getting to know you.

Title: Trainee Data (AI / Big Data Analytics / Data Management) (all genders)
Description: Du willst dich in nur sechs Wochen zum/zur gefragten Data-Spezialist:in entwickeln? Mit einem Traineeprogramm, das so nah an der Praxis ist, dass du dein Know-how sofort anwenden kannst – und das auf intensives Lernen durch Spezialist:innen in kleinen Gruppen setzt? Das ist genau dein Ding?   Dann lebe deine Leidenschaft in einer Position, in der du als Data Engineer namhafte Unternehmen rund ums Thema Applied Intelligence berätst.   Das erwartet dich  Unser sechswöchiges Traineeprogramm bereitet dich systematisch auf deine Karriere als Berater:in im Bereich Applied Intelligence und damit auf deinen Einsatz in anspruchsvollen Kundenprojekten vor.  Du lernst, auf was es bei der Projektvorbereitung ankommt, schärfst deine Softskills und machst dich mit agilen Projektmethoden vertraut. Dazu vermitteln wir dir die Grundlagen kommender Data-Warehousing- und Analytics-Architekturen.  Im Anschluss lernst du die Tools und Technologien eines Data Engineers kennen. Abhängig von der aktuellen Marktentwicklung und technologischen Trends folgt eine Vertiefung in nachfolgende Module: Introduction to Big Data Management (Analytics, Machine Learning & AI); Data Integration; ETL & Streaming Technologies; Data Warehousing; Cloud Hyperscaler (GCP, AWS, Azure); Python Programming; Version Control Systems (Git) and CI/CD; Intelligent Automation/RPA; Process Mining; Agile Methodology & Scrum  Nach deinem erfolgreichen Programmabschluss erhältst du einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag und wirst Teil eines funktionsübergreifenden Teams.  Darauf freuen wir uns   Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder Naturwissenschaften bzw. eine solide IT-Ausbildung  Erste Kenntnisse in der Programmierung mit Python, Java, Scala und C++/C#), in der Programmierung von Datenbanken (SQL), in relationalen Datenbanken und Systemen sowie in der Datenintegration  Sehr gute analytisch-konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, eine hohe Lernbereitschaft und Begeisterung für innovative Technologien  Kommunikations- und Präsentationssicherheit in sehr gutem Deutsch und Englisch  Dein Kontakt  Du hast Fragen? Dann wende dich an unser Recruiting Team per E-Mail an recruiting_germany@accenture.com oder telefonisch unter 00800 45045045.   Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung.

Title: Software Engineer (100% Remote)
Description: We are looking to hire a passionate Engineer with 1-8 years experience and a track record of methodically and creatively adding value to both the business and their organization in a strategic and caring way. This is a full-time position available for immediate start.   The Software Engineer should be a strategic and analytical thinker, you should also be an effective communicator, an expert in the domains and systems that you have built, comfortable working with other experts on complicated risk analyses and operational flows, and be willing to directly dig in yourself as we expand our internal resources. You should be a thoughtful collaborator, with a deep appreciation for systems design, and a passion for building amazing and powerful experiences while knowing the tradeoffs of moving quickly and getting things working vs. going deep and perfecting a product for the long-term   We are looking for strong engineers in many areas: data and data infrastructure, full-stack web application development, front-end wizards, as well as machine learning and natural language processing specialists. You should be a deeply curious individual, and have demonstrated continuous effort to satisfy that curiosity, through research, tinkering, organizing, and teaching.   Responsibilities:   Internalize the company’s goals and vision, understanding critical and minimal needs, foreseeing potential needs, and coming up with solutions that fit the context Apply state of the art technology solutions, including data API development, modern integration patterns, frameworks for building beautiful, responsive applications, machine learning, natural language processing, and explicable AI - in partnership with key partners Support all business lines, including sales and business development, by enabling those teams while balancing competing goals, and making difficult trade-offs when required Partner effectively with Product, User Experience, Growth, and Operations toward building best-in-class systems Support the technology needs of various departments by creating a data-literate ecosystem, and helping the wider organization understand how the technology helps them and how to think about their initiatives in terms of our capabilities Be a leader, taking initiative and ownership as needed, and connecting across the organization to come up with the best solutions that combine people, process, and software    Why we think this job is great:   It’s a remote full-time, 100% remote position where you’ll work from home with tech provided by the company You’ll have clear goals and the training resources you need to deliver. How you execute and deliver is up to you    Qualifications:   1-8 years of experience in performing results-driven development in a collaborative environment A proven ability to conduct research and internalize user needs, in partnership with Product and User Experience Able to adjust the level of specificity and context for different audiences, either in the interest of achieving common goals efficiently or to educate others For data engineers - experience in Python, relational databases and data warehouses, business intelligence tools, containers, cloud platforms, command line scripting For web back-end engineers - experience in Python, relational databases, cloud platforms For web front-end engineers - experience in React JavaScript/Typescript, CSS, cloud platforms Experience with Data API development, AI, ML and NLP A degree in computer science, engineering, applied math or a related field; or have demonstrated significant growth and impact as an engineer, regardless of your education    Preferred Experience:   Healthcare, insurance or financial technology experience Experience with startups is not necessary, but you should be looking forward to bringing order, power, and role definition to an initial blank slate Not afraid to dive into devops as needed and help us iterate on an efficient build/deploy process and a solid infrastructure    About Us   Bold Business is a remote-first, global outsourced-solutions company with over $7B in service solutions over the past 25 years. Our international team helps the world’s leading companies transform their ideas into bold impacts. From Fortune 500 organizations looking to reduce operational costs by 40%-60% to fast-growth startups looking to scale, we work behind the scenes and empower companies to do more for less.   If you like to move fast and have a bias for action, you’ll fit right into our fast-paced, results-based environment. We’re a 100% remote/virtual team environment where you can work from wherever you are.

Title: Working Student - Research Centre
Description: Your mission    You are responsible for carrying out market and trend analyses on decarbonisation issues You create reports and visualization with relevant tools You support the configuration and modeling of databases You support the development of digital prototypes, mockups and business models for innovative solutions Together with our team you support the research and development projects of the technology for the integration of renewable energies Last but not least - you support us in the preparation and implementation of our innovation workshops    Your profile    You are studying Computer Science, Business informatics, electrical engineering or a comparable bachelor's degree and would be available for approx. 16 hours per week. per You have already gained experience in programming with Python, Visual Basic or C# or have experience with database systems Ideally, you have good knowledge of statistics and have already gained initial experience in the field of machine learning. Language Package: German and English at least C1, other languages are an advantage. You have the motivation to actively participate and contribute your knowledge. Flexibility, constant willingness to learn, reliability and independence complete your profile.    Why us?   This decade might be overshadowed by Covid19, but sooner or later we will beat and overcome that son of a germ, am I right?   But the true topic for this decade lies in energy  ！   We are more than happy to state that not only We are leading this discourse, we also offer the fitting solutions for it. We have the strongest PV-Inverter R&D there is and became the world`s biggest Inverter Manufacturer, which we are extremely proud of!And now, for this decade, we are increasing our game, and You, You  might become part of it! Besides that, many things await You:    Opportunities for Career advancement Bonus payment based on pre-agreed and signed KPI agreements A multinational team awaits You with lots of european and transeuropean exchange! Possibility for technical and commercial knowledge increasement in regard to string inverters, central inverters, inverter stations including transformer and switch gear and storage solutions Technical and commercial training in our headquarter in Germany and even visits to the big R&D facility in China!    We are a green tech company unlike any other green tech company. We are a team of lateral thinkers, young professionals, and creative minds. We are fighting every day to make our mission happen – Clean Power For All!   With nearly 250 GW of clean power  presently installed worldwide,   Welcome at Sungrow   Sungrow is the global leading inverter solution supplier for renewables. We are proud to look back to a success story that already began in 1997, but we never stopped striving for more. We want to give fresh impulses, inspire, and contribute to a sustainable development of our planet, that’s why we constantly improve our portfolio.   From floating solar plants to large-scale utility projects and to small residential products we always offer the best and most suitable solution. At Sungrow we hold more than 1500 patents – no wonder as we employ the biggest research and development team of the whole industry. 40 % of all Sungrow workforce is continuously investigating on how to further improve the existing portfolio.

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: wefox  is the world’s leading InsurTech that is reinventing insurance at scale, with a record-breaking Series C funding round of $650 million in 2021, making it the largest funding round of any InsurTech to date.   wefox  is revolutionising insurance by empowering the customer and delivering personalised experiences, driven by data. Our vision is to enable people to be safe. By providing our customers 360 degree advice through our network of advisors, we optimise each individual's risk coverage through innovative prevention, assistance and insurance products.   As Data Engineer in the Data Platform Team you will be responsible to support improvement and development of our Data Platform, especially in the fields of Data Ingestion and Data Quality. You will implement methods to improve data reliability and quality.   The Role   Contribute to build a flexible self service data platform Extract data from various databases, third-party tools, and APIs Develop and evolve tools to ingest data into the data platform, often focusing on sources to enrich data needed for KPI oversight Improve ETL processes for ease of use and efficiency Follow and implement Data Quality rules introduced by our Data QA colleagues You will work together with Business Intelligence, Analytics, and the whole Engineering department to ensure high data quality Technical reviews and documentation Engage with stakeholders to understand business requirements for current and future projects. Engage in all Data Platform Engineering team rituals and knowledge sharing sessions    What you bring:   You have a good understanding of business logic and analytics You are experience working with cloud technology, preferrable AWS Advance skills in SQL and Python Proficiency in working with git Hands-on experience with orchestration tools like airflow, luigi Experience with stream-processing (Kafka) - an advantage High degree of independence, structured way of thinking and a bias for action    What we offer:  Now, we’ve gotten to the fun part, the part where you get to brag about your company, those perks your friends are so jealous of!   Here are some of them*:   Flexible working hours including hybrid working 26 working days of vacation, with an additional day for each year of service - up to 30 days + 24th and 31st December Mental Health Benefits Up to 50% of your public transport costs reimbursed A stack of the latest technologies and working gadgets Free coffee, fruit and snacks, because we need fuel! Grants for training and coaching    If you love a less-formal work environment, flexible paid time off, a great compensation package and benefits offering - and most of all, being the authentic you, get in touch, we want to meet you!   To all the misunderstood geniuses, rebels and mavericks looking to change the world for the better. Come work with us!   Your contact person for this role is Godwin Udongwo  .  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.  By submitting the application I confirm to have read and accepted the  data privacy policy  governing the job application process.

Title: Junior Machine Learning Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Wir sind auf einer großartigen Reise, um die Welt täglich ein Stück zu   verbessern. Zusammen mit unseren großartigen Positive Thinkern stellen   wir uns jeder Herausforderung auf diesem Weg mit Kreativität und   Entschlossenheit. Die Projekte, die wir angehen, und die Aufgaben, die   wir lösen, sind Gelegenheiten, sich weiterzuentwickeln, Neues zu lernen   und unsere Zusammenarbeit zu stärken. Bist du bereit, über dich   hinauszuwachsen? Dann werde Teil unserer Story!   Aufgaben  Dein Umfeld   Verantwortung für die Planung, Konzipierung und Realisierung von Data Science Projekten Durchführung komplexer Datenanalysen Vorhersagemodelle unter Anwendung moderner statistischer Analysemethoden und mathematischer Modelle entwickeln Methoden in den Kundensystemen zur optimierten Steuerung der Geschäftsmodelle und Prozesse implementieren Aufgaben der Modellierung und Datenanalyse (z.B. Forecasting, Recommendation, Clustering, Classification, Reporting)   Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kunden echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.   Qualifikation  Dein Talent   Akademischer Abschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, (Wirtschafts-) Mathematik, Statistik, Physik oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung Deutsch-Kenntnisse auf C1 Niveau - Beherrschung der Sprache (German Fluency is a must) Ca. 1-3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Science Erste Technologieerfahrung: Hadoop, Cloud, SQL or NoSQL, Tools wie Dataiku, KNIME, SAS, SAP Programmierkenntnisse: R, Python, Java, C# oder C++ Erfahrung mit einem Visualisierungstool (z.B. QlikView, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, etc.) oder In-Memory-Datenbanken sowie Erfahrung im NLP/NLU oder Computer Vision sind von Vorteil Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region    Benefits    Unser Versprechen   Onboarding: Du bist ab dem ersten Tag intern vernetzt: Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentorenprogramm Entwicklung: Entwicklung ist bei uns individuell auf Deine Stärken ausgerichtet: regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online Trainingskatalog, Internationales Arbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Kulturen Work-Life Balance: Raum für Deine persönliche Lebensplanung (Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, hochflexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg) Events: fachlich und mit Spaßfaktor (Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern) Netzwerken: connecte Dich mit Deinen Kollegen: innen: Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions Fehlerkultur: mache Fehler und teste Dich aus: wir geben Dir den Freiraum neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten Prämien: eine Vielzahl an Prämien für Dein zusätzliches Engagement Weitere Vorteile: digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement   Schaue Dir gerne an, was Deine zukünftigen   Kollegen auf Kununu (https://www.kununu.com/de/positive-thinking-company1/kommentare)   über uns gesagt haben!   Kein Kandidat wird jede dieser gewünschten Anforderungen erfüllen. Wenn deine Erfahrungen etwas anders aussehen und du denkst du kannst dieser Stelle einen anderen Mehrwert verleihen, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen.    Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du dran.  Hast Du Fragen zu Deiner Bewerbung bei PTC/Steep/Versett? Unser HR-Team beantwortet Sie Dir gerne, jeden Donnerstag von 12-13 Uhr unter der Telefonnummer 0151 72618189.  Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist du dran.   Bereit ein Positive Thinker zu werden? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung.

Title: Werkstudent Projektmanagement im Data Science Team (w/m/d)
Description: Du studierst, aber der Ruf nach beruflichen Abenteuern wird immer lauter? Aus deiner Sicht sollte auch im Job mit Lernen nicht so schnell Schluss sein und gleichzeitig ist es dir wichtig, ein wenig von deiner jetzigen Freiheit und Flexibilität zu behalten? Dann bist du hier genau richtig, schön weiterlesen. 🤓  Was uns ausmacht: Unternehmen & Produkt  Wir sind die vertical cloud solution GmbH, ein IT-Unternehmen aus Darmstadt. Mit unserer Software gastromatic bringen wir die Personalorganisation im Gastgewerbe auf ein neues Level. Dabei verbindet 90 Gastronaut*innen eine Vision: „Gemeinsam Arbeiten neu denken“. Das heißt wir stoßen Veränderung an, wo sie notwendig ist, und machen mit gastromatic das Arbeiten einfacher, effizienter und zufriedenstellender – für Arbeitnehmer*innen und Arbeitgeber*innen.  Dafür arbeiten wir agil und sind mit Kopf und Herz dabei. Standards sind da oft das, was wir als erstes hinterfragen. Das liegt in unserer Natur, denn auch intern stehen die Zeichen auf Veränderung, ob bei Strukturen, Rollen, der Einrichtung oder Bürohund Brunos Schlafplatz. Langweilig wird es nie. Kommt schon ein bisschen Euphorie auf? Dann schau dir jetzt unser Data Science-Team genauer an!     Das Arbeiten im Data Science-Team und deine Tätigkeiten:   Du baust einen Prozess zur Planung und Priorisierung der Anbindung von Drittanbieter-Systemen auf. Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für die Koordination der Anbindungen sowie der Kommunikation mit allen beteiligten Stakeholdern. Gemeinsam mit dem Team treibst du Kundenorientierte Projekte voran und bringst deine eigenen Ideen mit ein. Du erhältst umfassende Einblicke in den Data Science Bereich: Von der Beschaffung der Daten bis zum fertigen Modell.     Erkennst du dich selbst wieder?   Ich bin ein offener und lösungsorientierter Mensch. Ich erkenne, was zu tun ist, und organisiere meine Tasks gerne eigenständig und strukturiert. Ich fuchse mich gerne in Themen rein und eigne mir schnell neues Wissen an. Ich habe bereits Erfahrung im Projetmanagement und weiß wie ich Aufgaben strukturiert plane und priorisiere. Ich habe bereits Erfahrung in der Gestaltung von Unternehmensprozessen. Die Kommunikation mit beteiligten Stakeholdern macht mir Spaß. Nice-to-have: Ich habe bereits erste Coding Erfahrung mit Python und freue mich darauf mich weiterzuentwickeln.     Darauf kannst du dich freuen:   Einen abwechslungsreichen Job mit Verantwortung, bei dem du zu unserem Wachstum beiträgst Flache Hierarchien, kurze Entscheidungswege und Zusammenarbeit auf Augenhöhe Hochmotiviertes und dynamisches Team mit Zukunftsperspektive & Aufstiegschancen Modernes Arbeitsumfeld mit Top-Ausstattung und allerlei Gratis-Goodies wie Getränke, Snacks und Obst Balance durch mobiles Arbeiten trifft auf ein lebendiges Büroleben samt Events, Tischtennis Matches, Terrassen-Bierchen, wöchentlichen Workouts und und und…     Was dir zusätzlich verrät, wie wir ticken:   Wir feiern gerne Sternstunden: Das Video von unserer Weihnachtsfeier 2019 fängt ganz gut die Stimmung bei uns ein: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BEYxnrVp3BQ) Unser Instagram-Feed zeigt dir außerdem, wie das Büroleben bei uns aussieht: https://www.instagram.com/gastromatic_/    Passt alles für dich? Dann bewirb dich doch am besten direkt. Wir freuen uns dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Solution Engineer (m/f/o) - Google Cloud Platform (GCP) in Leipzig
Description: You make the difference.  Whether in business Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory, Tax & Legal, Financial Advisory or Consulting: at Deloitte, we help our global clients continuously evolve. Discover a diverse working environment that is constantly in motion and always revolving around one central hub: you and your expertise. What impact will you make?   We enable our clients to find the right balance in the field of cloud transformation between technology, organisation and people and thus realise the maximum potential of products and services, cost reduction, scalability and sustainability of the relevant business models. We consult our clients on their individual cloud journey, from strategy to agile implementation methods.   Our teams support, design, modernise and implement cloud services and act in reliable partnership on the journey to the digital future. To be more specific, we support our clients with the implementation of their digitalisation strategies with current areas of focus such as connected car, IoT, Industry 4.0, digitalisation, automation as well as streaming analytics and cognitive computing.   We are looking for motivated staff to join our teams at the Berlin  and Leipzig  sites.   Exciting tasks await you   Supporting projects in the implementation, testing as well as go-live Realisation of flexible architectures in agile teams in compliance with clean code and good software crafting Development of best practices for testability, maintainability and scalability to support an open team culture Active support in the knowledge transfer of best practices Technical support of internal teams as well as clients with the assessment of technologies to be used Participation in the Community, e.g. by actively taking part in conferences or meetups    Your skill set   Very successfully completed Austrian HTL degree, bachelor’s or master’s degree with strong focus on IT, such as (business) informatics, industrial engineering, mathematics or physics, or equivalent education/training/experience You have gained some first experiences in at least one of the following fields: Programming with Python, Java, C#, Kotlin or Scala Software development in a cloud environment, e.g. Cloud Functions, Cloud Spanner or CDAP Implementation of cloud infrastructure solutions (especially IaaS & PaaS with IAM Cloud, App Engine, Linux, Terraform or Ansible) and of microservices and security concepts in cloud-based applications Interface development with Apigee or streaming solutions such as Kafka or Google Cloud Pub/Sub. Containerization/serverless architecture (e.g. Kubernetes, Openshift) Continuous integration and deployment (e.g. git, Dataflow, Airflow, etc.), with using PowerShell as well as cloud deployment models at an enterprise level (especially public, private, hybrid) Machine learning libraries and natural language processing (Tensorflow, Cloud AutoML), database technologies such as Hadoop, Hbase or Cassandra Istio, Grafana for monitoring and visualising dashboards Ideally, you are already certified in the GCP domain (e.g. Cloud Engineer, Cloud Developer, Cloud DevOps Engineer) You have successfully completed a bachelor’s or master’s degree in informatics and/or an equivalent training You have an analytical and structured mind capable of responding to complex client enquiries You have good (B2) German and very good English skills Occasional travels to client meetings are not a problem for you.    What You Can Expect From Us  In addition to a pleasant, collegial atmosphere, we offer you a promising and international working environment. We have flat hierarchies and an open door atmosphere. Another plus point: Thanks to a large number of education programs, we take you one big step forward in your professional and personal development.   You are interested? We look forward to seeing you!  Please submit your application to the Deloitte Recruiting-Team.   You are more interested in a career in our Austrian offices  ? Please click here.  The inclusion of people with disabilities is our mutual understanding. We very much appreciate your application. Due to our German data protection law, please note that we can only accept online applications via our online recruitment system.   Our FAQs will help you with questions concerning applications at Deloitte and will give you specific advice on how to apply successfully via our online portal:   ⇒ FAQs  What impact will you make?  Job-ID: 31434

Title: Junior Software Engineer Java EE (m/w/d)
Location: Sankt Georgen im Schwarzwald, Baden-Württemberg, Germany
Description: Sie suchen Aufgaben mit gesellschaftlicher Relevanz? Sie möchten moderne und sichere Systeme für Millionen von Menschen erschaffen? Sie möchten mit uns die deutschen Verwaltungen in die digitale Zukunft führen? In unserer Brancheneinheit Public Sector können Sie in einem multidisziplinären Team Maßstäbe setzen. Abwechslungsreiche und verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben warten auf Sie – in einer Zukunftsbranche, die so schnell wächst wie kaum eine andere. Gute Zusammenarbeit als Team ist uns genauso wichtig wie ein individuelles persönliches Entwicklungskonzept, dessen Gestaltung Sie steuern können.   msg ist eine unabhängige Unternehmensgruppe mit weltweit mehr als 9.000 Mitarbeitenden. Unseren ausgezeichneten Ruf verdanken wir unserem ganzheitlichen Leistungsspektrum aus einfallsreicher strategischer Beratung und intelligenten, nachhaltig wertschöpfenden IT-Lösungen für eine Vielzahl von Branchen.   Das erwartet Sie bei uns   Mitarbeit bei der Digitalisierung der öffentlichen Verwaltung in spannenden, abwechslungsreichen Projekten Durchführung von Analyse, Konzeption, Programmierung, Test und Einführung von Softwaresystemen im Java- /JEE-/ Spring-Umfeld Mitgestaltung von Fach- und IT-Architekturen von Softwaresystemen Abstimmung von Anforderungen und Präsentation von Ergebnissen beim Kunden Unterstützung bei der Beratung unserer Kunden im technologischen Umfeld Java, JEE, Spring-Anwendungen (Client und / oder Server), Oracle und aktuellen Open Source Technologien Perspektivisch Option zur Teilnahme an unseren fachlichen Weiterentwicklungsprogrammen „Next Level: IT-Architektur“ oder „Next Level: Data Science“ „Grow Your Talent“: Methodisch fundierte Angebote u.a. zur Förderung persönlicher Stärken    Das bringen Sie mit   IT-naher (Fach-)Hochschulabschluss oder vergleichbare Ausbildung Idealerweise erste Erfahrungen in Konzeption und Realisierung von Softwaresystemen Kenntnisse in der Softwareentwicklung (Methoden, Datenbanken, Frameworks, Tools, Patterns) sowie ein Grundverständnis von IT-Vorgehensmodellen (V-Modell XT, Scrum o. ä.) Interesse in spannenden und innovativen Projekten die Digitalisierung des öffentlichen Sektors mitzugestalten Sie haben Spaß an kreativer Arbeit im Team und die Bereitschaft zur Mobilität    Das ist unser Angebot  Suchen Sie Abwechslung statt Alltagsroutine? Teamspirit statt starrer Hierarchien? Dann sind Sie bei uns richtig. Wir bieten Ihnen spannende verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben, attraktive Karrierechancen und internationale Perspektiven. Mehr noch: Bei uns finden Sie ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, großzügige Sozialleistungen und ein professionelles, kollegiales Arbeitsklima in einem hochmotivierten Team.

Title: Machine Learning Ops engineer (f/m/d)
Description: The Role   As a Machine Learning Engineer at Zenjob you will closely work with both Data Science and Data Engineering teams, leading our efforts to create, deploy, scale and maintain machine learning models.   To be successful in this position the most important thing is to live our values #humble, #honest, #helpful and #hungry. So we are looking for a data driven team player. We don’t hire on special tools, but here you will find what we are looking for from the skill side of view:   Zenjob is a Berlin-based jobs marketplace with a goal to empower the workforce of tomorrow with innovative technology. We envision a world in which everyone has full control over their working life. We already enable part-time jobbers to decide when, where and how to work with just a few clicks. Our service is available in over 30 cities in Germany and with our recent launch in the Netherlands, we want to gradually open up new international markets.   What you’ll do   Build (real-time) data pipelines that are reliable, scalable with a design that is extensible and easy to understand and use by data scientists Set up proper tooling and services that increases the Data Science team productivity in term of research and experimentation Set up proper monitoring, alerting, logging and testing of our ML tech stack Take ML models from research state to production-ready Work closely with data engineers on topics like data integration, cleanup and preparation for models Work closely with software engineers and product managers to integrate ML services into Zenjob’s backend Fluent in English.   Welcome, but not necessary:   Working experience or deep understanding of machine learning toolkits: Pandas, Tensorflow, Pytorch German is a plus.   What we offer   Relocation support and visa sponsorship Parental support: first 10 days of child sick time off is covered by Zenjob A supportive, open, and fun team that will have your back from day 1 28 days of vacation (increases based on tenure to up to 30 days), 1 day special leave paid for charity work, 5 days of paid educational leave, option of unpaid leave Hybrid work set-up combining office & remote work, flexible working hours, bring your dog policy Ongoing focus on your personal development (annual development budget of EUR 750, mentoring opportunities, continuous career conversations) 30 EUR subsidy on Urban Sports Club, 25% discount on FitX gym membership 40 EUR credit for Rydes - a sustainable mobility solution spanning public transport, bike sharing, etc. Tax-free meal allowance (saving :50€ net per month!) Quarterly team events, winter party, summer party, budget for employee's birthdays & anniversaries   Check out our culture video to see how it's like to work at Zenjob: Meet Zenjob - our culture, values and team   If this sounds good, then we'd love to find out more about you! Apply and send in your application.

Title: Algorithm Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Job-Beschreibung:    Wir verstärken unser Team im Bereich Fahrerassistenzsysteme in der Funktionsentwicklung für ADAS Safety Functions am Standort Koblenz.       Ihre Aufgaben:     Entwicklung von Algorithmen für innovative Fahrerassistenzfunktionen in Single- oder Multisensorsystemen (z.B. Radar und Kamera) Algorithmen zur Situationsanalyse, Zielauswahl, Gefahren- und Trajektorienschätzung für moderne Sicherheitsfunktionen wie z.B. AEB. Softwareentwicklung von der Konzeption bis hin zur Serientauglichkeit als Teil eines Entwicklerteams Teilnahme und Unterstützung von Fahrversuchsaktivitäten Sie decken neben der Entwicklung auch Parametrierung und Test der Software in der Simulation ab  Gewünschtes Profil:    Ihr Profil:     Masterstudium der Mechatronik, Elektrotechnik, Mathematik, Fahrzeugtechnik, Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation Kenntnisse in Machine Learning Algorithmen vorteilhaft Gute Kenntnisse der Programmiersprachen (Embedded) C und Python Führerschein Klasse B und Fahrpraxis erforderlich Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift sowie sehr selbstständige Arbeitsweise und Spaß an neuen Herausforderungen in einem innovativen und agilen Umfeld    Bei ZF ist die Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Privatleben fest verankert. Weitere Informationen dazu finden Sie unter www.zf.com/berufundprivatleben.

Title: Software Engineer (100% Remote)
Description: We are looking to hire a passionate Engineer with 1-8 years experience and a track record of methodically and creatively adding value to both the business and their organization in a strategic and caring way. This is a full-time position available for immediate start.   The Software Engineer should be a strategic and analytical thinker, you should also be an effective communicator, an expert in the domains and systems that you have built, comfortable working with other experts on complicated risk analyses and operational flows, and be willing to directly dig in yourself as we expand our internal resources. You should be a thoughtful collaborator, with a deep appreciation for systems design, and a passion for building amazing and powerful experiences while knowing the tradeoffs of moving quickly and getting things working vs. going deep and perfecting a product for the long-term   We are looking for strong engineers in many areas: data and data infrastructure, full-stack web application development, front-end wizards, as well as machine learning and natural language processing specialists. You should be a deeply curious individual, and have demonstrated continuous effort to satisfy that curiosity, through research, tinkering, organizing, and teaching.   Responsibilities:   Internalize the company’s goals and vision, understanding critical and minimal needs, foreseeing potential needs, and coming up with solutions that fit the context Apply state of the art technology solutions, including data API development, modern integration patterns, frameworks for building beautiful, responsive applications, machine learning, natural language processing, and explicable AI - in partnership with key partners Support all business lines, including sales and business development, by enabling those teams while balancing competing goals, and making difficult trade-offs when required Partner effectively with Product, User Experience, Growth, and Operations toward building best-in-class systems Support the technology needs of various departments by creating a data-literate ecosystem, and helping the wider organization understand how the technology helps them and how to think about their initiatives in terms of our capabilities Be a leader, taking initiative and ownership as needed, and connecting across the organization to come up with the best solutions that combine people, process, and software    Why we think this job is great:   It’s a remote full-time, 100% remote position where you’ll work from home with tech provided by the company You’ll have clear goals and the training resources you need to deliver. How you execute and deliver is up to you    Qualifications:   1-8 years of experience in performing results-driven development in a collaborative environment A proven ability to conduct research and internalize user needs, in partnership with Product and User Experience Able to adjust the level of specificity and context for different audiences, either in the interest of achieving common goals efficiently or to educate others For data engineers - experience in Python, relational databases and data warehouses, business intelligence tools, containers, cloud platforms, command line scripting For web back-end engineers - experience in Python, relational databases, cloud platforms For web front-end engineers - experience in React JavaScript/Typescript, CSS, cloud platforms Experience with Data API development, AI, ML and NLP A degree in computer science, engineering, applied math or a related field; or have demonstrated significant growth and impact as an engineer, regardless of your education    Preferred Experience:   Healthcare, insurance or financial technology experience Experience with startups is not necessary, but you should be looking forward to bringing order, power, and role definition to an initial blank slate Not afraid to dive into devops as needed and help us iterate on an efficient build/deploy process and a solid infrastructure    About Us   Bold Business is a remote-first, global outsourced-solutions company with over $7B in service solutions over the past 25 years. Our international team helps the world’s leading companies transform their ideas into bold impacts. From Fortune 500 organizations looking to reduce operational costs by 40%-60% to fast-growth startups looking to scale, we work behind the scenes and empower companies to do more for less.   If you like to move fast and have a bias for action, you’ll fit right into our fast-paced, results-based environment. We’re a 100% remote/virtual team environment where you can work from wherever you are.

Title: Trainee Data (AI / Big Data Analytics / Data Management) (all genders)
Description: Du willst dich in nur sechs Wochen zum/zur gefragten Data-Spezialist:in entwickeln? Mit einem Traineeprogramm, das so nah an der Praxis ist, dass du dein Know-how sofort anwenden kannst – und das auf intensives Lernen durch Spezialist:innen in kleinen Gruppen setzt? Das ist genau dein Ding?   Dann lebe deine Leidenschaft in einer Position, in der du als Data Engineer namhafte Unternehmen rund ums Thema Applied Intelligence berätst.   Das erwartet dich  Unser sechswöchiges Traineeprogramm bereitet dich systematisch auf deine Karriere als Berater:in im Bereich Applied Intelligence und damit auf deinen Einsatz in anspruchsvollen Kundenprojekten vor.  Du lernst, auf was es bei der Projektvorbereitung ankommt, schärfst deine Softskills und machst dich mit agilen Projektmethoden vertraut. Dazu vermitteln wir dir die Grundlagen kommender Data-Warehousing- und Analytics-Architekturen.  Im Anschluss lernst du die Tools und Technologien eines Data Engineers kennen. Abhängig von der aktuellen Marktentwicklung und technologischen Trends folgt eine Vertiefung in nachfolgende Module: Introduction to Big Data Management (Analytics, Machine Learning & AI); Data Integration; ETL & Streaming Technologies; Data Warehousing; Cloud Hyperscaler (GCP, AWS, Azure); Python Programming; Version Control Systems (Git) and CI/CD; Intelligent Automation/RPA; Process Mining; Agile Methodology & Scrum  Nach deinem erfolgreichen Programmabschluss erhältst du einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag und wirst Teil eines funktionsübergreifenden Teams.  Darauf freuen wir uns   Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder Naturwissenschaften bzw. eine solide IT-Ausbildung  Erste Kenntnisse in der Programmierung mit Python, Java, Scala und C++/C#), in der Programmierung von Datenbanken (SQL), in relationalen Datenbanken und Systemen sowie in der Datenintegration  Sehr gute analytisch-konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, eine hohe Lernbereitschaft und Begeisterung für innovative Technologien  Kommunikations- und Präsentationssicherheit in sehr gutem Deutsch und Englisch  Dein Kontakt  Du hast Fragen? Dann wende dich an unser Recruiting Team per E-Mail an recruiting_germany@accenture.com oder telefonisch unter 00800 45045045.   Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung.

Title: Softwareentwickler (m/w/d) Java / JavaScript
Description: Wir übernehmen Verantwortung für das nachhaltige Management von Energie und Wasser und leisten damit unseren Beitrag zur Energiewende. Durch Data Science machen wir Daten zu nutzbaren Informationen und helfen unseren Kunden neue, zukunftsfähige Geschäftsfelder in der Energiebranche zu erschließen. Für unsere Mission brauchen wir tatkräftige Pioniere mit Teamgeist, Kompetenz und Weitsicht.      Die CAIGOS GmbHist Teil der VIVAVIS AG. Bei CAIGOS entwerfen und entwickeln wir Geografische Informationssysteme (GIS) sowie Asset-Management-Systeme. Mit unserer Produktsuite digitalisieren und vereinfachen wir Arbeitsprozesse und das Management von Infrastrukturen in der öffentlichen Verwaltung, der Ver- und Entsorgungswirtschaft und der Industrie.      Zur Verstärkung unseres Entwicklungsteams bei CAIGOS suchen wir dich als       Softwareentwickler (m/w/d) Java / JavaScript  Vollzeit | Unbefristete Festanstellung      Standort:Ettlingen, Bochum, Kirkel/Saar oder Home Office möglich       Deine Aufgaben:   Du entwickelst innerhalb eines agilen Teams dynamische Websites in responsivem Design, die unsere Kunden begeistern Du gestaltest die neue Generation von Web-Anwendungen für Frontend, Backend und mobile Apps und hast Spaß dich in neue Projekte einzuarbeiten Du entschlüsselst die Bedürfnisse unserer Kunden und übersetzt diese in intuitive und mobile Anwendungen Du bringst eigene Ideen zur kontinuierlichen Verbesserung unserer Lösungen ein       Dein Skillset:   Du bist begeisterungsfähig und verfolgst die aktuellen IT-Trends Du hast eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung oder ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Fachrichtung Informatik Du hast Erfahrung in der Entwicklung komplexer Web-Anwendungen und beherrschst die Programmiersprachen Java und JavaScript bzw. TypeScript Du besitzt sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse sowie gute Englischkenntnisse       Unser Angebot:   Eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten in einem hochmotivierten SCRUM-Team Ein auf dich abgestimmtes Einarbeitungsprogramm Mobiles Arbeiten und flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung Interne, externe und digitale Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten Gute Vergütung und attraktive Benefits wie Bike-Leasing und Betriebliche Altersvorsorge       Unsere Teams arbeiten partnerschaftlich und vertrauensvoll miteinander – werde ein Teil von uns!  Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Are you looking for your next big adventure? Are you eager to work in a highly motivated team of experts in machine learning and deep neural networks? Do you enjoy the challenge of completing projects to a high standard? Then join our team! As a Data Engineer, you will develop cutting-edge computer-vision software for driver-monitoring and vehicle-interior monitoring that are deployed by international automotive manufacturers.  Tasks   You will have a central role in developing and operating our machine learning infrastructure. Data acquisition, cleaning, and processing. Development of tools for data collection. Automating our data processes with tools like Gitlab CI, Jenkins, and docker. Distributed storage and processing of our data using Hadoop. Data analysis, monitoring, and reporting. You will have responsibilities throughout our machine learning development pipeline. You will participate in designing our data architecture. You will work in a cross functional team in a rapid development environment.    Requirements    2 years or more of work experience with Python and a masters degree in Computer Science or similar. Very good knowledge of Python and Linux. You write clean, reliable code. Experience with data processing. Experience with cloud computing is a plus. Experience with databases is a plus.
