Independent working mentality, proactive attitude and an entrepreneurial mindset. Good communication skills in English, both verbal and written.    Benefits    Flexible working hours for a good work-life balance. Exciting and responsible tasks. Open corporate culture, flat hierarchies in a young and international team. Modern office at S Tiergarten (Charlottenburg).   Interested? Then send us your CV including salary expectations and possible starting date to the given Email address.

Title: (Junior-) Application Developer (w/m/d)
Description: Was wir bieten   Überdurchschnittliches Gehalt Geringe Reisetätigkeit Mobiles Arbeiten Flexible Arbeitszeiten und gelebte Work-Life-Separation: Freizeitausgleich ab der ersten Überstunde Teilzeit möglich 30 Tage Urlaub. Zusätzlich je halben Tag an Weihnachten und Silvester Zentrales und modernes Büro mit Loungebereich und ergonomischen Arbeitsplätzen Essenszulage, Jobticket und Job-Fahrrad Firmenevents in unterschiedlichen Rahmen (z.B. Sommerfamilienfest, Wiesn-Besuch, Weihnachtsfeier und 2-tägiges Teamevent) Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement Kaffee, Obst, Mineralwasser etc. zur freien Verfügung    Deine Aufgaben   Du entwickelst gemeinsam mit unserem Entwicklungsteam innovative Lösungen für unsere Kunden und integrierst unsere Produkte in ihre IT-Architektur (z. B. SAP HANA) In unserem starken Team erwarten dich optimale Bedingungen dein Wissen gewinnbringend einzubringen und dich in neue Technologien einzuarbeiten In spannenden Kundenprojekten und/oder in unseren eigenen Produktentwicklungen unterstützt du gemeinsam mit deinen Kollegen beim Aufbau von Software- und Daten-Architekturen Du stellst eine hohe Softwarequalität durch Code Reviews sicher und implementierst mit Unterstützung deiner Kolleg*innen automatisierte Unit- und Integrationstests    Dein Profil   Du hast ein Studium in Informatik, Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare IT-nahe Ausbildung erfolgreich abgeschlossen Du besitzt gute Kenntnisse oder konntest bereits Erfahrungen sammeln in den Programmiersprachen und Frameworks wie z.B. JavaScript, SQLScript, TypeScript, node.js oder Java Du brennst für innovative Technologien …. … und willst dich mit unserer Unterstützung zum Experten entwickeln … … und fühlst dich in der agilen Software-Entwicklung, Testdriven- und Clean-Code zu Hause Gute Deutschkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab    Über uns  BIG.Cube: Das Premium-Beratungshaus im Herzen Münchens   Spezialisiert auf Business Intelligence erarbeiten wir technologisch zukunftsorientierte Lösungen und Produkte für unsere Kunden. Wir bieten die gesamte Wertschöpfungskette von Business Analysis, SAP Analytics, SAP HANA und Data Science bis zu SAP Basis & HANA Platform aus einer Hand. Da Business und IT immer mehr miteinander verschmelzen sind wir als Premium Beratung in beiden Welten zuhause. Dabei sind unsere Mitarbeiter unser wertvollstes Kapital, deshalb investieren wir viel in moderne Arbeitsmethoden, ein herausragendes Unternehmensklima und bieten überdurchschnittliche Gehälter.   Wir sind BIG.Cube: Überzeugt von einem Miteinander basierend auf Zuverlässigkeit, Leidenschaft und höchstem Qualitätsanspruch – mit jeder Menge Spaß!

Title: Signal Processing Developer for Hearing Aids (m/f/d)
Description: WS Audiology   Formed in 2019 through the merger of Sivantos and Widex, WS Audiology combines over 140 years of experience in pioneering better solutions to help people with hearing loss. With a passion for impact, our 11.000 employees are committed to achieving our purpose: wonderful sound for all.   With brands like Signia, Widex, Audio Service, Rexton and Vibe, and with diverse assets across wholesale retail, online, managed care and diagnostic solutions, we are active in over 125 markets. Going beyond together, we achieve annual revenues of around EUR 2 billion.   As a global leader, our ambition is to unlock human potential by making wonderful sound part of everyone’s life.   Learn about us on www.wsa.com and take a look at why you will love working here:   The Team   Become part of our global Signal Processing group. We are +50 dedicated and highly skilled specialists working on a multitude of different topics all around Audio Signal Processing at two sites in Erlangen (Germany) and in Lynge (Denmark, near Kopenhagen). Join us in processing and analyzing microphone and other sensor signals, in realizing algorithms in hardware, firmware, DSPs, or mobile devices. Not being familiar with hearing aids, one can hardly imagine the complexity and the possibilities of hearing aid processing. Join us in experiencing and developing new algorithms, neural networks, detection methods, machine learning concepts, and much more.   The Role   As a Signal Processing Developer for Hearing Aids (m/f/d) you will join our global Signal Processing team and become part of the team based in Erlangen, Germany.   In this role you will have the following responsibilities:   Development of new algorithms in the field of (audio) signal processing Utilization of audio/sensor data processing and machine learning methods Implementation of these algorithms in C as an input for the realization in hardware, firmware, DSP, or mobile devices. Reviewing and optimization regarding efficiency and algorithmic complexity, considering the boundary conditions of hearing aid applications Close collaboration with international and interdisciplinary platform development teams (within Signal Processing and with Audiology, Firmware, APP-Development, Software, Wireless, …)    Requirements  You have profound knowledge in the development of signal processing algorithms or a strong expertise in machine learning methods. Ideally you have some experience in audio signal processing or audio and data analysis. Furthermore, you are motivated by working together with others in teams, sharing and exchanging ideas, defining joint targets and ambitiously working together to reach the targets with great success.   You most likely fit the following profile:   Master’s or PhD degree in electrical/electronic engineering, computer science, medical engineering, or any other relevant discipline. Very good knowledge in the field of signal processing and/or machine learning and their applications Good knowledge in the field of audio applications would be desirable Good knowledge in data analysis and statistics would be an added advantage Good programming skills in C, Matlab, and Python Structured working, analytical thinking, and strong problem-solving skills    Our corporate language is English, so you need to be confident in English, both verbally and in writing.   What we offer   We are driven by innovation and development so working with us is a constant learning curve. You will have the opportunity to pioneer new solutions.   We offer flexible working times & opportunities for working from home. You can always get free coffee at the office. We are part of the IG Metall tariff agreement offering attractive compensation and futher benefits like contributions to the company pension plan or child-care.   Join WS Audiology   If this opportunity sounds interesting to you, please submit your application stating your earliest starting date and your salary expectations and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

Title: Mercedes-Benz: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description: Für unser Projekt zur Digitalisierung unseres Vertriebsmodells suchen wir dich als Data Analyst / Business Analyst / Wirtschaftsinformatiker (w/m/d) unbefristet Vollzeit/Teilzeit.   Auf was Du Dich bei uns freuen kannst:   Individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle inkl. der Möglichkeit zum Mobilen Arbeiten und Gleitzeit (38 h/Woche, 30 Tage Urlaub) Übertarifliche Vergütung mit Urlaubsgeld und Sonderzahlungen sowie betriebliche Altersvorsorge (mindestens 67.000 EUR abhängig von Qualifikation und Erfahrung) Arbeiten in unserem modernen Bürogebäude in Berlin Friedrichshain mit eigenem Fitness-Studio (inkl. persönlichen Trainer*innen), Bistro und Kantine Vielfältige Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsangebote (Nachwuchsprogramme, Lunch Lectures, Speaker zu interessanten Themen, Learning Platforms z.B. LinkedIn Learning) Deine neues Team: Wir sind smart und arbeiten stets füreinander und miteinander, mit Leidenschaft sowie harmonisch zusammen. Wir legen Wert darauf, auf Augenhöhe, direkt und in regelmäßigen Austauschterminen miteinander im Gespräch zu sein. Zudem ist es uns wichtig, dass wir konstruktiv und ehrlich miteinander umgehen.   Diese spannenden Aufgaben erwarten Dich bei uns:   Du arbeitest an der Konzeptionierung und Ausgestaltung eines digitalen Daten-/Analyse-/Reporting Set-ups, seiner Datenquellen sowie der Ableitung, Implementierung und Weiterentwicklung der dafür notwendigen Daten-/Reportingstrukturen und -prozessen Du schaffst den Transfer von operativer Problemdefinition zu analytischem Anwendungsfall, beschreibst Use Cases und setzt diese unter Verwendung modernster Analytics-Werkzeuge und statistischer Modelle um Du implementierst und entwickelst explorative Analysemethoden und datenbasierter KI-Methoden im vertriebsspezifischen Kontext (Markt/Wettbewerb/Preise/Nachlässe), bereitest Ergebnisse auf und interpretierst diese Du machst in bereichsübergreifenden Projekten mit und hast Freude an der Entwicklung von Trainings zum Thema Datenkompetenz, um die Vertriebsteams für das Thema BI & AI zu begeistern   Idealerweise bringst Du Folgendes mit:   Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Computer Science, Data Science oder eine vergleichbaren Qualifikation Know-How im Bereich der Datenmodellierung, -aufbereitung und -analyse sowie der Gestaltung und Nutzung von System- und Anwenderschnittstellen Erfahrung in der Erstellung von Dashboards und Berichten (Nutzung von Tools wie Tableau, PowerBI und vergleichbaren Visualisierungstools) Programmierkenntnisse z.B. in SQL, Python, Azure Cloud, SAP-SAC Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Methoden der Künstlichen Intelligenz, Deep Learning, Datenmodellierung, Big Data Datenbanken Ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, Gestaltungsdrang, kreative Problemlösungskompetenz und Motivation etwas zu bewegen Sprachniveau Deutsch mindestens B1, verhandlungssicheres Englisch   Klingt nach einer spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann bewirb  dich ganz einfach online in 5 Minuten!

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description: Data Engineer (f/m/d)based in Germany or remote based anywhere in EU  WHAT IS WAITING FOR YOU?   Build, improve and extend a scalable and cloud-based data warehouse in an iterative way Gather business and functional requirements and translate these requirements into robust, scalable, operable solutions with a flexible and adaptable data architecture Build data pipelines for loading source system data into the data warehouse for further reporting and analysis Leverage industry best practices including proper use of source control, participation in code reviews, data validation and testing Provide tools and advice for data ingestion, processing and analysis to empower our teams in gaining valuable Insights   WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?   Graduate with a degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Informatics, Mathematics, or a related technical discipline Thrive in a dynamic environment, maintaining composure and a positive attitude Strong Analytical and SQL skills with demonstrated strength in data modelling, data pipelines, and ELT development You are knowledgeable about data modelling techniques, cloud infrastructure automation and management (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Gitlab CI) and are able to leverage these skills to make architectural decisions based on product opportunities Hands-on experience with Cloud Data Warehouse (e.g Snowflake, Redshift etc.) and Big Data technologies (e.g S3, Spark, Kafka etc).   LeanIX, The Continuous Transformation Platform® that efficiently organizes, plans and manages IT landscapes, supporting 650+ customers with our 3 solutions Enterprise Architecture Management, SaaS Management Platform and Value Stream Management.   LeanIX is not just a product, in fact it‘s a great place to work.  Colleagues (450+) from dozens of countries jointly make our vision reality. We believe in transparent communication, personal development, diverse workforce, innovation by creating ideas that prove useful and that our world-class team deserves the best software stack money can buy.   At LeanIX you have the freedom to decide on the work mode that suits both your personal situation and how to best organize work within your team. The Flexible Work Mode  means you can work from the office once in a while, on a frequent basis or maybe you prefer to work remotely from your home office most of the time. Next to that we have great benefits for you, CHECK OUT HERE WHAT´S IN FOR YOU!   _As an equal  opportunity employer LeanIX celebrates diversity and is committed to and promoting an inclusive work environment._  You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion,  belief, political affiliation, union membership, age, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability, protected veteran or marital status, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.

Title: Software Developer - IoT (m/w/d)
Description: Deep Tech meets Vertical Mobility  - we reinvent vertical mobility and intra-logistics with patented   IoT solutions  .  Using our unique IoT/Cloud technology, we are transforming machines into the smart backbone of   tomorrow's vertical cities.    In smart hotels, we enable autonomous robots to use the elevator, while using   predictive maintenance and machine learning  with our own venture  www.aufzughelden.com  to sustainably and effectively reduce operating costs for elevator operators.  Become part of our journey as   Software Developer - IoT   (m/w/d)    with cloud experience and possibly smart building networks like BACNet, OpC UA, ect.   Are you highly motivated and want to acquire new skills in a fast-paced and energetic work environment? Then come and join our amazing team!   That's You:    Completed IT degree Initial experience in the IoT environment, preferably with C++, Java Script, C# and/or TypeScript Initial experience with modern cloud technologies (e.g. AWS, Azure or more) as well as common software development practices and continuous deployment in the cloud environment is an advantage Initial experience in web technologies and programming interfaces such as REST API is an advantage Linux professional and Docker enthusiast Desirable: experience with Azure IoT or other IoT platforms (e.g. AWS IoT) Fluency in English If you are not located in the EU, existing visa and work allowance for Germany    Even if you don't meet all the points but are ready for a challenge, feel free to click 'Apply' anyway.   That's what You effect:    The focus is on the "Things" of industrial automation.  You bring these into the cloud and implement solutions "at the edge".   Scaling and load balancing of web services Full stack developer of web applications Proactively participating in the various project phases from definition to implementation and integration to deployment of cloud applications and components Collaboration in analysis of customer requests, design, development and implementation of cloud solutions/architectures In the context of innovative projects you develop solutions based on the emerging platform services     That's what we give You:    The possibility of actively shaping a technological edge on an everyday product With us, you can make your contribution to a better quality of life and energy efficiency in our cities Great working environment in the middle of Prenzlauer Berg in a well-equipped co-working space with a focus on medium-sized innovation (sufficient supplies of good coffee, organic soda and cold hops are provided) Flexibility, home office options BVG tickets reimbursement 30 days vacation and fair salary     Do you find yourself in the description?   We are looking forward to your application!

Title: Data Engineer (w/m/d)
Description: Vibracoustic ist Teil der Freudenberg Gruppe. Das Unternehmen sorgt für ein ruhiges und leises Fahrerlebnis in jedem Fahrzeug. Wir möchten Mobilität komfortabler machen und die perfekte Lösung für NVH-Herausforderungen unserer Automobilkunden bieten. Als führender Anbieter ist Vibracoustic der richtige Ort für offene, ehrgeizige Teamplayer mit einer praktischen Herangehensweise. Unsere innovative, sichere und dynamische Arbeitsatmosphäre bietet viele Chancen für Ihr persönliches Wachstum und Ihre Entwicklung in einem globalen Netzwerk. Möchten Sie in unser Team kommen?   Hamburg   Vibracoustic SE & Co. KG   Sie unterstützen unser Team als   Data Engineer (w/m/d)   Ihre Aufgaben   Sie kümmern sich um das Programmieren von Bildverarbeitungs- und KI-basierten Lösungen Sie sorgen für die Standardisierung und Weiterentwicklung von Technologien Sie treiben die Industrialisierung von Neuprojekten im Produktentstehungsprozess voran Sie verantworten die Vernetzung von Produktionsanlagen Sie übernehmen das Datenbankmanagement und die Datenmodellierung    Ihr Profil   Sie verfügen über ein Studium der Ingenieurswissenschaften, Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung Sie bringen eine mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in dem Umfeld mit Sie haben sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Programmierung mit C# .Net, ASP .Net Sie verfügen über einen sicheren Umgang mit Visual Studio, GIT, SVN o.ä. Sie haben Erfahrungen im Umgang mit MVTec Halcon, OpenCV o.ä. Sie haben Erfahrungen mit Datenbanksystemen wie PostgreSQL o.ä. Sie sprechen Deutsch und Englisch verhandlungssicher    Ihre Vorteile   Aus- und Weiterbildungen / Laufbahnentwicklung:  Programme zur Erweiterung von Fachwissen und Qualifikationen.   Flexible Arbeitsmodelle:  Flexible Arbeitsmöglichkeiten für den persönlichen Erfolg und Zufriedenheit   Cafeteria/Kantine:  Vor Ort werden frische, warme und kalte Speisen angeboten.   Betriebliche Altersvorsorge:  Mit Hilfe des Unternehmens für den Ruhestand vorsorgen.   Fahrtkostenzuschuss für öffentliche Verkehrsmittel:  Kostengünstiger pendeln durch Zuschuss für öffentliche Verkehrsmittel   Hier gelangen Sie direkt zu unserer Karriereseite. Drive your career!   Die Freudenberg Gruppe zeichnet sich durch Offenheit und Chancengleichheit aus. Wir begrüßen daher Bewerbungen von allen Menschen unabhängig von Alter, Geschlecht, Herkunft und Abstammung, einer Behinderung oder anderer gesetzlich geschützter Gründe.

Title: Deutsche Bahn AG: Big Data Engineer (w/m/d)
Description: Die Deutsche Bahn ist eine der vielfältigsten Arbeitgeberinnen Deutschlands mit unterschiedlichsten Aufgaben und Themen. Jahr für Jahr suchen wir begeisterte Mitarbeiter, die gemeinsam mit uns Menschen und Märkte bewegen.   Als Mitarbeiter bei der DB Systel gestaltest Du aktiv die Digitalisierung im Konzern und formst entscheidend die digitale Zukunft der Bahn mit. Dazu arbeitest Du bei uns in agilen, selbstorganisierten Netzwerkstrukturen und mit entsprechendem Gestaltungsspielraum. Wir setzen auf eigenverantwortliche, motivierte Macherinnen und Macher, die persönlich und gemeinsam wachsen wollen.   Im Team Data Services Rail verarbeiten wir große Datenmengen, sodass unsere konzerninternen Kunden einen möglichst großen Nutzen daraus ziehen können. Dabei kümmern wir uns um alles rund um Big Data und Business Intelligence - von Datenintegration bis zur Visualisierung.   Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir Dich als Senior Big Data Engineer für die DB Systel. Der Hauptstandort unseres Teams ist Frankfurt, wo wir uns zukünftig ab und zu treffen wollen - ansonsten arbeiten wir hauptsächlich flexibel remote oder an einem der anderen Standorte der DB Systel in Berlin oder Erfurt.   Deine Aufgaben:   In Deiner Rolle als Senior Big Data Engineer entwickelst und koordinierst Du übergreifende Big-Data und BI-Lösungen Zur effizienten Handhabung großer Datenmengen erarbeitest Du komplexe Konzepte von Big Data und BI Lösungen Du unterstützt im Bereich der Neukundenakquise, Projektberatung, dem Stakeholdermanagement sowie dem Ausbau von technologischen Communitys Ebenfalls repräsentierst Du das Team und stellst Konzepte und Evaluationen bei unseren Konzernpartnern bis auf Management-Ebene vor Als Big Data Spezialist coachst Du das Team und trägst zum kontinuierlichen Know-how-Transfer bei   Dein Profil:   Du hast ein (Fach-)Hochschulstudium in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung abgeschlossen oder verfügst über eine Ausbildung im IT-Bereich mit entsprechender Erfahrung in der Praxis Ebenfalls kannst Du eine langjährige Erfahrung als Big Data und BI Engineer vorweisen und kennst die gängigen Tools, zum Teil auf Expertenebene Deine ausgeprägte Kunden- und Teamorientierung zeichnen Dich aus Du liebst es, Dein Wissen zu teilen und förderst die Zusammenarbeit sowohl im Team als auch teamübergreifend - auf Dich kann man sich verlassen Fließende Deutschkenntnisse und Begeisterung für agile Methoden runden Dein Profil ab   Benefits:   Du erhältst bis zu 16 Freifahrten innerhalb Deutschlands pro Jahr und weitere Fahrvergünstigungen für Deine Freunde und Familie. Wir fördern flexible, individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle und unterstützen, wo es betrieblich möglich ist, durch moderne Arbeitsformen wie Homeoffice oder mobiles Arbeiten. Du schaffst Großes und bekommst nicht weniger zurück: ein marktübliches Gehaltspaket mit i.d.R. unbefristeten Arbeitsverträgen und Beschäftigungssicherung sowie vielfältige Nebenleistungen und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge.   Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte Bewerber bei gleicher Eignung bei bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

Title: Backend Engineer
Description: Teraki is a Berlin based tech driven company enabling true mobility. We stand for innovation in the rapidly developing connected car, self-driving and 3D mapping world. Teraki provides the data reduction and data processing solution for Automotive (IoT) applications and enables the launch of new applications by reducing costs. We help our customers on the challenges that are posed by the exploding amounts of data in connected cars for all sensor, video and 3D mapping data.   To expand our tech team, we are looking for a Backend Developer to join our diverse team in Berlin. You will closely work with other Backend developers, DevOps Engineers, Software Engineers and Data Engineers.   Tasks  Your Responsibilities   Create a web platform, as part of our software product, for machine learning operations, data visualization, monitoring, and configuration Build REST APIs and microservices Build and maintain tools to automate the provisioning, deployment, and monitoring of our infrastructure Contribute to the building of fast, robust, and scalable data-processing pipelines Take part in designing database schemas, setup and maintain databases Collaborate with data scientists and software engineers to continuously implement and improve features, following an agile and test-driven approach You and your team have ownership over the entire software development lifecycle from planning to coding, testing and maintenance.    Requirements    Who we are looking for   Background in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related. Proven experience +4 years as Python Backend Developer. Experience building microservices with Frameworks (such Flask, aiohttp, FastAPI, or others) is required. You are familiar with Python test suites (in particular: pytest) and you can write unit, integration, and system tests autonomously and appreciate the importance of testing, software validation and clean code. You have knowledge in Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment. You have experience using Relational databases (especially PostgreSQL) and Non-Relational Databases. You have experience running code in the cloud (ideally AWS) and in K8s. It’s a plus if: You have worked with Machine Learning products or you have the theoretical foundations of the discipline. You have significant experience in designing, scaling, debugging, and optimizing microservices-based and event-driven systems. You have experience writing asynchronous code with python async-await.    Benefits    What we offer   Unique opportunity to actively contribute to the IoT revolution and the emerging of novel data-driven automotive platforms To increase your technical know-how in current very hot topics in autonomous driving development: Algorithmic methods in Machine Learning, Neural Networks, Embedded Design To work on cutting-edge research with immediate industrial applications To work closely with top-class European, US, and Asian companies in Automotive and leading the pace in autonomous driving and novel connected car applications To work in a vibrant startup environment and share insights within an international team positioned between Berlin and the Bay Area Free public transport with Berlin and free German class.

Title: Data Engineer, EMEA
Description: Description  Who we are:  Firebolt is a disruptor in the data & analytics space. Based on technology that delivers an order-of-magnitude performance leap in TB-scale analytics, Firebolt helps the most data-forward companies create a new wave of data & analytics experiences for end-users. With a team of world-class data experts, led by leadership veterans from Looker, Google BigQuery, Imply and Sisense, and backed by $264M in funding - we are growing quickly and are poised to build the data platform of the future, and set a new bar for what can be done with data.   About the job to be done:  We’re looking for a data engineer to join a small team within our Release Group - developing tools that replicate our customer’s environments and conditions so we can analyze outcomes for release validation before production.   You’ll play a key role within R&D, working with modern data technologies including Firebolt’s own Data Warehouse and adapting to new and changing environments and technologies as we evolve.   Your responsibilities:   Work closely with product managers, solution architects, and engineering teams to understand data needs and help build data products that scale across the company. Consult with customers to ensure the use of Firebolt according to best practices and to unleash its full potential. Building and scaling a reliable data warehouse using architectural best practices for internal and external application data sets. Use your experience with various IT concepts of data management/engineering (ELT, data modeling, data warehousing, etc.).    Requirements   3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer Advanced knowledge of SQL and Python Familiarity with modern cloud data architectures Familiarity with modern cloud data warehouse products Experience with ETL/ELT tools: Airflow/dbt/ etc Experience in custom ELT design, implementation, and maintenance Experience working with cloud platforms, preferably AWS Bachelor’s/Master’s in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field or equivalent experience

Title: Data Visualization and Information Designer (f/m/x)
Description:
The Company Humans globally face unseen challenges while transforming their businesses. Navigating in a digital and borderless economy while the pace of change keeps increasing. Organizations encounter inter-dependencies and exponential growth of cause-impact relations. It’s getting harder to decide and navigate between things that actually have an impact. That’s why we’re building Field33. Our mission is to help people deepen their understanding and impact on organizations and empower them to make informed decisions. Our platform gives users access to empirically proven success factors, local data, and machine learning capabilities. We offer tools that model the complexity in which we all operate, enabling people to learn and explore - making complexity user-friendly. We are small but fast growing team with no strict hierarchies. Attitude, motivation to deliver and learning and adopting quickly is more important to us than years in the job and ticking all the boxes. We are looking for people able to take senior roles over time but are willing to adjust responsibility and package according to your current level of ability. THE ROLE We’re looking for a Data Visualization and Information Designer (f/m/x) across seniority levels with experience in prototyping, who will join us on the quest to build a new future for organizational data—empowering our users to explore and interact with data and knowledge across the anatomical levels of an organization. At Field33, you will be part of an interdisciplinary and diverse team that brings together expertise across varied domains such as engineering, data science, machine learning, business strategy, experience design, and many others to provide a new approach at the intersection of domain expertise and Software 2.0. We are looking for a teammate whose craft is informed by curiosity and thirst for knowledge, as we believe that connected seemingly remote data points often inspire great ideas. It is true for organizations as it is true for our design process. Alongside your experience working in cross-functional teams, you have the tools to prototype your vision. Visit our Blog to understand better what drives and where we look for inspiration. Your Responsibilities And Mission As part of our design team, you will apply your skills to conceptualize and implement interactive data visualization prototypes at the core of the overall Field33 user experience. Your day to day will include: Experiment and conceptualize innovative approaches to visualize live organizational data. Rapid prototyping of interactive data visualizations and related user flows. Collaborating with the engineering and design team to create and validate user-friendly and configurable data-driven interfaces. Translating our approach’s tech, research, and business foundation into a delightful visual language that enriches our product end empowers our users. Benefits Flexible hours and a dedicated remote budget 1.000 Euros personal development fund & 6 paid education days to help you grow within your role 29+1 days paid holiday per year Free eBike for commuting to work and for personal use and for a greener planet Good tech you need to do your job Regular (remote) team events, as well as regular (remote) social events ESOP

Desired Skills and Experience

What You Need To Succeed 3-5 years of proven track record of creating interactive data visualization that successfully balances analytics aesthetics and functionality. Solid expertise in information visualization. Including knowledge of industry best practices. You are a designer with a relentless passion for detail and aesthetics that can answer the immediate needs of a startup but also push for a vision. Knowledge of visualization and implementation tools. You have knowledge and experience in Data Visualization tools and frameworks such as Svelte, D3js, Cytoscape, Pixijs, Jupyter, or similar. You know how to work in a distributed, remote and collaborative team. Have a good level of spoken and written English. German is a plus. If you do not check all boxes in the job description perfectly, we still encourage you to apply. It’s perfectly fine as long as you’re willing to learn and gain the experience on the job.

Title: AI/ML Engineer (m/f/d) at least € 80k + shares
Description: eMedicals Healthtech GmbH is an ambitious Digital Health startup based in Frankfurt am Main. Thanks to its globally unique innovation, eMedicals won multiple awards and is promoted by the Federal Ministry of Education and Research, Hessian Ministry of Science and Art and funded by multiple investors as well as financial Institutions.   We are expanding our 15 members strong team consisting of doctors, nutritionists, designers, financial and tech experts! You are welcome to join us on our mission to increase patients’ quality of life and slow down the progression of nutritionally sensitive diseases, such as Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) through our medical app “kidiDNA”!   Tasks   Research and development (R&D) of a ML solution for our application area Discover, design, and develop analytical methods to support novel approaches of data and information processing Analyze and explain AI and machine learning (ML) solutions while setting and maintaining high medical and ethical standards Generate and test working hypotheses Prepare and analyze historical data and identify patterns Own and manage knowledge sharing within a community    Requirements    Familiarity with Unix/Linux operating systems Experience using software development best practices (e.g. GitHub) Software development skills in at least two different programming languages (e.g. Python, C/C++), including familiarity with machine learning and deep learning open-source libraries in Python Advanced knowledge in recommender systems Experience in NLP Experience in OCR (computer vision) Experience working in an Agile environment (i.e. Jira, Confluence)    Benefits    Very good salary package (salary + shares in the startup) Startup culture with flat hierarchies and transparency Flexible working hours Home office job ticket Leasing bicycles Free drinks, fruit, snacks Further education and training company events (going out eating and drinking together) Health programs Ergonomic and modern workplaces   Be part of eMedicals and make your parents, partner and your friends proud!

Title: Robotic Perception Specialist (m/f/diverse)
Description: Description  As part of the central advance development for artificial intelligence (AI) and mobile robotics, we are responsible for developing innovative technologies that address the advancement of the technical capabilities of driving mobile robots in changing environments. Potential applications include last mile delivery, mobility solutions for smart cities, and other future urban transportation applications. You will work in a dedicated, innovative team of Continental employees (m/f/diverse) and students (m/f/diverse).   Your tasks will focus on the following activities:    Develop new functionalities for our software stack for environment perception of mobile robots and transfer research results to the software to be used in the robot, which can be deployed on a cloud server, for example Contribute to our data management and model training infrastructure to ensure ML model management best practices are followed for newly added functionality Understand and translate business and application specific needs into technical requirements and project plans Maintain documentation related to requirements development, system solution architecture design and specification, failure analysis etc. Drive modern and emerging robotics technologies within the team    Qualifications   (PhD) degree in robotics, artificial intelligence, mechatronics, electrical engineering, computer science or other related disciplines Several years of professional experience in core research and software development in areas related to robotics e.g. computer vision, probabilistic modeling etc. Several years of experience with neural network training and deployment Experience with several of the following: statistical signal processing, probabilistic modeling, path planning, navigation, manipulation, optimization, control Direct experience applying machine learning to robotics is a plus Knowledge of the Robot Operating System (ROS) is a plus Excellent programming skills and knowledge of software architecture Extensive experience in Python, C++ or Rust is a plus Business fluent English and good German language skills written and spoken Excellent communication skills Ability to work in a team and intercultural skills Strong analytical skills Willingness to travel    Applications from severely handicapped people are welcome.   What We Offer   In addition to the interesting field of activity of the function, the city of Berlin offers a high recreational value and stands for quality of life You will work in an innovative work environment, namely the "co-working space AI Campus" Become part of our motivated team - we are looking forward to you You would like to learn more about our additional services? Click here.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Esprit isn’t just an Employer. It is more than a fashion brand, staying true to our core values of sustainability and diversity.   We are looking for real personalities. Smart characters with attitude, corners and edges. We love what we do. And so should you.   You are a team-player loving to take challenges together with your colleagues?   You would like to work in a company whose products are well-known and support such company in its success?   Then apply now as   Data Engineer (m/f/d)  to support our Team. (ID 16921)   Your responsibilities   You are actively consulting, analysing and documenting functional requirements and develop solutions based on an SQL environment You are supporting datasets based on all business processes in a retail and wholesale company ideally with Fashion background Keeping our tools and solutions up to date is key for our success. You are supporting this in an Azure environment in the cloud with on premise solutions combined You are building end to end processes in analytics from data source to report datasets Communication with and support or training of key users in Analytics and Reporting topics is part of the day to day job, ideally with experience in Power BI or similar visualisation tools Ensuring stable daily processes in the system is key for you including testing activity   Your skills   You have a degree in IT, business information technology or natural sciences or qualification and practical experience in data engineer area You have good experience with SQL architecture, ideally with Microsoft SQL server including SSIS or Azure environment You have experience with Databricks or at least extensive experience with Apache Spark Ability to write efficient SQL statements is key Additional skills like VBA, Python or R are beneficial You have experience with visualisation frontend tools, ideally with Power BI You have strong communication skills and you are a team player You have a solution oriented, independent way of working with excellent communication skills You have a good command of written and spoken German and English   Our Benefits   We have a flexible mobile office arrangement that allows you to choose your work location at least two days a week, plus we have flexible working hours We are a team that places a lot of value on collegial and open cooperation, open feedback is always appreciated With us you get 40% staff discount on our entire product range We don't have a dresscode, you can wear whatever you feel comfortable in We offer you of course a subsidy for public transport or you ca park on one of our free parking spaces We have an award-winning canteen that provides you with really tasty and healthy food every day   Are you a good match for this Job?   Then please submit an application with your salary expectations and an indication of your earliest starting date. Please feel free to contact Sabine Lang if you have any questions.

Title: Data Engineer / Analyst
Description: As part of our data team you will enable teams at Shpock to consume and build effective products based on trustworthy data.     Use your expertise to implement our data strategy and big data management approach Ensure uninterrupted and timely data availability, while using the resources efficiently Ensure correctness of data in all stages of the data-processing/-preparation pipeline Responsible for the continuous optimization, development and scaling of data warehouse processes and applications Guarantee the integration of internal and external data sources into our data warehouse Define and implement data quality assurance methods With your technical skills and knowledge you support various teams in getting access to the data they need Generate information and insights from data sets and identifying trends and patterns Prepare reports for executive and project teams Create visualisations of data    WHY IS THIS ROLE UNIQUE   Steep learning curve: you will receive a very intensive onboarding and take full ownership of the role very quickly Orchestrate engineering & analytics: next to your core data engineering responsibilities, you will also have possibility to enhance your analytical skills Hands-on: learning by doing is what we do, failure is acceptable, failing to try is not    WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH   Work with Shpock leadership team - you will report directly to CTO and support our COO Work with product team - you will work intensively with our international product and data team    YOUR PROFILE   2+ years experience in a Data Engineer role or similar position Experience with SQL and management of relational databases Experience with Python, JavaScript and Apache Airflow Experience working with 3rd party APIs (Facebook, Google, AWS...) Strong strategic, analytical and problem solving skills Ability to work independently and in a team setting Fluent in English    WHAT WE OFFER  Besides having an open and respectful culture with a caring and supportive international team, Shpock has a lot more to offer:   Flexible working hours: We care about your work-life balance and therefore have trust-based working hours. Get the job done is our motto. 4 days’ workweek in summer: Get into the weekend earlier with 4 days’ workweek from June until August, every Friday is off. Hybrid working model: You choose where you want to work from, whether in the office or from home. From time to time we will organize team events or workshops and will ask you to join us in person. Team events: We have a dedicated team budget to get together, have fun and strengthen our team spirit (eg, laser tag, bowling,..), and of course we like to celebrate at our Christmas party. Personal development budget: Shpock values personal development and helps set up individual development plans to train the skills and knowledge of our team members. You will have your own personal development budget to up-skill yourself. Discounts at our partnering shops: Shpock is part of the corporate benefits platform which is an online platform with a huge amount of discounts and a wide variety of shops (electronics, fashion, furniture and more). Choose your equipment: We let you choose whether you prefer to work with a MacBook or a Dell laptop.

Title: Software Developer (m/f/d)
Description: Überblick  Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. Bruker's high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular and microscopic levels. Today, worldwide more than 7,200 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 70 locations on all continents. Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems and a strong reputation among its customers.   The Bruker Nano Analytics (BNA) Division, headquartered at Bruker Nano GmbH in Berlin, Germany, develops, manufactures and markets state of the art systems and components for elemental and structural analysis on micro- and nano-scale.   We are looking for a Software Developer (m/f/d)  for our Xray Spectrometers to support our software development team at Berlin.   Aufgaben/Verantwortlichkeiten   Drive the software development for our next generation XRF spectrometers M4 Tornado, M6 Jetstream und S4 T-Star Design, implementation, test und documentation of device and PC software to control our spectrometers and process measurement data Coordinate work packages with other teams and external partners and integrate them into our products Implement test   Qualifikationen   Master’s degree in computer science or a related field Expert of object-oriented software development Two years of relevant working experience Graduates are welcome to apply also Fluent in German and English, both written and verbal You are a team player who likes software development    Additional Experience    Developing scientific software or device control software UML and design patterns   At Bruker, you can expect an interdisciplinary work environment in an expanding business. You will be part of a highly qualified and dedicated team. Alongside above average employee benefits, we offer training and seminars that support your further development.   Start your career and apply now for your new job at Bruker!   Please include your salary expectations and the possible starting date in your cover letter .

Title: Frontend Developer
Description: Unsere Mission bei getML ist es, ein Machine Learning Framework für relationales Lernen zu entwickeln, welches Data Scientist und Data Engineers ermöglicht, den manuellen Arbeitsaufwand bei der Entwicklung von Predictive-Analytics-Modellen um bis zu 90% zu reduzieren.  Das Alleinstellungsmerkmale von getML sind unsere einzigartigen Algorithmen für Feature Learning auf relationalen Daten und Zeitreihen. Nur wenige Zeilen Python Code genügen, um von Milliarden von Features zu lernen. Hierbei schlägt getML populäre Frameworks von Alteryx, Facebook und BlueYonder in Bezug auf Geschwindigkeit und Genauigkeit der erlernten Modelle.   Mehr zu relationalem Lernen, zahlreiche Beispiel-Notebooks und eine Live-Demo findest du unter https://www.getml.com/.   Als Teil unseres Data Science Team, ist deine zentrale Aufgabe, das getML Framework mit weiterzuentwickeln sowie unsere Kunden bei dem Einsatz von getML zu unterstützen.   Aufgaben  Das Aufgabenspektrum als Frontend Entwickler wird davon geprägt sein uns in der Weiterentwicklung von Web-Services des getML Frameworks zu unterstützen.   Unterstütze uns in der Entwicklung des getML Frameworks   Aufbau von mit getML verbundener Services, wie zur Nutzer- und Lizenzverwaltung oder Bereitstellungs-Services eines SaaS Angebots Weiterentwicklung der getML Web-Präsenz Konzeption interner APIs mit unserem Backend-Team   Qualifikation   Du hast Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Frontends mit JavaScript Frameworks, wie z.B. VueJs oder React Du beherrscht die Programmiersprache HTML, JS/TypeScript, CSS/SCSS und bist in der Lage Python oder Golang zu verstehen Du hast im besten Fall erste Erfahrungen mit Google Firebase Du bist ambitioniert dir ein Grundverständnis in AI/ML-Themengebieten anzueignen Du bist in der Lage in deutscher und englischer Sprache sicher zu kommunizieren Idealerweise hast du Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Cloud-Infrastrukturen wie Google Cloud, AWS, Azure    Benefits    Startup Atmosphäre mit flachen Hierarchien, sowie einem dynamischen und agilen Team Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Hybrid Office mit der Option auf Remote innerhalb Europas Option auf ein Büro in einer lebendigen und inspirierenden Arbeitsumgebung der alten Baumwollspinnerei in Leipzig Moderne Hardware für dein Home Office und im Büro (MacBook Pro, elektrisch höhenverstellbarer Schreibtisch, 38 Zoll Curved Screen) Die Gelegenheit, gemeinsam mit uns Machine Learning auf relationalen Daten zu revolutionieren Spannende und anspruchsvolle Projekte in unserem internationalen Kundenkreis Gestalte als Teil unseres wachsenden Teams die Zukunft von getML aktiv mit   Als Entwickler erhältst du außerdem modernste Hardware für dein Home Office. Dazu gehört unter anderem: MacBook Pro, elektrisch höhenverstellbarer Schreibtisch, 38 Zoll Curved Screen   Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung.

Title: Trainee Data (AI / Big Data Analytics / Data Management) (all genders)
Description: Du willst dich in nur sechs Wochen zum/zur gefragten Data-Spezialist:in entwickeln? Mit einem Traineeprogramm, das so nah an der Praxis ist, dass du dein Know-how sofort anwenden kannst – und das auf intensives Lernen durch Spezialist:innen in kleinen Gruppen setzt? Das ist genau dein Ding?   Dann lebe deine Leidenschaft in einer Position, in der du als Data Engineer namhafte Unternehmen rund ums Thema Applied Intelligence berätst.   Das erwartet dich  Unser sechswöchiges Traineeprogramm bereitet dich systematisch auf deine Karriere als Berater:in im Bereich Applied Intelligence und damit auf deinen Einsatz in anspruchsvollen Kundenprojekten vor.  Du lernst, auf was es bei der Projektvorbereitung ankommt, schärfst deine Softskills und machst dich mit agilen Projektmethoden vertraut. Dazu vermitteln wir dir die Grundlagen kommender Data-Warehousing- und Analytics-Architekturen.  Im Anschluss lernst du die Tools und Technologien eines Data Engineers kennen. Abhängig von der aktuellen Marktentwicklung und technologischen Trends folgt eine Vertiefung in nachfolgende Module: Introduction to Big Data Management (Analytics, Machine Learning & AI); Data Integration; ETL & Streaming Technologies; Data Warehousing; Cloud Hyperscaler (GCP, AWS, Azure); Python Programming; Version Control Systems (Git) and CI/CD; Intelligent Automation/RPA; Process Mining; Agile Methodology & Scrum  Nach deinem erfolgreichen Programmabschluss erhältst du einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag und wirst Teil eines funktionsübergreifenden Teams.  Darauf freuen wir uns   Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder Naturwissenschaften bzw. eine solide IT-Ausbildung  Erste Kenntnisse in der Programmierung mit Python, Java, Scala und C++/C#), in der Programmierung von Datenbanken (SQL), in relationalen Datenbanken und Systemen sowie in der Datenintegration  Sehr gute analytisch-konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, eine hohe Lernbereitschaft und Begeisterung für innovative Technologien  Kommunikations- und Präsentationssicherheit in sehr gutem Deutsch und Englisch  Dein Kontakt  Du hast Fragen? Dann wende dich an unser Recruiting Team per E-Mail an recruiting_germany@accenture.com oder telefonisch unter 00800 45045045.   Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung.

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Bei Bayer sind wir Visionäre und entschlossen, die größten Herausforderungen unseres Planeten zu überwinden und zu einer Welt beizutragen, in der genug Nahrung und ausreichende medizinische Versorgung für alle Menschen keine unerreichbaren Ziele mehr darstellen. Wir tun dies mit Energie, Neugier und purer Hingabe, lernen stets von den Menschen um uns herum, erweitern unsere Denkweise, verbessern unsere Fähigkeiten und definieren das „Unmögliche“ neu. Es gibt viele Gründe, sich uns anzuschließen: Wenn Sie nach einer abwechslungsreichen und bedeutungsvollen beruflichen Zukunft streben, in der Sie gemeinsam mit anderen brillanten Köpfen wirklich etwas bewegen können, möchten wir Sie in unserem Team haben.  Data Engineer (m/w/d)  Die Vision und Mission unserer Enabling Function „Global Data Assets Organization“ besteht darin, die Bayer-Unternehmensfunktionen wie Finanzen, Supply Chain und Logistik, HR, Beschaffung, Recht, Nachhaltigkeit usw. zu transformieren und stärker erkenntnis- und datengesteuert zu gestalten. Um dieses Ziel zu erreichen, ist die Aufgabe des Teams, die erforderliche Datengrundlage und FAIR-Datenbestände (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) bereitzustellen, die es den Unternehmen ermöglichen, ihre Entscheidungsfähigkeit zu verbessern. Sie werden Teil des Data-Engineering-Teams, unterstützen dieses bei der Bereitstellung von Datenbeständen und stellen sicher, dass unsere Kunden diese Datenbestände mithilfe einer hochmodernen Datenplattform, die auf der Microsoft-Azure-Cloud basiert, effizient verarbeiten können. Zu den Verantwortlichkeiten des Teams gehört die Bereitstellung von Lösungen, die die Entwicklung von Datenpipelines, Datenmodellierung, Systemkonfiguration, Datenspeicherung, -verarbeitung und -transformation umfassen, wie sie für den Aufbau und Betrieb eines Data Warehouse, eines Data Mart und einer Datenanalyseplattform typisch sind.   IHRE AUFGABEN UND VERANTWORTLICHKEITEN   Sie unterstützen die Data Asset Leads bei der Erstellung von Datenbeständen sowohl für unser Geschäft als auch für unsere IT-Community Sie erstellen und pflegen eine optimale Datenpipeline-Architektur und treiben die Automatisierung voran. Dabei sorgen Sie, wo immer möglich und machbar, aktiv für die Einrichtung der Automatisierung, um die Effizienz und Qualität zu steigern (Umsetzung, Überwachung und Sanierung usw.) Sie stellen große, komplexe Datensätze zusammen, die funktionalen/nicht-funktionalen Geschäftsanforderungen entsprechen, identifizieren, entwerfen und implementieren interne Prozessverbesserungen und optimieren gleichzeitig die Datenbereitstellung und gestalten bei Bedarf die Infrastruktur für eine bessere Skalierbarkeit neu Sie sorgen für eine optimale Extraktion, Transformation und das Laden von Daten aus einer Vielzahl von Datenquellen, darunter SAP- und Nicht-SAP-Systeme Sie arbeiten mit Stakeholdern wie Data Asset Leads sowie Daten- und Designteams zusammen, helfen diesen bei datenbezogenen technischen Problemen und unterstützen ihre Anforderungen an die Infrastruktur für Daten Sie arbeiten mit Daten- und Analyseexperten zusammen und bemühen sich um mehr Funktionalität in unserer Datenplattform Sie bewerten als Entscheidungshelfer (m/w/d) die besten Lösungsmöglichkeiten sowie Vor- und Nachteile und geben Empfehlungen auf Basis Ihrer Erfahrungen ab Sie stellen sicher, dass die Bayer-Architekturprinzipien sowie die Kodierungs- und Compliance-Richtlinien befolgt und eingehalten werden Sie arbeiten nach dem Prinzip des agilen Projekts – Sie kommunizieren regelmäßig Status, Blocker, Chancen und gestalten die Zukunft – und beeinflussen unsere Gesamtdatenstrategie mit Ihrem technischen und Tool-Know-how   WAS SIE MITBRINGEN   Hochschulabschluss im Bereich Informatik oder eine ähnliche Ausbildung bzw. entsprechende Berufserfahrung Sie haben bereits Erfahrung mit der Arbeit in der Azure-Cloud und verfügen über Kenntnis der Services, einschließlich Infrastrukturals Code, Einrichtung von Vnet usw. Sie verfügen über nachweisliche Erfahrung mit Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Snowflake und Azure Data Factory Sie haben bereits Erfahrung mit dem Aufbau von Data Warehouses, Data Marts, RDBMS und SQL Sie haben Erfahrung mit der Erstellung von Datenmodellen und kennen sich mit Data Engineering und Datenarchitekturprinzipienaus Sie verfügen über Fachwissen in Bezug auf die Programmierung in Python oder ähnlichen Programmiersprachen und zugehörigeProgrammierarbeiten; Repositorys wie GitHub, CI/CD-Pipelines usw. Sie haben ein gutes Verständnis der SAP-ERP- und SAP-BW-Systeme Sie verfügen über ausgeprägte mündliche, schriftliche sowie gute zwischenmenschliche Kompetenzen Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift   IHRE BEWERBUNG  Dies ist Ihre Chance, sich mit uns gemeinsam den größten globalen Herausforderungen unserer Zeit zu stellen: die Gesundheit der Menschen zu erhalten, die wachsende Weltbevölkerung zu ernähren und den Klimawandel zu verlangsamen. Sie haben eine Stimme, Ideen und Perspektiven, die wir hören möchten. Denn unser Erfolg beginnt mit Ihnen. Seien Sie dabei!   Bayer begrüßt Bewerbungen aller Menschen ungeachtet von ethnischer Herkunft, nationaler Herkunft, Geschlecht, Alter, körperlichen Merkmalen, sozialer Herkunft, Behinderung, Mitgliedschaft in einer Gewerkschaft, Religion, Familienstand, Schwangerschaft, sexueller Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentität oder einem anderen sachfremden Kriterium nach geltendem Recht. Wir bekennen uns zu dem Grundsatz, alle Bewerberinnen und Bewerber fair zu behandeln und Benachteiligungen zu vermeiden.   Standort:  Leverkusen, St. Louis   Division:  Enabling Functions   Referenzcode:  559912

Title: Junior Software Engineer Java EE (m/w/d)
Description: Sie suchen Aufgaben mit gesellschaftlicher Relevanz? Sie möchten moderne und sichere Systeme für Millionen von Menschen erschaffen? Sie möchten mit uns die deutschen Verwaltungen in die digitale Zukunft führen? In unserer Brancheneinheit Public Sector können Sie in einem multidisziplinären Team Maßstäbe setzen. Abwechslungsreiche und verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben warten auf Sie – in einer Zukunftsbranche, die so schnell wächst wie kaum eine andere. Gute Zusammenarbeit als Team ist uns genauso wichtig wie ein individuelles persönliches Entwicklungskonzept, dessen Gestaltung Sie steuern können.   msg ist eine unabhängige Unternehmensgruppe mit weltweit mehr als 9.000 Mitarbeitenden. Unseren ausgezeichneten Ruf verdanken wir unserem ganzheitlichen Leistungsspektrum aus einfallsreicher strategischer Beratung und intelligenten, nachhaltig wertschöpfenden IT-Lösungen für eine Vielzahl von Branchen.   Das erwartet Sie bei uns   Mitarbeit bei der Digitalisierung der öffentlichen Verwaltung in spannenden, abwechslungsreichen Projekten Durchführung von Analyse, Konzeption, Programmierung, Test und Einführung von Softwaresystemen im Java- /JEE-/ Spring-Umfeld Mitgestaltung von Fach- und IT-Architekturen von Softwaresystemen Abstimmung von Anforderungen und Präsentation von Ergebnissen beim Kunden Unterstützung bei der Beratung unserer Kunden im technologischen Umfeld Java, JEE, Spring-Anwendungen (Client und / oder Server), Oracle und aktuellen Open Source Technologien Perspektivisch Option zur Teilnahme an unseren fachlichen Weiterentwicklungsprogrammen „Next Level: IT-Architektur“ oder „Next Level: Data Science“ „Grow Your Talent“: Methodisch fundierte Angebote u.a. zur Förderung persönlicher Stärken    Das bringen Sie mit   IT-naher (Fach-)Hochschulabschluss oder vergleichbare Ausbildung Idealerweise erste Erfahrungen in Konzeption und Realisierung von Softwaresystemen Kenntnisse in der Softwareentwicklung (Methoden, Datenbanken, Frameworks, Tools, Patterns) sowie ein Grundverständnis von IT-Vorgehensmodellen (V-Modell XT, Scrum o. ä.) Interesse in spannenden und innovativen Projekten die Digitalisierung des öffentlichen Sektors mitzugestalten Sie haben Spaß an kreativer Arbeit im Team und die Bereitschaft zur Mobilität    Das ist unser Angebot  Suchen Sie Abwechslung statt Alltagsroutine? Teamspirit statt starrer Hierarchien? Dann sind Sie bei uns richtig. Wir bieten Ihnen spannende verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben, attraktive Karrierechancen und internationale Perspektiven. Mehr noch: Bei uns finden Sie ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, großzügige Sozialleistungen und ein professionelles, kollegiales Arbeitsklima in einem hochmotivierten Team.

Title: Junior Data Scientist / Data Analyst - Logistik
Description: Die FUNKE Mediengruppe ist eins der größten Medienunternehmen Deutschlands mit Standorten in Berlin, Braunschweig, Erfurt, Essen und Hamburg. Die FUNKE Logistik GmbH ist ein Tochterunternehmen der FUNKE Mediengruppe mit langjährigen Erfahrungen in der Presselogistik. Mit Leidenschaft und Spezialisten-Know-how sind wir für eine pünktliche und zuverlässige Zustellung von etwa 15 Millionen Sendungen pro Woche verantwortlich.  Wenn dein Herz für Daten schlägt, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig!    Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Braunschweig, Erfurt, Essen oder Hamburg suchen wir einen   (Junior) Data Scientist / Data Analyst - Logistik (m/w/d)  Mit flexiblem Dienstort an einem der Standorte und der Option zum mobilen Arbeiten     DEINE AUFGABEN   Du bist Mitglied des Data Teams im Bereich Logistik und gemeinsam verantworten wir dort alles rund um das Thema Data Analytics Gemeinsam denken wir Logistik von Grund auf neu und Daten sind dabei einer unserer wichtigsten Bausteine Ob einfache Analyse, Report oder Modell – du setzt das richtige Mittel für den jeweiligen Zweck ein. Das Ziel verlierst du dabei nicht aus den Augen und leitest konkrete Handlungsempfehlungen aus deinen Analysen ab. Wir haben kniffelige Fragestellungen und du Spaß am Detail – du kannst aber auch „pragmatisch“, wenn die schnelle Lösung gefordert ist.     DEIN PROFIL   Du hast bereits erste Berufserfahrung und begeisterst Dich für Daten und Analysen – aber für die Business-Seite. Entweder bist du bereits Experte in logistischen Prozessen – oder du hast den unbedingten Willen einer zu werden Du beherrschst den direkten Umgang mit Daten mittels SQL und du hast Erfahrung mit mindestens einer Programmiersprache wie Python oder R Du schaust gerne über den Tellerrand und hast idealerweise erste Erfahrungen mit Data Science oder Machine Learning gesammelt Du bist kommunikativ und offen, fokussierst dich auf deine Ziele und hast ein hohes Maß an Eigenantrieb     DEINE BENEFITS   Viel Gestaltungsspielraum: Wir denken Daten gerade neu und du darfst mitgestalten Dynamische Teams, kurze Kommunikationswege, eine offene Feedbackkultur und ein herzliches Miteinander Qualifizierungsangebot mit Workshops und E-Learnings im Rahmen der gruppenweiten FUNKE AKADEMIE Sehr gute Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten in Richtung Data Science & Data Engineering Kooperationen mit verschiedensten Fitnessstudios und spannende Gesundheitsaktionen FUNKE Benefits: Flexible Arbeitszeiten, betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Zuschuss zu (E)-Bike-Leasing, Mitarbeiter-Abos, Freianzeigen sowie Corporate Benefits Portal mit zahlreichen Rabatten

Title: Cloud Engineer Automotive (m/f/d)
Description: Our offer   Exciting mix of cross-industry experience, high learning effects and varied fields of activity from the world of high-tech engineering for the most renowned OEM customers and/or suppliers of powerful industries High level of transparency in career development in an extremely dynamic working environment where there is plenty of scope for advancement and prospects Enthusiasm and passion for engineering and research & development with a great deal of creative freedom, so that today's demanding challenges can become tomorrow's innovative solutions Good work-life balance, flexible working hours, 30 days' holiday, and mobile working by arrangement    Your role   As an experienced and enthusiastic software developer familiar with Hadoop you can help us construct a Big Data Pipeline that serves as infrastructure for future ADAS component qualification You are part of an international team of software developers. The team’s focus in this data-driven project lies on recording, classification, indexing and analysis of the data You are responsible for the ETL-pipeline and a query engine for the efficient search in the Data Lake You work independently but also effectively as part of a team    Your profile   Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field Profound programming skills (Python, Spark) and expert knowledge in Data Pipelines (e.g. Kubernetes, Airflow, Kafka, Docker). Moreover, you have expertise in the domain of Data Lake technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Cloud, HBase, Apache Drill, Hive, Impala, PostgreSQL, Elastic Search) You are familiar with Scrum and agile Methods You are fluent in verbal and written English. German language skills are helpful     WE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU  Do you have any questions about the job profile and/or requirements?  Please get in touch with your contact person in Recruiting.    Capgemini Engineering  Altran Deutschland S.A.S. & Co. KG   Laura Thee  +49 1622341594  laura.thee@capgemini.com    Please fill in our online application formcompletely and attach your CV, work and school certificates as well as any other relevant documents. We wish you every success for your application.    Capgemini Engineering is committed to the employment of a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants are considered regardless of their origin, skin colour, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status or disability.

Title: Trainee IT Project- and Product Management (m/f/d)
Description: Job Description    You just finished your studies as a graduate and are looking for the perfect start for your tech career? You want to be a driving force in one of the fastest growing E-Commerce tech unicorns companies in Europe? You are hands-on and want to take responsibility for tech projects and a massively used product? You want to join a motivated team in an agile and fast environment? You are open for new ideas, other opinions and eager to learn?   Are you ready to become a highly skilled project and product manager? Then you’re the perfect match for our IT Project- and Product Management trainee program!   ABOUT The Program    Gain your project and product management experience at ABOUT YOU and discover what it means to be part of the driving force in a unicorn start-up.   Throughout the 2 year traineeship you will experience working on a variety of IT projects and join 4 different tech teams at ABOUT YOU. This will result in a state of the art foundation of your tech career as you will undergo a specific training program including hands-on experience in Project and Product Management.   Through close cooperation with tech teams such as our Tech Project Management Team, Shop Application Teams, Business Intelligence Team and ABOUT YOU CLOUD Teams, you will quickly build up a large network in the (tech) world of ABOUT YOU and get a 360° insight into Hamburg’s first unicorn.   This will provide the foundation for you to potentially become a project manager or product manager at ABOUT YOU. In advance: the top 5-10% high performers have the option to shorten the 2-year traineeship.   Why ABOUT YOU?  ABOUT YOU is one of the fastest growing eCommerce companies in Europe and Hamburg’s first unicorn company that has launched in 15 different countries. As a fashion and technology corporation, along with our strong international team, our ambition is to digitalise the classic shopping stroll by creating a personalised shopping experience. Besides being a B2C company we also launched our B2B branch as a SaaS company providing our eCommerce infrastructure to other eCommerce players - the ABOUT YOU CLOUD.    Interesting Facts About Us    >75,000 orders per day resulting in 2,5 Billion Euro yearly transaction volume Online Shops in 15 countries developed with 250 Techies from 30 different nationalities based on state of the art technology 15 million active customers per month > 8 million app installations    ABOUT Key Learnings    Learn the key elements of project management processes from scratch e.g. project scoping, steering, risk management and milestone management Gain knowledge how to build successful minimal viable products e.g. client facing frontends, designing UI/UX, A/B testing and data flows in backend systems Work closely with other experienced product managers to learn about e.g. software planning, development processes, quality assurance practices, release management and the software tooling needed to build and maintain a cloud e-commerce platform Understand the main product e-commerce KPIs, main product revenue drivers and customer funnels Join as well our Tech Project Management team and help with structuring and optimising processes for the ABOUT YOU tech teams to establish suitable, fast, lean and agile processes Gain experience in state of the art software tooling e.g. cloud infrastructure, web tracking, project management, development and data management Work in an agile and international teams    ABOUT Requirements    Top graduate in Business Informatics or similar degree program Minimum 6 months of relevant hands-on experience as an intern/working student in project, product management or business related jobs Very good analytical skills with a hands on mentality and creative way of thinking Solution-oriented with direct and clear communication skills Open for new ideas, other opinions and eager to learn Organised and structured way of working Basic knowledge in agile methodologies would be a plus Proficiency in MS Office (especially Excel) Fluent English skills (spoken & written) and German is a plus    ABOUT Benefits    Get career coaching from our Director of Tech Project Management Grow together with one of the fastest growing eCommerce companies in Europe Flexible working times 40% discount on our online shop Fresh fruits + drinks everywhere Language courses (German & English) Free sports courses & reduced price for gym membership Subsidised public transportation ticket Free choice of hardware and operating system (Mac, Windows, Linux) also for private usage State-of-the-art tech stack running on AWS Modern office in the city center of Hamburg International working environment and English as company language Company flats (subject to availability) Agile work environment (MOVE) and cross-functional teams Free access to Germany’s greatest developer conference code.talks Company pension scheme Free Laracasts and Egghead account    You Are The Core Of About You.    We take responsibility for creating an inclusive and exceptional environment where all genders, nationalities and ethnicities feel welcomed and accepted exactly as they are. We believe that a diverse workforce essentially contributes to the ABOUT YOU culture. In order to maintain talent and diversity, we emphasize the care for physical health, mental health and overall well-being. Our values and work ethics essentially contribute to our brand mission: empower acceptance and shape an inclusive, fair and circular fashion culture.   And action!  We are looking forward to receiving your application – preferably via our online application portal! This way we can ensure a faster process and feasibility of easily uploading your application documents. :)

Title: Data Scientist / Analyst (m/f/d) - Remote
Description: Collecting data is one thing, but evaluating it and drawing the right conclusions from it is crucial! At Xentral, we have a lot of data for you to sift through, search for hidden insights and their business implications. We want you to deeply understand what’s going on in our product, marketing and financial data and propose solutions to any inefficiencies you find.   You want to be analyzing which stories our data is telling us?   Apply now and tell us where the breadcrumbs of our data will take us!   Your Tasks   Conduct exploratory analysis and present key findings to stakeholders on all levels Work with your focus departments to create opportunities for data science projects (e.g., churn prediction, uplift model, conversion funnel) and own respective data products within our evolving data mesh Contribute to the development of our reporting environment and data lake Translate complex concepts into implications for the business via excellent communication skills, both verbal and written    Your Profile   Bachelors’ or above in quantitative field: Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field Working experience in a comparable role You approach complex problems in a structured way You must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams and initiatives You can communicate your findings effectively to non-technical staff You are detail-oriented and can quickly shift priorities You thrive in a fast-paced environment and maintain a high level of output quality under time pressure You enjoy working in a team environment You have excellent project management and presentation skills You have experience in analyzing data and automating complex data handling through SQL and Python You are used to working with visualization tools such as Looker or Tableau Strong verbal and written communication skills Nice to have: Experience in working in a fast paced environment. Familiarity with Data Mesh Architecture. Experience in productionalizing machine-learned models     We offer    Remote first!  We grow all over Europe, join us fully remote or in one of our hubs in Augsburg, Amsterdam or Munich. You decide!   Xentral feels like home!  For us Xentral is not just a workplace. We make sure that our team feels at home even during work. We offer flexible working hours and home office.   Unique culture and structure!  We believe in flat hierarchies, short decision-making processes and appreciative communication at eye level.   With us to the very top!  With us there are many career paths and development opportunities for you, what you can't do yet, you can learn with us!   Planning ahead!  For our permanent employees we offer 50% subsidies to your private pension plan.   You have what it takes? Then apply now with your CV or LinkedIn profile.  We look forward to your application!  About Us  We are an established tech startup with major tech investors Frank Thelen, Sequoia Capital and Visionaries Club on our side. We are aiming at defining a new SaaS category and empower entrepreneurs and e-commerce vendors to automate their resource planning and focus on the things that matters most to them: their business. We grow all over Europe, join us fully remote or in one of our hubs in Augsburg, Amsterdam or Munich. You decide!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Job Description    Machine Learning Reply, with its sister company in Italy and over 10.000 employees at Reply globally offers consulting and software implementation services with focus on innovative AI and ML topics like Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Time Series Analysis, Machine Learning Platforms and more.   In our Unit Machine Learning Engineering we currently hire talents with Data Engineering and Cloud know-how who would like to develop not only PoCs but productive machine learning applications or platforms including automatic unit tests and end-to-end tests, automatic deployment pipelines, mechanisms for scaling in the cloud, monitoring solutions and operations support. We call this profile “Machine Learning Engineer”. You should love to see the ML algorithms working for millions of users, devices, sensors, etc., making the world a smarter, safer, more interesting, and/or more efficient place to live.   Tasks:   Developing and driving exciting solutions in the areas of data engineering, analytics and machine learning. Combine expertise in data pipelines and machine learning with innovative thinking to deliver excellent client work. Work together with Data Scientists to develop models for classification, prediction, natural language processing, recommendation, reinforcement learning, deep learning, computer vision and other Data Science-related tasks, including a good data preparation for best model performance. Design ML solution architectures using current technologies (often in the cloud) and discuss them with the client, while being up-to-date with the latest MLOps technologies, processes, and industry standards. Develop innovative use cases in cooperation with our customers and then implement them with the help of our experienced experts. Present your results with communication skills and verve. In an international team, you will work closely with executives from digital business and IT areas, making new contacts as you go along. You always keep an eye on optimisation and help our clients to utilise and profit from their inactive data resources. Be part of the Reply community, join communities of practice, participate in hackathons and use all the learning resources available.   What we offer you:   Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc.)   Very active group social program - including conference funding, team building, group events, Reply Exchange Recognition for Innovation to foster your personal development   Work in an open, flat environment, within a broad Reply knowledge sharing network (more than 90 autonomous Reply groups across 8 countries)   Office space in downtown Munich with access to Stammstrecke Training and certification encouraged Home-office contracts State of the art work equipment   Award winning office spaces for an excellent work experience   Public transport ticket within Munich Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice   (r)    Requirements    Technical Qualification   You want to take off after successfully completing your Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in informatics, business informatics, mathematics, statistics or equivalent field of study. Depending on your seniority, you have 1+ years of work experience experience in industry or consulting and developed systems that are in production You have cloud know-how with one or more of the major cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) and big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka..) You have experience developing data-intensive applications like Data Warehouses, Data Lakes and/or Data Platforms, using batch or real time data integration. You have experience with Python, SQL, and/or, Java You have a basic understanding of Machine Learning algorithms and/or processes related to the Model Development Lifecycle, and want to learn more. For example in the areas of computer vision, reinforcement learning or natural language processing.   Non-Technical Qualification   You have a high level of customer orientation and excellent communication skills. You are willing to travel. You are fluent in English and have at least intermediate proficiency (B1) in German (willing to improve).   Nice to Have   You have experience in DevOps, especially Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (e. g. Gitlab CI, Jenkins). Experience with Front-end Web Development Technologies like HTML, CSS, Django, Vue.js would be a plus. Experience with modern ML and DL frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and Keras.
