Title: R&D Engineer IT & Electronics (f/m/d)
Description: At Hitachi Energy our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation  In this position you will be part of an intercultural team and work as Electrical R&D Engineer (f/m/d) in a global organization on monitoring of high voltage switchgear and components. Your tasks are very diversified, such as test of measurement systems in electronics lab as well as in field but also software and prototype development and technical discussions with suppliers. We are looking for technically experienced and motivated team players with intercultural competence. If your working style is structured, creative, responsible, flexible and level-headed, we are looking forward to your application!   Your responsibilities   Contribute to the continuous development of Hitachi Energy monitoring solutions in an international team Create new ideas in a team-based environment and apply agile development methodology Development of software components including test automation and hardware-in-the-loop tests Test and installation of measurement systems in electronics lab as well as in field Failure analysis and product support Soft- and hardware maintenance activities for existing system and development of prototypes Technical discussions with suppliers and customers   Your background   Master degree in computer science, electrical engineer or similar At least two years' experience in development of complex industrial hard- and software, ideally with agile methodology Experience in object-oriented programming (e.g. Python, C#) Experience in working with electronic devices and in an electronics lab English and German language skills Willingness to travel up to 20% (domestic and international) Knowledge in signal and data analysis, algorithms, statistics   More about us   Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader that is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We serve customers in the utility, industry and infrastructure sectors with innovative solutions and services across the value chain. Together with customers and partners, we pioneer technologies and enable the digital transformation required to accelerate the energy transition towards a carbon-neutral future. We are advancing the world’s energy system to become more sustainable, flexible and secure whilst balancing social, environmental and economic value. Hitachi Energy has a proven track record and unparalleled installed base in more than 140 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ around 38,000 people in 90 countries and generate business volumes of approximately $10 billion USD. www.hitachienergy.com Interested in joining our team? If so, we look forward to receiving your full application (motivation letter, CV, references) only via our online careers tool. Hitachi Energy Germany AG Jil Nörber Talent Acquisition   Publication date   2022-03-09   Reference Number   DE52793932_E1

Title: Junior Software Engineer Java EE (m/w/d)
Description: Sie suchen Aufgaben mit gesellschaftlicher Relevanz? Sie möchten moderne und sichere Systeme für Millionen von Menschen erschaffen? Sie möchten mit uns die deutschen Verwaltungen in die digitale Zukunft führen? In unserer Brancheneinheit Public Sector können Sie in einem multidisziplinären Team Maßstäbe setzen. Abwechslungsreiche und verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben warten auf Sie – in einer Zukunftsbranche, die so schnell wächst wie kaum eine andere. Gute Zusammenarbeit als Team ist uns genauso wichtig wie ein individuelles persönliches Entwicklungskonzept, dessen Gestaltung Sie steuern können.   msg ist eine unabhängige Unternehmensgruppe mit weltweit mehr als 9.000 Mitarbeitenden. Unseren ausgezeichneten Ruf verdanken wir unserem ganzheitlichen Leistungsspektrum aus einfallsreicher strategischer Beratung und intelligenten, nachhaltig wertschöpfenden IT-Lösungen für eine Vielzahl von Branchen.   Das erwartet Sie bei uns   Mitarbeit bei der Digitalisierung der öffentlichen Verwaltung in spannenden, abwechslungsreichen Projekten Durchführung von Analyse, Konzeption, Programmierung, Test und Einführung von Softwaresystemen im Java- /JEE-/ Spring-Umfeld Mitgestaltung von Fach- und IT-Architekturen von Softwaresystemen Abstimmung von Anforderungen und Präsentation von Ergebnissen beim Kunden Unterstützung bei der Beratung unserer Kunden im technologischen Umfeld Java, JEE, Spring-Anwendungen (Client und / oder Server), Oracle und aktuellen Open Source Technologien Perspektivisch Option zur Teilnahme an unseren fachlichen Weiterentwicklungsprogrammen „Next Level: IT-Architektur“ oder „Next Level: Data Science“ „Grow Your Talent“: Methodisch fundierte Angebote u.a. zur Förderung persönlicher Stärken    Das bringen Sie mit   IT-naher (Fach-)Hochschulabschluss oder vergleichbare Ausbildung Idealerweise erste Erfahrungen in Konzeption und Realisierung von Softwaresystemen Kenntnisse in der Softwareentwicklung (Methoden, Datenbanken, Frameworks, Tools, Patterns) sowie ein Grundverständnis von IT-Vorgehensmodellen (V-Modell XT, Scrum o. ä.) Interesse in spannenden und innovativen Projekten die Digitalisierung des öffentlichen Sektors mitzugestalten Sie haben Spaß an kreativer Arbeit im Team und die Bereitschaft zur Mobilität    Das ist unser Angebot  Suchen Sie Abwechslung statt Alltagsroutine? Teamspirit statt starrer Hierarchien? Dann sind Sie bei uns richtig. Wir bieten Ihnen spannende verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben, attraktive Karrierechancen und internationale Perspektiven. Mehr noch: Bei uns finden Sie ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, großzügige Sozialleistungen und ein professionelles, kollegiales Arbeitsklima in einem hochmotivierten Team.

Title: Software Developer - ksqlDB Full Stack [Remote - Germany]
Description: Confluent is pioneering a fundamentally new category of data infrastructure focused on data in motion. Have you ever found a new favourite series on Netflix, picked up groceries curbside at Walmart, or paid for something using Square? That’s the power of data in motion in action—giving organisations instant access to the massive amounts of data that is constantly flowing throughout their business. At Confluent, we’re building the foundational platform for this new paradigm of data infrastructure. Our cloud-native offering is designed to be the intelligent connective tissue enabling real-time data, from multiple sources, to constantly stream across the organisation. With Confluent, organisations can create a central nervous system to innovate and win in a digital-first world.   We’re looking for self-motivated team members who crave a challenge and feel energised to roll up their sleeves and help realise Confluent’s enormous potential. Chart your own path and take healthy risks as we solve big problems together. We value having diverse teams and want you to grow as we grow—whether you’re just starting out in your career or managing a large team, you’ll be amazed at the magnitude of your impact.    About The Team    We are looking for strong full stack developers to help us build out an elastic, scalable, efficient, SQL-based, stream processing technology which operates both on-premises and in the Cloud. You can learn more about what we do by visiting ksqldb.io, or reading some of our recent posts on improving the availability guarantees of our distributed, stateful, systems. The ideal applicant has backend + infrastructure chops, but is also interested in building engaging and insightful products for managing and visualizing large scale distributed real-time data streams. Data flow is central to how companies operate and we aim to make that experience intuitive and attractive. As a full stack software developer, you will be responsible for creating new visualizations and interfaces that can scale with Apache Kafka.    About Our Stack    Multiple SPAs written in React over a common codebase using Yarn Workspaces Code verification done with comprehensive linting, type checking and unit + e2e tests Deployments happen daily with the ability to test each and every commit in production (even PRs) Feature flags unblock us from coordinating releases with backend teams Java + Go backend, deployed on Kubernetes Bots keep all of our dependencies up to date    What You Will Do    Designing and implementing new stream processing operators, including making extensions to the SQL language to incorporate streaming concepts Improving the performance, scalability, and elasticity of core stream processing technology like Kafka Streams Designing solutions to improve the efficiency, reliability, and operability of our distributed, stateful, data processing systems in public clouds Building novel solutions to enable efficient and scalable querying of state materialized from real time event streams Interacting with the Apache Kafka and the ksqlDB communities to provide technical guidance and thought leadership in the stream processing space    What We’re Looking For    Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar field or equivalent Strong fundamentals in distributed systems design and development Experience building and operating large-scale systems Solid understanding of basic systems operations (disk, network, operating systems, etc) A self starter with the ability to work effectively in teams Proficiency in Java or C/ C++ Experience building client-side web applications for data-intensive applications Excellent understanding of modern JavaScript, typing in JS, HTML5, and CSS Experience with React/Flux (or equivalent), modern JavaScript tooling/Webpack/Babel Strong foundation in algorithms and application design Experience with writing/monitoring/managing large scale system deployments Experience decomposing large, monolithic code bases    What Gives You An Edge    Experience in open-source development Experience using Apache Kafka is a big plus Interest in evangelism (giving talks at tech conferences, writing blog posts evangelising Kafka) Experience working on stream processing technology or query processing systems   Come As You Are  At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact.   Click here to review our California Candidate Privacy Notice  , which describes how and when Confluent, Inc., and its group companies, collects, uses, and shares certain personal information of California job applicants and prospective employees.

Title: Junior Business Analyst (d/m/w)
Description: Im Auftrag unseres Kunden aus dem Bereich Cyber Security mit Sitz im Osten Münchens suchen wir derzeit exklusiv einen Junior Business Analysten (d/m/w)in Vollzeit. Es handelt sich hierbei um eine unbefristete Festanstellung.   Ihre Aufgaben:     Entwicklung einer zielgerichteten Strategie und geeigneter Strukturen für Data Management and -Governance Analyse finanzrelevanter Daten und Entwicklung von Berichten, Dashboards und Datenmodellen zu Analysezwecken Vorstellung und Interpretation der Ergebnisse inkl. Erarbeitung von Handlungsempfehlungen Verbesserung der Qualtität, Inhalte und der Aussagekraft der erhobenen Daten für die verschiedenen Bereiche des Unternehmens Kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung der Erhebungsmethoden, der Visualisierung von Ergebnissen und Verbesserung von Prozessen der Datenlieferung und -gewinnung Umsetzung und Weiterentwicklung von Vorgaben zum Data Management und -Governance unter Berücksichtigung der Anforderungen von Informationssicherheit und Datenschutz Integration der Datensicht bei Einführung neuer Software Fachanwendungen Bei fachlicher Eignung: Pflege und Aufbau von Datacubes in Controllinganwendungen   Ihr Profil:     Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium (Mathematik, Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Betriebswirtschaft oder vergleichbare Studiengänge, gerne mit Schwerpunkt Controlling, Statistik, Datenmanagement oder Data Analytics) Mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung auf dem Gebiet Business Intelligence/ Data Management/ Data Analytics Verständnis für wirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge sowie hohe Zahlen-, IT- und BI-Affinität Strukturiertes eigenständiges Denken und ausgeprägte Analyse und Visualisierungsfähigkeiten Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Datenmodellierung,und Datenvisualisierung Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office Lösungsorientierung, Kommunikationsstärke, Flexibilität und Teamfähigkeit Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse (mindestens C1) und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift   Ihre Vorteile:     Umfangreiche Einarbeitung durch erfahrene Kollegen, ein tolles Team und Wertschätzung auf allen Ebenen Spannende Perspektiven in einem Unternehmen mit stabilem Kerngeschäft und großem Wachstumspotential Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit zu mobilem Arbeiten im Home Office (2 - 3 Tage in der Woche) Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie durch eine betriebliche Kindertagesstätte und eine Kinderferienbetreuung sowie Unterstützung im Bereich Kindernotbetreuung Ein Unternehmen, das die Hunde der Mitarbeiter willkommen heißt Individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten Firmenevents, vergünstigte Nutzung von Sport- und Gesundheitseinrichtungen sowie Obst und Getränke Betriebliche Altersversorgung Erstattung der ÖPNV-Fahrkarte, Förderung der E-Ladestation bei Ihnen zu Hause, sowie verschiedene Jobrad-Modelle   Ihre Ansprechpartnerin:    Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung (ohne Anschreiben). Bei Rückfragen steht Ihnen Frau Magdalena Dreisow unter der Telefonnummer +49 (0) 176 7588 3984 jederzeit sehr gerne zur Verfügung.

Title: Product Engineer (m/f/d) Semiconductor
Description: Looking for an exciting and permanent job offering a wide variety of different assignments? As a member of an interdisciplinary team, you will work on future-orientated projects in various high-tech sectors.   Your tasks   Responsible for the data analysis of production lots and root-cause finding of production problems in a very interdisciplinary team Develop data analysis algorithms and tools together with the software development team and analyse data from production processes of semiconductor wafers Support the design teams in making their designs less susceptible to production problems and in finding defect wafers in production Perform component verification activities in the lab in order to reproduce different electrical failure modes Furthermore, develop the interface to other statistical software modules and create dashboards and metric displays Additionally, work in an international scrum environment and deliver innovative results under tight timeline constraints and technical difficulties   Your profile   Successfully completed Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science, Electronics, Mathematics or comparable degree Deep understanding of semiconductor front end manufacturing processes like lithography, sewing, clean room activities, etc. Hands on work in the lab with electrical testing equipment in order to do failure verification Professional experience with R using ggplot2, data.table etc. and competences with the usage of Rshiny, Rmarkdown or similar Familiar with statistical methods and basic knowledge of machine learning algorithms, preferably experience with production data on component/product level Experience with databases based on NoSQL Skills in web-frontend development (HTML5, CSS, PHP, etc.) would be an advantage    Our Benefits    Flat hierarchies State-of-the-art IT equipment and office supplies Individual continuous training options through the "ALTEN Trainings Center" digital learning platform Company pension and supplementary health insurance Special leave in exceptional circumstances Exclusive employee discounts Free beverages in our premises Corporate events, such as summer and Christmas parties   Are you looking for interesting tasks and a permanent employment contract? Submit your application via email today to career@de.alten.com or fill in an application online at: https://www.alten-germany.de/jobs/

Title: Werkstudent Data Engineer (all genders)
Description: UPLIFT Y  OUR FUTURE   Wir sind 10.000. An 16 Standorten weltweit. Jedes dritte Flugzeug fliegt mit unserer Technologie.   Immer effizienter, leiser, nachhaltiger. Wir gestalten die Zukunft der Luftfahrt. Was wir noch brauchen? Sie.  Unser Team in München  sucht Sie:   Werkstudent Data Engineer (all genders)  Wir liefern Produkte und verantworten Querschnittsaufgaben für die MTU in den Disziplinen Aero Solutions, Business Development/Flugzeuganalyse, Digitalisierung und Wartungs-kostenmanagement. MCI bringt Menschen und Wissen zusammen, reduziert Komplexität, bietet attraktive Lösungen und schafft Perspektiven. Hierbei setzen wir den Fokus auf die Steigerung der Effizienz und die Verbesserung der Profitabilität. Wir entwickeln Mitarbeiter:innen, fördern Kreativität, Flexibilität, Eigenverantwortung und die offene Kommunikation. Wir begegnen uns auf Augenhöhe, wertschätzend und haben Spaß an dem, was wir tun.     STARKE AUFGABEN  Ausarbeitung neuer Data Engineering Anwendungsfälle aus Strategie, Finanz und Markt:   Aufbau von Datenbanken, die Strukturierung der Daten im Rahmen der Datenmodellierung und die Visualisierung der Daten in Employee Self Service Tools Erstellung eines Datengenerierungsprozesses und das verantwortliche Durchführen des Preprocessing zur Erzeugung einer hohen Datenqualität u.a. mit KNIME, Python oder R Erstellung von Datenbank- und Tooldokumentationen in Confluence Datenanalyse und Aufbereitung der Daten in Tableau Mitarbeit in einem agilen Scrum-Team    BESTE VORAUSSETZUNGEN   Studium im Bereich Mathematik, Informatik, Statistik, Physik oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung Programmiererfahrung in R oder Python und SQL-Kenntnisse erforderlich Strukturiertes und analytisches Denkvermögen, sowie Eigenständiges Arbeiten    Startdatum: ab sofort   AUSGEZEICHNETES UMFELD   Praxiseinblicke in die innovative & zukunftsweisende Luftfahrtbranche Verantwortungsvolle und interessante Aufgaben sowie Teamspirit Persönlicher Ansprechpartner und individuelle Betreuung Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Freizeitausgleich Netzwerkangebote    STARTKLAR?  Dann geben Sie Ihrer Bewerbung Schub und schicken Sie uns Ihre Unterlagen (Lebenslauf, Notenübersicht der Hochschule, Schulabschlusszeugnis sowie eine aktuelle Immatrikulation) online. Gleich jetzt, gleich hier.   Wir freuen uns auf Sie!

Title: Data/Analytics Engineer (m/f/x)
Description: We encourage and welcome ALL people to apply!  Do you want to make a real difference in the healthcare industry while applying your skills in an open, flexible, and fun environment? Join MEDWING!   We’re now looking for a Data/Analytics Engineer to help us manage and further develop our data pipelines and ELT processes.   Your Role in our Team   Being in charge of developing the data pipeline infrastructure and creating more robust ELT processes Improving MEDWING’s Data Model Helping the team implement modern techniques and best practices in Data and Analytics Engineering Developing MEDWING's Airflow infrastructure and increasing its range of use Working on improving or replacing Xplenty, the ELT software currently used by MEDWING Participating in daily stand ups, weekly team plannings and stakeholder meetings    Your Profile   You hold a degree, preferably a Masters- in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics, or have equivalent experience in computing/data analysis related areas Several years of full professional experience as a Data or Analytics Engineer Exceptional analytical thinking skills with a data driven approach Flexibility with taking on a wide range of tasks independently Excellent communication skills in English. German is a plus!    Your Benefits   Be part of a great team to find the solution to one of the biggest problems in our society – the shortage of healthcare workers in an aging society An open and colorful corporate culture with many international colleagues 26 vacation days per year, plus an additional day for each year with MEDWING – up to 30 days MEDWING Flex: With our office policy you can work up to 60 days from our offices across Europe (e.g. Berlin, London, Paris, Munich, Hamburg) The best of both worlds: We are an office-led, but remote-friendly company, aiming at roughly 50% remote work, 50% in the office (could be less or much more – whatever works for you!) Relocation assistance to move to Berlin with visa application and accommodation support Be mobile & travel sustainably to work: You have the option for a Swapfiets membership or a subsidized monthly public transportation ticket MEDWING Academy: Develop yourself further with our Learning & Development program (online language courses with Lingoda, free Udemy accounts) Exercise with our personal trainer several times a week Bright and dog-friendly office with large roof terrace and optimal transport connections in Berlin-Mitte Legendary team and company events, discounts at external partners, delicious Fairtrade coffee, various cold drinks, and fresh organic fruit for free    About MEDWING  MEDWING is building a digital career platform for all healthcare professionals. Our technology provides the perfect match between job searcher preferences and employer requirements - both for permanent positions, as well as for flexible assignments on a per shift basis. By making working in healthcare more attractive, we help solve the global shortage of healthcare professionals. We are a startup with a team of over 300 top-tier entrepreneurs, consultants, and engineers across Germany, France and the UK, and are rapidly becoming the go-to destination for working in healthcare across Europe.   As a team, we get along great with each other, both on a professional and a personal level. We care for ourselves, our company, and most of all for the lives and livelihood of healthcare workers. All reasons why this year MEDWING is ranked amongst the top 75 most innovative companies in Germany according to Handelsblatt, and in VCBay´s top 10 German healthcare startups!   More insights about MEDWING can be found here: https://team.medwing.com/   #Togetherwecare  - As an equal opportunities employer, we value diversity in age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or cognitive ability, family status and ethnicity. Our goal is to keep working towards breaking down barriers and making our opportunities accessible to everybody. We consistently work to ensure a culture in which people feel respected, accepted and valued at all times. Discrimination or harassment of any kind will not be tolerated. To ensure all this, we have an inhouse DEI team that is continuously working on improvements and critically examining actions!   Contact  Lily Day   Junior Tech Recruiting Manager   T +49 157 359 97 588   M lily.day@medwing.com   W www.medwing.com

Title: Cloud Software Engineer (m/f/d) // Remote
Description: Venture Team  Our Venture Team Loady is developing a new industry platform that will become a reliable standard of loading and unloading requirements. It will improve relationships along the supply chain network and efficiency in logistics processes. The venture is looking for a Cloud Software Engineer to join the growing development team. You get the opportunity to become part of a high-performance startup team that works with enthusiasm and great professionalism in developing a new, world-wide unique partner platform.   You will work in an agile team with latest cloud-native technologies to build modern, scalable and high-quality solutions for our customers. Our team has an end-to-end responsibility for the system, including system design and architecture, writing code with high standards, hosting the services in the Azure cloud, monitoring services, measuring quality, and guaranteeing service reliability and security. There is plenty of space for your own ideas to provide the best user experience.   Passion for our idea and commitment, experience in cloud software development or backend development, and high motivation for continuous learning is essential in this role.   Your role   Be part of an agile DevOps team with end-to-end responsibility along the complete product lifecycle Design and develop cloud solutions and backend services Create technical concepts and solutions according to business requirements Implement and integrate APIs for external systems Collaboratively work with frontend engineers to define APIs and data models Take responsibility for high code quality and long-term maintainable software Ensure high product reliability, stability, scalability and security Implement CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) solutions Drive automation, e.g., testing, monitoring and deployments    Your offer   Remote work - based in Germany 3yrs+ proven work experience as a Cloud Software Engineer, Backend Engineer or similar role Several years of experience in software development, ideally with .NET/C# Experience with designing and developing scalable cloud-based solutions, ideally with Microsoft Azure Experience with API development and integration Experience with implementing CI/CD pipelines, ideally with Azure DevOps Experience with relational and NoSQL databases Experience with unit testing and testing frameworks General understanding of data protection, data security and governance Experience in working within an agile environment Experience in a DevOps Team with end-to-end responsibility for the entire product lifecycle Bachelor or Master of Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Business Informatics, or similar Self-organization, team collaboration, agile mindset, problem solving, positive attitude and high motivation Good communication skills in English and German    What You Can Expect From Us   Become part of a great team and enabler of an emerging business supported by the business incubator CHEMOVATOR of a leading chemical company Exciting challenges in a dynamic market environment A highly motivated and open-minded team Attractive working environment Competitive salary  Join the founding team of an early venture idea with plenty of space for your own ideas.   Apply for this position   About Us  Chemovator is the business incubator of BASF. We provide a protected space to build commercial ventures from unconventional ideas. Our Venture Teams take full ownership of their idea, creatively explore their business, learn fast and pivot beyond corporate boundaries.

Title: Analytics Engineer - Forecasting & Data
Description: We are looking for an engineer with backend experience interested in quantitative modelling. You will be part of a small but growing team of data scientists and analytics engineers that specialise in the development of forecasting models and datasets to support the understanding of the Spotify Freemium business. As part of the job, you will drive the architecture of the forecast service to enable data scientists across the company to leverage our models and insights. This is an impactful role where you will be a key person influencing the direction of the technical architecture and roadmap of the team, which currently uses a combination of BigQuery, Scio (a Scala API for Apache Beam) and Python running on Google Cloud Platform.   What You'll Do   Own the work of evolving and improving the architecture of the team’s in-house Python based forecasting system Deploy and operate the forecast service that you develop on GCP Help craft and promote sound engineering practices, like continuous delivery and automated testing within the team Explore and develop scalable solutions to facilitate business performance tracking and business modelling connected with the forecast    Who You Are   Work experience running data intensive services in production, preferably with exposure to Python Have an understanding of JS concepts and web architecture patterns Worked in a team with both Engineers and Data Scientists Proficient in SQL based databases, ideally with a familiarity of cloud-based data warehousing solutions such as BigQuery Value team collaboration and seek to grow the skills and knowledge of your peers    Where You'll Be   We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them! Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the EMEA region in which we have a work location Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here. Working hours? We operate within the Central European time zone for collaboration We ask that our team members be located within Greenwich Mean time zone, Central European time zone, or Eastern European standard time zone for the purposes of our collaboration hours    Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.   Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.    Global COVID and Vaccination Disclosure    Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.

Title: R&D Engineer Deep Learning (m/w/d)
Description: Are you looking for your next big adventure? Are you eager to work in a highly motivated team of experts in machine learning and deep neural networks? Do you enjoy the challenge of completing projects to a high standard? Then join our team! As R&D Engineer, you will develop cutting-edge computer-vision software for driver-monitoring and vehicle-interior monitoring that are deployed by international automotive manufacturers.  Tasks   At least a Master's degree in Computer Science with a strong focus on Machine Learning. Deep understanding of machine-learning methods. Excellent problem solving and analytical skills. Experience with relevant scientific software packages (Python, TensorFlow, Caffe,…). Strong software engineering skills for prototypic development and implementation of experimental setups. Programming skills in Python and C++. Excellent communication skills in English. German residency or existing work permit for Germany are essential.    Requirements    Flexible working hours; Exciting and responsible tasks at the cutting edge of technology; Open corporate culture, flat hierarchies in a young and international team; Modern office at S-Bhf. Tiergarten (Charlottenburg).   Interested? Then send us your CV including salary expectations and possible starting date at the given e-mail address.

Title: Full-Stack Developer* in Köln und Remote
Location: Cologne Bonn Region, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany
Description: X-INTEGRATE unterstützt Unternehmen in der Erschließung neuer Geschäftschancen durch integrierte, automatisierte und optimierte Prozesse. Als Spezialist für digitalisierte Prozesse und Entscheidungsunterstützung beraten wir unsere Kunden auf Basis datengetriebener und etablierter Methodiken der Data und Process Science. Auf dieser Grundlage implementieren wir auf unsere Kunden passgenau zugeschnittene Lösungen mit Hilfe offener Standards, Open Source und kommerzieller Middleware. Damit lösen wir Schnittstellenprobleme, schaffen flexible, optimierte und automatisierte Prozessanwendungen und verbessern mittels mathematischer und kognitiver Verfahren die Entscheidungsprozesse unserer Kunden – On-Premise, in der Cloud oder in hybriden Szenarien.   X-INTEGRATE ist Teil der TIMETOACT GROUP. Die Unternehmensgruppe umfasst neun Unternehmen mit knapp 700 Mitarbeitenden an 16 Standorten und bietet Beratungsleistungen und IT-Lösungen auf Basis von IBM Software und offener Standards an.   Aufgaben   Du unterstützt unsere Kunden in herausfordernden und komplexen Softwareentwicklungsprojekten zur Prozessautomatisierung und -optimierung, sowohl in der Front-End als auch in der Back-End Entwicklung Du erarbeitest in interdisziplinären Teams innovative Softwarelösungen, die für unsere Kunden einen signifikanten Mehrwert im Kontext der digitalen Transformationen liefern und die Wettbewerbsfähigkeit erhöhen   Qualifikation   Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation Praktische Entwicklungserfahrung bei der Durchführung von Projekten im Webtechnologie-Stack Fundierte Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Frontend- und Backend-Entwicklungstechnologien, Web2.0 Technologien, Entity Framework, TypeScript oder JavaScript Kenntnisse in Webapplikationsframeworks, wie Angular, Blazor oder React Erfahrung mit den Prinzipien von DevOps, insbesondere im Umfeld gitlab Erfahrungen im Erstellen und Optimieren von automatisierten Build-Pipelines (CI / CD) Engagierter Teamplayer mit hohem Verantwortungsbewusstsein Erfahrungen in agilen Entwicklungsmethodiken Fließende Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse Kunden- und Dienstleistungsorientierung Reisebereitschaft    Benefits    Abwechslungsreiche und anspruchsvolle Kundenprojekte sowie agile Strukturen Arbeiten an "state of the art"-Lösungen Leistungsorientiertes Gehaltsmodell sowie ein kollegiales Arbeitsklima Erfahrungsaustausch, Teamarbeit und persönliche Weiterentwicklung bzw. Weiterbildung Flexible Arbeitsbedingungen mit Gleitzeit und Homeoffice Kunden aus dem gehobenen Mittelstand bis hin zu internationalen Konzerne Moderne Ausstattung, Firmen-Notebook und -Handy sowie Jobticket Regelmäßige Mitarbeiterevents, Sportangebote und kostenfreie Getränke Möglichkeit Deinen Einsatzort innerhalb der DACH-Region frei und flexibel mitzubestimmen   Interesse? Dann bewirb Dich jetzt direkt online - wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung unter Angabe Deines frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins und Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung!   Geschlecht, Herkunft, sexuelle Orientierung, Alter und religiöse Ausrichtung spielen bei uns keine Rolle – wichtig sind uns stattdessen die Passung im Team, gegenseitiger Respekt, Wertschätzung, sowie Deine Motivation und Spaß an der Arbeit.

Title: Junior Software Engineer Java EE (m/w/d)
Description: Sie suchen Aufgaben mit gesellschaftlicher Relevanz? Sie möchten moderne und sichere Systeme für Millionen von Menschen erschaffen? Sie möchten mit uns die deutschen Verwaltungen in die digitale Zukunft führen? In unserer Brancheneinheit Public Sector können Sie in einem multidisziplinären Team Maßstäbe setzen. Abwechslungsreiche und verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben warten auf Sie – in einer Zukunftsbranche, die so schnell wächst wie kaum eine andere. Gute Zusammenarbeit als Team ist uns genauso wichtig wie ein individuelles persönliches Entwicklungskonzept, dessen Gestaltung Sie steuern können.   msg ist eine unabhängige Unternehmensgruppe mit weltweit mehr als 9.000 Mitarbeitenden. Unseren ausgezeichneten Ruf verdanken wir unserem ganzheitlichen Leistungsspektrum aus einfallsreicher strategischer Beratung und intelligenten, nachhaltig wertschöpfenden IT-Lösungen für eine Vielzahl von Branchen.   Das erwartet Sie bei uns   Mitarbeit bei der Digitalisierung der öffentlichen Verwaltung in spannenden, abwechslungsreichen Projekten Durchführung von Analyse, Konzeption, Programmierung, Test und Einführung von Softwaresystemen im Java- /JEE-/ Spring-Umfeld Mitgestaltung von Fach- und IT-Architekturen von Softwaresystemen Abstimmung von Anforderungen und Präsentation von Ergebnissen beim Kunden Unterstützung bei der Beratung unserer Kunden im technologischen Umfeld Java, JEE, Spring-Anwendungen (Client und / oder Server), Oracle und aktuellen Open Source Technologien Perspektivisch Option zur Teilnahme an unseren fachlichen Weiterentwicklungsprogrammen „Next Level: IT-Architektur“ oder „Next Level: Data Science“ „Grow Your Talent“: Methodisch fundierte Angebote u.a. zur Förderung persönlicher Stärken    Das bringen Sie mit   IT-naher (Fach-)Hochschulabschluss oder vergleichbare Ausbildung Idealerweise erste Erfahrungen in Konzeption und Realisierung von Softwaresystemen Kenntnisse in der Softwareentwicklung (Methoden, Datenbanken, Frameworks, Tools, Patterns) sowie ein Grundverständnis von IT-Vorgehensmodellen (V-Modell XT, Scrum o. ä.) Interesse in spannenden und innovativen Projekten die Digitalisierung des öffentlichen Sektors mitzugestalten Sie haben Spaß an kreativer Arbeit im Team und die Bereitschaft zur Mobilität    Das ist unser Angebot  Suchen Sie Abwechslung statt Alltagsroutine? Teamspirit statt starrer Hierarchien? Dann sind Sie bei uns richtig. Wir bieten Ihnen spannende verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben, attraktive Karrierechancen und internationale Perspektiven. Mehr noch: Bei uns finden Sie ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, großzügige Sozialleistungen und ein professionelles, kollegiales Arbeitsklima in einem hochmotivierten Team.

Title: Researcher (m/w/d) for the development of innovative web applications for data management
Description: Are you looking for the ideal career start or change into research and development to advance the digitalization of public administration? A renowned employer that builds bridges between science and business sounds interesting to you? Then please read on!    The Fraunhofer Institute for Open Communication Systems (FOKUS) is located in Berlin-Charlottenburg and offers R&D services for the development of seamless, personalisable communication systems. With our clients, we work through all stages of the innovation process - from the initial idea, through research and development in projects, to prototype development, implementation and pilot operation.    For our projects in the areas of digital administration, digital government and public IT, we are looking for team-oriented researchers (m/w/d)who want to progress the digitalization and modernization of governments and public administrations. We offer you an exciting opportunity to work on innovative web applications for data management.     What you will do    We are an interdisciplinary team, helping governments and public administrations to solve some of their biggest challenges in IT and data. You can expect to work on projects that are practically relevant for our clients, address often publicly debated policy issues and add value to society at large. As a team, we offer you a professional and collaborative research environment where you can bring in your own research ideas and set your own priorities. We work in an agile framework, allowing us to reconcile the delivery of client projects with flexible working hours.    Your responsibilities:     Contributing to and managing individual tasks in (sub-)national and international IT research and consulting projects for the digital transformation of governments and public administrations. Developing technical solutions for data platforms, open data, big data and smart cities. Supporting the conception and implementation of functional architectures and/or software architectures. Contributing to the preparation of scientific studies in the subject areas of public IT, smart cities, digital government.    Through our projects, you will also have the opportunity to further expand your skills in one or several of the following topics:     Agile software development Semantic Web / Linked Data Open Data Smart City Data governance Big Data Blockchain / Distributed Ledger Technologies Knowledge in the area of digital government or in the digitalization of public administration     What you bring to the table    Essential requirements:     Degree (Master’s or Diploma) in computer science, mathematics, physics, business informatics, administrative informatics, or a related area. Experience in developing distributed systems in Java. Ability to communicate and translate technical topics to various audiences, particularly to (internal) developer colleagues, clients, and other non-technical audiences. Good knowledge of software architecture design methods. A creative, collaborative self-starter. Good analytical and conceptual thinking paired with a structured way of getting things done. Very good knowledge of German and English.    Knowledge in some of the following areas is advantageous, but not mandatory:     MicroServices and their provision via containers. Container platforms, e.g. OpenShift, AWS. Open Data, Semantic Web, Linked Data. Development in JavaScript, e.g. vue.js. Development in Kotlin or Python.     What you can expect     Space for both independent work and creative co-design with colleagues and partners. An open, collaborative and interdisciplinary team. A modern working environment with up-to-date equipment. Ongoing personal and professional development, among other things through a wide range of professional training offers. Flexibility to work part time and/or remotely. Support in reconciling family and work, e.g. through an on-site co-child office and specific offers from our service partners PME Familienservice and Voiio. Company pension scheme (VBL).    The weekly working time is 39 hours. This is a fixed-term contract with a duration of two years.    We value and promote the diversity of our employees' skills and therefore welcome all applications - regardless of age, gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion, ideology, disability, sexual orientation and identity. Severely disabled persons are given preference in the event of equal suitability. Appointment, remuneration and social security benefits based on the public-sector collective wage agreement (TVöD).    With its focus on developing key technologies that are vital for the future and enabling the commercial utilization of this work by business and industry, Fraunhofer plays a central role in the innovation process. As a pioneer and catalyst for groundbreaking developments and scientific excellence, Fraunhofer helps shape society now and in the future.     Interested? Apply online now. We look forward to getting to know you!     Would you like to learn more about our projects? Check here:    https://www.fokus.fraunhofer.de/en/dps/projects     Questions according to this position will be answered by:    Herr Dr. Jens Klessmann  Phone: +49 30 3463 - 7285  Fraunhofer-Institut für Offene Kommunikationssysteme FOKUS  www.fokus.fraunhofer.de     For questions about the application process please contact:    Frau Melanie Hennemann  Phone: +49 30 3463 - 7101  E-Mail: recruiting@fraunhofer.fokus.de     Reference number: 37962   Application deadline: 30.06.2022

Title: Trainee Data (AI / Big Data Analytics / Data Management) (all genders)
Description: Du willst dich in nur sechs Wochen zum/zur gefragten Data-Spezialist:in entwickeln? Mit einem Traineeprogramm, das so nah an der Praxis ist, dass du dein Know-how sofort anwenden kannst – und das auf intensives Lernen durch Spezialist:innen in kleinen Gruppen setzt? Das ist genau dein Ding?   Dann lebe deine Leidenschaft in einer Position, in der du als Data Engineer namhafte Unternehmen rund ums Thema Applied Intelligence berätst.   Das erwartet dich  Unser sechswöchiges Traineeprogramm bereitet dich systematisch auf deine Karriere als Berater:in im Bereich Applied Intelligence und damit auf deinen Einsatz in anspruchsvollen Kundenprojekten vor.  Du lernst, auf was es bei der Projektvorbereitung ankommt, schärfst deine Softskills und machst dich mit agilen Projektmethoden vertraut. Dazu vermitteln wir dir die Grundlagen kommender Data-Warehousing- und Analytics-Architekturen.  Im Anschluss lernst du die Tools und Technologien eines Data Engineers kennen. Abhängig von der aktuellen Marktentwicklung und technologischen Trends folgt eine Vertiefung in nachfolgende Module: Introduction to Big Data Management (Analytics, Machine Learning & AI); Data Integration; ETL & Streaming Technologies; Data Warehousing; Cloud Hyperscaler (GCP, AWS, Azure); Python Programming; Version Control Systems (Git) and CI/CD; Intelligent Automation/RPA; Process Mining; Agile Methodology & Scrum  Nach deinem erfolgreichen Programmabschluss erhältst du einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag und wirst Teil eines funktionsübergreifenden Teams.  Darauf freuen wir uns   Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder Naturwissenschaften bzw. eine solide IT-Ausbildung  Erste Kenntnisse in der Programmierung mit Python, Java, Scala und C++/C#), in der Programmierung von Datenbanken (SQL), in relationalen Datenbanken und Systemen sowie in der Datenintegration  Sehr gute analytisch-konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten, eine hohe Lernbereitschaft und Begeisterung für innovative Technologien  Kommunikations- und Präsentationssicherheit in sehr gutem Deutsch und Englisch  Dein Kontakt  Du hast Fragen? Dann wende dich an unser Recruiting Team per E-Mail an recruiting_germany@accenture.com oder telefonisch unter 00800 45045045.   Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung.

Title: Application Support Engineer, MATLAB & Simulink (m/f/d)
Description: Job Summary    MathWorks has a hybrid work model that enables staff members to split their time between office and home. The hybrid model provides the advantage of having both in-person time with colleagues and flexible at-home life optimizations. Learn More: https://www.mathworks.com/company/jobs/resources/hybrid-model.html.   As an Application Support Engineer (f/m/d) based in our Ismaning office (München area) you will help our customers solving complex technical issues related to MATLAB, Simulink and our entire suite of products. The list of applications includes Data Analytics, Machine Learning, Internet of Things, Model-Based Design, Advanced Driver Assistance Systems, Physical Modeling, Embedded Code Generation and Rapid Prototyping. As an entry level engineer, this role will help you identify and develop your technical, professional, and personal skills for a successful career at MathWorks. In short, it is a combination of practical experience and formal training in an international work environment that fosters and rewards cooperation, teamwork, learning, and fun.   MathWorks nurtures growth, appreciates diversity, encourages initiative, values teamwork, shares success, and rewards excellence.    Responsibilities    You will support our German speaking customers to be successful in using MATLAB, Simulink and our entire suite of products. As part of this, you will be resolving in-depth and complex customer reported issues in a wide area of domains, applications, industries - including latest technology trends. Key to success is collaboration and teamwork with other engineers, specialists and domain experts in the global MathWorks organization. In addition to your technical and troubleshooting skills, an important aspect of this role is communication with internal and external parties. Your direct contact with customers will be very valuable for providing user feedback to our Development organization. You will contribute to the continuous improvement of our products by sharing these use cases with Product Development teams. Understanding how our customers are using MATLAB and Simulink will give you a strong foundation in our business and technologies enabling you to grow your career within MathWorks.    Qualifications    A bachelor's degree and 3 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree, or equivalent experience) is required.    Additional Qualifications    This position requires a passion for continuous learning and professional development, so you must be very motivated and love to learn. MathWorks has a passion for lifelong learning and career growth. We also require:   Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science or related programs Experience of working with MATLAB and at least one other programming language (C/C++, Python, Java, JavaScript) Excellent German and English language skills are required (written and verbal) on at least C1 level or equivalent

Title: Product Engineer 3D Reality Mapping (m/f/d)
Description: Are you passionate about spatial data processing? Do you enjoy contributing to software development? Are you an investigative character — someone that truly wants to understand the mechanics through data analysis striving for constant improvement? Are you passionate about user experience and translating customers’ needs into technical requirements? Your eye for detail empowers user success through testing and structured validation? You enjoy training people personally and in written form by making complex topics simple to understand?   If you are excited about 3D reality capture and models and you enjoy working in a diverse, fun, caring, and progressive environment, join us in our mission of developing the leading photogrammetry software worldwide! You will work with an innovative team to provide a solution that allows users to unlock the full value of 3D surface data.   Tasks   Collaborate in a team to create industry-leading software for 3D reconstruction from images and lidar, scene understanding as well as visualization solutions Contribute to the long-term product and short-term development roadmaps Analyze, test, release, and support our products to enhance overall product quality Use your analytical and problem-solving skills to improve development, integration, and deployment workflows Manage bugs found through in-house testing as well as those reported by customers Contribute to development by pushing the limits of the software with creative workflows and evaluate and analyze data to empower future product development Create compelling product examples, blogs, articles, documentation, and tutorials to showcase new features Establish and define customer requirements; translate them into potential product improvements and new software designs Prepare and present demonstrations, talks, and workshops for international conferences Shape a product directly for a growing community of reality capture users    Requirements    2+ years of professional industry experience with relevant technology such as geospatial applications Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills Passion for quality and detail Know how to break software by finding bugs Drive to get to the bottom of complex projects involving real-world data – always striving for sustainable solutions Bachelor’s in the engineering field – preferably geomatics engineering, computer science, or related Existing work authorization for Germany    Recommended Qualifications    Knowledge of software development (C++, C#, Java, Python, etc.) Expertise in efficient handling of spatial data including automation with scripting Familiarity with 3D modeling Familiarity with GIS applications and technologies, ideally ArcGIS    Benefits    High profile team that is driven by the pursuit of excellent results Active ambition to become a technology leader in 3D reconstruction technology Passionate and supportive working culture Flat hierarchies Emphasis on team and personal growth through training and team development events Strong focus on company culture: appreciative, compassionate communication, enabling and embracing diversity Well-appointed office environment and equipment in the center of Stuttgart Part of Esri, a global organization based in California focused on GIS and spatial analytics to enable global change Attractive compensation and benefits like public transport, leased e-bikes, and fitness   We are an international team of young, engaged individuals who love to create professional photogrammetry software, turning cutting-edge research into value for our customers. Embracing a high diversity of skills and cultures, curiosity and an urge for excellence drive us. Municipalities and leading companies of the mapping industry use our unique technology for countrywide data production. We have built a strong reputation in the market—for us, this is just the beginning. Facing an evolving market and many fascinating challenges in technology, we need your expertise to help us get to the next level.   The Esri R&D Center-Stuttgart develops the software technology SURE, which is used worldwide to reconstruct 3D surface models from images and lidar. As one of the leading solutions in this domain, it focuses on high accuracy and large-scale applications like aerial mapping of entire cities and countries. The resulting data empowers various applications in areas like smart cities, infrastructure, 5G planning, change detection, environment monitoring, cadaster mapping, or VR.   In our software development, we implement recent research from Photogrammetry, Computer Vision, and Machine learning into reality capture software. Our development language for the SURE engine is usually cross-platform C++ (CPU as well as GPU)— as scalability and performance are important in our engineering work to be able to process massive datasets efficiently on workstations, computing clusters, or cloud infrastructures.

Title: Software Engineer (m/f/d) - Lidar
Description: Are you ready to shape the future of the vehicle? Revolutionize the experience of autonomous and networked driving with us and become a part of our VALEO R&D team!  Valeo's LiDAR organisation is embarking on an exciting journey. It makes automotive mobility a reality and ensures an entirely new level of safety on the road. We produce and develop cutting-edge technology on an international stage, shaping the future of the automobile.  At our Bietigheim-Bissingen  site, we successfully develop innovative products that reinvent driving comfort and safety. To drive our growth and further development, we are looking for you to join our team.    These Challenges Await You    Implement and evaluate post-processing algorithms in software and embedded systems Develop data visualization of 2D, 3D data including mapping (SLAM) Software verification and testing   Are you ready for it?   University degree or equivalent in computer science, electrical engineering, physics, or equivalent In-depth knowledge of C++, Phyton, C In-depth knowledge of (GUI) programming for Linux and Windows OS Understanding of data transport protocols for Ethernet, serial link interfaces    To Stand Out From The Crowd    Experience in using Matlab Familiarity with ADAS sensor technology such as LiDAR, Camara, RADAR, USS Experience with development in the ROS environment Experience in 2D or 3D mapping, SLAM   Revolutionize the future of the automobile with us!  Thanks to our innovation-driven strategy, we at Valeo are at the heart of the three revolutions that are transforming the automotive sector: Electrification, autonomous and networked vehicles and digital mobility. We offer excellent career opportunities and the chance to shape these revolutionary developments, including internationally.   Are you looking for new technological and personal challenges?Then come to us!You want to know more?  Lendita ALIJAJ  Tel: +49 (0) 176 3000 1465   Due to data protection reasons, please submit your application documents only online via the career portal on our website www.valeo.de.   More information on https://www.valeo.com.  Primary Location  HCC2-DE-Baden Wurttemberg   Job  Research and Development   Organization  G02E Lidar DE Bietigheim-Wemding   Schedule  Full-time   Shift  Day Job   Employee Status  Regular   Job Type  Regular   Job Posting  23/06/2022, 12:21:13 PM

Title: Specialist Application Engineer (*)
Description: Job Description  Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World  Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with 93,000 other curious, creative 3Mers.   “A long-lasting career at 3M comes from having vision, imagination and the ability to see what doesn’t exist. 3Mers are groundbreaking innovators and it’s important that we give every person the space for disruptive and creative thinking.” – John Banovetz, executive vice president, chief technology officer and environmental responsibility at 3M  We are looking for an Application Engineer with experience in automated grinding processes to help commercialize new products and adapt existing products to customer needs. The position will support different product platforms as well as applications and therefore requires a broad technical knowledge as well as the ability to work with people from different functions and regions. The ideal candidate is a passionate individual who aspires to bring relevant products to market, enjoys working with different technologies in different applications and takes pride in completing projects successfully.   The Impact You’ll Make in this Role  Here, You Will Make An Impact By  As an Application Engineer  (*)  located in Neuss, Germany for Abrasive Systems Division, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.    Identifying the best 3M Abrasive solution for an application by thoroughly understanding the customer need, testing, and analyzing results. Communicate results to customers through written reports and presentations. Providing launch support for new product programs by generating supporting documentation, demonstration tools, videos, and training. Building a deep understanding of customer needs and competition in assigned market focused areas and provide feedback to R&D and business functions of new product ideas and competitive analysis. Support specification process to grow sales and launch of new products/applications focusing on Robotic/automated applications within the Abrasive Portfolio. Willingness to provide significant support for ASD EMEA Robotics applications with initial focus on EMEA Transportation and Industrial Machinery accounts both internal and external.    Your Skills And Expertise  To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:    Possess a bachelor’s degree or higher in Mechanical or Electro-Mechanical from an accredited institution. Minimum of 3 years industrial robotics, automation, tooling, and power tools experience for Abrasive industry. Minimum of 3 years customer field service experience preferable in abrasive industries. Fluent in German and English others welcome Willingness for travel within EMEA    Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include    Proven track record of learning and adapting to new technology Ability to work independently and efficiently to meet deadlines Self-motivated, detail-oriented and organized Strong leadership, networking, and problem-solving skills Candidate should have a "hands on, self-starter" orientation to their work, have broad interests and willingness to explore new areas Basic understanding of one or more programming languages Experience with MS Office, CRM and preferable databases, data analysis, and data visualization    Supporting Your Well-being  Fair, performance-oriented and competitive payment is fundamental for 3M. To be attractive to the best talents, we regularly monitor the standards in the market. In addition, depending on the position and location, a wide range of social benefits is offered - including, for instance, additional payments such as vacation pay, a company pension and benefits under collective agreements and non-tariff agreements. A good work-life balance is the best basis for motivated employees, therefore flexibility has been part of our DNA since the beginning. We want your job suits best to your life situation - not the other way around! Depending on the position and possibilities, we offer individual, flexible work models.   Travel:  May include up to 50% international   (*) At 3M, diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.   Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.   3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement    Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.   Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

Title: Data Engineer – Python (f/m/d)
Description: Modoplus is the AI-powered cloud platform for identifying and developing real estate potential. We work with complex geodata that is interpreted and visualized in a cloud-based infrastructure. Our team consists of borderless thinkers and makers, working together to produce one-of-a-kind digital solutions and experiences. We´re on this rocket ship together! Do you want to be part of our exciting journey?   Your mission  The data team is responsible for the strategic analysis, conception and implementation of a scalable data and analysis infrastructure for Modoplus.   We are looking for a Data Engineer to build up complex scalable data pipelines and keep our custom tools and database up to date. As one of our first Data Engineers, you will shape the future of Modoplus with your colleagues.   You will be working hands-on and in close collaboration with developers, product designers and domain experts. As a member of the Data Team, you will be responsible for different aspects of our platform, including analytics, machine learning modeling, tooling, microservices and more.   Aufgaben   Working closely with leadership, engineers, product owners and data scientists to understand data needs. Design, build and launch extremely efficient and reliable data pipelines to move data across several platforms including data warehouses, online caches and real-time systems. Communicate, at scale, through multiple mediums: Presentations, dashboards, company-wide datasets, bots and more. Educate your colleagues: Use your data and analytics experience to ‘see what’s missing’, identifying and addressing gaps in their existing logging and processes. Leverage data and business principles to solve large-scale web, mobile and data infrastructure problems. Build data expertise and own data quality for your areas.   Qualifikation   Minimum Qualifications    Strong Python development skills. Experience with geospatial data (vector and raster) and services (WMS/WFS) in data intensive software using streaming, resource-efficient design principles Experience with (Postgre)SQL. PostGIS and MongoDB knowledge is preferred. Experience with Data Modelling. Experience in ETL design, implementation and maintenance. Experience analyzing data to discover opportunities and address gaps.    Preferred Qualifications    Experience with more than one coding language. Python is priority. Experience with Geospatial Information Systems (GIS) and WebGIS frameworks such as MapBox Experience processing both vector and raster data formats such as GeoJson, GML, GeoTiff, PNG, JPG and others. Experience designing and developing scalable REST APIs, preferably with Fast API Framework Experience with designing and implementing real-time pipelines. A keen eye for data quality and validation. Experience with SQL performance tuning and E2E process optimization Experience with anomaly/outlier detection.    Benefits    You have the opportunity to take Modoplus to the next level together with us. Assumption of responsibility from day 1 and a great deal of creative freedom Culture of trust with regard to working hours, place of work and vacation times Well-funded company, competitive salary   Please provide a CV, work samples and references from previous employers. To apply for this role please apply here. We are looking forward to getting in touch.

Title: Junior Software Engineer Java EE (m/w/d)
Description: Sie suchen Aufgaben mit gesellschaftlicher Relevanz? Sie möchten moderne und sichere Systeme für Millionen von Menschen erschaffen? Sie möchten mit uns die deutschen Verwaltungen in die digitale Zukunft führen? In unserer Brancheneinheit Public Sector können Sie in einem multidisziplinären Team Maßstäbe setzen. Abwechslungsreiche und verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben warten auf Sie – in einer Zukunftsbranche, die so schnell wächst wie kaum eine andere. Title: Hydroinformatics Engineer (m/f/d), Germany, Remote
Description: Description    Xylem |ˈzīləm|   The tissue in plants that brings water upward from the roots; A leading global water technology company.   Xylem is a leading global water technology company with over 16.000 employees dedicated to solving the world’s most challenging water issues. We are a global provider of efficient, innovative and sustainable water technologies improving the way water is used, managed, conserved and re-used. Our international team is unified in a common purpose: creating advanced technology and other trusted solutions to solve the world’s water challenges. We are committed to creating an organization of inclusion and diversity, where everyone feels involved, respected, valued and connected, and where everyone is free to bring their authentic selves and ideas.    Job Summary    A Hydroinformatics Engineer (m/f/d) is a multidisciplinary engineer with optimization and modeling skills and a passion for using data to improve urban watershed environmental and social impact. This position is focused on development and implementation of algorithms and analytics for operational optimization of water and wastewater systems. The primary focus will be on Treatment System Optimization, which is a Xylem platform that optimize the operation of Wastewater Treatment Plants, with the application of Artificial Intelligence by means of Machine Learning models and Optimization techniques.   Location: Germany, Remote / Homeoffice    Essential Duties/Principal Responsibilities    Frequent use and application of basic technical standards, principals, theories, concepts and techniques in the field of data analytics, optimization and process control engineering Provide support and answer business questions to clients and other Xylem teams Deploy and maintain reusable models for standard and special project with supervision Able to write technical reports and prepare deliverable documents Mentor Associate Engineer by training them the mechanics of models and standard workflows Develop and manage large datasets. Communicate summaries and conclusions drawn from data in clear and concise ways, visually and verbally. Translate data analytics into language understood by water resource engineers and data analysts, both in the practitioner and research space   Qualifications: Education, Experience, Skills, Abilities, License/Certification:   Undergraduate degree in Engineering or related field, preference given to those with Master’s or PhD degrees 2-5+ years of experience of inter-disciplinary research or project work with multiple different engineering or science disciplines Experience in water related projects is a plus Fluent in German and English Knowledgeable of software languages such as Python, R, C++, Matlab Knowledgeable of data filtering process, such as anomaly detection Knowledgeable of data-driven models, such as machine learning Knowledgeable of optimization process, such as genetic algorithms Familiar with databases (InfluxDB, PostgreSQL, …) is a plus Familiar with hydraulic models of wastewater networks or treatment systems is a plus Excellent written and communication skills   We Offer You More Than Just “A Job”   Professional Development – To advance the capabilities of our people, we offer a wide variety of experiences to support our employees’ professional growth and continuous learning. Total Rewards – We offer comprehensive programs for compensation, benefits, recognition, learning and development, work-life integration and corporate citizenship. Watermark – Watermark is our corporate social responsibility program working to provide education and access to safe water to ensure healthy lives, gender equality, and resilient communities. Employees have the opportunity to learn and volunteer on various water-related projects. Employee Networks – Our Employee Networks provide a professional, supportive network for employees from diverse backgrounds, including Women’s, LGBT+ and Allies, Veteran’s, People of Color and Allies, Emerging Leaders, and Working Parents Networks.   For questions regarding this opportunity, please reach out to Niklas Naunheim, Corporate Recruiter at +49 1621374371.   We are looking forward to your application!   Xylem is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Software Developer C++ (m/f/d)
Description: Überblick  As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker covers a broad spectrum of advanced solutions in all fields of research and development. Driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years now, all our systems and instruments are designed to improve the safety of products, accelerate time-to-market and support industries in successfully enhancing the quality of life. Today, worldwide more than 7,200 employees are working on this permanent challenge, at over 70 locations on all continents.   Our product SCiLS Lab is an internationally successful software for visualization and analysis of mass spectrometry imaging data. To strengthen the SCiLS Lab development team we are looking for a Software Developer C++ (m/f/d).   We offer a diversified job in an agile, interdisciplinary team with flat hierarchies and short decision processes. As a software developer, you will strengthen the leading position of the SCiLS Lab software, closely interacting with product management and the rest of the development team.   In our software development, we rely on current technologies and agile development processes, giving you room for independent and creative action. We offer you a secure, unlimited employment relationship in an international group with flexible working hours and a wide range of benefits.   Aufgaben/Verantwortlichkeiten   As part of our software development team, you contribute to the development and implementation of innovative workflow solutions, as well as of image processing, data analysis and visualization features. Together with the whole development team, you are responsible for implementing these methods into the SCiLS software, maintaining our high standards of robustness, performance, stability, and code maintainability. Your range of tasks covers the entire software development chain, including prototypical pre-development, software architecture and implementation, as well as UI design and quality assurance.   Qualifikationen   You have a degree in computer science, mathematical data science, industrial mathematics, bioinformatics or comparable knowledge and skills. You have sound knowledge in software development using programming languages C++, Python, and/or R. Ideally, you have experience in developing user interfaces using QT. Experience with GPU based visualization and data processing is a significant plus. A background in mass spectrometry, proteomics or metabolomics is a great benefit You are familiar with the agile software development process, as well as with professional software development tools (e.g. version control system, issue tracking, build system, automated testing). You are characterized by high quality standards, as well as creativity, perseverance and a structured, systematic working method. You show a high level of social competence and enjoy actively contributing to your team. You have a good command of English.

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Developer / Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Die TUI Cruises GmbH  sucht zum nächst möglichen Zeitpunkt am Standort Hamburg einen   Junior Business Intelligence Developer / Engineer (m/w/d)  WAS DICH ERWARTET   Ansprechpartner/in für Fragen rund um den Bereich Business Intelligence Betreuung unseres Datawarehouse-Systems Mitgestaltung der DWH-Architektur Erstellung und Optimierung von SQL-Skripten und ETL-Prozessen Entwicklung von Berichten/Reports und Betreuung der Auswertungssysteme Aufbereitung der Anforderungen aus den Fachkonzepten    WONACH WIR SUCHEN   Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, BWL oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung Erste Erfahrung in SQL-Programmierung Erfahrungen mit dem Microsoft SQL-Server wären wünschenswert Bereitschaft zur Aneignung neuer Themen, z.B. Cloud oder Programmierung Erfahrung in der Kommunikation mit den Anwendern und im Prozessengineering Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse Analytisches Denkvermögen Teamfähigkeit    WORAU DU DICH FREUEN KANNST   Ein modern eingerichteter Arbeitsplatz in zentraler Lage, nur eine „Seemeile“ vom Hauptbahnhof entfernt Eine zeitgemäße Führungs- und Unternehmenskultur Regelmäßige Feedback- und Entwicklungsgespräche zur gezielten Förderung Deiner Stärken und beruflichen Laufbahn Eine marktgerechte Vergütung mit Erfolgsbeteiligung, eine flexible Arbeitszeitkultur sowie den „PME-Familienservice“ als starken Partner an Deiner Seite Umfangreiche Sozial- und Gesundheitsleistungen (30 Tage Urlaub p.a., Essensgutscheine, ÖPNV-Zuschuss, vergünstigte Kreuzfahrten, Eltern-Kind-Büro, eigenes Fitnessstudio, interne Yoga-Kurse, Rückenschule, Massage u.v.m.)    Bei jedem Schritt behalten wir den Gast im Fokus! Möchtest Du diese Extrameile mit uns gehen?  Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung – ungeachtet deines Alters, Geschlechts, deiner Nationalität, ethnischen Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, sexuellen Orientierung und/oder Behinderung.   Bitte bewerbe dich mit deiner aussagekräftigen und vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf, Zeugnisse/Zertifikate) ausschließlich online.   Hast du Fragen zu TUI Cruises und/oder unserem Bewerbungsprozess? Auf unserer Karriereseite findest du umfassende Informationen und FAQ. Oder schreibe uns eine E-Mail an hr@tuicruises.com. Wir antworten dir schnellstmöglich zurück.   Auf deine Bewerbung freut sich

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description: Our mission is to empower businesses to make data-driven decisions faster and more effortless than ever before. Therefore, we are building an advanced analytics platform to reason why key performance indicators (KPIs) change.   We believe that causality holds the key to unlocking next level decision making. This means that the application of modern scientific research in this field is essential to our success.   Join our venture as Machine Learning Engineer  and impact how companies make data-driven decisions. In this role, you'll work directly with our CTO to model Kausa’s core: the algorithm. Get the chance to shape a young technology startup from its earliest days on through your efforts, experience, and industry expertise.   Our company is being built at Merantix, a Venture Studio focussing on artificial intelligence. This means that we are part of a very active AI community and have a rich ecosystem to support us on our path into the future.   Tasks  As Machine Learning Engineer your main responsibilities are the following:   Engineer state-of-the-art models such as recommender systems, unsupervised classification, or Bayesian networks for causal inference. Collaborate closely with our Chief Technology Officer to develop algorithms and robust statistical models that power our advanced analytics platform; Take responsibility for data and model versioning, manage the experiments and deploy models to production; Give input to the marketing team to create awesome technical content; As we value ownership and collaboration, you support and mentor your colleagues and review the team’s technical design, code, and documentation.    Requirements    Ph.D. in Maths, Physics, or Machine Learning, ideally expertise in the field of causal inference 2+ years industry experience 1+ year numerical programming experience in C++, Rust, Java, Scala, or Python machine learning experience in theory and implementation of state-of-the-art algorithms    Benefits    We invest in your personal growth  - learning & development budget will help you on your career path   We believe in trust and ownership  - flexible working hours, flat hierarchies as well as regular feedback are part of it   We live our values  - a dynamic, diverse and very motivated team which support and mentor each other   We promote our culture  - regular team events and intensive exchange with all Merantix companies   We offer a strong base  and 100% remote work  - it's your choice whether you prefer to work at our office at the heart of Berlin or somewhere else in Europe   There are many roads leading up to being an Software Engineer. Our team is already a mix of self-taught and formally educated people. Don’t self-select out!
