Title: Digital Graduate Program (m/f/d)
Description: Marsh McLennan GmbH is seeking candidates for the following position based in the Düsseldorf office:   Digital Graduate Program (m/f/d)  We at #MarshDigital in Continental Europe are looking forward to teaming up with you - as the digital minds of today - to shape the world of tomorrow. We offer an amazing opportunity to take part in the transformation of Marsh‘s digital capabilities while unleashing the power of industry leading platforms and data assets to deliver innovative products and disruptive business models globally. The team in Continental Europe works closely with the #MarshDigital Headquarter in Phoenix to drive the digital journey jointly with local colleagues across the region.   We are looking for talented graduates to join us. In your role you will support #MarshDigital in Continental Europe and have the opportunity to drive own projects across the region forward. If you are looking for an opportunity to be part of an exciting, global team of intrapreneurs with the mission to disrupt and deliver the art of the possible in the insurance industry, come join us in Germany, Düsseldorf and Frankfurt!   What can you expect?   Working within an international, agile team with low hierarchy that aims to reshape how digital, data, insurance and risk management can drive the future Open-minded, fun colleagues and environment Deep dives into digital transformation, data and analytics, innovation and labs, technology and as well as core business and industry practices such as Marsh Risk Consulting, Sales, Placement, etc. Take on responsibility from day one with opportunity to drive your own projects forward Your journey of growth and acceleration that includes technical training moments that will be alternated with on-the-job training sessions, pairing with constant coaching of your mentor Meetings with senior leaders and their teams Establishing an international network (internal / external)   What is in it for you?   The opportunity to make the difference developing your career in the world’s largest insurance broker and drive its digital journey forward Attractive benefits coverage, outstanding learning programs, mentoring opportunities, working in an international organization with the best and brightest people and colleagues A company with a strong brand and strong results to match    We Will Count On You To    Understand the risk and insurance industry and rethink how digitalization and use of data could reshape Support and drive digital change and digital learning initiatives across the region, leveraging global insights, resources (across MMC) and colleagues Prepare and take part in strategic meetings and assist with market research and stakeholder needs research and thought leadership Support our communities of digital practices on latest developments in emerging technologies and digital transformation Have a passion for identifying how emerging technologies can improve the customer experience and drive value in the insurance and risk industry To work closely with regional and local colleagues across Continental Europe Work with start-up partners, universities, insurance or tech companies to support Marsh Digital initiatives Support client facing technology development and client integration esp. on User Interface/User Experience Support in internal and external innovation happenings such as hackathons, start-up events Have fun and make change happen    What You Need To Bring    Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree (preferable in Economics, Management, Computer Science, business informatics, technology, Data Science, Mathematics or closely related topic) A plus would be knowledge and/or practical experience in either digital, innovation, risk or insurance management Advanced level of English and further European languages is a plus    What We Value    Open-minded, outgoing, positive personality with a high level of intellectual curiosity Structured way of working and project management skillset Creative spirit with the passion to challenge the status quo to drive cultural transformation Excellent communication skills and experience using social media channels a plus A plus could be knowledge of emerging technologies, programming languages or other BI tools   If you don`t meet all criteria but are passionate about the job,  apply !  Questions?  Marianna Balthes, Graduate Recruiter   Marianna.balthes@marsh.com   Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC) is the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. The Company’s 76,000 colleagues advise clients in 130 countries. With annual revenue over $17 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses. Marsh advises individual and commercial clients of all sizes on insurance broking and innovative risk management solutions. Guy Carpenter develops advanced risk, reinsurance and capital strategies that help clients grow profitably and pursue emerging opportunities. Mercer delivers advice and technology-driven solutions that help organizations redefine the world of work, reshape retirement and investment outcomes, and unlock health and wellbeing for a changing workforce. Oliver Wyman serves as a critical strategic, economic and brand advisor to private sector and governmental clients. For more information, visit mmc.com, follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter or subscribe to BRINK.  We embrace a culture that celebrates and promotes the many backgrounds, heritages and perspectives of our colleagues and clients regardless of their gender expression or identity, marital or civil partnership status, ethnic origin, nationality, age, background, disability, sexual orientation or beliefs. We are proud of our inclusive culture where everyone feels empowered to bring their whole selves to work and thrive. Learn more about our foundational values, mission and vision for the future by reviewing our  Greater Good Policy  .   R_120441

Title: Game Designer (f/m/d) - Hamburg/Berlin/Bangalore/Remote
Description: We are looking for a skilled and passionate Game Designer who will support our partner studios in building fun and high-retention mobile games.  Sunday is a young and successful startup that develops, publishes and markets hyper-casual mobile games. Our international team of around 30 developers, artists, game designers, marketers and publishing managers reaches an audience of millions of players every day. Our goal is to become one of the leading mobile game companies worldwide within the next years.   We receive immense support to achieve this goal through the AppLike Group. Our sister companies justDice and adjoe provide us with cutting edge marketing and advertising technology. Our growth is secured by a substantial investment from Bertelsmann, one of the biggest media companies worldwide.   If you like to challenge yourself and want to work in a high-performance environment, send us your application!  Tasks   You will analyze the market for upcoming trends and ideate new games by combining addictive game mechanics with smart monetization You will create clear and crisp game design documents that communicate your vision to the development studio You will iterate on prototypes until you found a well-balanced gameplay that sticks and delivers great KPIs You will help with level design by providing a concise framework and examples for best practices You will help adding depth and content to the game to optimize for long-term retention You will push the game towards a quick release by using an MVP approach and applying the 80/20 rule You will optimize Retention and ARPU by balancing gameplay and monetization based on data analysis and A/B tests    Requirements    You have at least 2 years of experience in game design, preferably in the hyper-casual space You are highly analytical and find simple, creative solutions to complex problems You are very empathetic and love working with different people from around the world You are very passionate about your work. If there is a problem, you are eager to take responsibility and solve it hands-on    Benefits    Work-Life Package: 2 remote days / week, 30 days vacation, flexible hours, kick-ass office in the center of the city, dog-friendly Relocation Package: Visa & legal support, relocation bonus, free german class in the office Happy Belly Package: Company & team lunches, breakfast, tons of free snacks and drinks Physical & Mental Health Package: Gym membership, Yoga classes Activity Package: Regular team events, hackathons, company trips Education Package: 1500€ Budget on top to visit conferences + online training opportunities   Skip writing cover letters. Tell us about your most passionate personal project, your desired salary and your earliest possible start date. We are looking forward to your application!   We celebrate diversity and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Title: Algorithmenentwickler (m/w/d)
Description: Bei ALTEN können Sie alles weiterentwickeln – vor allem sich selbst!   Wir sind weltweit einer der führenden Entwicklungsdienstleister in Schlüsselbranchen. Unsere Mitarbeiter stellen dabei unseren Erfolgsfaktor dar. Sind Sie bereit für spannende Projekte, bei denen Sie durch Ihr technisches Know-how punkten können? Dann verstärken Sie unser Team!   Ihre Aufgaben   Aufbau, Implementierung, Weiterentwicklung und Pflege von Algorithmen für hochauflösende Kamerasysteme (z.B.2/3D Lidar, dGPS, IMU o.ä.) Entwicklung der Algorithmus-Architektur und des Algorithmus-Designs zur Auswertung von Sensordaten Unterstützung bei der Definition von Testszenarien, Testdurchführung und Dokumentation der Testergebnisse Visualisierung und Auswertung technischer Referenz- und Sensordaten   Ihr Profil   Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Computervisualistik, Physik, Mathematik, Maschinenbau, Elektrotechnik oder vergleichbare Fachrichtung Erste Kenntnisse in der Algorithmenentwicklung für klassische Fahrerassistenzsysteme (ADAS) / automatisiertes Fahren oder vergleichbare Erfahrungen aus verwandten Bereichen (Robotik, Umfeldwahrnehmung und Sensordatenverarbeitung) Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung sicherheitskritischer Systeme im Automotive Bereich (ASPICE, ISO26262) und standardisierten Entwicklungsprozessen für embedded Software Kenntnisse in der Entwicklung eingebetteter Systeme in C/C++ oder Python Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse    Unsere Benefits    Remote Arbeit möglich Flache Hierarchien und Duz-Kultur Modernes IT-Equipment und Büroausstattung Individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten durch die digitale Lernplattform „ALTEN Trainings Center“ Betriebliche Altersvorsorge sowie Krankenzusatzversicherung Fahrtkosten- und Steuerberatungszuschuss Sonderurlaub bei außergewöhnlichen Ereignissen Exklusive Mitarbeiterrabatte Kostenfreie Getränke an unseren Standorten Corporate Events wie Sommerfest und Weihnachtsfeier   Sie sind auf der Suche nach interessanten Aufgaben und einem unbefristeten Arbeitsverhältnis? Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt über unser Online-Bewerbungsformular.

Title: Software Engineer - Query Processing
Description: There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.   We’re hiring talented Software Engineers to join the Snowflake Query Processing team! This position is part of our engineering team to evolve our elastic, large scale, high-performance query processing system. We need smart engineers who can pick up and understand complex technical areas quickly – and who are enthusiastic about building new technologies! The official language for this office will be English.   AS A SOFTWARE ENGINEER AT SNOWFLAKE, YOU WILL:   Design, develop, and support a petabyte-scale cloud database that is highly parallel and fault-tolerant. Build high-quality and highly reliable software to meet the needs of some of the largest companies on the planet. Analyze and understand performance and scalability bottlenecks in the system and solve them. Pinpoint problems, instrument relevant components as needed, and ultimately implement solutions. Design and implement novel query optimization or distributed data processing algorithms which allow Snowflake to provide industry leading data warehousing capabilities. Design and implement the new service architecture required to enable the Snowflake Data Cloud Develop tools for improving our customers' insights into their workloads.    OUR IDEAL SOFTWARE ENGINEER WILL HAVE:   2+ years industry experience working on commercial or open-source software. Fluency in Java or C++. Familiarity with development in a Linux environment. Excellent problem solving skills, and strong CS fundamentals including data structures, algorithms, and distributed systems. Systems programming skills including multi-threading, concurrency, etc. Experience with implementation testing, debugging and documentation. Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field; Masters or PhD preferred. Ability to work on-site in our San Mateo / Bellevue / Berlin office.    BONUS POINTS FOR EXPERIENCE WITH THE FOLLOWING:   SQL or other database technologies including internal design and implementation. Query optimization, query execution, compiler design and implementation. Experience with MySQL, PostgreSQL internals Data warehouse design, database systems, and large-scale data processing solutions like Hadoop and Spark. Large scale distributed systems, transactions and consistency models. Experience in database replication technology Big data storage technologies and their applications, e.g., HDFS, Cassandra, Columnar Databases, etc.    Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.   How do you want to make your impact?

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d)
Description: Job Description    Machine Learning Reply, with its sister company in Italy and over 10.000 employees at Reply globally offers consulting and software implementation services with focus on innovative AI and ML topics like Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Time Series Analysis, Machine Learning Platforms and more.   In our Unit Machine Learning Engineering we currently hire talents with Data Engineering and Cloud know-how who would like to develop not only PoCs but productive machine learning applications or platforms including automatic unit tests and end-to-end tests, automatic deployment pipelines, mechanisms for scaling in the cloud, monitoring solutions and operations support. We call this profile “Machine Learning Engineer”. You should love to see the ML algorithms working for millions of users, devices, sensors, etc., making the world a smarter, safer, more interesting, and/or more efficient place to live.   Tasks:   Developing and driving exciting solutions in the areas of data engineering, analytics and machine learning. Combine expertise in data pipelines and machine learning with innovative thinking to deliver excellent client work. Work together with Data Scientists to develop models for classification, prediction, natural language processing, recommendation, reinforcement learning, deep learning, computer vision and other Data Science-related tasks, including a good data preparation for best model performance. Design ML solution architectures using current technologies (often in the cloud) and discuss them with the client, while being up-to-date with the latest MLOps technologies, processes, and industry standards. Develop innovative use cases in cooperation with our customers and then implement them with the help of our experienced experts. Present your results with communication skills and verve. In an international team, you will work closely with executives from digital business and IT areas, making new contacts as you go along. You always keep an eye on optimisation and help our clients to utilise and profit from their inactive data resources. Be part of the Reply community, join communities of practice, participate in hackathons and use all the learning resources available.   What we offer you:   Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc.)   Very active group social program - including conference funding, team building, group events, Reply Exchange Recognition for Innovation to foster your personal development   Work in an open, flat environment, within a broad Reply knowledge sharing network (more than 90 autonomous Reply groups across 8 countries)   Office space in downtown Munich with access to Stammstrecke Training and certification encouraged Home-office contracts State of the art work equipment   Award winning office spaces for an excellent work experience   Public transport ticket within Munich Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice   (r2)    Requirements    Technical Qualification   You want to take off after successfully completing your Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in informatics, business informatics, mathematics, statistics or equivalent field of study. Depending on your seniority, you have 1+ years of work experience experience in industry or consulting and developed systems that are in production You have cloud know-how with one or more of the major cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) and big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka..) You have experience developing data-intensive applications like Data Warehouses, Data Lakes and/or Data Platforms, using batch or real time data integration. You have experience with Python, SQL, and/or, Java You have a basic understanding of Machine Learning algorithms and/or processes related to the Model Development Lifecycle, and want to learn more. For example in the areas of computer vision, reinforcement learning or natural language processing.   Non-Technical Qualification   You have a high level of customer orientation and excellent communication skills. You are willing to travel. You are fluent in English and have at least intermediate proficiency (B1) in German (willing to improve).   Nice to Have   You have experience in DevOps, especially Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (e. g. Gitlab CI, Jenkins). Experience with Front-end Web Development Technologies like HTML, CSS, Django, Vue.js would be a plus. Experience with modern ML and DL frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and Keras.

Title: Data Science Associate (m/f/d)
Description: realworld one is the global leader in enterprise virtual (VR) and augmented reality (AR) software solutions, focusing on the life sciences, analytical, diagnostics and medical, pharmaceutical, chemical and processing industries.   Our customers include several major, well-known companies such as Lonza, ZEISS, Bio-Rad, Becton Dickinson, Beckman Coulter Life Sciences, QIAGEN, Tecan, Hologic and GEA Group among many others.   With our comprehensive scientific and industry expertise, we have developed a systematic approach to implementing VR and AR within the areas of sales and marketing, service and support, research and development, as well as manufacturing and production.   As a spin-off of IKA, a leading manufacturer of laboratory and processing equipment, we are privately funded and are among the largest VR and AR software companies that focus on industry solutions. We have cultivated a vibrant company culture with an international team of more than 280 people at our headquarters in Freiburg im Breisgau (Germany) and at other locations in Berlin (Germany), San Diego (USA), Bangalore (India), and Guangzhou (China).   We place great value on fostering a creative, performance-driven and employee-centered work environment for everyone – whether your specialty is working with clients, developing cutting-edge technology or crunching numbers!   In order to expand our team in Freiburg (Germany), we are now looking for a talented   Data Science Associate (m/f/d)   Your responsibilities:   Support the Management in their decision-making by creating dashboards and reporting to them regularly Analysis and evaluation of telemetry data, including data exploration and visualization Independently build dashboards showing relevant KPIs for internal and external stakeholders Collaboratively discuss gained insights with the founders & management    Your profile:   Minimum of 3 completed semesters in a technological program Ability and willingness to dive deep into technical topics and data science independently Experience with Tableau or other data visualization tools Highly enthusiastic about working with data and bringing own ideas about evaluating them Excellent communication skills in English, additional German language skills are a plus Previous experience with Machine Learning Tools and knowledge of Python or other programming languages for data analytics would be beneficial but not required    What we offer you:   An opportunity to work for a market-leading, hypergrowth tech company with a broad international customer base that is using VR and AR to transform the way they work, learn and research The experience of creating and implementing highly-valuable and innovative technology, while contributing to the long-term growth of a successful tech company Profit from an open and modern work environment with flexible working hours Be a part of a diverse international team with highly-qualified and dedicated colleagues representing over 30 nationalities Learn and grow with your colleagues and get the opportunity to take responsibility for your own tasks even as a student Receive additional benefits such as team events, company lunches, office snacks, gourmet coffee and a great office location in the heart of Freiburg    Do you want to help revolutionize the virtual world and join one of the most extraordinary tech companies in Germany?   VR technology is transforming industry standards and reshaping how businesses communicate. Our company actively drives these developments.   If this sounds like the right fit for you, please apply now, and join the realworld one team!   We look forward to hearing from you soon!

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d) Search Engine
Description: AVANTGARDE Experts places Software Engineering Experts for web development, mobile, data science, AI and many other areas throughout Germany - apply now for an exciting job with one of our well-known clients!   For our customer from the electronics industry, we are filling the following position immediately on the basis of temporary employment with option to take over:   Data Scientist (m/w/d) Search Engine   YOUR TASKS   Improvement of search rankings with the help of statistical methods Extension and optimization of the existing search architecture Creation of analyses for the evaluation of search results Creation of dashboards to control the search engine and rankings Further development of the ML workflow for generating search rankings with Python and SQL Rollout of the search engine to other countries    Your Qualifications   Very good communication skills, solid business and customer understanding Strong background in statistics and machine learning Proficient in data analytics languages (SQL, Python) and Frameworks (Keras, Tensorflow, NumPy) Experienced working with public Cloud Provider Environments (AWS, Azure, preferable Google Cloud, e.g., Bigquery, Cloud Build, Composer, Auto ML/BigQuery ML) Preferably experience with orchestration Frameworks like Apache Airflow / KubeFlow or similar Basic experience in data visualization creation with standard solutions (Data Studio or Tableau)    Benefits   Professional and personal development opportunities Employee discounts Flexible working    INTERESTED?  Then we look forward to receiving your convincing application including salary requirements and earliest starting date via our online portal.

Title: Praktikant Data Engineer (all genders)
Description: UPLIFT Y  OUR FUTURE   Wir sind 10.000. An 16 Standorten weltweit. Jedes dritte Flugzeug fliegt mit unserer Technologie.   Immer effizienter, leiser, nachhaltiger. Wir gestalten die Zukunft der Luftfahrt. Was wir noch brauchen? Sie.  Unser Team in München  sucht Sie:   Praktikant Data Engineer (all genders)  Wir liefern Produkte und verantworten Querschnittsaufgaben für die MTU in den Disziplinen Aero Solutions, Business Development/Flugzeuganalyse, Digitalisierung und Wartungs-kostenmanagement. MCI bringt Menschen und Wissen zusammen, reduziert Komplexität, bietet attraktive Lösungen und schafft Perspektiven. Hierbei setzen wir den Fokus auf die Steigerung der Effizienz und die Verbesserung der Profitabilität. Wir entwickeln Mitarbeiter:innen, fördern Kreativität, Flexibilität, Eigenverantwortung und die offene Kommunikation. Wir begegnen uns auf Augenhöhe, wertschätzend und haben Spaß an dem, was wir tun.     STARKE AUFGABEN  Ausarbeitung neuer Data Engineering Anwendungsfälle aus Strategie, Finanz und Markt:   Aufbau von Datenbanken, die Strukturierung der Daten im Rahmen der Datenmodellierung und die Visualisierung der Daten in Employee Self Service Tools Erstellung eines Datengenerierungsprozesses und das verantwortliche Durchführen des Preprocessing zur Erzeugung einer hohen Datenqualität u.a. mit KNIME, Python oder R Erstellung von Datenbank- und Tooldokumentationen in Confluence Datenanalyse und Aufbereitung der Daten in Tableau Mitarbeit in einem agilen Scrum-Team    BESTE VORAUSSETZUNGEN   Studium im Bereich Mathematik, Informatik, Statistik, Physik oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung Programmiererfahrung in R oder Python und SQL-Kenntnisse von Vorteil Strukturiertes und analytisches Denkvermögen Eigenständiges Arbeiten    Startdatum: ab sofort   AUSGEZEICHNETES UMFELD   Praxiseinblicke in die innovative & zukunftsweisende Luftfahrtbranche Verantwortungsvolle und interessante Aufgaben sowie Teamspirit Persönlicher Ansprechpartner und individuelle Betreuung Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Freizeitausgleich Netzwerkangebote    STARTKLAR?  Dann geben Sie Ihrer Bewerbung Schub und schicken Sie uns Ihre Unterlagen (Lebenslauf, Notenübersicht der Hochschule, Schulabschlusszeugnis sowie eine aktuelle Immatrikulation) online. Gleich jetzt, gleich hier.   Wir freuen uns auf Sie!

Title: Werkstudent Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description: Wir sind Deichmann-Digital - Mit Tradition im Rücken und den Möglichkeiten der Digitalisierung vor uns, bauen wir jeden Tag an der Zukunft von Deichmann. Unsere Teams bestehen aus den unterschiedlichsten Menschen, die jeden Tag versuchen, Deichmann Digital einen Schritt weiterzubringen. Dabei gehören was wir tun und wie wir es tun unmittelbar zusammen. Das zeigt sich in unseren Projekten und Werten. Für den Aufbau unserer neu geschaffenen Digital-Abteilung in Essen suchen wir ab sofort Dich als Werkstudent Data & Analytics (m/w/   Aufgaben:   Entwicklung und Automatisierung von Datenflüssen (ETL- und ELT-Prozesse) innerhalb des Data Warehouse Entwicklung und Betreuung von ein- sowie ausgehenden Schnittstellen zwischen dem DWH und den operativen Systemen Enge Abstimmung mit den Fachbereichen innerhalb von Deichmann Digital und weiteren Stakeholdern in der Deichmann SE Themenspezifische Recherchen und Analysen Unterstützung des Data & Analytics Teams im operativen Tagesgeschäft Übernahme von administrativen Tätigkeiten    Profil:   Studium an einer FH / Hochschule z.B. in den Bereichen (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, (Wirtschafts-) Mathematik, Physik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation Du bringst eine hohe Zahlenaffinität mit Du verfügst über sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS Office und/oder Google Docs, speziell MS Excel Großes Interesse hinsichtlich der neuesten Technologien im Bereich Data Warehousing und Business Intelligence Starker operativer Fokus, eine pragmatische Hands-on-Mentalität und eine ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit Datenbanken und Abfragen per SQL sind Dir nicht fremd Programmierkenntnisse - vorzugsweise in Python - sind wünschenswert Du hast Spaß daran, große Mengen an Daten zu strukturieren und für diverse Business Stakeholder sichtbar zu machen Du arbeitest mit großer Genauigkeit und Zuverlässigkeit und gehst Aufgaben gerne strukturiert an Du verfügst über eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe Sehr gute Deutsch und Gute Englischkenntnisse setzen wir voraus    Bei Deichmann Digital wollen wir nicht einfach Stellen besetzen. Wir suchen Menschen, die Digitalisierung fasziniert – Entdecker, die mit uns zusammen Digitalisierung bei Deichmann leben. Du willst mit uns die Zukunft gestalten? Dann bewirb dich bei uns !

Title: (Junior) Data Scientist (gn)
Description: In unserem neuen Data Innovation Lab erforschen wir die innovativsten Lösungen um das Einkaufserlebnis für unsere Kunden auf ein neues Niveau zu hieven. Hierfür suchen wir Antreiber mit Pioniergeist die Lust haben, HORNBACHs digitale Welt nachhaltig zu verändern.   Das sind Ihre Aufgaben:   Als (Junior) Data Scientist (gn) verstehen sich als Motor und Antreiber für alle Themen rund um die Bereiche Big Data & Analytics. Dazu gehört unter anderem das Modellieren von Daten aus internen wie externen Quellen und deren Aufbereitung für Analysen und Reports. Daneben betreuen Sie operative Analysesysteme und entwickeln diese weiter. Auch begleiten Sie Projekte für komplexe Datenanalysen, entwickeln Machine Learning Algorithmen weiter und bringen Ihr KnowHow aus den Bereichen Analytics und Datenmodellierung ein. Mit Ihrem Innovationsgeist und einem hohen Grad an Freiraum erproben Sie neue Methoden, Technologien & Best Practices und nutzen modernste Algorithmen in interdisziplinären, agilen Teams.    Das bringen Sie mit:   Wichtiger als Ihr Studienabschluss in Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder Physik ist uns Ihr Feuer und Ihre Leidenschaft für das Thema Big Data. Gerne geben wir auch technisch interessierten Hochschulabsolventen die Möglichkeit sich in das Thema einzuarbeiten. Als angehender Big Data Experte ist Python für Sie keine Würgeschlange sondern neben SQL & Datenbanken ihr tägliches Toolbelt. R, Apache Spark, Tableau oder PowerBI sind Ihnen darüber hinaus ein Begriff und Sie sind interessiert an Cloud-Lösungen (z.B. AWS, Azure oder Google Cloud). Sie haben den Mut neue Wege zu gehen, haben Spaß an Analyse & Statistik und lassen andere gerne in Form von Präsentationen oder Workshops an Ihren Erkenntnissen teilhaben? Dann machen Sie diese Herausforderung zu Ihrem neuen Projekt!    Darauf dürfen Sie sich freuen:   Hängen Sie die Krawatte an den Nagel: Es erwartet Sie eine offene Arbeitsatmosphäre durch flache Hierarchien und tolle Kolleginnen und Kollegen in einem bodenständigen Familienunternehmen. Raum für private Projekte: Mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten inkl. Zeiterfassung und einem modern ausgestatteten Arbeitsplatz sowie der Möglichkeit zum Homeoffice (mobiles Arbeiten) legen wir das Fundament für die optimale Vereinbarkeit von Arbeit und Privatleben. Wachsen Sie mit uns: Mit maßgeschneiderten Fort- und Weiterbildungen fördern wir Ihre fachliche und persönliche Entwicklung. Wir bauen auf Sie: Mit einem unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag sowie einem attraktiven Gehaltspaket inkl. Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld. Unsere Anerkennung für Ihr Herzblut: HORNBACH-Rente, Jobrad, Gutscheinkarte, HORNBACH-Mastercard, Berufsunfähigkeitsversicherung, Multimediaprogramm, Belegschaftsaktien und viele weitere Zusatzleistungen (alle Infos unter www.hornbach.de/zusatzleistungen).    Wir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständige Bewerbung (Anschreiben, Lebenslauf und Zeugnisse) unter Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung.
